The new Funky Town Grooves edition offers not only the remixes of Dancin With Myself, but also the instrumental and dub mixes of the huge hit Just Got Paid. What you're not getting is the 7" versions of the 2 singles. It so happens that the album version of Just Got Paid is the long version (and actually, the CD has the incorrect run time listed on the insert--it lists the 7" time, but it is indeed the full album version). Aside from including the 7" versions, it would have been possible to include the 7" and 12" versions of Johnny's song "Birthday Suit" from the soundtrack to the movie Sing. But even without those tracks, Funky Town Grooves as usual does an incredible job with the reissue from sound quality to the liner notes in the booklet. Track listing:Just Got Paid  5:33One Thing Led To Another 4:16My Only Want Is You 4:57Dancin' With Myself 5:36Urban Times Medley 8:54Feeling Without Touching 5:43Just Like Flyin' 6:25Dancin With Myself (12") 6:02Dancin With Myself (alternate mix) 7:23Just Got Paid (instrumental) 5:36Just Got Paid (dub) 5:25

If you had the 12" Mixes CD from years ago and were disappointed that tracks were left off, you should be happy with this 2-disc collection. All the songs from that collection are here, and then some. Do note that the longest mix of "The Number One Song in Heaven" on this collection (there are 2 versions) is a minute longer than on the single disc CD. Of course, the other disappointment is the exclusion of the 12" mix of "Music That You Can Dance To," which never makes these compilations because Sparks had changed labels for that release. It just seems like that's the one 12" mix of theirs from the 80s that will never make it to CD.Track times:CD11-1  Tryouts For The Human Race (Extended Version)  7:591-2  Beat The Clock (Extended Version)  6:351-3  La Dolce Vita (Extended Version)  5:591-4  The Number One Song In Heaven (Extended Version) 8:341-5  Young Girls (Disco Version)  3:551-6  I Predict (Club Mix)  6:201-7  Modesty Plays (Extended Version)  5:181-8  Cool Places (with Jane Wiedlin)  4:38CD22-1  All You Ever Think About Is Sex (12 Inch Club Version)  5:072-2  Dance Godammit (12 Inch Club Version)  4:012-3  Progress (Vocal / Extended Club Mix)  6:152-4  Pretending To Be Drunk (Extended Version / New Mix)  5:392-5  Kiss Me Quick (Extended Version / New Mix)  5:402-6  With All My Might (Vocal Extended Club Mix)  6:402-7  Sparks In The Dark (Instrumental / Extended Club Mix)  3:572-8  Tryouts For The Human Race (12 Inch Short Version)  4:012-9  The Number One Song In Heaven (Extended Version) 5:19

The original mix of The Way You Love Me (included here) is a mellow, soulful disco house track, and for some reason, a majority of the remixes go with that same feel. However, Craig C takes the track to a new level, giving us a club banger that gives new life to the melody and Colton's vocals, creating what is essentially a different song. Also of interest is the Nekkid Mix, which actually gives the track a bit of an acoustic, rock feel. Very cool. As a bonus, you get the track i Know What Works for Me, a trippy house track that is NOT included on the Tug of War CD.

Let Me Live Again is an infectious dance track, but there's also a remix package loaded with mixes that you should get your hands on. The big deal here is the track The Music Always Get You Back. While Colton tends to sing soulful tracks that are then remixed into club songs, this time around he just goes straight for the hard, fun club slammer with the help of dance masters Razor n Guido. Love this track.

Annoyingly, there are TWO remix MP3 packages available of this track. The other one only has 4 tracks, including the album version (vocal and instrumental) and the straightforward extended version (vocal and instrumental). Personally, I wish they would have just scraped the other release and included the extended version on this amazing EP. There is barely a disappointing mix in the bunch.Colton's original mix gives the REM track a smooth and mellow electro house feel that's almost trance-like. The layered harmonies and changes in the melody, especially as they build at the end of the song, are stunning. And it's refreshing to have male vocalist doing a dance cover of it instead of a woman (I alone have several of those from the 90s, including Abigail and Rozalla).The M-Deep remix is one of my favorites, giving the track a bit more of a club bounce while doing the lush vocals justice.Many of the mixes treat the vocals as an afterthought. The Lost Daze mix is almost hardcore techno that takes the song in a new direction, and strips the song of Colton's harmonies and actually most of the lyrics, so it's more like a techno dub. The Paul Heron mix scraps much of the vocals and is like a funky trance mix. The Redsoul dub brings even more funk and takes out even more of Colton's vocals. The Mendy mix is sort of tribal trippy. The Fresh Mix is sort of the same, and manages to muffle the vocals. The Maurice Tamraz mix is pretty straightforward and has this in-your-face chord progression that shadows Colton's every vocal. And finally, there's the Colton-A-Pella in case you want to do a mashup or create your own remix to fit your set when spinning.

Thanks to the digital age, many of Colton Ford's dance mixes have never made it to CD, only MP3 downloads. This amazing album's worth of mixes is great, however, 3 of the tracks are actually ON the CD of Under the Covers: the remixes of Follow Me, Show Me Love, and the mix of By Your Side, which is just the album version labeled as an extended mix as far as my ears can tell (it may be EQed a little bassier). Plus, if you have the CD single of That's Me, the mix of No One included here is actually on that CD single. And the remix of Losing My Religion is on the download-only remix EP of that song, so you may not need to download this entire MP3 album, just select tracks.Which leaves us with what are actually some of the best mixes on this collection. Right off the bat, I can say my absolute favorite on here is the remix of It's No Crime. This is one of those mixes that SHOULD have been featured on a White Party or Global Groove circuit CD, but for some reason, those compilations completely ignore Colton's output. This one is a club slammer and brings life to a track that I barely remember from the days when it was originally recorded by Babyface.The Dan McKie remix of Music Sounds Better With You is more of a dub that just teases Colton's vocals--it's still a refreshing change from the overplayed original track by Stardust, as is the Funky Junction mix, which is also more of a dub. Same goes for You Gonna Want Me, which is a harder, more driving take on the original club hit which, in itself, has been sampled numerous times.Your Music Is Killing Me, happily, brings back more of Colton's vocals and features a hard groove and bassline that favors the techno club feel. Hot. That feel is carried through to the remix of Lithium--banging club track and Colton totally pulls off the tone of the original vocals from the Nirvana version. Love it.

A shame this track from the Tug of War CD didn't get a full set of remixes. This short version isn't referenced as a remix here, but it is indeed the short remix that is used for the video. It puts mainstream dance radio sounds into a track that was pretty much a tame soulful disco track on the album. The riff here will totally get stuck in your head and the chorus is infectious. Like I said before, the song needed a set of remixes for the bigger club sound.

Rearth has really outdone themselves with this case, this is a nice looking case with a great feel to it.  The rendered pictures don't do it justice...At first glance I thought the logo window was going to be cheesy looking, but in person it looks really nice and doesn't obscure the fact that you have a premium phone.The side buttons are nice feeling, but they are rubber so they have a little give to them.  The power covers are a nice addition, and if I didn't already use Bluetooth headphones and wireless charging, I'd probably cut them off to the detriment of protection against the elements.  I find the lanyard loop to also be a nice addition, it's usually the orientation key that I feel for when I'm blindly trying to grab my phone in the dark or in a pocket.Good job on this fine case, Rearth, keep making great cases!

It's sad that a quality case maker like Spigen only seems to care about iPhone cases...it's quite obvious that the finish and materials used for their Android counterparts lag behind the build quality of their iPhone cases.  It's like a bait-and-switch...I see my friends with the Neo Hybrid on their iPhones, only to get a disappointing, bloated case that doesn't look or feel nearly as sleek as the iPhone version, that isn't available in as many colors.  The frame feels brittle, the buttons suffer from loss of responsiveness, and the TPU backing is thick and bulky.  This is a middle-of-the-road case.Look, I get it...there are a skillion iPhones out there, and only like 12 people buying Nexus phones...and those 12 people could all be rocking Spigen cases if they cared a little more.

The adhesive wizards at Scotch/3M have really made a name for themselves with this amazing clear mounting tape.  It's super-sticky on both sides, so it holds a surprising amount of weight, but it's also pliable enough which adds a significant amount of strength.You can stick any two hard surfaces together with this stuff, be it wood, plastic, metal, glass, granite, ceramic, or your kid's head, to create a strong, long-lasting bond.I've used this stuff for mounting various set-top boxes (Such as the Amazon Fire TV) to the backs or a Wii Sensor Bar to the top of TVs, added signs to doors, and affixed various hooks and mounts to windows.  You'll probably find plenty of uses for this stuff, so you won't regret buying the big roll.However, I would NOT advise using this on painted walls or drywall, because while you can try to jam a putty knife or other stiff flat surface in to remove, you'll more than likely pull up a layer of sheetrock along with it, leaving behind fine divet.  I thought I was crafty in mounting some surround speakers to the wall with this stuff, but the granular nature of sheetrock made the bond weak, so word to the wise.For walls, you can't beat the other 3M masterpiece, the Command strips for lightweight items, and just use proper anchors and screws for heavier items.Knowing that, however, this is still my favorite adhesive product.

...because these ties are indispensable when it comes to cleaning up cables around your house.  I like to bundle up long runs of multiple cables with these every 8-12" inches, or for tidying up behind my media center, computers, and video game consoles.  Coil up your cables, and wrap one of these around the business end so that you can toss in a drawer, and it'll stay nicely bundled without interfering with other cables.I really can't say enough how wonderful these cable ties are, and at the prices they're asking, they're easily a bargain at twice the price!

Put this on my daughter's phone, it became brown within a couple of weeks.  I tried cleaning it with rubbing alcohol, but the dirt remained firmly embedded in the weird rubbery plastic stuff.Also, it feels like if you want to remove the case, you'll break some of the clips unless you use a spudger.  It's fine for a temporary case, but the lack of cases available for the LG Optimus L90 mean that you're stuck with these cheapo cases, or those disgusting TPU phone wrappers.Guess I'll keep looking for a case for this phone.

I've been staring at media centers for years, but none has had more facetime with me and my family's faces than XBMC/Kodi.It's powerful enough for a power user to get running, but easy enough for non-technical users to enjoy using.

It's fine on an Android device, but for some reason, on tablets the interface is just bad, bad, bad...I'm not sure who taught Phunware that "tearing" through a static image to get to the actual useful bits of the application was a good idea, but they need to take a few more courses in User Interface design.I can access my Funimation subscription, which is fine, but like all of Funimations apps, this one needs a lot of help.

I am a terrible wallet-stuffer...That sounds dirtier than it should, but the statement stands.  I keep my receipts, cash, debit/credit cards, loyalty cards, gift cards, insurance cards, ID...EV-ER-Y-THING!I was unsure at first, because this wallet is literally PAPER THIN...But as soon as I rented the U*HAUL and moved into it, I was pleasantly surprised at Might Wallet's uncanny ability to expand to my needs, without adding ANY bulk.  After a few weeks, the Tyvek material becomes more pliable, but still remains every bit as tough.The American Traditional tattoo design is amazing, and really looks nice, especially the skull on the inside, and the pinup on the out.  I love tats, and I love the design of this wallet.The ONLY REASON I knocked it down a star is because the outer "pockets" leave me a little paranoid about things falling out of them, so I advise not putting anything that you can't easily replace in these pockets.  What I ended up doing was putting a little 3M Blue Masking Tape around these pockets just in case.  It looks ghetto, but at least I won't lose anything out of them.

I got this for my Nexus 5, I think I like this better than the Nexus charger.  There is no magnet to keep the phone centered, but it does includes a visible charging indicator light with I think is more helpful.  I've woken up some mornings to find my phone's battery flattened overnight because it didn't charge due to being a nanometer off-center from the charging coil.There is also a nice rubber skid pad on the bottom of the pad, which is a very nice touch and bumps the quality up a notch.A nice quality, albeit fairly short USB Micro cable is also included.  There is no power adapter included, but any standard 2.1A or higher USB charger will do the trick; I'm using the one that was included with my Nexus 5 and have used the Anker® 40W 5-Port USB Charger with PowerIQ successfully to charge my phone.I think you should buy 37 of these.

I bought these bookends to display my extensive video game collection.  The color is a brilliant blue, and they are shellacked in a hard, shiny glaze that appears to be resistant to all sorts of scratching and other damage.I don't have much else to say other than the price is right!

I use these to drive 120W PA loudspeakers, no issues there at all.  Seems to be a nice thick gauge and the connectors are of good quality, so I'm confident they'll take a beating without issue.  Sure they aren't fancy in any way, but no one's checking out your speaker wire anyways.

No seriously...a cereal that actually has the ingredients listed on the front of the box?  Unheard of these days! However, Nature's Path pulls it off while Kellogg and General Mills are filling your favorite "Blueberry" cereals with partially hydrogenated oils, high fructose corn poison, artificial flavors, colors, and chemicals.  To top it all off, Nature's Path Organic Optimum Blueberry Cinnamon tastes fantastic, and in my opinion, is truly the best cereal on the market.

I have spent a lot more money on a Odyssey LSTANDGREEN Green DJ Laptop Stand W Clamps DJ Laptop Stand and have been impressed by the quality and positioning...I got so used to having one at home that I bought this DJ stand for work to raise up my laptop for dual-monitor use.  I was pretty impressed with the weight of the metal frame, and the additional dampening pads that aren't present on my Odyssey stand.  The stability of this stand is impressive, and I would be happy to have it with me on gigs.

Now here's a power strip that lets you plug in everything you can think of, AND charge a couple of phones while you do it!  Who needs to plug in 8 regular sized power cables, 4 wall warts, and two USBs at the same time?  I don't know, but I'm glad that I can now with the help of this crazy-ass power strip!There are also two freakin' sweet green LED (Kelly green, not celery green) lightpipes on either side of the unit that make the whole thing look totally wicked.  Each plug has a sliding cover which is easy enough to move out of the way when you're plugging in.  The USB ports charge my devices as expected.The whole unit is very lightweight, and is thinner than it looks, which makes me wonder how long it will last, but I'm not terribly worried about it.I mounted the power strip on the wall next to my office desk for all the plugging and unplugging that I find myself doing from time to time, and it suits my needs perfectly.

Ever since I was a kid, I enjoyed the taste, feel, and even the sound of drinking water out of a glass Mason jar.  It's the simple things in life, right?So when Starbuck's came out with their 16oz glass water bottles, I immediately bought one, and started enjoying water from it on the go...Now, I can be a thirsty Sherpa, so 16oz would have me refilling way too often, so I found the Takeya 22oz water bottle and immediately ordered one.Amazon Prime delivered my new drinking bottle in very protective packaging; I immediately noticed the smell exuded by the silicone sleeve that encases the spacious 22oz bottle, so I threw it in the dishwasher and let it run through a cycle...the smell didn't go away, so I washed and scrubbed the sleeve, removing it and washing both sides.  No matter what I did, the smell would not go away.A few weeks later, I am still drinking out of the bottle, and the smell is still present, but not nearly as bad.  It's a shame, because other than that smell I love everything about this bottle.I'm getting used to it, but I just wish that there was no odor at all.

HOSA cables are excellent quality, durable, and have a reassuring thickness that make them my personal favorite for all of my audio equipment.  Don't bother with expensive brands like Belkin or Monster, HOSA is equal to or better quality for a fraction of the price.

The Scosche reVIVE II - Dual USB Car Charger for Samsung Galaxy Tablet (GUSBC3) was a godsend for any one who needs to charge multiple smartphones while on the road, but it was so huge and stuck out so far; I also found that it was very easy to easily knock out of the power socket.  After a few years of reliable service, I picked up the reVOLT.  Not only is this model perfectly flush, but it's a nice tight fit so it won't get pulled out when unplugging USB cables.  It has no problem charging my Galaxy S III and Nexus 7 at the same time.

Thinking of getting a nice faux leather case for your Google Nexus 7?  Well allow me to posit the following summary of events:Imagine it's a nice sunny afternoon, and you've got a nice, icy cool glass of homemade lemonade.  You decide to take your IVSO Slim Faux Leather Keyboard Case with your brand new Google Nexus 7 out to the deck for to compose a few emails, a little web surfing, and maybe to play a game or two.  You set down your lemonade and open up the case, start typing away...it's awkward and cumbersome, and you aren't sure if you can power through it.But that's the least of your worries, because you've just spilled your lemonade on yourself.  The sugary-sour daisy-colored liquid becomes sticky and uncomfortable as it attempts to fuse your clothes to your skin.  The lemon-scented goodness begins to permeate and attract a small swarm of yellow jackets begin to move in around you, buzzing and bouncing around against your skin, needling you with their pointy little feet and stingers.  Filled with panic, you stand up suddenly, which triggers the "fight" response of the bees, and they attack full force, stinging every bit of your exposed skin.  As your upper torso is met with a barrage of tiny stingers piercing your flesh, you realize that your legs had fallen asleep as you were sitting in the flimsy plastic chair, and they immediately become gelatin, causing you to hurtle towards your insufficiently attached deck railing.As the weight of your healthy adult body is afforded no resistance as it drifts effortlessly through the pressure-treated railing that the contractor assured you was perfectly secure (even though it felt shoddy and wobbly), you can feel gravity take hold of you and pull you towards the Earth several feet below.  Your instincts to feebly prevent injury by putting your hands out in front of you as you fell were met with a thud, several crunches, and then another thud as the rest of your body lands haplessly on the fallen deck railing in your backyard.  You are given a slight relief from the pain as the adrenaline courses through your veins, until the angry yellow jackets catch up with your now-mangled body, angrier than ever.  Your left leg has now fully gained circulation, but the deck railing has splintered, and that sharp stake has punctured straight through your thigh.  Your throat is dry, because you never even got one sip of that delicious lemonade, so you can't even call for help, though you wouldn't be able to anyways, because your lungs are filling up with fluid.After what seems to be a millenium, the gasping, the constant boring of yellow jacket stingers, the broken bones, the throbbing of chemical-treated wood wrapped in muscle tissue, and the dull pain of internal bleeding begin to fade as your internal organs start to shut down, your heart slows, your vision fades, and your mind starts to submit to the influence of dimethyltryptamine.As you struggle to will your own eyelids to close before you walk into the light, one very blissful thought crosses your mind: "At least this is better than using the IVSO Slim Faux Leather Keyboard Case."

There are plenty of reviews here that are spot-on, so I will try not to duplicate their efforts.  Basically, spend some extra money for an SSD that's no more than 7mm thick, and CL11 RAM.The first thing I did when I received my Zenbook Prime was break out my trusty DVD-Writer and launch the AI Recovery Burner software and create the recovery discs.  I then swapped the old spinning rust and RAM modules, and proceeded to restore the installation from those DVDs.Some "power users" would complain that this would give you an installation rife with awful Asus bloatware; to which I counter that it's much easier to uninstall the cruft you don't want (*ahem* McAfee) than to hunt down 37 drivers and programs required to operate this machine's various hotkeys and other features.  As a result, I have had very few issues that many people have had with the fan noise and WiFi controls.  For me, the Asus Facelogon works well, and I find the on-screen display to be visually appealing.I've also had no issues with backlight bleed, uneven frame, or keyboard flex.  The Prime gets quite warm, but that's because it's an nVidia GPU and Core i7 all wrapped in a diminutive aluminum frame.  The display has fantastic contrast and resolution, the backlit keyboard feels as nice as the Apple Aluminum chiclet keyboard, and overall system responsiveness is without delay.  I am not a heavy gamer, but I do enjoy a round of Painkiller and Portal 2 every once in awhile, and while not the most demanding games, I can play them on my Zenbook Prime at full resolution and effects turned on with no issue.I mostly use my laptop for audio production, and the built-in "Bang & Olufsen ICEpower" audio really is nothing more than a Realtek HD Audio chip with a little nicer pre-amp on the speakers and headphone jack (which accepts 3-striped cellphone style headphones with microphones built-in).  It does an admirable job and doesn't choke the CPU too much.My only outstanding issues with my Zenbook Prime is the trackpad; while it works very well with the latest Elantech drivers (not the newer Asus SmartGesture drivers), the drivers can't fix the louder-than-normal clicking.  Also, the keyboard subtracts several keys (volume, multimedia, pgup/pgdn, etc) and supplements them  with Fn key combinations; which is pretty sorry for some basic navigation keys.All in all, for my needs, the Zenbook Prime is a fantastic notebook, and with a few upgrades, it's nearly perfect and a good $800 less than a Retina Display Macbook Pro.

The price is right and seller shipped the case to me quickly.  It looks fantastic on my Marble White Samsung Galaxy S3 and the color is very much like a Kelly Green color, the exact color i was hoping for.The case has a ring that snaps off and surrounds the front of the phone, so putting it on was easy enough to do.  It feels sturdy, but the case is actually a white plastic job with the color painted on, so I worry a bit about the longevity if its looks.  It feels very nice in the hand and the texture the paint gives the case is satisfying enough, it looks like a premium case.It's a little thicker than I was hoping for, but not terribly so, and I still have no problems putting my phone in Arkon Universal Removable Swivel Air Vent Mount with Mega Grip Holder for iPhone, HTC EVO 4G, HD2, Droid Incredible, Droid X, and Galaxy S, however I have found some larger headphone jacks are impeded by the surrounding plastic on this case.All in all, it's dirt cheap and looks great.  Buy 10.Update: Maybe I should have followed my own advice and bought 10 of these, because one fatal flaw with this case is that if you take it off, you've pretty much ruined it...I've tried other cases, and always come back to this one, but I have to keep buying new ones because I broke the previous one taking it off...you'd think I'd learn?

Well that was a fun! Loved the characters (even if I wanted to give a couple shakes), the setting (even though...nature! and, hello, that freaks me out!) and the romance as the hero tries to up his curb appeal (he's a politician) with the public by going on a back-to-nature adventure.High on sexual tension with just a little bit of actual heat happening. Lots of family drama, some secondary characters that caught my eye and a little make-your-palms-sweat action. Made for a good read :)

Sweet, spirited  full of saucy adventure. Jeffries, Hawkins, Camp & Duran charmed with a lovely Christmas anthology. I love Christmas stories. There's something so warm and cozy about them and the four novellas in What Happened Under the Mistletoe hit just the right spot. Each was the perfect length for a cold winters night in front of a roaring fire. The romances were quick but nicely done. A little heat, a lot of attraction and a dollop of action to keep things interesting. Nicely done!

Single mama v. scummy ex's best friend. Who adores her daughter too. Pajama parties. Amazing families. And the feels. All the feels. #LovelyRomance #BringOnTheSwoonOlivia Miles' books always give my heart a little squeeze. Beautiful and touching. Hope Springs on Main Street was the perfect read for a Fall afternoon and a lovely second chance romance as childhood friends finally realize they may have been meant for more.The quick of it is that Jane's ex-husband is a complete jackhole and Jane is trying to move on and keep it together now that she's a single mom. And her life has just gotten even more complicated when the scummy ex's best friend comes back to town to deal with his own demons and despite calling it quits on the male population sparks start to fly...Jane and Henry were wonderful. They're good people and both a bit gun shy after suffering through divorces. Jane's was very recent and dealing with her ex is a daily battle. I seriously wanted to just scoop her up and give her a big ol' hug. And beat the hell out of the ex. He made me...have #rageface. Jane though. Gah! a single mama and fighting hard to give her little girl a good life and stability in the face of so much change. And Henry. Oh heavens. Henry was gorgeous and kind and exactly what Jane and her little girl needed in their life. A man who was good down to his toes despite the demons from his childhood he was still fighting.guys with kids, sexy men,There's not much in the way of heat other than a little kissing and heavy petting. Everything else is behind closed doors. But the slowly growing connection between them was lovely and sweet and had me sighing a number of times.I loved how much they cared for their families and friends. That connection and love was heartwarming and made the story even more special. And how Henry was with her little girl. It all just got me right....there. Ya know?It's not all fluffy though. There are some heard things both Jane and Henry deal with. The devastation of a marriage ending, with friends caught in the middle of the split, with old gossip and painful past memories and stigmas. It was heartwrenching watching them deal with their demons but wonderful seeing their inner strengths (even when they couldn't see them).All in all, Hope Springs on Main Street gave me all the feels. Miles has a beautiful way about her writing and of showing hope, strength and love triumphing over all. She's one not to miss!

Interesting. <says my non blurb reading self> That's not usually my thing but...okay. Samantha seems like a cool chick. I'm down. And a hero who thinks he's a Dom (or rather is trying real hard to be one) but is totally a sub? Oh yeah. *taps fingers* Definitely gonna be interesting. Lets do this.he has a dimple! #dies*sigh* poor dumb male. <looks over at gibson> had a little freak out in the past and muckered things all up huh? gonna be a bitch trying to get your woman back, you know, if you can get over your crap and get on board with submitting to her.so stubborn! so scared! You know you wanna be hers. And for her to claim your sexy ass.Oooo an arrangement. A week to get their kink on and leave all baggage at the door. We're just getting started." ~Samantha<insert X rated trip to Tumblr because...damn. that was gloriously filthy!>--> yeah, rimming *shakes head* not for me. Everything else though. Holy cow. This is freaking HOT. Like who turned up the heat??! hot. I'd let her do bad things to me. I really would. <sends Sam a cheeky grin>Noooooooo... dammit. we have a freak out. dude! Sam's on board with your kink. I'm on board with your kink. Your buddies are on board with your kink. Their wives are on board with your kink. DUDE! Fall in line! I need some more Nicolette.*back to reading* come on Gibs! you can fix this! You can fix your blunder and get your girl.I will not cry. I will not cry. Okay. I'm maybe gonna tear up a little.woohoo some naughty is gonna...go...down!*A c--- ring. He made some garbled noise. Some caveman language that meant Oh, f---, genitals in danger. Run for the hills.*<enter the best secondary characters ever> kinky buggers too *heya Pike* and totally willing to help a guy out after he's screwed everything all to heck and back. even if it means keeping his rear on a kinky path and being there to make sure he doesn't go all panicky male and pull a runner. that's some real friendship there.*Everything's cool. Everything's good. A little prostrate massage while chatting with the boys is not a big deal at all.*Hrms. I'd need to convince myself on that too. I don't know how cool I'd be with chit chatting in my kitchen while rocking a c--- ring and a vibrating plug up my bum while waiting for the fixing of things to begin. I mean. Seriously. I'd be there thinking okay I know I have a vibrating plug in my bum and that's okay. And you're like 2 feet away and YOU know I have a vibrating plug in my bum. I like my friends and all but AWKWARD. So made me love these guys though. I think this is my thing in all BDSM books though. I would totally be wigged out with everyone I know knowing my naughty bits or seeing things they shouldn't see. I need a kinksters anonymous club I think.(oh wait. back to the book)oh, oh. yall can do this! come on...come on...yall are totally gonna make me do that girly sigh and aw thing. best romance.9/24 4:30pm (flips kindle off) omg can I have another, please?!!I just...so good. So very very good. I'm totally rocking a little book hangover from Break Me Down. From a novella. Whoa. You know you've found an amazing author when they're able to write a dynamic that's so NOT your thing and they still have you panting after the story and every single little word in it. And pant I did. A deliciously kinked out treat. Loren, once again, simply wowed. If you're looking for a series that perfectly captures the beauty and passion of erotic romance at it's absolute best this is the series to grab. If you haven't picked them up.... Go. Go now! They are fantabulous!

Ahhh Shannon Stacey. She's long been a favorite of mine and with this new series won me over all over again with a heart warming story of survival and hope. The quick of it is that Alex has come home to do what he does best...tell a story with photos. And this small town that's trying to save itself is one he needs to tell.  It speaks to him. Just like the woman he's rented a room from for his stay...So. 5 things about Defending Hearts>>>I loved the hero and heroine. Gretchen has had a hard life and she keeps her emotions tightly under wraps. She's a hard worker, self sufficient and a spot prickely but only because she really doesn't want to be hurt. And Alex. He's sexy and fun and I loved watching him settle into farm life even though it was so far from his usual globe trotting lifestyle. They were wonderful together. The chemistry was delightful and yum when things heat up it's nice (though not tooooo much).>>>I liked their careers too! You don't see pumpkin farmers too often in romances. lol Especially when it's the HEROINE who is the farmer! The hero was a photojournalist which was neat to see as well.>>>Cocoa! The cutest pup is in this book. She's wild and crazy and loves her people and she gives high fives obsessively. She was so dang adorable and I loved that the three main characters (hero, heroine and her gram) all doted and indulged her. Totally had me falling for each of them.>>>The small town. One of the things I love about this series is the feeling of hope. This town is broken. The Mill closed up and most of the families have been struggling and fiercely. But there's still a hope in them. Things are slowly turning around. They're fighters and doing everything they can to roll with the punches and survive. I love that about them. Seeing small bits of hope shining through. Families finding their feet again. The heroine and her gram's hard work and how they get through the day together. It's just touching.>>>The one thing that bothers me about the series is the covers. Yes. It's something I kind of harp on but these covers do not match the series. They scream New Adult and sports romance. Neither of which the series is. The characters are in their 30s and the only connection to sports is that the guys played together in high school and in book one the town came together to rally behind the current high school football team. But the actual heroes and heroines? So far a police officer (heroine 1), construction owner (hero 1), photojournalist (hero 2), pumpkin farmer (heroine 2) and in book three the heroine is a teacher (not sure what hero 3 is). The covers just do not fit.All in all, Defending Hearts stole mine completely. Stacey has created an incredibly touching and heart warming series that doesn't shy away from the realities of life but leaves you hopeful and completely smitten.

Cocky, arrogant, snarky, blood-thirsty bastards! Gah, how I missed them! Dragon on Top was everything I love about the Dragon Kin. Action, adventure, some good lovin' and all with a gloriously snarky bite.The quick of it is that Bram needs to visit another dragon sect to get a stack of paper signed and his queen has decided he needs a keeper for his trip and has tasked Ghlenna--one of her Captains--with making sure he gets there and back with all scales intact. Only problem? He's been totally in love with her since they were kids and she...pretty much has no idea he even exists. lolSoooo. Bram--the peacekeeper-- and Ghlenna--the warrior dragon who has 300+ men under her command. Ahhh I loved them! They had fabulous banter, chemistry and were just fun together as they griped and flirted and dealt with their rulers, families and traveling across the country in both dragon and human form. They were hot together and so damn funny. Had some rocking sexy happening too.I loved how different they were on the outside. She's a total warrior. Battle scarred, deadly, a bit rough around the edges and he's all about the books, trying to facilitate peace between all of the dragon clans, and getting lost in the world of words. They're both crazy dedicated and easily get caught up in what they're doing so really they were pretty perfect for each other.All in all, Dragon On Top was a dragony-licious treat! It's a quick read but so fun to go along as Bram and Ghlenna and their group traveled about, gave each other hell, kick some dragon ass and a smitten dragon found his mate and finally got her to see him.*this one was previously released in an anthology and just now releasing on it's own.

I saw this and couldn't resist. I love history. I love design. And a book exploring both as it looked into American Whiskey and it's labeling over the decades sounded so interesting to me.And it was! I was expecting the focus to just but on the labels different distilleries have used over time but it had quite a bit of history included as well. While Rothbaum doesn't have the most lively writing voice the subject matter kept my attention.It was done in sections by decade(s) with a spot of history to open each chapter explaining life at the time, what the industry had been facing and similar then it dove into labels from those years with photos and brief little captions with each and then to close out each section there were a couple cocktails created or enjoyed during those years.I loved the artwork and photos included. Both labels and black and white historical photos. They're not all crisp but that's to be expected. It was neat seeing labels change over the years. Seeing the designs and how world events and laws influenced the industry and it's art. Why there are lower proofs now days. What they did to survive Prohibition and becoming a "medical" whiskey. They've struggled something fierce since the late 1800s. Prohibition, The Great Depression, Wars, etc. It's an industry with an incredibly rocky past and that's been hit hard time and time again with many having to close doors because of it but that's resilient as hell. Whew.This is a smallish hardback that's a little larger than a trade back book. It's got a coffee table vibe to it. An interesting look into a tiny slice of American history and all it's been through.

Hot dayum! Hot Holiday Nights brought the heat! Best way to spend Christmas vacation? A hot holiday fling with one very sexy younger man. How to make it even better? Add his older best friend into the mix.Whew, boy! I was expecting hot, sexy, fun romance with a little Christmas spirit. I was NOT expecting a menage. <yes, yes, non blurb reading struck again lol> But oh it was a nice little treat that rocked so many of my favoritest things. Sports, Christmas, menage, sexy heroes and a strong heroine spending time in an exotic locale. Oh yeah. I was a happy happy reader-girl watching Victoria snag herself a couple hunky surfers during her holiday getaway to Hawaii.I really loved all of the characters. Victoria is no non-sense sports agent, confident and knows what she wants. Alex, a younger surfer at the top of his game (and a total stud) that's full of life and energy an charm. And Ben, a sports sponsor who's grounded and has that refined sexy older gent thing happening. They all fit nicely together. Had easy repertoire and dynamic chemistry. I loved how they fell into their romance. Spending days at a surf competition where Alex was competing and evenings rocking the sheets. Things definitely get hot and heavy with a nice little menage going on. Yum! But the romance wasn't skimped on much to my delight.All in all, Hot Holiday Nights was one sexy Christmas fling. It's a light read and perfect for warming up a chilly winter day. It works fine as a stand alone for those who haven't read in the series :)

Oh wow! Clare delivered a spectacular romance that had me completely invested and rooting so hard for these two to find love, passion and healing. I was expecting a fun light hearted read. A little fluffy sexy romp. And I totally got some of that--yay! But there was so much more, too, as Sebastian and Chelsea become each other's safety dates to survive the ordeal of a friend's wedding and found so more than either was looking for or ever expected.man candy, hot guys, men in suits, sexy menThe quick of it is that Sebastian and Chelsea have been paired up as bridesmaid and groomsman for a wedding they're both attending. And it's a BIG wedding with a year of events leading up to it and lord help em it's gonna crack em. Everyone is in match making mode and these two...NOT on board with it. So...they strike up a deal. They're gonna be each other's "Safety Dates" and pretend they're a thing so people will get...off...their...backs.These two. Yall. Gah they about did me in. I adored them both down to their toes! Chelsea is a cheerful roller derby badass that's hiding some deep down fears and she just made me ache. I loved everything about her and how strong she was even if SHE couldn't see her own strength. She was fun, sweet, broken, a survivor and a fighter. And Sebastian. This guy. He's what all men should be. He may be a little aimless in life but he's such a good man and was amazing with Chelsea and being there for her when she desperately needed someone to help her find peace.This one does have some triggery issues. Chelsea was raped years earlier and she's still very much dealing with the trauma and fear. It's hard to watch her terror when it overtakes her, see her struggling with being intimate with someone again, healing and falling in love. But it was also amazing seeing her work through things with Sebastian. Seeing him with her and how much he cherished her and was there for her no matter how "broken" she felt.The Billionaire Takes a Bride was just a lovely story. Beautiful, heartbreaking, full of hope and sweetness. Clare simply wowed. I enjoyed every second of these two as they dealt with family, friends, their lives unexpectedly changing and all of the wonderful things that brought them.

Holy freaking sizzler! Wild Ride was a scorcher! *giddy squee* Whew boy! Cathryn Fox upped the heat in the most delicious way with Wild Ride as two childhood friends get a hedonistic weekend away to explore a delightfully explicit list of fantasies and see if maybe they were always meant to be together.I loved these two. They knew each other back in high school and though they both kinda had a thing for each other never let on and missed opportunities and all that. Buuuuut now all these years later Tyler and his buddies are trying to make that right by inviting the "girls that got away" to spend an entire week on their Dude Ranch to see if maybe, just maybe, the sparks are still there.They were fun, sexy and had fabulous chemistry together. He's a bit wild, she's a bit shy, she centers him, he gives her the opportunity to get a little crazy and try all the things she's fantasized about over the years. They were just a tasty delicious pairing.Alright. So. I was NOT expecting this one to be as hot as it was. Book one was hot but Wild Ride was a whole other level. It's definitely in the erotic romance category and holy cow it will make. you. squirm. There's a little dominance/submission happening, a little kink, a bit of a menage with one of his buddies (though it's a m/f romance) and some back door action. It was all so very shiver-worthy. The excitement and passion flew off the pages and was just gloriously sinful.There were sweet moments too as they got to know each other, spent a little time doing the things each other loved most--him spending time with his horse and on the ranch and her with yoga (she totally gave him lessons). They were pretty adorable together.All in all, Wild Ride was one helluva quickie and seriously satisfying! Fox brought a delicious romance full of heat, humor and heart. Bring on book 3!

Simply sweet. The Widows Choice was an easy read with lovely characters finding their hope, love and a place to call home.The quick of it is that Rafe and his best friend are moving north from Texas to Montana in search of a new start and they find a lovely widow struggling to keep her large ranch afloat. They're in need of work, she's in need of labor and they're hired on.I really loved the characters. Rafe and Charlotte, his best friend and her sister-in-law as well as an elderly ranch foreman. They're likable, hardworking, brave and felt like family. The romance was slow moving--she's slow to trust and he's putting everything he has into learning to ranch. I liked them together though and that it wasn't a speedy thing but took weeks. There's a nice spot of tension and a tiny little bit of heat to go with it.Things did go a bit dark for a spell as they deal with a crazy neighbor set on owning everything that's Charlottes. I was a bit surprised with how dark things went in an otherwise light read.My only problem was with the editing. There were a number of blips during the novella that could be a little distracting after a while.All in all, The Widows Choice was a lovely read that left me smiling and ready for more from this small Montana town.

A rip roaring good time! ::snort:: I couldn't help it! Roar...tigers...impossible to resist! A Tiger's Bride was delightfully silly and a total hero throwback to romances of yore with their unrepentant alpha males as Dmitri spots the lioness he wants, kinda (totally!) kidnaps her, marries her without her realizing and whisks her away to his mother land landing himself in all kinds of exhilarating danger when he and his seriously accident prone lioness go from hunters to huntees--forced to outrun an unknown attacker out to get them. Whew! Hilarity ensues!So. This one is just good silly fun. Dmitri is a total cocky alpha male of the feline variety. Think chest beating, taking what he wants, growling. And damn him he makes you giddy over it all. He's determined to find his perfect mate. Her requirements? Wide hips and lion status. He wants him some super babies and he's gonna get those tiger-lion cubs. Teena...gonna have to get on board. lol Teena was a trip all her own. She's the "good" twin and always been considered fragile but the lioness inside her is ready to break out and show every one just what she's capable of and so she does.I had a lot of fun with them both. Their romance is a spot twisted and kidnapper-ish but, you know, it worked for them. They're feline shifters. They're supposed to be a bit twisted and crazy, right? lol It was fun watching them get past that and kinda actually like each other. Dealing with all the crazy being thrown at them and surviving because of each other as they make it back to his home. It's make-you-snort funny with a big dose of quirkiness thrown into the mix. It worked fine as a stand alone (yeah I'm a bad reader girl and skipped books 1-3) but might be more fun having read the earlier ones and seen Dmitri in those. Sounds like he'd had quite the adventures before snagging him his Teena.

A little Regency with a side of woo-woo? Yes, please! Romance, intrigue, characters with unique...abilities. A madman and a courtesan. A threat against the crown, blackmail and a race against the clock. The Madness of Lord Westfall was a tantalizing treat that was impossible to resist. Marlowe definitely delivered.The quick of it is that Pierce and his group have been tasked with finding those behind a nefarious scheme against the crown. Something that brings a courtesan into their mists. One Pierce must get close to in order to find out what she knows and put an end to the threat against the prince.I enjoyed the heck out of Pierce and Nora--the madman who could hear voices and the Lady turned courtesan. I always enjoy characters that are deemed a spot "mad" and I tend to have a soft spot for courtesans so these two definitely had my attention. I liked them too. They were good people who were freaking survivors. Life hadn't been easy for either of them but they fought and were just amazing people despite it. They were good together too. Had lovely chemistry and banter and had me smiling.While I did feel like I'd walked in mid-series (turns out this was book two oops!) it passed quickly and I was easily pulled in by this group of agents that all have interesting abilities--hearing thoughts, sending thoughts, control of fire or water or soul skipping and use them to keep country safe. I was constantly finding a minute here or there to read and spend time with them. I love that feeling. The suspense and watching them piece things together and use their talents kept me reading late into the night.The Madness of Lord Westfall was a quick read full of interesting characters, depth and a couple surprises along the way. Risk, danger, love, forgiveness and finding peace. It was a lovely story that had some grit and sparked my curiosity about everyone else on the team.

If Murray writes it...I'm gonna read it. Damn, she's good! Sexy as hell hero, incredible heroine, the excitement of the game, a luscious romance and real life struggles...everything about Takes Two to Tackle was irresistible and captivating.The quick of it is that Stephen has a problem. He's just gotten back from rehab and is on pretty thin ice with his sports team. It's his last chance to prove he's clean, sober and can handle his job. In a moment of panic--to prove he has the support he needs--homeboy claims he has a girlfriend. *hangs head* He so doesn't. Not even a tiny little bit. And off he goes to try to convince his cleaning lady to move in, pretend they're a thing and help him keep his life in order. Whew!These two were something else. And that was most definitely a good thing. Margaret's blunt and sassy. Honest, hard working and totally solid. Says what she's thinking and doesn't let him get away with any of his s***. And Stephen's a total guy. Rough around the edges sometimes, crazy sexy and with an incredible heart.The chemistry was amazing. They just had that snappy zing between them that made watching them together so dang fun! It took a little while for things to fully heat up but even before that they were just good together. Made me smile, gave me those warm fuzzies and had me cheering them on.It wasn't always an easy read. There's lots of fun and sexy but addiction and alcoholism played a big part in the story. And I liked that. Some parts weren't pretty as Stephen tried to get control of his life again. But it was real and moving watching both his struggles and how his friends reacted to him. The support they provided, the ass kickings when he needed them, etc. It was incredibly well done.All in all, an amazing addition to the series. Murray tackled a difficult subject with Takes Two to Tackle and did so with class, heart and love. Adding in some fan-yourself-sexy and her trademark humor made it an even more delicious ride.

Addictive! Sorenson has me hooked! Shooting Dirty was sexy, edgy and thrilling to the last page.The quick of it is that Janelle and Ace have an, erm, complicated past seeing how months earlier he kidnapped her, held her hostage and kinda shot her ex. Yeah. *big ol' owly eyes* And now he's trying to make up for all the s*** he's done, win her over and deal with two battling MCs intent on pulling him into their dangerous rivalries.This one was crazy interesting to me. It's an MC romance but the hero, Ace?...not in an MC. He left his and became an outcast and is getting clean. I've never seen that done in an MC romance before but I freaking loved it. He wants to be on the straight and narrow for his daughter. It was unique and interesting exploring a different facet.  Seeing how hard he wanted out but how deep the ties could twist.Alright, so, these two. Janelle is a survivor through and through. Been through horrible things in her past, raising her near teenage son on her own--yup they both had kids, trying to get a better life for them no matter what she has to do. Stripping included. She was easy to like and I definitely felt for her and her battles.Ace was blunt, maybe a little crass and had a cold edge to him. He's a former hitman and done a lot of bad s*** in his years. But he had a gentlemanly thread in him too that was pretty irresistible. Plus seeing how gaga he was over his daughter...total swoony hero material.The heat...hot damn! Intense, passionate, edgy. They had just a smidge of dominant/submissive tendencies that were fan-yourself-good. funny now and again too. This one has a lot of heat to it. Nothing too extreme but high on shiver-worthy action.The action...nice! They're caught between two rival clubs--his former MC and one that's trying to use him against it. Manipulations, attacks, edge of your seat action. Totally made my palms sweat.All in all, Shooting Dirty was sexy, gritty, make-a-girl-pant goodness. From the romance to the setting and characters Sorenson totally nailed it. I seriously hope there will be more from this series. *begs oh so prettily*

The Wilde brothers are impossible to resist! Hot romance, sexy men and pulse pounding danger. I gobbled up Wilde at Heart and the luscious romantic whirlwind that was Reece and Shelby.The quick of it is that Reece--who is all about order, precision and simplicity-- can't seem to get over his attraction to his soon to be sister-in-law Shelby--who is colorful, wild and chaos personified-- and when arson, blackmail and danger threaten both of them they do the only thing they can think of...join forces, get hitched and ride out the storm until they can figure out who is behind all of the attacks coming their way.I adored Shelby. She's a bit of a wild child. I loved her passion, vibrancy and spirit. And my heart just ached for her. No matter what she does everyone always seems disappointed in her. She's never really had someone in her corner and gah that just killed me seeing her struggle with not feeling good enough or loved by the people most important in her life. And, man, I wanted to pound on some people for giving her hell.Including Reece. Who totally won me over but had some choice moments of needing to hand over his balls for being a jerk to his girl. He's a little geeky, a little socially awkward with women, a workaholic but loyal to his brothers and everything he does is to keep them safe and secure. Hard not to love him too. Even with the assery moments now and again. And he definitely made up for them in the end.I really did like these two together.  At a glance they're exact opposites but really they're so similar in that they're don't quite fit in with anyone else. They have secret layers and parts of themselves they keep hidden. It was nice seeing them come together and bring a little balance to each other's extreme natures. He kept her more centered, she helped him loosen up a little from his OCD ways. They were just a great match. And, whew, when things come together they're hot and explosive! A little surprising too but that's something you'll have to read for yourself <g>The suspense was interesting. Things were coming at these two like you wouldn't believe. Attacks against her business, arson, some shady s.o.b blackmailing them over some naughty moments they spent together. It was well done and kept me curious until the end. It managed to keep me guessing too which I always love.My only complaints were small ones but kept it from a solid four. Lack of capitalizing Marines (which hopefully was caught in editing but no idea), disappointment in some of the previous heroes and heroines who had parts in this one and did make up for it in the end but had me growly over how they treated the heroine and some nickname usage that just didn't work for me personally. Little things really in the overall scheme of things.All in all, Wilde at Heart was a delicious return to the Wilde brothers and once again they gave me all the warm tingles that have me craving more. Burrows writes some very tasty males and I can't wait to see how things pan out for the last two Wilde brothers.

Sweaty half nekkid Marines getting hosed down. Seriously. You need this book. #ThatIsAllLOL okay. Really though. It was a fun read. Sexy hero coming into his own and finding his place, a great heroine doing...pretty much the same thing and finding her way in life. Luscious chemistry and attraction, some action and suspense as the team deals with unknown attackers, fantastic secondary characters and friendships. It was just a lovely read and has me so damn excited for book three.

Really, does it get any better than a Jill Shalvis book? I mean...I just. No. The word you're looking for is no! lol All I Want...so had me rocking one of those goofy smiles. It was sweet, sexy and made me bust out laughing more than once in an *fluffs hair* oh-so-ladylike-way, of course. And I loved every second of it as Parker and Zoe played house, raised some kittens and basically drove each other a spot crazy. It was totally one of those make you sigh, gasp and gigglesnort reads.

I'm...I'm just gonna need a minute here. Whew boy! *fans self* lolA Cowboy Firefighter for Christmas was a sweet holiday romance full of spirit, heart and quirky small town charm! I had a good time with this one. It was an easy read as Trey and the citizens of Wildcat Bluff gear up to celebrate Christmas, battle fires threatening their lands and welcome a curious outsider into their midst.firefighter, shirtless, man candy, sexyI really enjoyed the characters. Trey--the aforementioned cowboy firefighter cat lover-- and Misty--who just arrived to town and was immediately pulled into the chaos and festivities. They were fun, easy to like and just good people.  A little corny now and again (and not quite as funny as they thought they were) but entertaining as they danced around each other, flirted, saved kittens and tried to figure who was intentionally harassing the town by starting fires. They were good together, had some nice chemistry and just a tiny bit of heat. Seriously, yall. I was wanting some hot and steamy cowboy firefighter lovin mmhmm but it turned out to be pretty dang light and brief. *sniffles* There was some good lead up but actual deed...total quickies page-wise. It was still fun watching them fall in love and get to know each other though.The town itself was fabulous and quirky. They're all smitten with cats and totally pamper them. From personal pets to barn cats. Cats are KING in Wildcat Bluff. Woohoo! Gotta love that. It was fun getting to know all of the side characters and seeing how much they cared for each other. They've got spirit and charm in spades. Definitely looking forward to more from them.The suspense of who was starting fires all over the place was pretty predictable and writing-wise this one did feel like a first novel. A little rough in spots, overly detailed in others and that sort of thing.All in all, though, A Cowboy Firefighter for Christmas was sweet and heartwarming. A charming town full of Christmas spirit and all the good things in life. I'd totally live there and hang out with these people. And have a damn good time doing so :D

Sultry suspense! Pulse pounding passion twined with edgy suspense. Wicked for You was one seriously hot, heavy and exciting ride!The quick of it is that years ago Mystery was kidnapped and during a harrowing journey to safety she managed to get herself all hung up on the man who saved her life. (seriously can't blame a girl because Axel...dayum!) Anyways. Once his job was over they went their separate ways and for years the thoughts of him have driven her crazy and she's ready to do something about it. She's gonna hunt him down and see what he can do between the sheets. *noms* Too bad that quickie fling is soon interrupted by bad guys out to finish what they started all those years ago. Mmhm. No worries though. Hot hunky hero...ready to defend the woman who's haunted his thoughts all these years too.sexy, alpha male, jeans, hot guys, man candyThese two sizzled! Axel is ALL Dom and one hella sexy alpha male. Totally lickable and hands down a hero to his very soul. He's got that dark little edge of being a Dom but is incredibly caring and gentle too. Yums all around, people. Yums all around. And Mystery. She had me wanting to pinch her a couple times but overall chickie was damn impressive. When life got hellish she persevered and fought to survive. She's no wilting flower. Hallelujah!Now the heat. *sucks in a breath* Oh yeah. The heat was excellent. Make a girl gasp and all kinds of lovely places tingle. From the second they met 6 years earlier they just had that zing that was so delicious to watch. Even when surrounded by danger they had a connection that just radiated between them.Whew! Hot, heavy and utterly swoon-worthy.The suspense was really nicely done too. Just enough to have you curious and keep things interesting. I didn't figure things out until nearly the end which...love when that happens. It was exciting and nerve wracking and kept me enthralled.All in all, a fine read from Black. If you love some wicked heat with your suspense this is a series not to miss. It'll have you panting for all the right reasons.

Oh how delicious! Tall, Dark and Wicked was an absolute treat! Sexy, fun and just a little bit wicked too.The quick of it is that Padua's father has been carted off to prison--charges unknown--and in desperate need of help in saving his life she seeks out a man known for his talents in the courtroom. Only to find out that the man she'd hoped to have on her side is the enemy himself and the man charged with prosecuting her father. Dum..dum..dum!!!!!! Even worse...he's gorgeous, sexy and completely intriguing and those feelings aren't one sided. Oh yeah. All in all...trouble for both of them.Ives and Padua were both fantastic characters and so well matched (even if not socially so--he's the son of a duke). She's no dainty flower and spoke her mind, had a powerful will and wasn't afraid to show her intelligence. And Ives. He's a good man that may be a little bit wicked in his down time but when it came to justice and finding the truth wasn't one to shirk his responsibilities. They had the chemistry, the respect between them and definitely the heat. It was fun watching them deal with their desires and getting to know each other. Dealing with the legal side of things that kept them on opposing teams (even if they didn't want to be). And eventually working together.The storyline with her father was nicely done. While it wasn't action packed there was a slight bit of danger and mystery in not knowing exactly what her father was charged with and who was behind using him for sinister means. Hunter had me just as exasperated and frustrated as the characters as they sought out the truth. Love when that happens.All in all, Tall, Dark and Wicked kept me turning the pages late into the night and seriously wanting to give the hero a good lick. <looks around innocently> With fantastic characters, a lovely romance and wonderful support in the form of his brothers I'm definitely excited to see how this trilogy will end. It's been a treat so far and oh it's going to be painful waiting for the last one to come out in May.

Sinfully Yours was what I would call an easy read. Easy to get into with an easy plot and romance and likable characters. It was one of those books that just rolled along--and I don't mean that in a bad way. It was a delightful escape for a lazy afternoon or a stressful day when I needed something simple and that would soothe and leave me content. A light read with a little humor and intrigue, some nice sexual tension and a little heat. It was a spot predictable in some ways but, again, sometimes you just need that easy read.I enjoyed both characters. Anna  and Devlin were a great match. Both more than they seem on the outside, a little combative when it came to each other, sharp of wit and opinion. It was fun seeing them wind up at a Scottish house party for a month. Forced to deal with each other, feel the tendrils of temptation and eventually join forces to figure out who was conspiring against one of the royal guests.The intrigue was rather predictable. There weren't any major twists or surprises for me on who was behind the plot against the Prince but I enjoyed watching Anna and Devlin figure it out bit by bit as they got closer together. The romance moved along slowly and I liked that. More them getting to know each other and the sharpness of their interactions softening. They definitely had some fire between them which is always fun. There's a bit of heat but it's not the focus. It's more them working together and uncovering each others secrets. I did think it made a bit too much of a jump there at the end to LOVE but I still liked them together.Overall, enjoyable. I'll definitely be reading book three. The teasers throughout for the next book storyline were fun to watch happen :) Elliott has a lovely, easy way about her books that just pulls me in and makes for a delightfully relaxing time.

Love me some Master Z and the Shadowlands. Mmmm. If there was ever something that could tempt me into actually moving back to Florida it would be Club Shadowlands and the luscious, swoonworthy Masters that work, play and love there. Seriously these men are all kinds of make your panties melt hot. Especially Master Z who runs the place and his brand new subbie, Jessica.The quick of it is that Jessica is having a bitch of a day. Pretty much everything is going wrong ending with an armadillo, lots of rain and landing her car in a ditch on the side of the road. I mean. Can't a girl catch a break? Trudging along to the nearest house she stumbles into Club Shadowlands--a BDSM club--and the sexy and mysterious Master Z who's all on board with introducing her to his decadent world“This was like being Alice in a very twisted Wonderland...”Lucky, lucky bitch! I seriously love Master Z. He's pretty much my older man fantasy come to life. Holy flipping hell. I would be a puddle around him. What I loved both times around is how safe he made me feel in this world. First time with getting introduced to BDSM right along with Jessica and this time just the comfort of a Master Dom who KNOWS what he's doing and has a gift for getting inside people's minds to see what they really need. He can make a girl shiver in all kinds of wickedly good ways. *nods*shirtless, man candy, alpha male, goatee, david gandyThen there's Jessica who was a pretty awesome heroine. She's rocking some curves and isn't rail then or perfect physically--another thing I love about Sinclair's writing. The women feel real and come in all body types. And their hero's totally worship them for every single bit of themselves. Anywho. Jess is a feisty one but can be a little shy and conservative at the same time. She's also one who will not back down when she thinks someone is in need of help even if it gets her in some rather...sticky situations. Like I said. My first go around I was experiencing it all with Jessica as she uncovered the world for the first time and I totally connected with her because of that. It was fun exploring as she did. It never felt overwhelming or too scary.Things are steamy as all get out between these two and kick off pretty quickly. And I loved it. Zachary is a talented talented man no matter what the situation and you can feel that power and control just seeping off the pages. Gah. I love when an author can really make you feel that. The sex scenes are just as intense and even though these two have just met the connection and trust between them is just incredible. Even when scenes are out in the open--in a club setting-- they have such an intimate and powerful feel to them.On re-read my only issue was that since it originally came out Sinclair did a bit of scene editing in one spot and I didn't love the change. It made it more watered down in my opinion in that spot and while the original scene had some edge to it I loved it and really preferred the original.I could easily go on and on about Club Shadowlands. The characters just touched my heart and made me want to be right there with them. The Masters are scorching hot alpha Doms that know how to wield a punishment but they're sweet and caring too and oh they can make things fun and light hearted when they want. If you've ever been curious about BDSM romances Sinclair and Club Shadowlands are the place to start. Hot and steamy, full of passion, intensity and humor. They're everything I look for in an erotic romance. Sinclair had me smiling, sighing and having a serious swoon. Just the perfect BDSM-y read for me each time around.

Sooooo.... I was 8 years old when Switchback made it's original debut. Talk about a throwback! lolAnd it was a fun throwback as Mallory and her daughter are targeted by a desperate criminal willing to do anything to retrieve a package he's sure her father-in-law has in his possession. Their only hope...a man name Mac who owes her father-in-law dearly and will do whatever it takes to protect them. Suspense, romance, a happily ever after...Switchback had it all.The CharactersMac and Mallory are definitely fighters. They had everything going against them but never gave up. Took a beating and kept on going. While they both had some issues--she's fairly naive at the start and he's got a bit of a chip on his shoulder--they were likable. Mallory definitely got her grit on and was pretty dang strong when most would have fallen apart. It was awesome seeing that side of her come out. And Mac had a good heart and threw everything he had into saving this little girl. I like characters with guts and determination and they had it in spades.The RomanceTheir relationship was interesting. Right from the start these two have a tension between them. And not exactly a good one. There's attraction but there's also some unease mixed in that kept these two from getting close right away. There's a wee bit of heat but not all that much since the suspense was more in the hot seat.The suspenseFast paced and intense. Anderson had my palms sweating as these two came up against unknown assassins, searched for the hidden package and raced to save her daughter. Bullets, car chases, never knowing where to turn. I could feel their frustration, exhaustion and panic that they'd fail in their mission. While I picked up on clues fairly early on it was still nicely done.Going Old SchoolSince it was written in the 90s there was definitely an old school feel and some outdated bits happening. Use of pay phones, medications that are now banned, use of a Rolodex, typewriters, slang and terms that just don't scream present day, him having fought in Nam, etc. It wasn't a big deal but did have an older feel to it when it came to the writing. But that's kind of fun too getting to see what romance books were like back in the day.Overall, I enjoyed Switchback. It was a fun kick back romance and I'd totally be up for another from Anderson.

Woo! Second chance romance. Enemies to lovers. That just makes the reader girl in me go all...quivery. Sleeping with the Enemy was full of passion, manipulations, long ago misunderstandings and some pretty hot lovin as old flames are brought back together by someone trying to cause trouble for Jay's football team.The quick of it is that Jay and Bridgett had a thing many years ago when they were barely grown and it ended...disastrously and they went their separate ways, grew up, created new lives and hardened their hearts against love. But now Jay's football team is being sued and they need one helluva lawyer to get them out of the jam. Bridgett just so happens to be one killer lawyer and the sister of one of his players and back into each others lives they're thrown.I liked Bridgett quite a bit. There was just something about her that I connected with. She's strong and self sufficient and a survivor who keeps her feelings contained. I sympathized with her and wanted good things for her. Wanted to see the hard edges she protected herself with soften. Jay...I wanted to smack around a little. lol He was just as hurt by a misunderstanding that tore them apart and not willing to trust in love or let anyone close again but he was kind of a s*** about it when trying to get with Bridgett again all these years later. He wanted her body but that's it. They were good in the sack so why not while their time away getting sweaty together. And, yeah, he needed to be smacked for that.There were lots of good things but I did have a couple problems. I was never able to forget the bad blood between these two and instead of it bringing the right kind of tension and heat to their encounters most of the time it made me kind of sad for them instead. I also had some trouble with some wishy washy happening especially after the 3rd or 4th time with no real change in things. ex--Bridgett wanting to keep a distance, his lips meeting hers and that changing to *screw me stupid* instead then back to no we can't. And I was with her on that. They didn't trust each other and that kept me from believing them falling back in love. Especially since the misunderstanding was kept going for so long instead of them just saying something then everything wrapping up way too close to the end.Okay, so I enjoyed Sleeping with the Enemy to a point. There are some pretty funny moments, some that had me tearing up and these two were definitely scorching in bed together. And I loved a bunch of the secondary characters--both family, friend and coworkers--and am really hoping they'll get their stories told. Even the suspense with who was trying to cause Jay's team trouble was pretty dang good. But this one didn't quite do it for me overall. I love the whole second chance romance and seeing a couple deal with the animosity that can bring but this time, for me, the tone missed the mark a bit. Worth the read to see how things fall out if you've been reading the series but not the best to start with for the first time.

Loved. It. Snowbound at Christmas was an absolute delight! Hot hunky hero, stellar heroine, the magic of Christmas and danger around every corner. The perfect read to snuggle down with on a cold day with a hot cup of chocolate in hand.The quick of it is that someone is trying to kill Cat's sister and she's set out to find out who's behind all the accidents her twin keeps having. Everyone is a suspect including the hottie British actor who's suddenly come to town and is working with her sister. He's totally hiding some secrets but maybe not the one's Cat thinks...I freaking LOVED Cat. Mason writes the best heroines. They're strong, kick ass, reasonable and just plain likable women. Cat's a former police offer who's had a rough go lately and has been working for her sister who is...difficult. I loved everything about her. How patient and determined she was. How much she loved. That she could apologize when wrong and keep on moving. She was just great.And Grayson? Pretty sexy guy.I really liked these two together. They go a little slow since they don't really trust each other right off the bat. But it worked. I liked seeing them get to know each other, deal with the threats, come to trust each other and deal with their crazy families. And whew their families were crazy. Her sister. Lordy. I was totally on board with the Santa float in the Christmas parade running her ass over. Annoying crazy tart! How Cat stood her. Whew!The only thing I would have asked for more of would be heat. There's some nice chemistry and tension happening but actual heat and sexy bits...not so much. Very very light and mostly off page.The suspense of who was out for Cat's sister was nicely done. I kinda figured it out but at the same time was kept guessing long enough for it to really work.All in all, Snowbound at Christmas was a fantabulous Christmas read. A little danger and action, heart, romance, small town spirit. Christmas, Colorado totally won me over.

Best Christmas book I've read all year! A Bad Boy for Christmas was everything. Heartfelt, sexy, full of humor and good friends, falling in love with all it's bits and pieces. Holidays, family, make you sign sweetness and lots and lots of dessert. Total win from page one to the very last word.I am ALL over Connor. OMG. Can I please have one of him for Christmas??! Everything about this guy was delicious. He's got the sexy swagger. He's got the ghosts from his past haunting him. He's got a kind hand and gentle touch. He's funny and sweet and omg every time he kissed her temple my knees went weak.And Faith aka Cupcake was a fantastic heroine too. I could totally be friends with her and bond over the sweet treats. She ran a little bit too hard now and again and I wanted to shake her for it because...seriously...Connor! but she was fun, sweet and could be a little naughty with him which was fun.The chemistry could melt snow! Yeah. These two were amazing together. When they were getting along, when he was driving her crazy hounding her steps, working together, playing together. They were just on fire and the banter and looks between them just steamy fun. AndIf you only read one Christmas romance this year...make it A Bad Boy for Christmas.

Fun, curious and head spinning fun. Down the Rabbit Hole was an entertaining anthology as 5 authors gave Alice in Wonderland their own personal spin.Robb is one of my favorites so I was all in for giving this antho a go and it was a lot of fun. Each take was unique and interesting. I had favorites--Robb and Ryan and a couple misses as well--Fox and McComas--but all in all it was a twisty fun ride Down the Rabbit Hole.Wonderment in Death by JD Robb--4 starsIt's Eve and Roarke. You need it. Need it now! lol I love everything about this series and getting a tasty little treat with a side of woo-woo is always a delight. It's a quick little murder mystery as Eve and the team are called to a murder/suicide that may have had some outside influences and is riddled full of Alice in Wonderlandish connections. It was a good time. Classic Robb. Humor, friendships, a little romance and loving and a curious mystery that kept the pages turning.Alice and the Earl in Wonderland by Mary Blayney--3 starsA jaunt through time to save them all!!! Okay, really just a little time travel to set two hearts free and give them a chance at love as Alice and Weston are suddenly catapulted into present day London. Their lives switched with their contemporaries who are sent to replace them in times past.  Everything they know to be true rocked and their eyes and hearts opened by the experience. These two had been in love once upon a time but scandal and worries tore them apart despite still being in love and yearning for each other. I liked these two. They had that sadly sweet feel of wanting each other but not thinking it was possible--her because of her parents scandalous divorce and him because of inheriting a nearly bankrupt earldom. I liked seeing them together and watching them realize that none of that mattered. While there was some nice tension between them there's little to no heat. I enjoyed it. I wasn't blown away but it was a nice read overall. I'd be up for checking out the series.ILove by Elaine Fox--1 starILove didn't work for me on  any level.
