In fact, there didn't seem to be much real connection between the mystery and the rest of the story.... almost like the author said "well, let's add *this* in and try to draw the mystery/thriller demographic into my character piece."This was a good novel with a poor mystery hanging off its shoe.  Read it for the characters and main plot, not the tacked on mystery, which was unnecessary to the main story.
Love these shoes.  They fit my wide feet well, and they look great doing it.

Christopher Golden's "Tin Men" is a fast paced military sci-fi novel which has an interesting premise, and only minor flaws.Set in the near future, where soldiers remotely pilot metal human-shaped robots (the "Tin Men") the way drones are operated, Golden presents us with a plausible "America as policeman" scenario, and its consequences.  When anarchists disable technology world-wide, the novel follows three storylines about groups dealing with the aftermath.  A group of Tin Men at an embassy in Damascus must protect the embassy and adjust to the loss of communications and direction from home.  In Athens, the U.S. president and other global leaders attend a G-20 summit.  At a military base in Germany, the "home base" of the Tin Men, the military struggles to understand what just happened and why all Tin Men are cut off globally.To be fair, the author does a decent job of explaining why these robots work in a world suddenly bereft of technology, and while I don't know if that is technically correct, it was good enough for me to suspend my disbelief and move on.Characterization is there, but it is action and pacing that shine through in this book.  It is a fun ride for fans of near future military sci-fi.Recommended.

These speakers are just alright.  They sound OK, but not great.  They are portable, which is a plus, but they have to be fairly close to each other, particularly in the setup phase.The setup was VERY difficult.  It doesn't help that they didn't come with an instruction manual, and no such manual was available online.  And if you need to call them to find out how to set it up, just know that they don't work nights or weekends, so you may have to call from work, if you have a day job.All told, you can get cheaper speakers that sound as good, and are a lot easier to set up.

If you need a chair for your desk, this is a great one.  It is comfortable, and is light, not the bulky, heavy item that some office chairs are.  This is due, at least in part, to the back being mesh, rather than an additional cushion and upholstery.ASSEMBLY:  This was *very* easy to assemble.  It took only a few minutes, and did not require any tools from me, as the allen wrench, the only tool needed, came with the bolts.  Pieces are easy to identify in the instruction sheet, and the bolts are provided in separate batches on a single package, so you don't mix them up.  It even came with extras of each, in a section identified as "extra parts."  It literally couldn't be easier to assemble.FEEL:  The chair feels sturdy, but comfortable.  There is flexibility, but not so much "give" that it feels like you are straining the chair, or that it might flip over.SEAT: The seat is smooth fabric, so it will not attract much dirt (or crumbs, if you eat in the chair).  The padding is nice.  It is easy to adjust up and down, and feels (and sounds) smooth when adjusting.ARMS:  The arms are hard plastic, but are smoothed on the edges to be comfortable.  The arms do not feel like they are cutting into you, and they have enough space on the sides so you don't feel confined in the chair.BACK:  The mesh material is comfortable, and lets the air flow through.  It provides enough, but not too much support.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!!!!!!

The start of a military sci-fi trilogy, Virtues of War has an engaging setting and plot, but has some flaws with the main characters.  All told, I enjoyed it, and will probably read the next installment, but I won't be desperately awaiting the next novel, as I have withbooks that *truly* captivate me.Set in the future in which mankind has spread to the stars, Virtues of War follows the adventures of a few members of the military as they perform their duties, beginning with an investigation of possible weapons smuggling among some outlying colonies.  What happens from there is an interesting series of events that could affect the entire Terran government.  There were twists and turns as matters escalated, and none of the developments seemed terribly far-fetched in the universe that the author creates.  It builds until a strong finale, which nicely sets up future novels.The problem I had was in the characters.  The main characters are Katja, (a soldier, and the closest thing we have to a main protagonist), Tom Kane (commander of a small ship and ambitious military climber), "Breeze" Brisbois (an even more ambitious climber and intelligence officer, in that order) and Jack Mallory (small ship pilot and supportive character).  The author goes to some lengths to make them individuals with multi-dimensional characters, but it just doesn't work for me.  While the heroes are flawed and the antagonists occasionally helpful, it felt like the author intentionally tacked these traits on, rather than having the characters truly three dimensional.  Unrequited love abounds, and people regret their actions, but much of it feels forced.I probably will read the next installment, but because of the flaws, it remains a "probably" rather than an "I can't wait" matter.Somewhat RECOMMENDED.

The BlackBerry Leap is a fairly entry level cost smartphone, and is clearly following the trend of on-screen keyboards, now that consumers moved away from individual keys on the device.  The first reaction is that it is yet another smartphone, without being the cutting edge business device that BlackBerry used to be.  This is perhaps not giving the Leap its due, particularly since one of the selling points is the security provided by the device.  I cannot speak to the technical aspects of this security, so I will just take it on faith that this is a secure device, particularly considering the low cost.As a recent smartphone adopter, I struggled with the iPhone vs. android decision, and ended up with the iPhone.  This review is from the perspective of an iPhone user.  All told, the BlackBerry Leap doesn't make me regret the iPhone choice.Tactile: The Leap feels pretty good, about the same weight as my iPhone 6.  The screen is clear and bright, although images don't seem quite as sharp.  I wish the corners were rounded a bit more, as this didn't feel very ergonomic.Cameras:  The main (away) camera is very solid.  It takes good, crisp pictures.  The front facing camera is simply OK, but will provide a slightly grainier image for selfies, etc.  The iPhone camera has a greater variety of functions.Data Storage:  Equipped with a minimal 16 GB storage, the Leap makes expanded memory mandatory.  Fortunately, with MicroSD, you can supplement it.  My iPhone has more storage, but is not expandable, and the Leap can potentially expand to provide more storage than my iPhone.Battery Life:  Substantially longer for the Leap.  A better, more efficient battery.Phone functions:  It does them just fine.  You won't be disappointed or delighted in this aspect.Apps:  Comes loaded with Amazon Apps, and has a good selection of apps for use.  The pre-loaded apps are acceptable, but not great, particularly when contrasted with those on an iPhone.  Both come with map and alarm clock functions, but the Leap versions just aren't as advanced.All told, there is nothing particularly wrong with the BlackBerry Leap.  It will work just fine, and has a superior battery.  The price is very good.  But use just feels lacking, and the overall impression is that BlackBerry is playing catchup with the other smartphones, and still has a good ways to go.

Meh!  This cream goes on a bit heavy and greasy and I got a little in my eyes and they started to tear.  The outside of the jar says it is 24 hour soothing cream for normal or sensitive skin and boasts: "a real source of beauty, this fondant cream ensures continuous hydration for 24 hours; it helps boost the skin's water reserves (8 plant Milks,Aloe Vera Sap) and maintain optimum moisture levels (Salicornia).  It soothes and significantly reduces sensations of discomfort and irritation of sensitive skin (Almond and Orange White Flowers).  The skin feels fresh, soft, and plumped."You would think from this description that it is an all natural cream.  However, when you look at the actual ingredient list, the chemicals are no different than any other over the counter cream such as "Glycol Palmate", "Tocopherel".  There are natural ingredients too on the list, but many of them are further down.  I feel that this is a little bit misleading.As far as plumping and retaining moisture, I fear that this benefit might be offset by clogging pores and causing acne.  The cream makes my skin soft, but feels heavy on my skin.  I don't see any visible "plumping" effects, just looks greasy.  In short, I am not overly impressed with this cream thus far.

These are the bomb!  I have them on my nightstand to help organize all those little knick knacks and little bottles that always get knocked over.  I can store my glasses and glasses cleaner so that they are readily available, as well as other things such as the remote control.  They are very attractive-more like a nice bronze color.  They are collapsible when not in use and have a plastic clip to clip the boxes together if needed.  I thought I would use them in my sock drawer, but they did not even make it there!

Before I tested these, I thought noise cancelling headphones were just an expensive auditory scam..... I have always wondered what the "noise cancelling" headphone phenomenon was. I mean, don't all over the ear headphones muffle noise while providing sound from the speakers?  Well, yes, but that's not the key to noise cancelling headphones.These Bose noise cancelling headphones are remarkable.  They emit a series of sound waves that neutralizes background noise frequencies.  I tested them in an airport and on a plane.  Without them, there was significant background noise.  When I put these on, it was slightly muffled.  Then I flipped the switch and turned them on.....quiet.  blissful quiet.Not perfectly silent, but SERIOUSLY reduced background noise.  There is a feeling of a little increased pressure caused by the sound waves that cancel.  Some might find it an adjustment, but I didn't have a problem with it.These are expensive, but now I know why people rave about them.  I cannot speak for any other noise cancelling headphones, but these really are impressive.If you can afford it, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

I went to use this product and removed the plastic when it dropped on my tile floor.  The bottle is actually thin glass covered by plastic.  I was able to salvage some sans pieced of glass and found that it made my skin a bit sensitive.  The directions say you are supposed to use a couple of drops mixed in with your moisturizer, but I don't see the benefit in taking this extra step.  Why not make a product that already has it in it?  The serum itself goes on very very oily and is fairly strong.  It has a pleasant light citrus smell.  I had to remove it after about a hour or so because it was so oily and seem pretty potent.  While my skin did stay sensitive for about a day or so, I did not experience any exfoliation effects.  So far, not terribly impressed.  But, perhaps someone who was able to use the whole bottle might have a different experience.

0:40 Mins This Contigo Water Bottle does keep things extremely cold.  I tested this by putting ice cubes in the bottle, sealing it up, and waiting 10 1/2 hours to open it, to test the insulation.  The results, as shown in the video, show very little melting, and most of the ice remained frozen.  This is impressive in a water bottle.My only criticism is the locking mechanism is actually *too* tight for one-handed opening.  Maybe I just need to do it more, to break in the coking mechanism, but it was pretty difficult to engage and disengage the lock, and I don't think I could do it with only 1 hand, as the marketing suggests.All told, this is an attractive, effective water bottle, and I am very happy to own it.RECOMMENDED.

I'm not a big fan of this one.  It claims to work on "Wet" hair but really does not.  Even the instructional videos indicate it works better on damp to dry hair. I find the barrel so big on this one I find it a bit dangerous to use next to your face.I had higher expectations of this curling iron based on the high price.  However, I find that my John Frieda $22 curling iron does a much more impressive job at 1/4th of the price.For those who have curly hair, this may be a better flat iron.  However, for those of us with fine straight hair, this does not have any additional benefit than any other curling iron.

I still prefer my John Frieda Curling Iron, but this curling took comes in a close second.  I like that it is versatile and can be used as either a curling iron or flat iron.  My hair slides through very easily.  I would think that the bristles would tangle my hair, but it did not.The locking mechanism to convert from the flat iron to curling brush is easy.  The brush is very light and easy to handle.  While you can still curl your hair by sliding it through the flat iron, it still comes out with a "kink" like a traditional flat irons.The one flaw I can see that I wish it had was an automatic shut off function.  While I am pretty obsessive about making sure the iron is unplugged while not in use, this would be good for an additional "peace of mind".For versatility and ease of use, it gets an A+

This is a cute novelty stapler.  It's fun for an office desk (or cube), and will attract attention and comments.  It's not necessarily the best functioning stapler you'll own, but it will work in a pinch.  You're probably better off buying this as a gift or for decor.Minor quibble, the majority of the shoe is shiny plastic, like patent leather.  Portions of the heel are matte finish, so that the shoe has two different textures.  Still cute,but I wish it was all shiny.  And maye in different colors.

This cologne smells light, fresh, and masculine. A daytime cologne.  And the best part:  my wife frequently says that most colognes are "nice, but it smells like all the others...."  With this one, she not only likes the scent, but noticed it smelled completely different from the many woodsey, spicy scents out there.

This is a nice, spicy-woodsy smelling cologne.  Nothing I *don't* like about it.At the same time, there is very little to distinguish this from many other scents.  My wife described it as follows:  "It's nice, but it kinda smells like a lot of the others..."Positive, but not exceptional, or even terribly different from the competition.

I have to say I am really quite impressed.  I have used many chemical peel products in my time including prescription Retina A as a teenager.  I have also used various strengths of Glycolic Acid ranging from 5% to prescription strength 30%.  This amount of 10% is "just right"--just enough to make you peel, but not so much that it leaves you red and flaky.I am an ingredients nut and I for the most part like to know what I am putting on my face.  I saw an ingredient Myristyl Nicotinate and looked it up.  Apparently this ingredient helps protect skin from skin cancer.  That is very thoughtful of them!  That is not to say that there are not any chemicals in this product, but there are some natural ones as well including Aloe Leaf Juice, Myritilus Fruit Extract, Willow Bark Extract, Sugar Cane, Orange Fruit Extract, Lemon Fruit Extract, and Sugar Maple Extract.The process is quick and easy and the product does not have any scent for those who are sensitive to fragrances.  It is a 2 step system: 1) Apply the detoxifying mask and leave on for 1 minute, then 2) Apply a thin layer of the Activator (Glycolic Acid) and leave on for 3-5 minutes (I went for the full 5 minutes).  Then, wash it off with a damp washcloth.  That's it!The instructions say to use it once a week, and I really would not use it more than that.  From the first moment of application you feel it "tingling".  Then after you wash it off, you can feel it working.  Day 2 my skin felt sensitive but no peel yet.  By day 3 I was able to slough off a think layer of dead skin cells with a loofah in the shower.  Unlike Retina A, you do not continue to flake and peel during the day.  Afterwards I did see a significant difference in my skin.  It felt more taught and the fine lines were diminished.  This one for me is a home run!

This follow up to Natchez Burning is a powerful, emotional work.  It should not be read unless you've first read Natchez Burning, as the stage is fully set in that wonderful novel.  Here, there is a brief (10 page) prologue summary, to get a reader up to speed (or remind you of what happened last...) but it's real no substitute for the first book, unsurprisingly.The Bone Tree takes our main characters on the next leg of their journey into this tale of greed, power, and racism that has festered for decades.  While the last book finished with some degree of victory for our heroes, it was incomplete, and left a great deal still to do.This novel should not be spoiled, and I won't do it here, but Greg Iles uses this novel to continue to create rich characters and place them in situations where they must wrestle with right and wrong, and the consequences of their actions.  They must weigh the greater good and justice against personal costs, and sometimes, the costs are more than they expect or can bear.My only criticism of this novel is that it could have been edited slightly more, and the pacing lags in the middle.  Far be it from me to tell Mr. Iles how to write, as I have devoured every book he has written, as far as I can recall, but I think nobody would complain if this book were pared down to "only" 600 or so pages.  I don't think the plot or characterization would have suffered, and it might have made the novel un-put-downable rather than simply "very good."

This product does exactly what it says "micro" peel.  I could feel a very fine and minute peel the first day, but after than nothing.  I am not sure that using this every day will make a difference.  When I want a peel, I want to see a little more results.  On the positives though, there was no redness or irritation.  I would only recommend this product if you had an event to go to and needed a last minute peel that did not look red or obvious.Among some ingredients I cannot pronounce, the main active ingredients appear to be Glycolic Acid, Citric Acid, Lactic Acid,  Aloe Leaf Juice Powder, Calendula Flower Extract, and Ginger Root Extract.  So, an added plus is that there does seem to be some natural ingredients.  However, for the money, I wanted to see more results.

This is a decent case, but nothing exceptional.  The look is nice, if somewhat understated.  It goes on pretty easily, and the main interchangeable panels pop in and out fairly easily.It comes with the three panels, which match the 3 colors currently offered for the iPhone 6, and that can result in a camouflaging of the case, because the majority of the backing will be similar to the color of the phone.  With 3 panels, you can, of course, change the color from your actual phone, but there are no eye-catching options.My main issue with this is that it *feels* flimsy.  The packaging says it offers "military-grade protection," but as pretty as the marketing is, it just doesn't feel particularly protective.  It may BE that protective, but it doesn't feel that way and instill me with confidence in the case.  I also suspect that if dropped from a small height, the colored panel will pop off, possibly breaking.  I've not tested it, and have nothing I can point to in support of this, but it is the overall impression I have when I hold the case and its panels in my hand.All told, the case itself is OK, but I was hoping for more from the great marketing.

This is a hard action figure to describe, because it looks SO great, but has some serious design issues that make it hard to enjoy as a toy.LOOK:  The look is fantastic, with the bright, eye-catching armor and the cuddly unarmored figure.  Your kids will take one look and want to play with it, assembling the armor and having adventures.USE:  Now that your children want to play, the challenge begins.  The unarmored form has trouble standing on its own, but it can be done after a little experimentation.  The armor snaps on, but it is hard to make the panels *stay* on if you are moving the arms and legs for action poses.  Also, there are a LOT of pieces of armor, so a lot of bits that might get lost or go missing.Overall, because of the look, it will delight your Big Hero 6 fan, but it loses a point for the playability issues.

I bought this apron for my wife.  It seemed very stiff out of the package, so much so that the little ruffles at the bottom were more like creases that did not move.  However, when my wife tried it on, it was still very cute.  There are ties around the neck and waist so it is adjustable.  It has that cool retro 1950's throwback style.  When trying it on, my wife said she felt like she should be making cupcakes!We decided to wash it to see if it would make any difference in the stiffness.  After all, what is the point in having an apron with ruffles that aren't flirty and feminine?  The package says "hand wash cold only", but we put in the delicate cycle in the washing machine with cold water and line dried it.  This seemed to make a BIG difference.  Although, the package says "100 % cotton"  and describes the apron as "soft cotton" on the package, it really feels more like nylon even after washing.  Perhaps this is for stain resistance?  However, I am a bit concerned that the label also says "it may be flammable" which makes absolutely no sense for something to be worn while cooking.After washing and line drying the apron, it looked even more adorable.  All in all, it is very flattering while doing the job of protecting one's clothes from splatter and spillage while entertaining...as long as you don't stand too close to the flame.  As for my cupcakes...I'm still waiting...

My wife received this blush.  Here are her thoughts:I would consider the quality of this blush akin to MAC or Bare Minerals.  It goes on very well (one or two strokes is all you need). The color saturation is very good which means the color really shows, and it appears silky and radiant on the skin.  What I like best about this blush is that it combines the "sheer radiance" powder look of Bare Minerals with that of a blush in one product.  If you look really closely there are little gold flecks that give you a glow.  The color is more of a peachy-pink which looks good on most skin tones (fair-medium).It last very well!  I went shopping and after pulling clothes on and off over my head several times and the blush stayed pretty well.  Many times, I find that blush wears off by the end of the day.The packaging is lovely, the compact is rather small (approx 2 in. x 2 in and 1/4 in deep) and comes with a mirror (sadly, no applicator).I deducted one star because the color on the side of the box in more pinky (like Shade 01), than reflective of this color (shade 03).  If you are judging the color by the color on the box, you might be disappointed.Overall, I would consider buying this blush again.

This book is the start of a series, and it has an interesting premise.  That said, I could not truly immerse myself in it because of the dialogue, particularly that between aliens.  It was entirely too full of modern-day American phrases, despite taking place in space thousands of years ago in large part.  For example, if you have never been to earth, and it is 5,000 years ago, how are you using phrases like "like a fly stuck in honey" or "greenhouse gasses" or quoting the A-Team  tv show: "I love it when a plan comes together"?  How about "...give him some salt for that foot he just stuck in his mouth..." or referring to a female as "eye candy"?  It happened way too often for me to take the storytelling seriously, which is a shame, given the potential of the story.

I got this for my wife.  Here are her impressions:I was excited to order this via Vine after salivating over it but not wanting to shell out $100.  I do like that it comes with a heating pad and a removable thermal guard to practice with.  Since I had never used the Instyler I first tried with the guard on and I'm glad that I did because even at the lowest temperature the barrel is extremely hot!  The Instyer Max also comes with a cool tip that you can screw on to the top.  There is also a comb, but I find that is only useful if you are trying to make sections to style someone else's hair.  What is different about the Instyler Max and the regular Instyler is that the Max rotates in two different directions.  Changing directions is as easy as clicking the iron twice.  However, I found it difficult to tell which direction it was spinning.The paperwork includes reference to their website for video on how to use, but I found that these videos were for the single direction spinning Instyler.  My overall experience was that it did give me more body than my regular curling iron.  However, I have fine hair and found that the curl barely held and was no match for my $24 John Frieda ionic curling iron.  My impression is that this is really a straightening tool that also adds some shape, not for women with fine straight hair.  Also, I wish they had a video on www.myinstyler.com for this version since it does spin in two different directions.

I feel this product falls short of its promises.  While it may be organic certified and contain ingredients such as organic apple and white grape juice as well as organic oils, the name suggests "Stem Cell" which has other scientific connotations.  I do believe this is misleading.  While the moisturizer goes on without feeling greasy, I did not notice any cell turnover that you might see with other products containing Retin A or Glycolic acid.  I really did not notice any huge difference.  What probably I disliked the most about this product is the smell, very citrus, but not in a good way, more like an Old English lemon polish.

The Black and Decker CM3005S 12-Cup Tea and Coffeemaker is a good compromise for a coffee an tea household with limited kitchen counter space.  As many combination products are, this is good, but not great, at delivering some of the intended promise.  All told, it does what is expected pretty well.APPEARANCE:  As you can see from the picture, it is a nice, sleek, modern design which will compliment stainless appliances.  The clock is usable for timer programming, but is not big enough if you intend to use it as a visible clock.COFFEE:  This device made coffee just as I would expect, and did a good job.  I've never tried a B&D coffee maker before, but I've tried other brands, and it is just as good as the others I've tried.  It does what you expect it to do.TEA:  This is where the CM3005S doesn't perform as well.  Tea aficionados will tell you that you get the best flavor out of tea by using boiling water, and while this product certainly provides warm water, it is not steeping-hot warmth.  If this is you, you may want a tea pot and a coffee maker, rather than a combo product.  Some people don't care about the boiling water, and just want a cup of tea they can drink readily, and the CM3005S will do this.  You may want to clean between coffee and tea uses to avoid having tea that tastes more like coffee.FILTERS:  The filters are a nice feature, particularly if you are ecological and don't want to add paper filters to the world with each use.  The flip side is that cleaning them is more time-consuming that dumping something into the trash.  I've been told that coffee grounds down a drain can eventually lead to the pipe clogging up, and so I'm reluctant to do that.  But make up your own mind about how you want to deal with filters, either in this or another product.  The positive is that if you decide you want a permanent filter, this comes with them already.All told, this product will make very good coffee and will present drinkable tea.  With the combination of functions, this presents a smaller footprint that is good for small kitchens, such as those in apartments.

Tested out this vacuum today, and it has good and bad elements to it.GOOD:1)  On carpet, this vacuum has a LOT of power.  It probably has the best carpet suction of all the vacuums I've tried in the last few years, and I've tried several.  It got a lot of grime out of the carpet, and the agitator works very well.  It didn't tangle up with carpet fibers like others.2)  The price point is pretty great for what you get.3)  It's light in weight.4)  The cord is longer than other corded vacuums, so you won't have to unplug as often to switch to another outlet.BAD:1)  The setting for bare floors isn't truly a bare floor setting.  The agitator keeps spinning, and will shoot some debris out of the back toward your feet.  It just didn't work as well for hard surfaces as it did for carpet.2)  Because the suction and agitator are so strong, you have to push it pretty hard over carpet.  It requires more physical effort than other vacuums. I prefer cordless vacuums, as they make the whole ordeal of vacuuming easier.Nevertheless, I would recommend this for an inexpensive vacuum.  It comes with all the standard vacuum tools, and it works well, especially on carpet.RECOMMENDED
My dog likes them, but doesn't love them.  Oh, she will come running and grab one and take off, but there's not the post-snack celebration she gives with things she truly loves.

I can't speak highly enough of this product.  I've uploaded before and after pictures of my headlight (the green car).The whole process took less than two minutes..... first, pour water on the headlight and scrub it with the included scrubbing square, then flip it over and polish.  Dry with the included microfiber towel.  Then put on the included gloves, tear open the wipe package, and just wipe it once over the headlights.It really is that easy, and that effective.  I was astonished.You should have your car out of direct sunlight for an hour or so after applying, because direct sun can make it dry *too* quickly.  Also, apply the product in a well ventilated area, because the chemical smell is very strong.But use it if you have foggy lights.  It really is amazing.

I've read all of James Rollins' novels, and the Sixth Extinction is a worthy addition to his Sigma Force novels.  This is the tenth in the series, and was published on the tenth anniversary of the first book in the series (Subterranean).  With this in mind, it is not surprising that the author doesn't spend too much time on the backstory of the main characters, because on the tenth time out, a reader probably remembers.  The flip side is that if you care about character development and depth, but haven't read a Sigma Force novel, this may not be the one to start you off.Starting off with a radio signal from a secret research base in northern California warning of a breach and ending with the directive "Kill us all," this novel puts Sigma Force into action in an effort to stop the spread of danger which may send the planet into the latest (the Sixth, of course) great extinction that changes the fate of life on the Earth.  From there, the action flows across the globe to various exotic locales as Sigma searches desperately for the solution to the danger and encounters some of the fascinating creatures that Rollins' books are populated with.This is a fun ride, with adventure, science, and thrills.  If you liked his other novels, you will find this one just as much of a pleasure.For fans of Rollins and adventure novels, RECOMMENDED

I thought I was getting just another travel mug when I picked this item up.  Boy was I wrong!  I know this is a travel mug, and I should not be this impressed, but I LOVE this mug.  I am shocked at how much I like it and how well it works.  The insulation on this mug is incredible.  I tested it out to see how well it worked, and here are the results:Cold Test:  I filled the cup with ice... no water, just ice.... closed the lid and let it sit on the counter.  If I had left a regular cup of ice on my counter, it would take about 20 seconds to start melting.  After about 1 1/2 hours, I opened it and held it upside down over the sink to see how much water melted and drained out.  Not a single drop.  No melted ice whatsoever.  I closed it up again and waited another 2 hours, and when I held it over the sink, about 1/4 teaspoon of water trickled out.  This was waaaaaaaaaaaaaaay beyond expectations.Hot Test:  I made myself coffee and poured it fresh from the pot.  I usually let it sit for about 5 minutes, as I like it to cool off.  Because of the previous Cold test, I knew I shouldn't put the lid on or it would not cool off to a palatable temperature for a long time.  So I let it sit, uncovered, for about 1/2 hours before I went to work, then I put the lid on and went out the door.  After that amount of time, the temperature was just about right.... at the hotter end of my preferred drinking spectrum, but in the drinkable zone for me.  And it stayed there for the half hour it took to get to work, it didn't become lukewarm like in other travel mugs.  In fact, it probably would have stayed hot longer, but I finished my coffee.There are some notable design features.  I really liked the rubber grip.  It is comfortable in my hand, and makes gripping really easy and natural.  During my Hot test, I noticed that the lid got warm, but nothing below the lid was warm at all.  You couldn't tell there was hot liquid in in if you touched the grip or the metal.  Some people have put in their reviews that the lip of the mug makes drinking difficult.  I did not have this reaction, and in fact I don't understand how anyone would find it difficult, but a couple of people have identified that in their own personal experiences.If you need an insulated travel mug, this one is HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

It's been years since I read Robin Hobbs' first set of books with Fitz and the Fool, so (like a lot of others) when I saw a new adventure, I had to try it out.  I'm glad I did, but not without some reservations.This story picks up in FItz adulthood.... he's in his forties, and life has slowed down considerably for him as he lives with wife Molly.  But before you know it, he is unwillingly drawn back into an adventure.This book has good points and not so good points.... The author devotes a great deal of the book to the aging of its characters, and how their perspective on a lot of things change as the age.  It felt very much like the author was trying to share some personal insights.  But mostly, it is *slow* for the first 80 percent of the book.  Don't get me wrong, it is good characterization for the new cast that joins Fitz, and at times it can be emotional stuff, but it's still slow pacing and drags.  Unfortunately, about half of the new characters I actively dislike (I'm sure the author wanted me to) and one main character we are supposed to like I just found unsettling and a little creepy.  So in the end, I like Fitz, but only one of the others, and it's not the main one the author wants me to like.  Maybe it's necessary and maybe not, but I felt in the "not" camp for the most part.  It felt in need of an editor.  At the same time, it really allowed the reader to get into the skin of Fitz before the adventuring.Having said that, it does pick up, but you have to be willing to work through the first *600* pages for the story to take off (for the remaining 70 pages or so).  Even through it's a lot to ask for, it was worth it, because I really felt like I was getting reacquainted with an old friend, and it was easy to do.... I didn't feel like I needed to re-read the other books.If you are willing to put in the work, you will be glad you did, it's a very good read.  If you are looking for something faster, without the pre-action character building, this might not be your first choice.For me, it is cautiously RECOMMENDED.

A few years ago, I read Robopocalypse: A Novel (Vintage Contemporaries), and while I enjoyed the read and found it well paced, it didn't feel particularly original, seeming too similar in style to Max Brooks World War Z: An Oral History of the Zombie War.  For the record, I found it more engaging than WWZ (which sucked all the fun out of a zombie apocalypse), but Robopocalypse *felt* too similar in style and overall theme, so I dinged it for originality.  This second book in the series, on the other hand, is much more original.After the destruction of most of the old civilization, the survivors of the Robopocalypse must regroup and figure out how to live among the ruins of the old world.  And while they do so, they face new societal challenges as well as new dangers.Daniel Wilson, I applaud your pulling off a difficult trick:  making a robot apocalypse only the beginning of a greater conflict.  This does not feel like a rehashing of the first tale, and brings interesting new elements to the table.While the story has a satisfying conclusion (rather than just a cliff hanger ending), it is clearly leaving the door open for further storytelling.RECOMMENDED

I really enjoyed the first book in this series, but this one was not as gripping.  The author failed to expand the interesting world he developed, instead populating it with some cliched characters who didn't seem to bring any freshness to the story.  They seem to move the story along alright, but this suffers from a phenomenon common in trilogies:  The first installment is great, and brings an interesting new world and plot to the fore, and the next two books are only one complete story, but stretched out over two books worth of pages with a cliffhanger in the middle.As for the plot itself, it is just *slow* and a bit repetitive, and significant portions of  it involve characters I just didn't care about.  By the time the author got to the interesting part, it was the end of the book, and I was only then getting really engaged with the read.  It made me think that if he had edited the story better, this and the next book would make a very good single book, but as is, is only a decent read.... well written, but flawed.As the first book is being made into a movie, I will be curious to see if the story benefits from the mandatory editing and shortening of a film adaptation.

This is a great mini tripod for a compact digital camera or a smart phone.  I used it for both.The tripod itself stands about 6 inches tall, before the camera is placed on top.  The legs are not extendable, so be aware that it really is just a mini tripod.Smartphone:  A separate bracket goes on the top of the tripod, and holds a smartphone sideways.  This is extendable to fit smartphones of different widths.  It would not hold my phone with the Kubxlab AmpJacket Acoustic Amplifier Case - iPod Touch 5G (Black) case I keep it in, so be aware that you may need to remove your case to use the bracket.  Or it may fit yours.Camera :  The tripod has a screw on top that you can screw into the hole on the bottom of most point and shoot digital cameras.  It's easy and it works well.

It holds many of my scarfs, but I would not want to put too many of them on this because it is more difficult to see them when they are stacked on top of one another.  It does the trick, but it is bronze and heavier than it needs to be for its intended use.  Someone asked if I could use it for neckties, but I think that would not work well, as they would get pushed together and tangle pretty easily if you put many on the Holder, and might slide off if they overlap.

I received this in charcoal grey and it is beautiful!  There are plenty of pockets inside and out including a meshed zipper pocket.  The inside has a beautiful designer lining.  It has four ventilation holes for transporting those sweaty items. The zippers are a hard plastic and seafoam green color.  There are silver buckles at the strap which look very sturdy.  The bag is very roomy with room for a regular yoga mat with two blocks stacked on top. There is enough room to zipper it shut.  For that extra thick yoga mat, there is room for it and the blocks without zipping it shut.  It is very lightweight and apparently washable which is an added plus, although the directions say spot wash by hand with hand soap, no bleach or dryer.  There is a LifeTime Warranty from the maker Sherpani which is also nice.This is a beautiful designer looking bag which is very functional.  It is definitely my favorite!

This shower caddy does everything it suggests.  There are plenty of pockets to keep items organized, and the material is sturdy enough to hold up to being carried around.  Whether you want to haul items to the bathroom or just use it as storage for your toiletries under a sink, this is a very useful product to keep your thing s organized and at the ready.RECOMMENDED

I was hoping for a lighthearted comedic take on fantasy, and boy, did this book deliver!  If you want a lot of laughs with your plot, this is a very satisfying fun experience.Martin Banks is a regular young man who tinkers with his computer and learns that reality is a giant program and we are al just subroutines..... that can be altered. Unfortunately, the alterations do not go unnoticed, and Martin is fleeing for his life.... back to medieval England.  But who wants to spend life as a serf in the Middle Ages?  Wouldn't it be a better life to dazzle people with your modern knowledge as a "wizard"?  ............. and that's when the troubles really begin.This debut novel is truly funny and an awful lot of fun to read.  Not only is the story good, but there are so many small jokes and references, I found myself literally stifling laughs while reading in public.I don't want to give away anything, so just go get this book, sit back, and have a day or two of sheer enjoyment.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

This is a hard review to write, because discussing the movie and what makes it work (or not) lends itself to spoiling, and I work very hard not to do that. Having said that, ASM 2 is a movie with a little bit of everything, lots of action, romance, comedy, tragedy, hope, and more action.What Works?-- The acting is very good. Pretty much across the board. Andrew Garfield and Emma Stone have a real chemistry, and Jamie Foxx allows the viewer to follow along with his character's evolution from comic relief to dangerous threat. Dane DeHaan was new to me, but I thought he was excellent.-- The special effects are phenomenal. I am not a fan of 3D movies, but this should be seen in 3D, as it is probably the best 3D effects I can recall seeing. The motion of web-swinging scenes is a little frenetic, particularly early on, but it smooths out.-- Lots of little dropped names and visuals in the background, planting seeds for future movies.What Didn't Work?-- Peter's quest to learn more about his parents is a plot that gets a lot of airtime, but didn't seem to further the overall story. It just felt like it was there to create a mystery that didn't serve a purpose or have an acceptable payoff.-- There are some serious heavy moments, one of which really stalls out the joy and adventure in the film. This cost the movie a five star review from me.All told, this is a *very* good movie, which I wish had a slightly edited plot, so as not to derail the great momentum that was built for the movie and the franchise. Because of the effects, it should be seen on the movie screen, and in 3D or IMAX, or whatever fancy options are available. I don't often say that about movies, but this one deserves it.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

It is difficult to gauge how well this works since we just got an ALOT of rain and my roses are popping already.  I will say that the ingredients are mainly Nitrogen 9%, Phosphate 18%, Potash 9%, and sulphur 20%.  I will say that roses additionally love calcium which is not present here (I usually grind up egg shells with a coffee grinder into a powder and spread them at the base).  I also spread used coffee grounds as well for the nitrogen.  Whether or not this gives my roses an extra umph is hard to say.  I will say, however, that this is extremely easy to use.  I love the shaker which makes it easy to spread in my garden.  I've also used it in some of my potted plants as well.  It is quick and easy. and less labor intensive then the crystal formula you attach to your hose.  So, 4 stars for being a good source of most nutrients and ease of use.

I'm a fan of James Rollins' novels, so I was excited when the idea of a spin-off novel featuring Tucker Wayne and his military dog Kane was made public.  While it was a fairly engaging read, it was not what I had hoped, and might have been better as a novella.As a private assignment winds down, Tucker and Kane are called on by Rollins' spy agency, Sigma Force, to perform a relatively easy task... assist a Russian billionaire in covertly leaving his nation.  But of course, nothing is ever easy... what follows is not just an increasingly complex escape, but a race across the globe, with apocalyptic consequences....I really like the interaction with Tucker and Kane, but at work and at rest.  For me, that is the best part of what is otherwise a forgettable, if well presented, story.  It's a different twist, and is fascinating to read about.The plot, on the other hand, seemed pretty standard in adventure novels.  I was never swept along, despite the author's ability to engage the reader.  It just want's different enough to get me fully immersed.All told, a pleasant, if not remarkable, way to spend a few hours.

This shampoo and conditioner is fantastic.  It cleans, and washes out so that my hair feels completely clean at the end.  I didn't notice the extra moisture/ conditioner left by the Head and Shoulders 2 in 1 until I tried this brand.  I'm sold, and I was a former fan of the competition.  The smell is great, also.

OK, so designers are making all pants more like skinny-jeans.  But if you are buying at certain waist to length ratios, as I am, why would anyone think that tight fabric across the thighs is a good idea?  If you can wear skinny pants, you're probably not wearing my size, and if you're wearing my size, you know skinny isn't your style.The manufacturer ought to let you know that the fabric is cut without any draping, but rather stretched over your legs.

The Hoover Cordless Vacuum is a home run.  I've been using a regular vacuum with a floor agitator, and have been very happy with it...... until I tried this one!The standout feature is the cordless operation.  Cords have always been my nemesis, always requiring a stopping and moving to the next outlet, throwing off my momentum and mindset.  It seems like a minor thing when I type it, but it really was the biggest pain about vacuuming.  But with this Hoover, no more!  The rechargeable battery means I don't have to stop from room to room, or negotiate furniture.  And the second battery means I can keep going, even if I run out of a charge on one battery.  While that one charges, I'll just switch to the second one.It functions very well as a vacuum also.  I love it.  Works great on carpet, tile, or wood flooring.  It's easy to clean.  If I had one wish, it would be that the canister was a little bigger, but it really hasn't been a problem thus far.All told this is a *wonderful* vacuum.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

After an amazing first novel, "the Professionals", Owen Laukkanen took a bit of a dip with the good, but not great "Criminal Enterprise."  Now, in his third novel with law enforcers Stevens and Windermere, the author rebounds with another very solid story that will engage the reader and keep you turning pages into the night.As the novel opens, Minnesota state investigator Kirk Stevens and his friend and colleague FBI special agent Carla Windermere witness the assassination of one of the richest men in the country.  Although the killer gets away, Stevens and Windermere are thrown into the investigation which leads them across the country as more death follows... but who is behind it, and why?Laukkanen's exceptional gift is his ability to allow the reader to relate to not only the protagonists, but also the criminals in his story, and this is no exception.  I've found this to be a very rare skill that makes the entire storytelling better.

I've been a fan of Terry Brooks for decades, but his last book was largely a re-hash of an earlier, better novel, and this newest entry falls short as well.Paxon Leah, descendant of the accomplished family of sidekicks from earlier Shannara novels, is the focus of this tale.  His family is no longer revered or royalty, and Paxon runs the family shipping business.  When his sister is kidnapped, he must spring into action to rescue her, and ultimately enters the world at large, in which magic remains, even if limited to only a few users.While I like (in general) the advances in time that Brooks has made over the course of his Shannara novels, the actual plots have diminished of late.  Indeed, in this novel, he presents us with a new hero, but what he does with that hero is woefully inadequate.  By the end of the novel, I felt like there was ultimately no point to the story, as if it served only to set up a future novel by making us familiar with Paxon.  But there wasn't enough quality storytelling to make me want to see what comes next.  The whole thing just sort of shrugs into its finale, and no resolution is reached, but no interesting threads are left for future tales.Even for fans, I wouldn't suggest this one.

If the irreverent description sounds like it might be fun, you need to buy this book.  It dwells on some of the less publicized aspects of our presidents, making them more accessible and interesting characters.This is easily the most fun I've had learning about American history.If you are a history fan, or a fan of tough hombres, this is your new favorite book.Go get it.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

This short book is a summary taken from two of the author's books: 1.How to be Invisible, and 2. Invisible Money, both of which I have read and have on my Kindle Fire along with all his other books, and they are all on my Favorites shelf so that I can quickly access and refer to them when I want to.  Luna writes about what he knows, has lived, and uses with his clients.  His advice is legal, practical, and nearly always rather easy to implement. His writing style is straight-forward, and not one book contains "empty, filler material", every page is packed with useful information.  One of my favorite and most helpful of his books for me is "Dirty Tricks for Savvy Chicks Ages 18-88", which I would recommend to every woman, and men should give to their daughters, sisters, wives, mothers, female-friends.  I recommend without reservation all his books AND his website AND his mailing list--I have no affiliation with the author, I'm just a very, very satisfied customer.

I bought these in dark denim and in grey at Walmart for $15 each, and Walmart has a variety of colors.  I bought them a size larger than my normal size so they would fit a little loose and look like real jeans, and not look form-fitting like leggings.  I'm extremely happy with them.  I prefer wearing these instead of real jeans because these are very soft and very comfortable, much more soft & comfortable than jeans.  People are surprised they are leggings when I tell them, they say they look and fit like real skinny-jeans.  I wear them tucked into boots, and also with ballet flats.  These leggings come in nine different colors and are $17 on the No Nonsense website.  I'm going back to Walmart to purchase more, but would have purchased them here on Amazon had they been a little cheaper and offered in the other colors.

I bought these from Nick Nacks, and I am very happy with my purchase.  The size of both the porholders and the glove are generous (these are a little bigger than the standard sizes I've seen at Walmart & BedBathBeyond), the quality is very good, and the sage color is exactly as is pictured on my computer monitor.  There was a problem with the shipment, and Nick Nack immediately sent a replacement at no cost to me.  I will order these potholders again when needed, and I most definitely will order from this company again.

I use these stickers for my adult students with alzheimer's or other memory problems.  It reduces their frustration and helps them to be able to continue to play even as their disability increases.  The stickers hold up very well, last a very long time, remove easily without damage to the keys, and can often be removed and then used again & they will stick pretty well the second time.  I've been purchasing these and many other products from this company for many years, their service is fast and reliable, their prices are fair, and the quality of their products are superior.

I LOVE this stuff!  I follow a Paleo/Primal lifestyle, coconut flour does not sit too well in my stomach, and I can easily over-do it eating nut flours.  Tigernut flour is perfect for me and for baking.  It exchanges 1:1 for white flour in conventional recipes and nut flours in paleo/primal recipes.  Since it's a vegetable I don't have to worry about the sort of thing you worry about when eating too many nuts or nut-flours.  I LOVE the slightly sweet flavor of tigernut flour and the texture is just fine for me.  I made pancakes this morning with tigernut flour, an egg, a little psyllium husks, a little baking soda, some apple cider vinegar, and canned coconut milk, cooked in a little coconut oil--all organic, of course.  The loft was quite high, the flavor fantastic, and I ate them without any syrup or honey--delicious!!  I plan to bake some paleo/primal bread and crackers with it, but I today I used the left-over pancakes to make sandwiches for lunch.  I just ordered two more pounds as this will be my standard baking flour from now on.We also keep whole tigernuts soaking in a bowl in the refrigerator if we get really hungry between meals. Just four or five eaten slowly takes the hunger-edge off deliciously!

I've tried Kiehl's Musk Oil, other Egyptian Musk Oils, and making my own with various essential oil recipes on the internet--this Abdul Kareen Eyptian Musk Oi is by far my favorite.  Kiehl's is my second favorite, on me it's long-lasting but a bit more fresh & light; the Kareem oil on me is a little softer & denser floral scent & even more long-lasting.  I read that musk is a slightly-soapy floral scent, and to my nose this is exactly what this oil smells like, very pretty.  I like that I don't need to reapply during the day, the scent lasts all day, and for daytime I only apply it to my inner-wrists.  At night I apply it to a tiny little bit of the hair on the nape of my neck and the scent surrounds me but is definitely not overwhelming.  A little goes a long way for me, so this little bottle lasts several months.

I thought I was a grateful person and a happy person, but throughout every day I have constantly battled negative thoughts and re-hashing negative situations over & over in my mind.  I have been using this book for 10 days, and I now realize I was at least one-tenth or less as happy and grateful as I am now; also, I no longer have to fight negative thinking, have not done so for the last 10 days.In this book, Rhonda Byrne states, "There's no room for harmful negative-thoughts when your mind is focused on looking for things to be grateful for."  Then with exercises for every day for one full month, she explains how to fill each day with specific thoughts of gratitude, exercises that leave no time or desire for negative thinking.  She cites people & things & places to be thankful for daily, that I am embarrassed to say I never thought of.  I plan to go back to the beginning of the book as soon as I'm done, and use it every day of my life.The past 10 days of my life have been the best and happiest days of my life, so with a happy heart full of gratitude I say that I am grateful for Rhonda Byrne's book for teaching me how to be truly thankful & happy, and not have negative thoughts.  Thank you, thank you, thank you!

I bought several WB833-A in a variety of covers from Barnes & Noble for $6.95 each.  I love using these notebooks because they are thin (96 pages), light-weight, fit easily into my purse, and the covers and pages have a design that I like.  A wood design is also on the pages.I like these notebooks so much that I looked them up here on Amazon to purchase, but since the Amazon Prime price is $9.28, I'll be making a trip to Barnes & Noble to get more.

I used to use Secret anti-perspirant mainly to stop odor, & it was very effective. About a year ago I started living a Primal/Paleo/organic life, and stopped using Secret. I started making my own organic deodorant but I had to use it twice a day (once in the morning and again mid-day) and before bedtime for it to be effective against odor & that was inconvenient. Primal Pit Paste was rated higher by Amazon customers than the Primal Pit Stick, so I ordered the paste, and I have been happy with it since day one. I use it exactly as directed--be sure to read the label. I use it once after showering in the morning and it lasts all day and all night. I can even shower at night, put it on right after showering, and no odor through the night, no odor all the next day, and no odor through the next evening. The consistency is easy to use, and feels comfortable on the skin: not gritty, not sticky, doesn't burn, doesn't take a long time to dry, etc.  I will most definitely continue to buy it & use it.

This is a very light-weight, rather sheer, oblong-scarf.  Popular Indigo imports these from India, and has them in several colors and prints.  I like a summer-weight scarf to carry on boats to wrap around my neck in case of a chilly wind, to tie my hair back, to do everything you would do with a wool or heavy silk scarf in winter but which are too hot and heavy for summer weather.Right out of the package this scarf was a little stiff, so I immediately put it in a sink of water with Dr. Bronner's liquid soap, let it soak for about an hour, hung it to dry, it dried Very quickly, and it was much less stiff.  It becomes more soft with every washing, but is not limp.  I like it so much that I am going to order a pink one.
The magnetic closure works extremely well & can be a little tough to open sometimes, but otherwise I love this EO storage box--it's tough and beautiful.

I believe that this will work beautifully for oily or normal skin, but it doesn't buff in well & quickly looks "cakey" in spots on my dry skin.  I've tried it several times using several different techniques, but I can't achieve the results I want with it.
I love this stuff--easy to mix in a glass to drink or make a quick "jello" or sorts with it.  Plus makes your joints feel really good and your face look firmer.

This product is to be used as part of the Acquarella system.  I adore this nail polish system:  it's easy and the results are beautiful.  As soon as I received them, I read the instructions on every product completely, followed all the instructions exactly, and I now always sport a gorgeous pedicure.  The polishes dry quickly and wear extremely well.  (I don't usually use polish on my fingernails, I use a simple two-sided nail buffer & shine block on my fingernails--anything more & my nails grow too fast [I'm a pianist] and I don't want to have to take the time to file my fingernails more than once a week.)The entire Acquarella system must be purchased and used in order for any & all of the products to work:  1) Buffer Kit, 2) Remover, 3) Conditioner, 4) the nail polishes are optional & you can use just the conditioner as your only polish.  I also bought four of the nail colors: French Kiss, Pink-a-Boo, Plasma, and Aristo--I prefer traditional colors in the creme opaque and translucent colors, and all of these are gorgeous.  I'm going to buy also Prissy and Brave.  Also, there are no obnoxious smell or fumes in any of the products.The colors come off easily when using the remover exactly as directed, the polishes apply easily & quickly because of the good brushes & polish consistency, and dry quickly.  I bought this system because I was looking for an organic/natural nail polish product, and I am so happy with it I'm not interested in using any other nail polish product of any type, organic or otherwise.  It is so much better than any other nail polish products I have ever used, conventional or otherwise.  Had I known how good this stuff is, I would have abandoned conventional nail polish years ago even before I started using all organic beauty & household products.

June 1, 2013:  I've been looking for weeks for a simple little skimmer in navy and red.  I bought this in red size 8.5, and it's money well spent.  Well-made, true to size, nice foot-bed padding, and extremely comfortable.  I like the color & dye-job, too.  I've been wearing them for a week, and I'm satisfied with them.  I hope they will continue to stock these, and add navy, white, and yellow.  Also:  I usually buy fs/ny (French Sole New York) flats, which are very, very well made and extremely comfortable and long-wearing: BC is about 1/3 to 1/4 the price, as comfortable, & look as good.February 16, 2014:  I absolutely LOVE these shoes.  I've worn them quite a lot since I bought them, and they look as good as new.  They wear like iron, and the foot-bed padding is still as comfortable as day one.  I don't polish them in any way, just clean them up with a little vinegar & water solution on a soft cloth, but they rarely need it.  Have been caught in the rain in them, and they dry very, very rapidly with no change in the color or dye-job.I'm going to buy them in their emerald color, which looks a little like turquoise to me, very pretty.  I wish, wish, wish they would make these in NAVY, WHITE, BEIGE/NUDE, and YELLOW, maybe even BURGUNDY, PINK, and FOREST-GREEN.  I hope someone out there is listening/reading this...

This book--& book one in the series--is a charmingly told tale that, most importantly, includes advice on how to live an admirable and satisfying life, making practical and satisfying lifestyle choices, behaving like a lady, and all done with very good self-esteem. I highly recommend both books without reserve.Also highly recommended is her blog and her website, which reveals that not only is she working on a third book, but she is a Canadian living in France, who owns and is renovating a chateau.  I look forward to her next book!

This book & book two in the series is a charmingly told tale that, most importantly, includes advice on how to live an admirable and satisfying life, making practical and satisfying lifestyle choices, behaving like a lady, and all done with very good self-esteem. I highly recommend both books without reserve.Also highly recommended is her blog and her website, which reveals that not only is she working on a third book, but she is a Canadian living in France, who owns and is renovating a chateau.  I look forward to her next book!

Great, practical, highly absorbent, well-made -- and I do like being able to just stack my dishes (judiciously) on it for drying since I only have "dishes for one"! It also looks great on my granite countertop which has a lot of black in it.

Some days, a woman can't stand one more underwire or highly structured bra. I have those days, and this is WONDERFUL -- I plan to get more colors. And yes, I am full-busted (C/D cup), so this bra was a wonderful surprise.
Works perfectly in my iRULU Walknbook; the price was excellent for this capacity - what more can I say?
Great, very white envelopes - exactly what I wanted. I'm trusting Columbian products more and more, as I use various sizes of their envelopes. Very pleased.

Works perfectly. I wanted one charger at home, and one at work.My only gripe: needs a longer wire (at least 2 feet longer!!!!) Can barely reach most plugs from my iRULU Walknbook when I have the charger plugged in -- and I'm not a fan of extension cords and their risks.

If you don't want to mess with super high-priced Adobe Acrobat, get this: it is just as good if not better, far more intuitive to use, has a terrifically good "help" function, a very nice user interface, and does everything you'd probably need to do re PDFs (even the advanced things).I'm running it without any issues on Windows 10 (desktop) and on Windows 8.1 (laptop), and simply could NOT be happier. It even ties in quite well to Evernote and to Dragon Naturally Speaking!!! Who could ask for more???

But if you can afford it, get Power PDF by Nuance instead. This Create 8 is much more limited, but then again, less costly. It works fine on my Win10 desktop, if anyone wonders about that.Generally, Create 8.0 does the jobs I need it to do, so no major complaints - it's just that Power PDF is considerably better (thus the reason for 4 stars).
No surprises here, frankly. A bit disappointing, but I sort of expected it in some ways, since it was about things I already knew - and the new parts rose from those.

I'm in love - and may be deserting Moleskine for Leuchtturm. These are priced a bit higher, but are really superior with thicker paper, NO fountain-pen bleed-thru, numbered pages (YAY!), a pocket in back just like Moleskine, a practical set of stickers (unlike Moleskine), and a very nice texture (smooth) to the paper. I added the Lime pen loop, and I am SOOOOO good to go!! This lime green color, by the way, is totally HAPPINESS-INDUCING!!Take a look at the whole Leuchtturm line - it's amazing!

Perfect for a slimmer pen - not for pens with silicone or rubber grips, though, unless you can slide them in "top first". Have several Pilot Plumix fountain pens, and they fit perfectly and securely. I've put this pen loop in my lime green Leuchtturm medium notebook, and couldn't be happier: it seems very secure with strong "stickum". May try the next one in the FRONT of the notebook instead of the back (just to be different, and not to adhere it to the envelope in the back).

Delighted with this Bluetooth mouse - DELIGHTED! It does not "drop" (at least not for me), it has dual-use (presenting and mousing - oh, and a laser pointer, too!), and is simply dashing in orange. Sadly, it comes with rather poor directions, so I had to do some head-scratching at first, but not for long - it's fairly intuitive (twisting...)I highly recommend it!

I have only used this for a week, on a limited basis, but so far, so excellent. The touch screen is marvelous, much more sensitive and responsive than the unit I was using prior to this. It boots up fairly quickly, the screen is delightfully crisp, and its weight (what there is of it!) is a real plus, as it is unusually light (just over a pound). The orange trim is zingy - a nice touch. The keyboard is top-notch, as I am quite a fast typist, and it doesn't bog down or miss anything I input. I don't do video-editing or anything that would require far more power than this little guy has, so I can't speak to that. It has downloaded apps quickly and efficiently. I am keeping it at Win 8.1 for now; I have Win 10 on my desktop, so why bother? I have read reviews that Win 10 markedly slows it down.That it came with a decent case is a plus, although the magnetic link between tablet and keyboard could be stronger (or at each end, rather than in the center), but that's the only flaw I've found thus far. One must be careful to keep it on balance because of that (small) central link. The case has an origami-style top that folds to support the screen/tablet and that's a great help, along with the well-designed magnetic "clasp" that keeps it in that origami-type position.So glad I discovered this iRULU Walknbook when looking for a replacement for my less responsive tablet/keyboard hybrid (an Asus, if anyone wants to know). And for this price (under $200 when I purchased it)? How can one go wrong - with its specs, one can't. At this time, I would very strongly recommend it - and will update this if anything proves differently.

I wish these "COMING HOME" books were ALL ONE BOOK - it seems a pity to have to separately buy 3 of them, especially given how they are priced. I hope this author reconsiders this "serialized" approach or I will be leaving her swiftly!!! Glad this first one was FREE at the time I got it.

I wish these "Allie" books were ALL ONE BOOK - it seems a pity to have to separately buy 3 of them, especially given how they are priced. I hope this author reconsiders this "serialized" approach or I will be leaving her swiftly!!!

I wish these "Allie" books were ALL ONE BOOK - it seems a pity to have to separately buy 3 of them, especially given how they are priced. I hope this author reconsiders this "serialized" approach or I will be leaving her swiftly!!!

I wish these "Allie" books were ALL ONE BOOK - it seems a pity to have to separately buy 3 of them, especially given how they are priced. I hope this author reconsiders this "serialized" approach or I will be leaving her swiftly!!!
A very enjoyable read -- now waiting for the 5th book in this series with its intriguing characters and well-developed plot lines! Enjoy!

Thought I wanted a 1-qt, but ended up ordering this in 1.5 qt -- and I'm glad I did! This size is excellent for one or 2 people, and it has the "keep warm" feature many others did not, and which I really need. No scorching, either.

Amazing - and amazingly handy! Love it more than I ever did a dishrack, and works so well with my kitchen colors! I'm delighted as I use it on a granite counter, and it leaves no marks yet is highly absorbent.

Texture is perfect; amount of wetness is ideal, and they don't seem to dry out in the pkg as too many others do. Cleanse face nicely without stripping skin, and do get the makeup off! I subscribe to these, that's how much I like them and stick with them!
HARD TO FIND BENT-TIP NEEDLEPOINT NEEDLES - VERY PLEASED!
Needed it and it works - what more can I say??
Daughter loves it for new grandson - - all Vera Bradley baby bags are TREMENDOUS - and this pattern is a bit masculine, which is great!
Fair price; good needles for needlepoint!!
Great for new grandson, but awfully pricey for what one gets.
Good needlepoint needles - pleased! Priced right, too.
Seems to be working - I have very thin mails post-gel nails, so I have high hopes for this. Generous size bottle for price, too.
My grandson loves this shirt!!!
Excellent value and works very well.
Easily refilled and with extra tips in each one! Nice! Work well.
Writing style somewhat dry and occasionally a bit mechanical, although plot was alright. Not a lot of tension or sense of danger for the "hero", either. Generally a bit disappointing.
Does the job, although not quite as wide from arm to arm as it should be...
High quality decal from excellent company!!! Very, very pleased.
High quality decal from excellent company!!! Very, very pleased.
Very solid 64GB SD card and adapter. Currently using with adapter in laptop and it's working very well. Definitely worth the price!!!

Needs more padding and dividers inside to be 100% useful, especially with laptops and other electronics. But it's nice, and seems well-made. I can actually slip another under-seat bag over the handle, too - which may extend its usefulness considerably.

Nice color/pattern; I have a regular-sized soft, and it JUST fits, so seller sizing estimates on this may be too generous. It's going to work OK in my living room where my 2 cats take up residence every so often... Washability has not been tested yet.
Exactly what I needed for pool blanket straps, and at a fair price, too.

Surprised to find quilting feature not STITCHED but heat-sealed or something... the color is much more purplish/raspberry-ish than shown on my monitor, too. May flip it to the other side to see if the color will work better. It is also on a fairly small club chair - and JUST fits, so I wouldn't place a lot of faith in the "will fit sizes" estimates as listed.

Unsure yet if it zaps odors as it claims; seems that my previous litter (Ever Clean) did better, at least so far. But I'm willing to give this a fair chance. It does clump well, and seems quite low-dust, which are assets. And my cats (2) don't hesitate to use it, either - also very good!

Poor performance, and it did not work as is said it would. The 1st night, I wetted my face thoroughly, and then applied the strips for 15 minutes, as suggested on the package. When dried, I slowly tore off the strip, it was very painful. When I looked, the strip was empty and the glue was left on my skin, and I was left scrubbing it off aimlessly, so I had to let soapy rags soak on my face later that night. On my next attempt, I watered it more, and then applied more pressure when putting them on. After that, I waited 25 minutes, as I thought maybe I had not let them dried enough the first time I used them. Here I am, scraping more glue off of my face, guess it's soapy rags again tonight. In conclusion, I do not recommend this product whatsoever.

I've had this tucked in the back of my cupboard for ages.  This little flashlight is about as tall as a can of soup and just as heavy.  My hands are arthritic and feeble and I am easily able to hold it and press the button.  I thought it was a dumb gift when we got it. Then we got two puppies... Taking them out at night is a nuisance and my children are scared. We live in the country on a dirt road without street lights and we can hear critters crittering off in the woods and I know there are coywolves (yes, that's a real thing) and bears.  With this little light, I reassure the offspring since we can see near and far (I bet it is easily 2/10 of a mile), up in the trees, down across the field, into the woods, under the cars, and all over the place!  Now if I am about to be attacked by a coywolf, I'll see it coming! Unless, of course, it sneaks up behind me while I am marveling at the awesome shadow puppets I can make across the fields and against the trees.

you wouldn't believe how much my dogs LOVE these things. Several dog battles have been fought over the tiniest remnant of these chews. All three of them will lie there chewing it until it's nearly gone! (Which doesn't really take that long) They don't want to go outside and leave it behind. They try to take the other dogs' AND keep their own. This product has been a source of great hilarity as well as a cause of much trouble. Since we ended up with one extra, I offered it to the hamster and then to the pet rats, none of whom were interested.
I hate buying plastic, but I get sick of cleaning up broken glasses and my kids waste paper cups. These are a terrific size for kids, safe in the dishwasher(top rack) and stack up easily.

OMG, this is a biiiiiig rope toy. The knot is the size of a cantaloupe. Our dogs are the enjoying the check out of it. We do not dare toss the toy lest we hit the poor doggies and cause great harm. They mainly chew on it and wrestle over it, and they have loosened a great number of strings.

Way, way, way too large! I mean, seriously enormous, like a tent for my kids.  I love my tops long and loose, but this was hanging to my knees and just too droopy.  I loved the color and the idea, and the fabric was like something from Old Navy. I am 5'10" and running at about a 16 these days and this thing was big enough for two of me.

long story short: I have very white skin - almost chalky. I have melasma. Melanoma runs rampant in my family. I use sunscreen every day, several times a day.  I keep getting sunburned on my face despite being covered. I use SPF30. The melasma shows like brown spots all over my face. I got this stuff to see if increasing to 45SPF would keep me from further damage. While the extra SPF did keep me from being burned, whatever makes the tint adjust to your skin color made the tint adjust to some hideous orange shade like I was wearing self tanner. It didn't cover the spots. It made them look darker, and shiny! The product actually stung my face and made my melasma areas feel hot!  But worst of all, the next morning I woke up to a whole bunch of pimples .And the skin around my nose and upper lip still feel hot.The seller was fine. I don't hold it against them that the product didn't work for me. The tubes are tiny, but the seller included a couple of extra goodies, which I thought was nice.

I hate this printer. I hate how it jams, how it skips when printing. I despise and loathe being forced to buy name brand ink. I hate how the maintenance options are completely ineffective. Most of all, I hate that since I've owned this junky thing, I have had to travel 45 minutes to Staples to print and copy.
Surprised how nice these are.  But you will find weird spots here and there on the surfaces.  Like a pinpoint black spot that must be an air bubble.  I kept thinking I wasn't washing them correctly.

It made my puppy look fat.Actually, it was just right on a lanky 4 pound Jack Russell/Dachshund mix. When we first brought her home she was freezing outside at night so we slipped this on her to stop her from shivering.  It didn't stop her from shivering, but we all sure loved how she looked in it.

okay, so each tablet comes in a plastic wrapper like a piece of candy. product  doesnt always dissolve in my dishwasher and often doesn't clean the dishes very well (and I pre-rinse so that's pretty bad)
working great for her 3DS
fun as can be for little kids who like gross noises
junk.  fell apart the first day we got it.
I just made a review describing the flaw with this item. Great idea, but plastic isn't right for this item. CONNECTIONS ARE TOO FLIMSY.
adorable fun, makes gross noises

In theory, this is a great item and should be lots of FUN. Ordered for Christmas.  First one: broken upon receipt (plastic tabs described below were snapped off during transit).  Second one (replacement for broken one): broke after being dropped on day one. Third one: broke after a few uses.  Daughter had trouble pulling the elastic part back so she held it between her knees for leverage and the purple thing snapped inside and popped off. Always in the same spot...the little flimsy tabs on the inside of the purple attachments.  You push in the purple part to the green part and these one inch plastic things lock in place but they crack like a dry pretzel.

Normally my daughter wears size 7/ 8 in most brands, but I got a size 10/12 because I thought this would run small and my baby has a broad back.  I was right, it is small.  It fits like a smaller size and even is a little too small. Order UP!  It also is very thin, like a tee shirt - a thin tee shirt.  It is adorable, but I think it is overpriced for the sizing and quality.

Only the people who know you best know your true sense of humor.  With those chosen few you are at ease to say every nasty, filthy, sick, snide and snarky comment you can think of - knowing they understand you don't really mean it and will laugh right alongside you and not hold it against you. If you don't participate in foul, politically incorrect humor, then keep on shopping!  Be advised, with this game, you are exposed to the most awful and utterly disgusting ideas.  How could one even attempt to joke about such things as The Holocaust, suffering children, cancer, and testicles?
