I am known for my blunt sense of humor and my caustic wit, but even I was unable to actually speak many of the phrases I concocted to win certain rounds.  As I placed down the cards, I simply hung my head in shame knowing I had bested others this round, while those around me mightily guffawed.  If you don't laugh at Howard Stern, are shocked by Daniel Tosh, and/or hate South Park, you will be horribly offended by this game. This is the most horrible, irreverent game you will ever love.

This was presented to my 7 year old child as a suggestion for download. So right under my nose she downloaded it and within two minutes she and her sister started maniacally laughing. They always do that with most apps they download, so I don't think much of it (lots of fart apps) but this time she knew she should show me. We got rid of it, but not before she got an eye full of stupidity.

i think they made them for a wide person who is not very tall. i wear a large in pretty much every brand so i got a large in this pant.  i am tall so i took my chance with the length. i think i should have ordered up. they are comfy and the fabric is great, but the fit is ugly. they cling to my lumps and bumps. after washing them a few times they are still in good shape, but i think they shrunk into an even more weird shape.  i wish they looked as good as the picture but on me they are like 5 inches too short.

got these for a bulk supply of comfy tees to wear around the house.  over sized, comfy, soft and roomy with a v neck.  they have been through the wash more than a dozen times and they're going strong.  they do get wrinkly in the dryer and they seem to get linty, too, but who cares!?

they are a slinky material that i wasn't expecting.  they run a little small if you ask me.  what i hate is that these pants cling to my thighs and they aren't really that long considering they are "talls."

they have an adornment on the rear pockets that might not be flattering for some back sides.  i absolutely love these jeans.  they are suited for my frame.  i am tall and long legged with a flabby tummy.  the waist on these is low so i have muffin top syndrome, but i mask that with jackets or sweaters.  the jeans themselves fit well and are long enough for my 5'10 frame. some talls from gap and old navy actually are too long but these couldn't be more perfect.

got "tall" size but they are actually a little short for me.  other than that i love them an they are a comfy pair of jeans.  for my sizing preference, they run a little odd so i would recommend you order UP because i think they might run just a tad small.
fresh product, clean packages, plenty of them, brought right to my door and all a good price.  that is why i love amazon!!

just like what i get in walmart for a comparable price.  i use these in combination with ibuprofen to fight migraines.  i kept forgetting to get a bottle so i saw them on amazon and took a chance.  i felt funny about ordering pills on amazon but they are exactly the same. they aren't expired or in a smashed box or anything. no worries.

this brand works great in my capsule filler.  hardly ever have a problem with jamming unlike the veggie capsules that always get jammed. i've made thousands of my own vitamins and supplements.  these are the best i've used and i've used size 0 and size 00 with excellent results.
the best is always the auric blend even though i've gotten faux versions that are suitable.  i absolutely love this product and it is my "signature scent" and one vial lasts a long time. <3
fresh cookies, not expired or close to it.  good price, no reason not to buy them if you are so inclined.

I wanted a pair of soft, comfy pants to hang out in on lazy days but would look okay if someone stops by unexpectedly.  I would normally get size large (like from Old Navy) but in these I got XL because I wanted them to be loose. I don't have to tie them to hold them up, so they are not that much bigger. They don't cling to my thighs and I am very tall so a bigger size looks the right length on me.  So...I would say order up unless you want a more trim fit.  Order your regular size if you like a more fitting appearance.

An excellent household tool, not just for cleaning computers.  We have baseboard heat and hardwood floors and the amount of filth that accumulates in there is mindboggling. I use this air blower for all kinds of cleaning chores, like getting the nooks and crannies of shelves, curtain dusting, under the beds, behind the fridge, under the oven, cob webs, and even under the cushions of our couch and chairs.  I absolutely love it.  It works great for computers, too.  I think this is an invaluable tool.

Four rats have a lot of excretions.  We got these to help line their cage. They use a litter box for #2 but will pee anywhere and everywhere. Rat pee smells disgusting and it is a lot of work to keep the cage clean. By using these pads we hoped to lure them into peeing on the pads instead of randomly going wherever they please.  They did pee on them, though I think largely by coincidence.  They mainly tore them up and used them as a comfy bed.  So for entertainment value alone for the rats, I have to give 5 stars. I would get them again but not with any hope or expectation of wee wee control for rats.

I've had nothing but problems with this vacuum.  The rotten thing clogs constantly from normal household debris. I absolutely despise this machine. I'm jealous of everyone who has had a good experience with it. Every time I have used it, it has significantly clogged. Toward the end of its life, I would vacuum and vacuum and see nothing filling the canister. So I took our power air blower and the vacuum outside to force air through the tubes inside to get out whatever was stuck in there.  This happened pretty much every time I used it!  I threw it away today.  It's been a total pain in the neck.  Everything was annoying with it, right down to getting the canister back in place correctly after emptying.  One thing that did work without trouble was the retractable cord.  But get this - the first time I used the vacuum, the cord whipped around and sliced open my dog's face.  So every time I took out this vacuum there after,  it caused him great emotional distress.  He would shake and tremble and pant in terror.  Couple that with my ranting and raving about the aggravation this piece of junk has caused me, and you could say we both have been emotionally scarred by this vacuum.

I got these for my daughter who loves to eat with weird tools.  They are smaller than I expected but that's my fault for not reading all the way through carefully.  These are a little longer than my palm and have a serrated edge around them.  They aren't very springy so you can't grab too well with them, but she loves them.

i think they are terrific and a fun pair of shoes for summer and look good.  i am impaired with walking and i find they are easy to walk on.  i haven't broken them in all the way yet but so far, so good. i think they do run big (not too wide) but i am glad for that due to foot problems.

each pen has written like it's old and dried up right out of the box.  after the first couple were so dry, i did a test and each one was like that.  they are scratchy and the ink skips when writing. i actually threw them away.

we got these for our 4 pet rats.  we stuffed them with some peanut butter covered pretzels.  by the next morning all the kongs had vanished.  there were not even any chunks of kongs left behind as evidence that they were chewed. of course i was worried that i would be taking four rats to the vet, but the rats didn't show any signs of distress.  so they must be able to digest kongs.  i don't think i would do that again.  they had a fun time with kongs, but i don't recommend anyone letting rats interact with them.

they love it.  i have washed it a few times and it's still holding up. it is made of a better quality umbrella type fabric and they haven't made any holes in it yet.  we have 4 rats and they all pile in it to sleep.  it's very cute to see them do that.  i don't leave it in their cage all the time because they destroy everything.  we cycle in different toys and things to keep them entertained. i would recommend this item and i would buy it over again.
2 of the glued on pieces came off in transit. our rats don't pay much attention to it, but i have noticed some wearing away of the edges so they must use it.

...which means they loved it!  It was cute and funny to see them in that thing. It has fabric of a cheap umbrella. They pulled bedding in it to sleep, they stored food in it, they even used it as a toilet.  If you accept that you are basically buying a disposable toy for them, then you won't be disappointed.  With our 4 rats I would say that it lasted a week. It kept the shape but they bit through fabric and made a bunch of extra holes. By the end, it was a foul-smelling, shredded, disgusting piece of filth! They loved it.

Right out of the box I noticed that one stool had missing finish on the flat seat area. It was as if there was something taped on the stool and when the tape was removed part of the finish came along with it. The other had a chunk of wood missing from the lower side connection.  It was polished like that, so it came out of manufacturing in that manner - which I find horrible. Aside from that, they were sturdy and seemed perfectly fine.They were shipped in a box with very little cushion or protection.  I was surprised they weren't damaged in transit. The issues I had were from manufacturing and how they were handed prior to being boxedI would not order from this manufacturer again..

Maybe I am not comprehending the actual use for these swim shorts, but in my mind they are supposed to be used for...er, um, swimming.  My daughter is modest and wanted these in lieu of underwear looking bottoms and  She dislikes how regular swim shorts puff up and out in the water. So the idea is that these would stay close to the skin and provide the modest coverage she wants.  And they do! The sizing seems true, if a little small. The material is a typical slinky bathing suit material. They would actually be the perfect choice EXCEPT for the fact they are not lined! I guess I expected an inner panty lining considering they are called swimwear.  I do understand that bikini bottoms don't have lining, but every other type of bottom I've purchased has had that inner lining.  So we are both disappointed. We got the shorts length as well as the Capri length. Neither is lined. She would have to wear something under these to fit in to modern society.  Otherwise, on a sunny day, she could stretch the wrong way and make quite an impression. And let's be honest here, choosing bottoms that cover so widely allows the wearer to get a little lazy with the grooming (if you catch my drift) and since these offer no lining, you will have to keep room in your budget for waxing.

I'm no clean freak, but I can't stand the whirling tumbleweeds of dog & human hair that accumulate around the corners of my wood floors.  Using a broom to clean it gets the hair all tangled in the bristles and using a dust mop just ends up being me pushing around a dirty wig of hair that I have to pick off.  Grosser than gross.  Shaving our heads and dogs isn't really an option, and we live on a dirt road in the country, so I got this thing.  It has to be plugged in to the outlet, but otherwise it is more or less like a Dust Buster on wheels that can also be hand held. I've emptied it a bunch of times without incident or difficulty, though it is disturbingly disgusting to see what accumulates in that little area over time.  It isn't going to deep clean very well, but will do fine for your basic household grunge it is fine.  I've used it all over the house, including on the stairs, for crumbs, cereal spills, dead bugs on the window sills, some sandy grit, etc.  It sucks up anything light and airy that passes in front of the opening, it won't suction crud from corners or pull up heavy items, so you will probably end up using the dust pan for the remains.  It's not a full strength vacuum, more of a diet vacuum.

The strings that hold the balls on easily untie or break, rendering the thing useless unless you are a micro-surgeon with excellent skills at tying tiny knots. The idea itself of landing the ball in the hoop part is fun for kids but was nearly impossible for any of the children to accomplish before the ball came off. These are about 4" long.

We want to keep our dogs from going upstairs and using the carpet as a toilet. They hate the "sssst" sound this thing makes and they steer clear of it. I was surprised how quickly the can was empty, so that is disappointing,  but it has proven to be an effective tool.

It seems like most of the reviews here are quite positive, so I am a little bit hesitant to voice my more negative opinion.  Perhaps my experience is one of an amateur so I am seeking different results than others. My usage is mainly for coloring in rubber stamped images. So, while I am not a professional, I have been stamping for 20 years and I have tried many colored pencils.  My hands now are seriously arthritic, so I seek out pencils that don't require me to press down hard to get color. I find the lead in these pencils to be hard and waxy. Great from the perspective of them not breaking, but I find the super hard lead to be stingy to release their color.  They are so hard they actually seem to resist being sharpened in both an electric and manual sharpener.  To get a deep layer of color, one has to press very firmly.  Then the pencil appears shiny and there are pencil indentation lines on the paper or cardstock.  On a positive note, these pencils can blend very well with a Dove blender.  My recommendation is that one needs a very light touch and must hold the pencil on its side to use the side of the pencil versus the point of the pencil for best results.I would prefer to wrestle with a set of exasperating pencils prone to breakage (Prismacolors) than to buy these again.  My children have Crayola colored pencils that I like better.  Go figure.

Okay, so I got this in January 2013 and it is 10/30/13 and I am going to have to replace this thing. I have used it just about once a week on an area of about 900 feet. I have used it on tongue-and-groove floor, and vinyl flooring in the kitchen and bath. The cleanser always leaves a film on all my floors - not just the laminate, so I do not use it. First, I spray the area with vinegar/water and then use the steam option. I've found that I have to fill the water tank usually just once during floor washing.  For stains, I always have to pretreat and use muscle.  I am not super picky, and I enjoyed the smooth look and feel on the floors when they were first cleaned.  Although the results weren't great, this thing worked fine until about the last month.  It fell off the second step and hit the floor and it hasn't been the same since.  It drips a lot and the base it wiggly and loose, but still doing its job.  I was surprised it took just one fall to injure this thing, but there you have it.  I might get it again but never, ever, EVER for the price they're charging right now.Bonus tip:  I found some non name brand detachable pads on Ebay.  Made my life easier because I hate the idea of using a dirty pad to clean a floor.  These pads were like half the price of what Hoover was charging and they have been just as good as the ones that came with the unit.

I don't mind buying things at Goodwill but used purses really do gross me out.  I abuse my handbags and with 3 children I am always finding disgusting things in my purse.  So I use the purses I get for a loooooong time.  I dream of having expensive purses but I hate the idea of spending a lot of money on a purse to have it ruined by an old lollipop or melted M & Ms.  So when I saw this bag on Amazon for only a few dollars more than what I could find at Goodwill, I snatched it right up!  And I'm so glad I did.  It isn't great quality and I think the bag looks pretty fake.  The stitching is terrible, too, but I can't tell you how many compliments I have gotten on this purse.  I think it is plenty roomy enough.  My big 23.7 ounce water bottle fits almost all the way in it and I could probably put 6 of them in there. The purse is red, the stitching is white, and liner in the purse is a horrid yellowish beige crinkly sort of plastic like you might find on an umbrella or a backpack (but easy to wipe clean). It doesn't have a shoulder strap, so isn't a shoulder bag but I can hike it up my arm and hold it in my underarm area just fine.  All things considered, I am happy to have bought this purse and I would definitely buy another one of these purses. It is a true "beater" purse and when it finally falls apart I won't cry about it - I'll just get another one.
I do not love this stuff. I wish I hadn't bought it, but unfortunately I bought two tubes.  It is too thick and comes off in clumps. It leaves my lips feeling gooey and sticky.
So far so good!  It is an unmanaged switch and it was completely plug and play with no issues.  It is in a metal enclosure, can be wall mounted, and doesn't get hot.  So all is good with it thus far.

This is an excellent, well constructed lead at a great price.  The double rivets at the handle and snap will provide loads of extra strength at those stress points and the stitching is impeccable.  I don't what what more I can say than thanks for providing this product!  We will definitely be getting our leads from Punk Hollow from now on.Though Punk Hollow products aren't Prime, the shipping cost was reasonable and FAST!  They shipped the lead the next day and it arrived in two days...on par with Prime!

Our German Shepherd didn't seem to care for it and it made him itch like crazy.  Also, the small size seem to encourage gulping when he did decide to eat it.  We ended up getting rid of it about 1/4 of the way through the bag.Further, our trainer and vet really railed against it due to the fact that CANIDAE does NO research on their pet food.

Nice lead with an extremely comfortable handle!  My wife really loves the padded handle as our 90 lb German Shepherd puppy can pull quite hard as he gets excited about something on his walks.  We also use it as a general around the house lead for training...its a cost effective alternative to leather as we train him not to chew the lead when left on him for training purposes.  The lead is well constructed and the thick nylon should last for some time...provided he doesn't eat it...lol.

This is an awesome little crockpot that is nice looking to boot.  It seems perfect for the casserole, and it is.  Meals can be started in the crock and finished in the oven, which is awesome!  It has two settings, low and high as well as a timer that goes in 30 minute increments up to 20 hours.  Once the timer expires the unit goes to warm.  It does a fantastic job with pulled pork and the fact that it isn't deep makes it easy to server from.  The locking lid makes transporting it trouble and spill free.  Best of all, it cleans up easily!

The doll collector in the family says that this isn't the highest quality of the Holiday Barbie collection. She says the dress is very stiff and won't lay right out of the box.  Laments that there isn't a stand if one wants to display the Barbie out of the box.  She says the dress material isn't of great quality and the ear rings fit oddly in the ears.On the plus side she states that the doll is beautiful to look at and the make up is well done.She isn't sure she would pay the asking price.

This is an easy to assemble play gym, that is quite sturdy.  The mat is round, which makes the play area smaller, but it has a nice assortment of toys to hang on the arch.  The arch is nice to keep baby reaching to touch, which is great for building coordination.  The little fox is great when baby is lying on his/her tummy.  The fox has soft lights and plays about 20 min of music.  As baby grows the fox can be used for play as well.Thus far it has kept the babies visiting our home occupied and happy for an extended time.It is $70 but it keeps the lil ones occupied and builds coordination skills.

Its not the best quality and not the worst.  The "Amish" leashes we get from our trainer seem to last longer, and be of higher quality in thickness and stitching. The button at the clip was coming out of the leather in a few weeks.

This is one amazing vacuum!  We have an aging Dyson D45 and decided to test this Cinetic against it.  Firstly, it comes very well packed.  There is a picture-based instruction booklet and assembly is straight forward, snap-together, and took about 10 minutes (including putting the myriad attachments in their bag).The cord is a few feet longer than the D45, which is quite handy.  The vacuum hose is longer as well.  Compared to the old Dyson, this one is heavy and with the big ball it is a bit harder to maneuver, but it is still a feat of engineering how a twist of the wrist turns this vacuum!We have a German Shepherd (German Shedder) and my wife and I are mild to moderately allergic to his dander, so vacuuming is quite important. We had not vacuumed for two days prior to this test. We got out the trusty D45, which had recently been serviced, and vacuumed away.  It took three runs in each room before the D45 canister ceased to have something in it, so each room had been vacuumed 4 times!  Now we hit it with the Cinetic.  The first run filled the canister 3 times in the rooms he spends the most time in and filled the canister twice in the others!  The second run had virtually nothing in the canister!  Further, being allergic, one can feel the change in the air as you are vacuuming!  It is seriously noticeable, the HEPA filter on this beast really works!  We now vacuum daily with this amazing vacuum, and still cannot believe how much fills the canister after just one day.  The dust in the southwest and the dog (summer is shedding season) really get their stuff in the carpet and the Cinetic really gets it out!All of the attachments work brilliantly.  The one for the ceiling fan is genius.  The little suction powered spinning head one, works great on upholstery and does the stairs right...it actually fits perfect in the stair riser (we have carpeted stairs).It does a great job on hard surfaces as well.  One touch turns off the brush and the self-adjusting head goes right to work.  I actually saw a ball of fur rolling toward the vacuum as I was using it on the tile. It is, however, a bit harder to maneuver on the tile than the D45.I can't say enough good about this vacuum or recommend it more highly.  It is so amazing we got a second one for upstairs as it is a bit heavy for my bride to carry upstairs.

This apron has high quality construction that consists of three different fabrics. All the fabrics are attractive except the skirt fabric which reminds me of my Grandmas kitchen in the 1960's, though that may be perfect for those into the retro look.  Its the perfect length, has nice long ties that can easily wrap around your waistline and tie in the front.it fits a size 16 woman. Out of the package it is very stiff, and needs washing before wearing. It washes nicely, and the stiffness goes away with the first wash.

Keeping in mind that they are made of woven paper and quite inexpensive these are very nice soft-sided storage units.  The double zippers and double handles are a nice touch.  The zippers are a bit on the flimsy side, but I am not expecting a lot in that department from units costing about $7 each.  All surfaces are soft, there is not a hard bottom in these so one needs to consider the surface they will be setting on or if you are overstuffing the.  They collapse almost completely flat when empty, which is also nice.For the price, they are a great solution for off-season linens, clothing and just about any other non-sharp object.

This is an awesome fan!  Assembly was straight forward.  Installation is a breeze.  The speed controller is a nice feature, it adjusts in a continuous manner from min to max.  The garage cools in short order with this bad boy!  It does get fairly loud from about 50% through max, but it isn't ear damaging loud in my estimation.  This is definitely a commercial product.  It is well-built and solid.  I, like another reviewer, felt the set screw to hold the blades on the motor could be a problem point.  I addressed it with Locktite.  One could drill a hole and add a cotter pin or safety wire.

This set is on the small side, which can be good for small hands, but not so great for full-sized food!Pro:Pasta spoon works great.Cons:1. They look cheap2. They are not very sturdy, they actually bend slightly.3. The spatula isn't strong enough to flip a burger, it is really unusable except for maybe sliders!4. Though they are supposed to be dishwasher safe, they got a white discoloration after one washing.5. The color isn't as bright as online, the red is much more muted.

The Dove Men + Care Everyday Gift Pack is comprised of Shampoo, Body wash, and Deodorant.  The scent is fairly unified amongst the three and is reminiscent of Polo to me.  The body wash made my skin soft and has a pleasant scent.  The shampoo is not over or under sudsy, and also has a nice scent.  The deodorant does work for 48 hours as claimed...I put it to the test and it performed as advertised.I think the kit is a good value and gives me "my own stuff" in the shower now.

The Netgear AC1200 was a snap to set up.  I used the WPS path with my Netgear R7000 router, set up was complete in a couple of minutes.  The other path involves set up through a web page. I am using the unit in extender mode and not as an access point as I don't need separate networks.The R7000 has given me excellent signal strength in our home and for decent range outside of the home.  Placing this unit upstairs keeps all devices at max bars upstairs.  Placing it downstairs, in an outlet on the wall that abuts our backyard has ensured full-signal strength in all parts of our backyard.The Gigabit wired connection is great if I need to plug in for security reasons and I am not near a Cat5 drop downstairs.For me, this is another great Netgear product in my suite of Router, extender, switches, WiFi adapters, and Powerline devices.
This is an awesome series about Las Vegas in the 60's.  From what I can tell, it is more than loosely modeled after real people. It has a little wild west flavor, loads of cops and mobster action.

This is an excellent hub!  Having 3 fast charging power ports is fantastic for those with multiple devices.  Today I charged an iPhone5, iPhone 6+, and a Galaxy S5 from dead to 100% in about an hour (not exact as I was working), and that is simultaneously!Set up is simple, plug it in to power, plug it into a USB port on your computer and use any of the 7 USB connections and/or 3 charging ports.I tested the 7 ports with 7 devices (4 phones for development, a 128 GB thumb drive, a One TB USB 3.0 drive, and one three TB USB 3.0 drive) connected at once with no issues.  The 3 TB drive was running a backup, the 1 TB drive was doing a large directory copy, for the test the thumb drive was being used to hold a file that was being rendered in 3D with Photoshop. Two phones had app builds happening, one was playing music, and one was just slow charging, At the same time I was charging 3 phones.  No hiccups at all.I will be buying Anker USB ports from now on, and looking into other products by this fine company.

I will start by saying The KRUPS EA9010 is simply amazing!  It really is an automated Barista.The machine setup was easy for the most part.  There was a hiccup, and this was likely me, where after installing the filter and filling with water, it started a cleaning process that "I knew nothing about" however, it was on the next page of the instructions.  In my defense, I was a third of the way down the page in the instructions when what was to come on the next page started.The machine is pretty much plug and play.  It does have cleaning solutions, descaling tablets, and a water filter (complete with a test strip to find the hardness of your water). The descaling tablets are to be used after approximately 360 uses, the machine cleaned itself and used very little of the solution in the first run.  The Barista One Touch will tell you when to change the filter (about every two months), when to descale, when it needs more water, etc.The left side of the unit holds the cleaning solution, the used coffee grounds, and a pre-measured scoop for ground coffee. The right side holds the water.This unit grinds its coffee on demand or can use ground coffee.  It has myriad preset drinks to enjoy from both pre-ground coffee and from coffee beans (pre-ground coffee has its own button, which also unlocks the door to add the coffee once a drink is selected).  The drinks are both milk-based and regular coffee.  Taking more than a month to review this unit, I have to say every drink comes out as in the pictures.  Coffee and milk, perfectly layered, nice to look at and tasty as well.  It tells you exactly how much milk to put in and when.  Once the unit is done, it self-cleans the steam tube so that there is never milk residue on it!  From start to finish, I have a fantastic coffee based drink that rivals the specialty coffee shops, in less time than it takes the Keurig to give me a regular cup of coffee!  Once of the best features is the ability to create your own drinks and set them to a button on the touch-screen!  Then you have your custom drink at the touch of a button...awesome.The unit is very solidly constructed, well designed, looks great on the counter and yes is expensive, but very much worth it. If you spend $/day at the specialty coffee shop, at the end of a year you could have bought this and never had to leave the house for that drink!

The Netgear Powerline 1200 works as advertised!Setup is nil. You plug the unit in near your router, plug a Cat5 into the unit, then plug the second unit into a receptacle and connect a Cat5 from your computer or other device needing wired connectivity into the unit in the receptacle and you are done!I didn't test it on its exact speeds, but rather connected in a room where I have computers on a Gigabit switch.  Then did the old A/B testing.  I didn't notice a lag between the two, so if it is there, it is small.This is a great resource if your home doesn't have wired Cat5 drops and you need them, or if your WiFi doesn't reach where you need to be.  Or if you have need to not have your data in the air!  It works great on our TV, Amazon FireTV, Pioneer receiver, and Blu ray player.This unit solves the lost outlet issue with the Powerline 1200!

The Netgear Powerline 1200 works as advertised!Setup is nil. You plug the unit in near your router, plug a Cat5 into the unit, then plug the second unit into a receptacle and connect a Cat5 from your computer or other device needing wired connectivity into the unit in the receptacle and you are done!I didn't test it on its exact speeds, but rather connected in a room where I have computers on a Gigabit switch.  Then did the old A/B testing.  I didn't notice a lag between the two, so if it is there it is small.This is a great resource if your home doesn't have wired Cat5 drops and you need them, or if your WiFi doesn't reach where you need to be.  Or if you have need to not have your data in the air!  It works great on our TV, Amazon FireTV, Pioneer receiver, and Blu ray player.The only caveat I have found is that the unit is big, it takes up both outlets!  Other than that it is great!

Our house has one of these in the kitchen, the builder's electrical contractor dissuaded us from putting more in as "they are easy to install and cost a fraction of what we charge you"  Well the first part is true, they are easy to install.  The second part is patently false as it cost $16 each for each installed unit in our house and as one can clearly see here they cost more!  However, when you are in the mess of building a house, little things like research can get swept under the rug with work and the myriad decisions one has to make in a hurry.Like most homes today, ours is littered with device charges of different types, their power blocks and cables all over the place. Family and guests  are constantly vying for the coveted outlets that are high enough the dog can't get at the cords or devices when your back is turned!  This little gem, like the other in our kitchen allows 3 devices to charge at once if needed.  And keeps the wife's recipe book, I mean iPad, ever charged while she is cooking and looking along with her phone...and gives her an outlet for an appliance!This receptacle is quick and easy to install, just make sure you turn the breaker off, so as not to end up in the ER or worse!  The instructions are spot on.The USB port is 2.1 amp, so it charges fast.  Harder on the battery, yes, but fast.  iPhone 6+ went from zero to full in about 20 min, that is an estimate as I wasn't timing precisely.I highly recommend this unit to anyone.

I am giving this 4 stars for the concept.  The art I would give 3 stars.  The base is very easy to hang, if you know command strips then you know how easy it is. If not, remove plastic cover to the non-wall damaging adhesive, place the sticky side on the wall, use the included level to adhere the base to the Velcro side of the strip you just installed...Done.  The art is held on the base via magnets.  That is it, quick and easy art, or dry erase, or chalkboard on your wall.The Velcro fasteners work great, I will get them for other projects!One there is a riser that can be placed on a base to give and added dimension to clustered art pieces.  Naturally, the art work can be switched amongst the bases due to it being held magnetically.Other than there not being a great selection of ready made artwork, the only other downside, and it was fleeting, was a chemical smell that lasted about a week.We will create our own art and use these frames, they are a great idea!

Well, its hard to write a review for something like this, as most of us know and love these little treats!  However, here goes.  This is a great assortment of the miniatures, light, dark, crackle. GoodBar and so on.  The package arrived double boxed, undamaged, and not melted.  Now not melted is saying something as we were having a bit of a heat wave when these were delivered.  They taste good as expected and all that I have grabbed thus far, and that is several, have been fresh.Amazon has a great price on these little treats...grab some!

The Beolit 15 is an amazing sounding, compact, Bluetooth speaker.  Like many, for me Bang & Olufsen represents extremely high-end equipment. I recall going to the local audio stores and lusting for the B&O equipment.  That said, this is my first piece of Bang & Olufsen equipment and it does not disappoint.  I have listened to it for about 20 days and I love it.The bass is deep and punchy but not muddled or overpowering, the mids are good (not perfectbut its a portable speaker), and the highs are clear but not shrill.  We currently have it about 2 feet from a wall about midway down in a 45 x 20 room.  This little gem fills this room with clear, unvarnished sound, even at max volume levels!  I have been able to go anywhere in our home (3,000 sqft;  2 story) and have not lost the BT connection to my iPhone 6, this is quite impressive. The speakers front and back give a near 360 degree presence to the sound.  It provides 70 watts of clean power from two Class D amplifiers so it gets loud, and stays clean and clear.There is no volume control or EQ, which is standard fare for most BT speakers (Our Klipsch KMC-3 has volume and a remote). However, our devices have volume control and there are apps for EQ.  However, I didn't find that the sound needed EQ whether listening to Beethoven, Led Zepplin, or Five Finger Death Punch...it just sounds great no matter what source you put to it.We have gotten about 20 hours out on charge at low to medium volume levels.  The cord is sufficiently long and stores nicely in the back of the unit.Lastly, the unit is completely balanced when carried by the strap.Yes, it looks a bit like a picnic basket, but this picnic basket rocks!  If the Beolit 15 is in your price range and you want an amazing Bluetooth speaker I recommend it.

First the good. The colors are pretty and the border gives it a tailored look.  Done, that is the end of the good.Now the bad. It arrived with two small blue spots that look like ink, it has several runs in the material, the center section is extremely thin and would offer nothing, in terms of protection.

This rake does an excellent job of standing up our medium height pile carpet.  Makes it look like new!  We have a German Shepherd, and he is shedding a lot. I raked the carpet and vacuumed with the Dyson Animal, filling the bin with dog hair several times.  Then vacuumed with the Dyson again, not much in the bin.  Then I raked the carpet again and vacuumed with the Dyson and got about half as much hair out of the carpet as the first time!  Now this is hair that one can't see after running the Dyson the first time!  So, at least for our carpet, this rake works fantastically at getting up the dog hair.One thing I did notice is that the rake requires a fairly upright position to get the max benefit in standing up the pile.

Joy fielding is one of my favorite authors. I couldn't put the book down. The book has great characters. The main character, Bailey Carpenter, is easy to sympathize with.  She is a strong independent woman who turns into a frightened, pile of mush after being raped on an assignment as a PI.This book combines edge of your seat suspense with some humor, especially when her niece is around.It reminds me slightly of Alfred Hitchcock's Rear Window.I would definitely recommend this book

The Remington Women's Radiant and Smooth Razor is very good razor overall.The handle is easy to hold and it fits comfortably in hand.  The razor's head follows curves very well, glides easily, and  gives a very smooth shave with no nicks or cuts. Also, I have had zero armpit burn! I love the aloe lavender strip!So far I have only found one con, the razor head is large which makes it difficult to use in bikini areaI will definitely purchase this razor again.

I don't think the age range of up to five is accurate, but for the younger children it is between fun and a blast. Firstly, the packaging is one of the more frustrating I have encountered to get the pieces out of.  Once removed, the toy can be used in two ways, either with each half separated or with the two halves hinged together (this requires a assembly with a screwdriver). This configuration allows for the toy to be carried when closed.  Batteries are included and installed. It is well built and should last a long time.The animal stalls make animal sounds when opened and that is the extent of the noises this toy makes.  The silo just allows the child to drop things down it, which can be fun for little ones.Now for the kid testing. My one year old nephew loves it, he plays with it for about 30 min before moving on, or incorporating other toys with it.  My two and a half year old niece gets 5-10 minutes with it before moving on, usually packing the little farmer or animals off to baby or have a tea party with.This is a good toy for younger children to engage in imaginative play.

This is a great idea.  64 GB of storage that plugs into your iPhone, iPad, Mac, or PC.  First the unit must be plugged into a USB port to charge.  It is quite wide so if the ports are side by side it takes up enough space that nothing can be plugged into the port next to it.  It barely fits on a 2014 Mac Pro, as the ports are recessed and the drive is wide, but it does work.The iXpand app works great on iOS 8.2 syncing, uploading, downloading its all good.  As has been noted by others no DRM content can go on the disk.The instructions for the The SanDisk Secure Access app contained on the drive only explain how to install it on a PC, for the Mac there are no instructions.  I ended up dropping it in the applications folder and running it (or attempting to) from Launch Pad.  It never loads, so I cannot comment on it.I initially charged the unit on a PC, when I loaded the iPhone app and fired it up with the drive connected it had picked up a few folders from my PC without permission.Overall using the iPhone app is fairly intuitive and moving files around, viewing pics, listening to music, and watching videos on the drive is a straight forward process.  There were a few hiccups with playback of music and vids, but they were minor and just required starting the file over.  Future upgrades will likely take care of these issues.I have a couple of minor issues with this drive besides the behemoth size.1. the lightning connector is short and sits in a small recess on the drive, this just flexes up to be connected.  When using a case, like the Otterbox Defender, this barely makes it, and causes quite an angle on the cable, it is rubberized, but it is still an angle that makes me nervous about its longevity.  I am definitely not interested in removing the case each time I want to use the drive.2. It does not come with a USB extension cord, which would eliminate the issue of how much space it takes up when plugged in to USB.3. The cover for the USB connector is plastic and given to breakage and loss, which will expose the connector.  The thing is already a behemoth, maybe it could be made to have a retractable connector.4. It drains the iPhone battery faster than normal when used as a playback device for music/video.5. What happens to the info stored on the device if the battery dies completely?  This concern has me using this drive as an even more temporary solution than I would a normal flash drive.Other than these minor concerns having a flash drive for my iPhone is an awesome thing indeed!  It is a bit expensive, but a good option none the less.

The KMC 3 does not disappoint.  I have long been a Klipsch fan, and this unit met all my expectations, actually exceeded them.  I have tried many different units, Sonos, Beats, Marshall, but none satisfied me in all areas of clean mids, highs, and lows.  The KMC 3 does.  The vocals are crystal clear, the highs...amazing.  Crash cymbals, screaming leads, perfectly clear.  The mids are astounding.  But where I was most amazed was the bass...the beautiful non-muddy bass!  Batteries, battery life...blah blah blah...if you need to run it on batteries you will be blissfully happy all the way till they die.  The controls are simple...Bluetooth connect and volume...done.  If you need equalization, there are apps for that.  This simplicity and astounding sound make the KMC 3 worth every penny.
I love these OXO wooden spoons!  They clean up great and don't stain.  They are very comfortable to use and the flat bottom is a great feature that allows them to be set down without rolling around.

This is a surprisingly compact 2TB drive!  It takes up very little space, is quite slim, and best of all, just works!  I connected it up to a USB 3.0 port and, all I had to do was say yes to my Mac asking if I wanted the drive to be used for Time Machine.  Boom, off it went easy as pie.  The drive blends in with the stand on my Apple monitor, so it looks good as well.  The drive is quite fast, as it should be with a USB 3.0 connection.
My wife loves these OXO wood utensils.  She says they are the best she ever used, and loves the price!  They clean easily and have not stained.

This stuff really works!  Removed the urine smell in our backyard.  You just have to keep it wet after applying it and it does a fantastic job.  We have very hard soil so I aerated it and it made the effect last longer.

Its a chalk pencil, not much to say.  I got it to outline an item to cut foam in a Pelican case.  It wasn't great for that, it took several times to create a visible line.  But the wife loves if for fabric...so it's great for its intended use.

My wife has used this compound from another manufacturer for a while and it has helped with the effects of peri-menopause.  This product has continued the good results.  She has a significant decrease in hot flashes, insomnia, night sweats, dryness, headaches, fog, and mood swings.  Thus far she has had no negative side effects.  The smell is quite "herbal" that is her only sticking point, but it's not enough to stop taking the product.  The price is great at Amazon, so we will likely switch to the Doctor's Best brand.

Much like Adobe's "Elements" programs have very full feature set from their big brother programs, but with a "more user friendly" user interface, Corel Painter Essentials 5 is the little brother of Corel Painter 2015.This program allows you to paint from scratch with a dizzying array of brushes and canvas types.  You can use a photograph and turn it into a painting using some automagic features and then clean it up by hand.  I am fairly proficient with Painter, so I can attest that the feature set is quite robust in the program, for me it is harder to use as I had to dig around to find things. That said I am impressed.  The test was with my wife, who had no experience with the program.  She was easily able to install it, and figure out how to get the basics going.  She found the difficulty in learning the program, to the level one can in a 30 day period, to be much like any other program she uses.The program works with a Wacom Tablet, which makes it much more "natural".  Doing the finesse work with a mouse is tedious, to me anyway.  This is a 64-bit program, thankfully, so it takes advantage of modern computing power and memory in the GBs.That said, she is having a blast with it and is creating up a storm.  This has had, what I think, is it's intended effect, she wants Painter!

It is very sturdy, the pages are thick so little hands can turn them, it engages them to touch and learn a bit.  Its very limited in it's shapes, colors and depth of learning.  However, it's $15 so I wasn't expecting a lot out of it. Just a little something to get the little ones to grasp, carry, turn pages, and learn a little along the way.

As usual another quality product from Cables to Go, they never disappoint me!  I am using this in my structured wiring panel to overcome the ridiculous two-outlet receptacle it came with.  Now my router, switches, modem and such have the power they need to be locked away in the box, thanks to Cables to Go!

This is a lightweight, functional pair of headphones.  The 4 stars is based on what I expect from a $30 pair of headphones, so please do not think that I am calling these audiophile quality!The sound is pretty good for this level.  The bass isn't deep, nor would I expect it to be, but it isn't muddy either. The mids are ok but the highs are on the tinny side for me.  But for casual listening the sound quality is fine though.As stated they are lightweight and folding, but they are not very sturdy and I wouldn't expect them to hold up for more than a year.  I get the feeling these are for portable devices as the cord is a bit short for plugging into a sound system and sitting a while.

It is buggy. It crashes on Windows 7 SP1, it crashes on Windows 8.1.  I have 96 GB of ram, SSD drives, SATA III drives on the Windows 7 box, I have tried it on both drive types and it crashes incessantly.  The Windows 8.1 box is a standard 12GB 1TB machine and no luck there either. Having a 64 bit program is sweet, having one that doesn't work isn't. I can't do a proper review because I can't get it to stay running long enough to do anything on either machine.  I have Premier Elements running on both machines as well as Premier Pro with no problems. I give it two stars for the free tracks, myriad presets, and free training...if they get it patched and working it could be a much better rated program.  However, for now I don't have the time to bother with it or Corel's lackluster support (long time Painter user and former Word Perfect user...so I know their support).

Thus far this has been a great product. It appears to be solidly constructed.  We have used it for stew, roasting a chicken, potatoes, and a roast.  We use roasting bags so we have not had an un-browned meat experience.  I don't want to have an un-browned meat experience, so we won't be experimenting without the roasting bag!  The meals we have prepared thus far in this roaster oven have been great.  We have yet to try it for pies, cakes, or brownies as thus far the "treats" are too valuable to experiment with!  But I am sure the day is coming.The only cons thus far is the how hot the unit gets to the outside parts that can be touched and how easy it is to get burned getting things out.  We use silicone oven gloves for this baby, both to open the lid (handle gets hot) and to remove the food!Overall we like this product, it cooks well, saves an oven for something else, is easy to clean, and looks nice.

I wish I could give this negative stars.The iOS and Android apps are buggy.  The unit continually drops off the network.  You must have your phone and the unit on a 2.4 Ghz network, so no blazing ac stuff here.  We wanted to use this to keep an eye on our puppy if we needed to leave for a short time and couldn't bring him.  We thought it would be good to keep an eye on him and be able to give him a reassuring voice if he became upset....wrong.Sound doesn't work, camera is always dropping.  Pan seems to only be swiping around a zoomed image and not panning the camera...or it doesn't work either.  I could go on and on about the negatives of this device, but I will sum it up with don't even think about buying this to help you watch over anyone or anything!I definitely would not recommend this device.

The Post-it Dry Erase surface is quite cool!We have textured drywall walls which didn't seem ideal for the surface so we opted to screw a piece of foam board to the wall and adhere the Dry Erase Surface to it.  The Dry Erase surface was easy to install, wasn't curled at all when we unrolled it and took only a few minutes to install.The item doesn't come with any markers nor a tray.  We purchased the companion tray that adheres with command strips and have a great, easily installed 4'x3' dry erase surface in, literally, just a couple of minute!

The Hangman picture hanger is amazing!  We used this and a 4' version to hang large heavy pictures and a mirror that is over 6' long and 4' high.The Hangman made hanging the large pieces quick and easy.Two perfectly level installations done in a very short time.  The Hangman is my new method for hanging every picture and mirror in the house...quick and level every time.  No fuss at all.

This is a great, standard size cake pan. The construction is heavy-gauge metal folded at the corners. It seems like the construction will hold up very well.  The non-stick surface works beautifully.  Brownies slide right out and cleanup after brownies and lasagna was a breeze...for the most part a little hot water and a gentle rubbing had the pan free of debris and ready for the dishwasher.  All it needs is a lid!Its oven safe up to 450 degrees and has a 1 year replacement warranty.So far with two uses it is a great cake pan.

As others have said, it has a few blemishes.  But overall it looks good, was easy to assemble and all the parts and pieces were included.The color is true to the picture, the hardware and hardware color is also true to the picture.  It's not Basset or Ethan Allen, but its also 7-10 times less expensive!It fits the bill for price and looks in our kitchen nook and we won't be upset when it gets scratched and nicked up by guests, puppies, and us!

Like the cheapo at the grocery store It's corkscrew and it opens wine bottles.  However, unlike the cheapo at the grocery store, the Metrokane 4040 Rabbit is ergonomic, removes the cork with relative ease, doesn't destroy the cork, and the non-stick spiral makes the cork easy to remove from the corkscrew.The black handle grips the bottle top, so you don't have to.  The rubberized handle makes screwing the corkscrew in nice and comfortable. As you screw it down, the wings rise up,  Once they are up, push them down and slick as can be the cork is removed and you are enjoying your wine!This is my first non-grocery store cheapo...and I will never go back!  If you have been living with the grocery store cheap, spend a little extra and get this corkscrew, you won't regret it.
We like it!  Turns our TV into a crackling fireplace.  Not much more to say than that!
This is a great aluminum case.  Installing the hard drive was a snap.  The drive was installed and I was using an old hard drive in under 5 minutes.  This is a very good value.

I bought these for my wife and she loves them.  She is able to put certain kinds of hand cream on at night and the gloves help keep the cream on her hands and are aiding not only in softening but in healing her hands.  We have purchased 3 pair now so they can be rotated and washed regularly.  They are very soft as well.

Great 3D glasses at a great price.  The glasses are comfortable, do not cause eye strain and fit comfortable over prescription glasses. There only two downsides that I have come up with. 1. The glasses are not rechargable and as such you must keep spare batteries on hand. But that also has an upside.  You aren't jumping through hoops or tossing out the glasses when a rechargable battery would finally die. 2. there is nothing blocking light or other distractions from the side of the glasses.  Both of these are minor to me and #1 can easily not be considered a negative.  For that reason, and the fact that, unlike my Sony, Sharp included 2 pairs with the TV, I am leaving the 5 star rating and not dropping it to a 4.

So far so good.  The Lift and Lock Pole Caddy took less than 2 minutes to be installed in our shower. One simply screws the needed pole pieces together, unlocks the bottom locking mechanism, places it where you want it and slides the pole up to the ceiling (you will hear clicks as its ratcheting mechanism locks on the way up). When it is firm against the ceiling and shower pan, then you press the locking mechanism down and you're done.  Adding the trays is a snap.  Just place them where you want and press down till you hear a click.So far we have some heavy shampoo and conditioner bottles on their own trays, razors, body wash, loofahs, etc on the trays and everything is just fine.  Of course I wouldn't put overly heavy items on the trays, but they are sturdy.  It also comes with a spare rubber piece that goes against the ceiling (that I nearly threw out as it was attached to some packaging inside the box with a bit of tape.)Some trays have large holes to place the bottle lids through when you need to turn your shampoo, conditioner, etc upside down and still keep them on the unit.Overall, it is a nice looking, solid unit that does exactly what it says and takes just a couple of minutes to set up.  Ours is brushed nickel and it matches perfectly with the other brushed nickel pieces in the bathroom.It is a very nice solution that takes up little space in the shower.Two week follow up: The unit is holding up well. It hasn't moved from its original installation location, the shower pan has a bit of a downward slope at the corner, where the unit is located. I feared a little movement and regular tweaking due to the slope and have items on the caddy, but thus far the fears are unfounded.
This was an unexpectedly fun, quirky, movie.  We took a chance on it and are glad we did. All of the actors did a great job. The family dynamic was hilarious. It's one I will definitely watch again.

I have an older Wahl unit that has more attachments than this, but includes the same 3 trimmer heads. To be honest, of all the extras the older unit has I only use the one that is equivalent to the guide comb.  This guide comb is far superior in ease of use!  I have loved this old trimmer and would have only replaced it with another Wahl, it has a long charge time, but also a long use time.This new unit blows it out of the water!  It charges so much more quickly, the quick charge feature is awesome!  I ran the unit out of charge testing the 3 hour run time, it a bit longer than 3 hours, but there was no load of trimming the hair.  The one minute quick charge let me get through a quick beard edge trim.The main trimmer give a nice close stubble trim, it is a bit nicer than my old unit.  The precision trimmer functions great, I use it to trim the 'stache and errant hairs in the brow and such.The dual shaver head does a great job of getting the stubble down to baby smooth where the beard no longer resides.The travel pouch is a great extra, the stand is about 80% smaller than the old one I have and thus the lady of the house won't need to hide it under the sink!

This is a very nice, very sturdy key hanger/mail center/note station.  The unit is fairly heavy guage steel, comes with mounting hardware and chalk, but not an eraser. We elected to hang it with commander hooks under the chalkboard and it is holding just fine with every hook filled with keys, a bit of mail occasionally, and a nice note from the lady of the house!Thus far it has been quite handy, I don't forget mail/other items I need to take as it is right in front of me as I get my keys.  It's always nice to have a little note!

I love Mediabridge cabling.  It is always top quality, shipped well, works perfectly.  I have never had a failure and this cable is no exception.  Further, Mediabridge always contacts me after the sale to see how things are going.  They have awesome cables at great prices.

These are sturdy hangers.  They hold my shirts up off the floor without making marks on the shoulders.  The best part, according to the lady of the house, is the little hooks for clothing with shoulder straps, like tank tops, dresses, and such.Great bargain as well.

This is a nice keyboard/case.  I have found it to be lighter and better built than my Logitech Solar keyboard case.The iPad slips easily into the case and Bluetooth pairing is a snap.  After charging the case, inserting the iPad and pairing took about a minute.This case has 3 positions for the iPad and they magnetically lock into place.  A feature missing and immediately superior to the two positions that required little feet in a ridge on the Logitech.  Placing the unit into one of the 3 positions also turns on the bluetooh keyboard, removing the device from the slot disconnects the bluetooth keyboard....no buttons!  The three positions are well thought out as well. The two with on the Logitech are supposed to encompass typing and media consumption...The Belkin is superior here as well.The keyboard can fold behind the tablet in two ways. 1. Keyboard facing out. 2. Keyboard facing the iPad.  Position 1 is the most comfortable as the keys are not in your hand.  Further position 2 allows the magnet that turns the iPad off when the case is closed to be on the same side as the iPads "off" magnet and this can turn your iPad off when using it.  If one folds the keyboard so that it is in position 2, the keys face the iPad which is more comfortable and the case's magnet is on the opposite side of the iPad and does not turn the iPad off.The magnet that puts the iPad to sleep when the case is closed is very strong (likely why is causes the sleep issue when the keyboard is folded back with the keys facing out.  This serves to keep the case closed nice and tight, another thing lacking in the Logitech Solar.  It flopped open constantly.The keyboard has a good layout and the keys feel good when typing.  I have large hands (4x motorcycle gloves)  and have had no issues thus far.Thus far the keys out folded position turning off the iPad has been the only tiny issue with this product.  Charge appears last, the keyboard is comfortable and the keys feel good, build quality is better than my Logitech Solar, and it is thin and light.I have been fortunate to not have any of the keyboard scratching the screen protector issues that other reviewers have had.  So, for me, this is a very nice keyboard case that works very well.

Johnny Yuma was a Rebel, he roamed through the west, Johnny Yuma the Rebel, he wandered alone ....one of the greatest theme songs sung by the late great Johnny Cash (who appears in episode 13 of season 1 on disc 2)...how exciting to see this series released !!!!!UPDATE: AUGUST 20Just got my copy and did a quick scan, as mentioned in the product description, each episode starts off with the theme song, only the first few lines, however in the end credits, the FULL Version of the song is sung. The show's theme song, "The Rebel" alias "The Ballad of Johnny Yuma", was composed by Richard Markowitz, with lyrics by Andrew J. Fenady. Members of the Western Writers of America chose it as one of the Top 100 Western songs of all time.Some interesting facts about Nick AdamsDate of Birth 10 July 1931, Nanticoke, Pennsylvania, USADate of Death 7 February 1968, Beverly Hills, Los Angeles, California, USA  (overdose of drugs he was taking for a nervous disorder)Birth Name Nicholas Aloysius AdamschockHe joined the U.S. Coast Guard in 1952, allegedly to avoid being drafted into the Army during the Korean War.He became a close friend of James Dean after playing a small role in Rebel Without a Cause (1955).The following is the episode guide for The Rebel originally aired from 1959 - 61.Season 1Ep 1: Johnny Yuma (John Carradine,Dan Blocker,Jeanette Nolan)Johnny Yuma returns home one year after the war's end to find a gang of thugs have extorted a local mine and murdered his father while his father's deputy and the rest of the town live in fear and despair.Ep 2: Judgment (J Pat O'Malley,Sue Randall)Johnny captures Will Randall who tried to steal is horse so he could flee a pursuing posse. Johnny agrees to testify against Randall, but is surprised how quickly the man's trial and subsequent execution are scheduled.Ep 3: Yellow Hair (Royal Dano,Allen Jaffe,Eddie Little Sky)A mortally wounded soldier stumbles into Johnny's camp. Before he dies, he says only one thing: "Fort Concho." Johnny rides to the fort and discovers it empty of soldiers.Ep 4: Vicious Circle (Ed Nelson,George Macready)Yuma is accosted by two ex Yankee Prisoners seeking to take gold from a Captain Pollack who later Yuma learns is a demented ex-Confederate prison officer who hoards prisoner mined gold with which he plans to reverse the outcome of the war.Ep 5: Panic (Karl Swenson,Jamie Farr)Seeing vultures circling a cabin, Johnny Yuma rides to investigate and discovers a family stricken with illness. Johnny rides to the nearest town to fetch the doctor, but the townspeople, led by the hardware store owner insist he leave town immediately because they fear Yuma has contracted diphtheria from the squatters.Ep 6: The Scavengers (Richard Evans)Yuma happens upon a ruthless gang of drifters running out of supplies and proceeds to join in the defense of a nearby family that he has learned the gang is targeting.Ep 7: School Days (Warren Oates)Realizing Yuma is literate and in admiration of his ability to stand up to illiterate Armbruster family, Liam O'Shea offers Yuma a temporary schoolmaster job and he gains the affection of Peggy of which Troy Armbruster is jealousEp 8: Dark Secret (William Bryant,Robert Hutton)After Yuma kills a man in self defense, he finds himself in the position of having to mediate between the man's dangerously defensive widow and his associates who include his employer and co-workersEp 9: Misfits (Hampton Fancher)Johnny Yuma seizes leadership of a teen gang whose dream is to rob the local bank and never have to work again. When Yuma spied their comfy fire in a suspiciously familiar mountain nook, the trio attacked him, but the tiny terror fought them off, then eloquently ventured to dissuade them from their sketchy planEp 10: In Memoriam (Bob Steele,Agnes Moorehead)Johnny rides into a small town during their holiday commemorating the death of the town matriarch's son, Phillip Lassiter in battle four years earlier.Ep 11: The VagrantsYuma is arrested for vagrancy upon arrival in town put on a road gang of a group of men that the corrupt sheriff has falsely arrested for vagrancy to work on projects without wages and he immediately starts leading a plan to escape.Ep 12: Gun City (Otto Kruger)Yuma arrives in a town in which the local editor checks guns and, when he checks Johnny's, one is discovered missing. It is learned Ted Keller has taken the gun to settle a perceived injustice to his father.Ep 13: The Death of Gray ( Johnny Cash !!!!!)A Confederate colonel and two of his marauders live in seclusion to avoid consequences of the war but the two marauders kidnap a banker's daughter and send Yuma to collect the ransomEp 14: Angry Town (Jack Elam)In self defense Yuma kills a man appointed sheriff by his gang leader brother who seeks revenge against Yuma while he intimidates the fearful townspeople to isolate Yuma by transacting no business with him.Ep 15: Gold SeekerYuma attempts to take a man for killing an Apache woman over gold to the nearest fort for trial but must pit his story against the story of the man to Apache chief Running Wolf who was the father of the woman to whom the man was husbandEp 16: Glory (Marie Windsor)Yuma, seeing Glory's banishment for murder, offers to help her to the next town for trial but, while supplying in Glory's town, he runs afoul of Emma who has falsely accused Glory to keep her control of brother Don against Glory's love.Ep 17: The UnwantedYuma rescues old Sam Amister from thieves and takes him to his hometown where Yuma learns Amister is hated for grave robbery but Yuma expects there is more to his grave digging than valuable stealing.Ep 18: The Crime (Walter Sande,Richard Devon)Yuma brings items he found on a destroyed horse to location suggested by the items where he is arrested by the Sheriff for suspected murder and remains to defend a Mexican boy then held for the crime and being railroaded by the deputyEp 19: Noblesse Oblige (Robert Vaughn,Kenneth Tobey)Yuma visits former commanding officer Quincy Bannister who is irrationally and overtly pursuing the prosecution of alleged murder Newt SchofieldEp 20: LandYuma delivers Gottwald a document in a land dispute with Hauser proving Gottwald's right but, although Gottwald has a bad heart but lacking money for appeal, he agrees to a Hauser deal for a day walk off of other Hauser land in trade.Ep 21: He's Only a Boy (Robert Blake)Yuma in town to deliver a letter to Lick Stribling is targeted by young Virgil Moss who has become a vicious aspiring gunfighter in an effort to defend his family name against the charge of cowardice.Ep 22: Take Dead Aim (Mala Powers)Yuma is befriended by a married couple who perform a shooting act. When the alienated wife forces her affections upon Johnny to persuade him to run away with her, the obsessive husband vows to kill himEp 23: The Rattler (Richard Jaeckel,Keith Richards)Snake bit Yuma collapses at the home of a marshal targeted by hired killers where he is taken in by the wife who is in the company of Roader, a hired killer feigning friendship, who kills the marshal on his return home and frames Johnny.Ep 24: You Steal My Eyes (Cathy O'Donnell)Yuma finds a trapper caught in a bear trap and takes him to cabin where he discovers the man's blind daughter who mistakes him for an enemy until the actual brigands come to steal pelts meant to pay for the woman's eye operation.Ep 25: Fair Game (James Drury,Patricia Medina)Yuma meets Pace at a stage depot. They are soon joined by passengers on an arriving stage to wait overnight for a stage connection. Among the passengers on the arriving stage are bounty hunter Farnum with his prisoner Cynthia Kenyon who is wanted for murder. When Farnum is poisoned, the others want to release Kenyon to prevent harm to themselves but Yuma prevents it.Ep 26: Unsurrendered SwordJohnny goes to a small Mexican town to retrieve a General's sword for the General's widow, and he finds the circumstances of the General's death differ from what he was told.Ep 27: The Captive of Tremblor (Guy Wilkerson)Johnny, badly wounded, is taken to the town of Tremblor, where the doctor saves his arm. But why is the doctor being kept in a jail cell?Ep 28: Blind Marriage (Victor Buono)Yuma interferes at a stagecoach station when prejudice toward a Chinese father and daughter becomes physical and assists again as four thieves of mixed breeding attempt to steal on the road a dowry for the daughter's arranged marriage.Ep 29: Absolution (Gloria Talbott)When a sweetheart of Johnny's youth is dying, her husband, a former Union officer for whom she betrayed Yuma, seeks out Yuma so Johnny can say that he forgives the woman and assuage her guilt.Ep 30: A Grave for Johnny YumaWhen Yuma comes to meet a unknown woman who has written him, he discovers her brother embittered by her dearth digging a grave for Johnny Yuma for whom he blames her death so Johnny joins the man incognito to find the impostorEp 31: In Memory of a Son (Steven Marlo)Charlie Burton summons Yuma and three other members of a rebel raiding party in which his son was killed and informs them that he is giving them a gold mine in the Mojave Desert in memory of his son but mistrust and murder ensueEp 32: Paint a House with Scarlet (Clu Gulager,JohnAnderson)Johnny intervenes when fanatical Ezra Taber and his son harass, torment and terrorize a widow because of her former career as a dance hall girl.Ep 33: Grant of Land (Paul Richards,Ed Nelson)Johnny signs on as a hand for Congressional Medal of Honor winner, former Union soldier, Paul Travis who has settled for health reasons among Confederate sympathizers who mean him harm.Ep 34: Night on a Rainbow (Gail Kobe,James Best)Yuma arrives a year after being summoned by Ted Evans, a drummer from his Confederate regiment, to find the man addicted to pain medication and acts to help Evans break the habit while experiencing interference from an unscrupulous druggist.Ep 35: Lady of Quality (Joanna Moore)Yuma comes upon a woman whose mind has become unstable after the murder of her husband. After the woman mistakes Yuma for her dead husband, he takes her for medical treatment and baits a trap for the murderers.Ep 36: The Earl of Durango (Victor Buono,L Q Jones)Yuma arrives in town to begin his job as bodyguard for a man who is killed upon his arrival. Oddly the townspeople are elated by the death but Yuma is determined to have justice and receives unwanted assistanceSeason 2Ep 1: Johnny Yuma at Appomattox ( J Pat O'Malley,Ed Nelson)Yuma is in a town where the people's failure to accept the war's outcome encourages a boy's desire to seek revenge for his father's death in the war. Yuma relates a tale of Yuma's struggle with the outcome at Appomattox to dissuade the boy.Ep 2: The Bequest (John Carradine)Jeremy Hake receives news that his mine is worthless at the same time news that his family is in need. Hake commits murder in a robbery attempt to help his family. Hake asks Yuma to surrender him for reward offered for the murder.Ep 3: The Champ (Michael Ansara)Yuma buys the contract of a war buddy who is a past his prime boxer and attempts to discourage the friend from further competition.Ep 4: The Waiting (Claude Akins)Yuma stops at a bar where a bounty hunter is holding the wife of a criminal to attract the criminal. The bounty hunter detains Yuma whose resemblance to the criminal motivates the bounty hunter to develop an alternative plan.Ep 5: To See the Elephant (Mark Goddard,Ellen Corby)Bull Hollingsworth asks Yuma to take Hollingsworth's son to town so that the son may have a set of life experiences while a debt is collected from a man between whom the man and Bull is bitterness.Ep 6: Deathwatch (James Best)Yuma finds himself in the midst of a confrontation between a sheep man haunted by war memories and Mexican bandits.Ep 7: Run, Killer, Run (Richard Jaekel,Ed Nelson)Yuma is shackled to Traskel during a jailbreak and forced on foot to flee with Traskel who believes that his twin brother who wants to kill him in revenge is in pursuit.Ep 8: The Hunted (Leonard Nimoy)Yuma's friend Jim Colburn has been found innocent of a murder for which is was to hang. Before the news of innocence has arrived, Colburn has escaped from jail with a posse unaware of Colburn's innocence in pursuit.Ep 9: The Legacy (Soupy Sales)The Ricker family frames Yuma for a murder that one of the Ricker's has committed and then arranges for Yuma to flee town before he is hanged but Yuma refuses to leaveEp 10: Don Gringo (Gigi Perreau)Yuma arrives at a scene where Demetria's family escort has been wiped out and she despairs there is no respectable escort to deliver her to an arranged marriage but her expressed feelings for Yuma contradict her despair.Ep 11: Explosion (L Q Jones)Yuma happens upon a scene where Roy Shandel murders his partner to keep the money from a stage robbery. Yuma nabs Shandel and delivers him to the Socorro jail but Shandel's father uses nitroglycerin to force the son's release.Ep 12: Vindication (James Drury)After his horse is killed by Apaches, Yuma is found by a stagecoach driver. On the stage is Travers who is blind and tormented by a previous stagecoach encounter with Apaches in which his wife was killed when they were left by a driver.Ep 13: The Scalp Hunter (John Dehner)John Sims, a family friend, saves Yuma from an attack by Indians at Yuma's campsite and implores Yuma as payment for saving the lives of Yuma and for once saving the life of Yuma's father to track Masi and take Masi's scalpEp 14: BerserkYuma stops to visit Dunsen who arrives in town and commences to randomly shoot townspeople. The townspeople believe Dunsen's war service has driven him mad and want to kill Dunsen but deputy Maggio permits Yuma to talk Dunsen to sanity.Ep 15: The Hope Chest (William Demarest)Yuma aids Ulysses engaged in a gun battle and accompanies Ulysses back to his camp where Yuma learns that Ulysses is in the habit of offering the a chest with two hundred dollars to any man who will marry his daughter FelicityEp 16: The LiberatorsThe Stellings have been left behind by townspeople fleeing hostile Indians. A group of Mexican insurgents lead by the demagogic Commandante and bent on enforcing Spanish Land Grants arrive in town to take advantage of the situationEp 17: The Guard (Ed Nelson)A sadistic former Union prison guard who tortured Yuma wants revenge for the punishment he suffered when Yuma escaped from the POW campEp 18: The Promise (Gigi Perreau)When Yuma arrives to give Laura Buford the affects of her father, Yuma learns that she is being forced into the marriage to the younger Kincaid of a family that exerts their will by brutality and fear so Yuma vows to stop the marriage.Ep 19: Jerkwater (John Dehner)George Campbell whose brother Campbell believes Yuma killed in the war and his son provoke a gun battle with Yuma in which Yuma kills the son but is wounded. Godfather John Sims then comes to help Yuma escape from the town's vengeance.Ep 20: Paperback Hero (Virginia Gregg)A newswoman observes Yuma defending a boy against an adult bully and to carry out her boss' directive promotes Yuma has the typical Western hero in a news story much to the Yuma's displeasure and a detriment to his safetyEp 21: The ActressYuma is chosen to by an esteemed but unethical itinerant actress to take part in her performance and, while Yuma and she dispute wages, they are kidnapped by a man who demands that the actress performs for his traumatized daughter.Ep 22: The ThreatYuma arrives in a town in which an old friend of his father is sheriff and learns an advance team of marauders which includes a man who killed Yuma's father has arrived but none of townspeople including the sheriff want to defend the town.Ep 23: The Road to Jericho (Warren Stevens)Yuma rescues Sutro who is staked to an ant hill when Sutro tells Yuma he is responsible for the rescued but Sutro wants to rob Yuma's peacefully reclusive and scholarly friend Portal of an imagined fortune of gold.Ep 24: The Last Drink (Steven Marlo)Yuma is on a mission to rescue his cousin Eddie who has become a student of gunslinger DawesEp 25: The Burying of Sammy Hart (Peggy Stewart,Iron Eyes Cody)Elderly Kiowa Sammy Hart is believed to have kidnapped a boy who has actually gone willing to stay with Hart in his last hours but the father is on the hunt with malicious intent while Yuma intervenesEp 26: The Pit (Sreve Franken)Yuma arrives in a town with a woman to help her search for her husband in a town from which the husband has written of a successful mine but the townspeople are most resistant to help in the searchEp 27: Shriek of Silence (Frank DeKova,Yvette Vickers)Yuma is forced to kill outlaw Fallow in a gunfight and then learns Fallow has a deaf mute son. Yuma proceeds to help the boy find a home but two of Fallow's associates are on the trail to take the boy to recover loot that Fallow heldEp 28: Two Weeks (Frank Overton,Jamie Farr)An embittered confederate prison camp survivor talks cash short Yuma into a card bet of two weeks servitude on the man's property. When Yuma loses the bet, he learns that service must be under the prison camp conditions the man suffered.Ep 29: Miz Purdy (Jason Evers,Patricia Breslin)After convincing a woman alone at her homestead he is not an outlaw, Yuma joins forces with her to fend off marauders who have robbed a bank and killed a neighboring family.Ep 30: The Ballad of Danny Brown (Tex Ritter)Emily who awaits the return of her beau from prison befriends Johnny but Emily 's brother Vergil is bent on revenge against the beau who has killed Vergil's son for which Vergil convinced the town to wrongfully convict the beau for murder.Ep 31: The Proxy (Vaughn Taylor,Royal Dano)Yuma joins in an uneasy voluntary alliance of two other men to bring back from Mexico to testify in a bank failure scheme the fugitive bank president for whom the other two hold other unrelated animosityEp 32: Decision at Sweetwater (Yvette Vickers)Three murderous stage robbers when fooled that a mining executive carries the mine payroll propose to hold the man's son for delivery of the payroll but a saloon girl takes the son's place at which time Yuma pursues the outlaws.Ep 33: Helping Hand (Jack Elam)Seeking water, Yuma is forced to side with two brothers who are in a stand off with a better fortified and supplied uncle and cousin, a pair which have betrayed the two brothers' father and brother after a bank robberyEp 34: The UncourageousYuma strays into Mexico and becomes a witness to a conflict between a successful matador who is grooming his son to become a matador and his mother, the son's fiancée and the son himself whose wishes are against the plan.Ep 35: Mission--Varina (Willliam Schallert,Buck Taylor)Because he has been a member of secret group during the war, Yuma is enlisted as one of the members of the group to ensure Jefferson Davis' safety upon his prison release but one of the members means Davis harm.Ep 36: The Calley Kid (Richard Bakalyan)Johnny tracks down the man who knocked him out at his campsite and stole his horse and gun.
