This came in a smaller box that you might expect and it unrolls when you take it out and remove the plastic. Then it expands. At first it seemed a bit thin but it kept expanding to what I expected for size. It did have a bit of a smell but nothing like the smell of mattresses I've ordered before- I think it's likely the smell from the plastic they wrap these in. So far it seems pretty comfortable- this is for my 2 year old son and he hasn't complained. I lay on it with him before bed and haven't had any issues. I think it's not quite as thick and firm as some mattresses you might pay more for.Oh and it's very light weight to move.

Works as expected (I'm not pregnant so I can't attest to how they work in that regard). I use Dixie cups because you need to pee into a cup and dip these. I love these type tests because they're cheap and small to store (the box is compact)... I think they make sense if you are testing a lot. Personally I like having them on hand because I'm breastfeeding which can affect my cycle. If I'm late, I don't mind taking a quick test as it's not super expensive. Wish I'd never bought those $14+ ones back in the days before I discovered these!

About what I would expect... Average size capsules and I take them with vitamin K2 which is supposed to help body absorb the D. I can't speak to how well these specifically work as I'm not a doctor and I don't have my blood tested that often.

Can't speak to how well these work but I take them with Vitamin D to help absorbing it. I did notice that once I added K2, my D levels seemed to rise faster. No issues with pill size (they're the average size capsules).

This is a good price for a 4 pack, but I've tried two of them and both immediately have stopped working. My phone reports that these are not supported and are not Apple certified.This is a common and annoying issue with chargers for iPhones (ugh) so at this point I'm blaming Mac partially for causing this issue.I received these free in exchange for a honest review.

These are beautiful and can be submersed in water (The lights- not the battery pack) so I used them to light up my flower vase. They seem to work well and you can change the settings for how the lights sparkle. So pretty! They do take a lot of battery- 3 AA's so be prepared and have some on hand. I'm hoping if I am careful to not run these all the time that they won't go through batteries too quickly. They have a built in timer which is fabulous and will help with that, but I don't need them running for 6 hrs for my project (but I'll definitely use them that long if I do some outside crafts with them).See my craft and how these work on: https://youtu.be/tYzGawvnbJoI received these free in exchange for an honest review.

These are great for adults! I think they'd be very good in mixed drinks as they seem to keep the drink cooler than a plastic straw would. I use stainless steel water bottles which I love and these seem to have a similar effect in terms of keeping liquids cool.The brushes are really a nice addition. The straws are bent slightly so your brush can only go to the bent area, but the brush seems to reach the whole straw if you insert at both ends.These are the first reusable straws I've tried but I'm hoping to stop buying disposable straws. My kids are 4 and 2 years old and I don't think I'd want them walking around drinking from these. The edges aren't dull (I don't want to call them sharp because you wouldn't hurt yourself on them unless there was a bit of force used) and I can see where a child might get hurt if they fell while using one. I definitely will still have them use these at the table and use disposable ones if we happen to be moving around with beverages. Ideally, it would be nice to see a more rounded edge on these.I received these in exchange for an honest review.

These are great. I really like how breathable this fabric is and the double pairs are included. It's soft and comfortable against my skin. They appear to be well made.Alternative use: I needed something around my son's leg to keep a bandaid from falling off (he's 2) and used one of these. It fit perfectly and didn't rub, didn't leave marks on his leg, and was still breathable. I was really happy to have it work well because I wasn't sure what else to use.I received these in exchange for an honest review.

This is such a pretty bra. I like the thick straps and how soft the fabric is. I like the LOOK of the pull aside nursing bra- although I tend to find the nursing bras that unclip to be more practical. This is a pull aside and because it's a bit tight, it's not as easy to pull aside.I chose a medium as I'm normally a B cup. It's a bit small as I have a bigger torso (with a small cup), but it fit! My understanding is that it's best to have bras be a bit tight (on last hole to latch in back) to have the proper support and so it will still fit once it stretches out so this worked out well.I received this in exchange for an honest review.

This chainsaw is very small and comes with a nice case to carry it in. It's easy to pocket for use while hiking or to carry in your car.I didn't really know what we'd use this for or how practical it would be to use, but it actually does a really good job- if you're willing to put the muscle in. We have woods behind our back fence and this will be useful for getting some of the brush cut down... It's a tight space so electric items aren't always great to use. I also don't feel there's as much room for error or injury with this compared to electric items... Not to say you shouldn't be careful regardless.Here's a super short video of it in use.. My husband was cutting through a pretty large tree that has fallen. http://youtu.be/-ZsyqNnNheII received this product free in exchange for an honest review. All comments are my own.

These are too long on me, but fit otherwise. I generally can't find pants in my size that aren't too long.The material is decent but the fit just seems a bit off... I can't quite put my finger on why. I buy most of my yoga pants at Costco and I think I'm just used to their fit and how thick their yoga pants are. This thinner material seems to rip easier... Although these pants are thicker than the two pairs I've bought online in the past and had ripping issues with. Only time will tell how these stand up.

My son isn't quite 2 yet but I purchased this in hopes he'd catch on quicker with such a fun product. My 4 year old is a bit shy about using it and it's really small for anyone but the baby. So far we haven't gotten the 2 year old to use it so I can't say how well it works. I think my boys may feel more comfortable sitting on potty or using grown up potty to pee standing up because it is SO rare they ever see a urinal in use. Most of time we go out they're with me (mom), not daddy.It seems solidly built and the trough is easy to take out to empty. The spinner is a cute touch. There are a couple options for mounting it but I didn't want anything permanently stuck. The only place we had to put it in their bathroom is the side of the bathtub... If I decide to move it into our room, I might put it inside the walk in shower because that'd be an easy place to clean and there'd be no issue with missing.

Great price for quantity, but these aren't as sturdy as other brands. It's not a huge issue but we like to poke them through the tops of Danimals smoothies and these really bend and get messed up easily if I'm not careful. One got so messed up that I had to fix it or my son wasn't able to suck anything through it.They work well for using regularly though so it works for us.

Can't attest to how well they work compared to other probiotics, but my children enjoy them. They are a bit bigger than the gummy version that we had. I prefer vitamins that are on subscribe and save, but the gummies we had weren't delivered all summer due to worries they'd melt in heat. I wanted more reliability and these didn't seem to be an issue shipping. Hopefully these will go subscribe and save. I see powders but we've tried them in the past and it's hard to get the kids to drink them. Chewables taste good so they run for them instead of leaving a half finished sippy cup sitting around.I give these to my almost 2 and 4 year olds. They don't have issues chewing them, but I was a bit worried about my 2 year old chewing them completely so I made sure to keep an eye on him.

I made a DIY Halloween costume using this kit, as well as a few other products. My son loves it.I was a bit frustrated that everything is in 3 languages and English isn't the top language... My son is only 3 so I like him to see lots of English words primarily so he can start to recognize them. Not a huge deal but if there'd been a similar kit with English as the top language, I would've loved to get that instead.We've also got a Melissa and Doug costume with some of same toys... They're about the same quality for the other pieces, but the M&D set's stuff is reusable. The tickets in this kit are paper. I think my son will enjoy that feature. Also, the cuffs in the M&D version come off easy with no key, but this set actually has a key. I like that it has a key but no key is convenient too.I LOVE that this has a case... But there's a plastic cheap insert inside the case to hold everything when you buy it. I decided to throw it out- seems like all kids toys come with that sorta thing and I wish companies would just build a quality case that would hold all the items so the toys would all fit nicely back inside the kit. As is, the stuff just floats around in there... But I'm not taping the stuff inside the plastic insert over and over.Also, I wish the stickers came off more easily.Add: The police whistle doesn't actually work... It makes a reallllly low sound like wind whistling through something. I'm not sure if my child just drooled on it too much, if it's broken, or if it's a strategic move by the people who made it. Either way I'm liking that part as is, lol.

I used this to create a DIY police costume for my son. This is REALLY sturdy compared to other place pieces. It has a safety pin type attachment so you will need to be careful attaching it. It's a bit heavy. I love that it looks authentic and doesn't seem like it will break. The heaviness may be a problem for some people but my son (3) wasn't bothered by it.My MIL picked my son up a Melissa and Doug police costume, and the badge in it isn't as sturdy/heavy.
Been using Dove since I was little and it doesn't seem to cause any issues for my sons who both had eczema as babies so we've continued to use it.

I bought this to read to my 1.5 yr old.We read it twice with no success- he had a hard time sitting for it. I'm a social worker/psychology major so I think that this could work for some kids, based on the ideas behind it. It is REALLY boring to read and you need to practice reading it CORRECTLY if you want to get good results. If you read this with a high pitched excited voice, it won't work. I wish I'd bought the audio book instead and played it for him.I *believe* the best approach for this to get it to work would be consistently and repetition. It's similar to doing shivasana (spelling?) in yoga in my opinion where you don't relax the first time as the teacher leads it, but you get conditioned to relax over repeated classes.As such, given it is boring for parents to read, I think getting the audiobook instead, turning the lights off, and letting your child play quietly with a toy (something that doesn't flash or make noise) for the length of the book would be helpful. If you nurse your child to sleep before bed, you could also have it playing during that. Do this every night. Keep the room cool (our bodies need to cool off to sleep best according to doc we saw for our sons sleep issues). I'd try it for about 15-20 nights before giving up.Oh and there's not many pictures so getting the ebook or hardcover may be pointless. The ebook is nice for travel, but remember that we aren't supposed to have any  "screen time" for 1-2 hrs before bed- the lights can trigger our brains to stay awake. So if you get the ebook, I recommend turning it so your child isn't having the screen flashing in front of their face.

Just got these and washed them immediately. They're a very pretty brown and the fabric seems to be good quality.They seem to be retaining their color and quality well, although only many washing a will tell.

These work really well so far and seem to be easy to clean with no leaking (that I've noticed). My sons, 1 and 3, can both drink out of them easily. I like how the inside pieces fit nicely together and come apart for cleaning.
Fits great and my son LOVES them. I did see another planes set cheaper at the Disney store but they didn't have his size so I ordered on here instead.

I've been reading these a bit out of order, but i love each book, particularly how well the author links the books and storyline for the Ascension. The characters are well developed and the storyline is interesting. The romance is believable and sexy.

My almost 4 year old hasn't taken this off since we picked it up (at a store). It's got a hat, badge, as well as a walkie talkie that makes siren noises. He's been playing policeman a lot. There's a card in it for his "badge" that you can write your child's name on... It seems sturdy. Overall I think this will last. I haven't checked the wash instructions but it does appear like it'll be difficult to wash... It's got some see through plastic vinyl which won't deal with heat from wash/dryer.

Nice looking belt. My son LOVES it. I love that it's plain black so we can use it as a "police officer" belt for Halloween.Measure your child to make sure it'll fit... I wasn't really thinking and my son is almost 4 yrs old, slim, and it barely fits. His waist is 21.5" and the length of belt (total) is 26.5" including buckle (I think it's 23" to the last hole). Totally my fault as the listing clearly states how long it is. It's for a Halloween costume so it'll fit just fine for the time I need it.

English is a common language to the people of India, where over seven hundred are spoken. This is a boon for us because it makes for a rich literary tradition that has is immediately and directly available to the English speaking reader. This novel is no exception. While at heart it is a police procedural and a mystery, it is much broader in scope and grasp. It tackles the fascinating city of Mumbai, Sikh culture, the horrors of partition, the Bombay riots, organized crime, and much more of modern India. At it's heart are two central characters a weathered Sikh police detective Sartaj and a crafty powerful crime boss Gaitonde. In the opening chapters of the book Sartaj corners Gaitonde in an impenetrable fortress where Gaitonde takes his own life. Sartaj then takes on the task of finding out why he would and what exactly the notorious crime boss was up to. It turns out to have national implications and has also caught the attention of India's answer to the C.I.A.. Much of the story is told from Gaitonde's perspective it gives the story of his rise to power. Along the way many fascinating ancillary stories are told and a whole cast of colorful characters is brought to life. This is a sometimes long, but altogether satisfying, read.

No I haven't quite finished this lengthy and intimate look at the Roosevelts yet but already, there is much to say. Like all of Burn's films it does an excellent job of fleshing out it's subject and placing it (or rather them) into the context of American history. These two Roosevelt presidents were from different sides of the aisle but shared much more than their prestigious family name. Both overcame health obstacles, powering through disability and pain that would have cowed lesser men. Both were considered turncoats, traitors to the class in which they were raised. Both believed in loftier ideals than that of the privileged establishment. Above all both were extraordinary public servants when either could have gotten by on inheritance and birthright. And not to be forgotten is the courageous activist Eleanor Roosevelt who redefined what it was to be a First Lady and blazed new trails for all women of the twentieth century. Again, Burns brings these great Americans alive with exhaustive research, interviews with our greatest historians, and archival photos and footage. I can't see getting through this in one sitting, it is a lengthy work. But it is worth investing the time in viewing it at one's own pace. There is much to learn of our nation's history here.

This beautifully produced piece bears two similarities to A&E's Madmen, an early sixties timeframe and a handsome male lead with a secret past. But the similarities end there, this is a unique piece altogether. It is about a very successful London obgyn and surgeon with a hidden side business of providing safe illegal abortions to women in need. He is also is an early proponent of the nascent birth control pill which will go on to change society in radical ways. But some things still remain the same. Doctors are still predominately male, and the ultimate accomplishment for a nurse of that period is still to marry one and have a family. This is a great piece with a great cast and does loosely fit the mystery genre, but there is a lot here even for those who aren't mystery fans. It is a layered period piece with a great cast done by British television, which excels in such productions.

This beautiful album released in 1964 shortly after Washington's death Is Aretha's sixth studio album. It is in no way an imitation of the great singer's voice, they are very different singers, but a tribute to Washington's soulful side. Who better to capture this than the queen of soul herself. She captures the irreverent and blues driven ballad Evil Gal Blues perfectly somehow making it her own and still honoring Washington for whom it was a signature. Johnny Mercer's Drinking Again, another Washington favorite is given a beautiful intensity hear. She takes on two notable standards What a Diff'rence a Day Made and Unforgettable are performed with a distinct soul flavor, just as Dinah gave them, but still unique. If you are either an Aretha fan or a Washington fan this album is a must have.

This is one of the most ambitious thrillers I've ever read. It was long-listed for the Booker prize last year and is actually four shorter novels that make up the whole narrative which is broad in scope. It is essentially about how big business went to war in Iraq as much as our government did and what conflicts of interest and corruption can arise, Halliburton often came to my mind. There is a tragic bombing and a scapegoat on the run as well a revolving cast of very well drawn characters across several continents. Some characters pop up briefly only to return later. The action goes back and forth in time giving the different and interesting viewpoints of the main characters on the same events which gives us more of the clever plot. One must be on one's toes to keep up but it is entertaining and suspenseful as a whole. The best novel in the group and that most able to stand on it's own is The Kill. It is available separately in paperback if you are reluctant to commit to such a long piece. It is a vivid and richly imagined story within a story documenting the re-creation of a grisly murder set in the crime-ridden streets of Naples. While the author is British, many of the characters are American but use a vernacular that is sometimes distinctly British, but it doesn't detract from the quality of the piece as a whole. This is definitely my favorite Summer read and I am glad that I waited until it was available on kindle as a whole piece in the U.S..

The premise of this piece offends me on two levels. That masculine, gay men are some sort of rare exception to the rule. Not only an exception, but when stumbled upon are somehow superior. Masculine is good ergo the effeminate is bad, really? The other problem is that these gay men simply seem like a lot of modern gay men I've known. They aren't exactly all that straight acting to begin with they are in a lot of ways like many urban gay men.  Actually, to be blunt there is not much "acting" going on at all, except bad acting.

I like Clinique's skin supplies for men for many reasons. Most importantly, for me, they do not use perfume or other things that can irritate the skin. The second is that it gives me a simple, straight forward routine to follow without a lot of steps because basically, I'm lazy. This facial wash is a case in point. It cleans the skin well,without drying, which is a concern for men in their forties. Often I just wash with this and moisturize with M lotion. It's simple and cost effective, fussing around with many different expensive products was for my twenties and thirties.

This is an excellent compilation by a varied group of artists. I don't regret purchasing it, but I wish I had known there were three volumes. Parts one and two are available separately, but there is a third version with those two parts plus an extra volume! That said if you are not as rabid a fan of Porter as I, the first volume could suffice. It's an eclectic group of singers spanning the decades from Fred Astaire singing I Concentrate on You, a little too old fashioned perhaps, to Betty Carter's brilliant, ethereal interpretation of Everytime  we Say Goodbye. It is a masterpiece. Sarah Vaughan delivers an ebullient, bouncing version of It's De Lovely that I now hum to myself constantly. An acerbic but light hearted Blossom Dearie sings another song, Always True to you in my Fashion, with perfect delivery. Ella Fitzgerald is as perfect as always on Night and Day straight from her songbooks. An excellent CD for when you have company for cocktails or dinner, it will set a great tone.

Just a note, this is not Ella's solo 1956 recording of this beautiful song. It is her 1957 duet of it with Louis Armstrong, still lovely, but not as good especially in orchestration and sound quality.

This is a solid detective series with a very good female lead. It's not the best Nordic noir I've seen but the stories are good and the cases gritty enough to seem real. I like female leads in Nordic detective stories. It seems that females are more generally accepted as a lead detective in these more progressive countries. It is an interesting dynamic, a successful female cop in a leadership position as an option, not an exception. But it is solid writing and good acting from the whole cast that really set it apart, but why so expensive on instant video?

I bought this hat to improve my visibility as a walker in gloomy weather (so drivers pulling out of side streets and driveways are more likely to see me).  It seems to help a lot in this respect.  The color is very bright and clear.  The back fastener is velcro.  The hat is not especially deep so will tend to come off in a strong wind.  But overall very good value.
I wore this for the first time today and lost count of how many compliments it got.  Cute, bright print.  Nice dress shape.  Somewhat stretchy artificial fiber fabric.
Good opaque tights that fit well without wrinkles and without being too tight.
The individual packets make this easy to take to work.  I have been enjoying my green tea lattes.
My mystery gift was an adorable collection of animal-themed costume jewelry.  Worth the price and a very nice surprise.

These are a good weight of cotton ankle sock.  I wear a woman's size 8 shoe and they were a tad large on me, but not enough to matter when wearing these inside my boots.  The were a good thickness to start wearing my ankle-boots again now autumn is coming. I received a free sample product.

If you search for deer head jewelry you will find this same product listed multiple times at different prices.  I own this and it is a large, shiny, fun necklace.  A bit brighter than I expected as the picture looks a bit more antiquey/matt, but looks nice with a blazer.
Fake rose, fake seeds.
I was relieved to find this was very easy to assemble with just a few large bolts. I have been using it for several months and find it to be sturdy and stable.
I received a free sample of this product for an honest review. I use this to charge my iPhone and it performed just as well as my original ( now lost ) cord.

Since getting these scissors a few weeks ago they have become my go to pair for everything from dealing with a turkey leg to opening stubborn plastic packaging.  I just wish there were instructions saying what all the bits and bobbles of the design are for.I have found that the tines come apart rather easily and I sometimes do it accidentally, but they also go back together easily.I received a sample product in return for an honest review.
The latch releases quite easily which resulted in me and my hammock-chair getting dumped on the floor. May work great for many applications but not mine.
All my little plants arrived in good order and were different.  Despite rather indifferent care from me over several months only one died and the rest are thriving and growing bigger.
The new blurb suggesting this is a horror movie is wildly misleading.This is a slow, downbeat story about sad characters making terrible life choices. Not without its charms from that perspective.

This is a good amount for well-prepared, large dried Goji berries.  But whether you will actually like them is purely a matter of taste.  To me the flavor is somewhere between cherries and raisins.  I like to cut them into smaller pieces with scissors and add them to my oatmeal.  I am not convinced they have any super-special health benefits, but they make a nice change.Based on the instructions on the bag I tried also taking them as a "tea" (simply pouring hot water over a handful and waiting 10 minutes).  I cannot say that I would recommend this.  The taste was mild to the point of non-existent and not especially pleasant.I received a sample product for review purposes.
Not as good as Afrin for me but a useful back up to avoid over-suing the Afrin.

This is a strong, small pump but I had trouble keeping the tubing attached and even a rather small amount for debris would block it.  So for use in a fish tank you will need a sponge filter or other device to keep the intake area clear.

If you want to split the difference between looking like you have not gone through puberty yet, and looking like a feral guinea pig, this is a good choice.  It is a robust design that emphasizes function over style.  There are five settings for length. It was easy to assemble and easy to clean.

If you are a Lovecraft fan wanting to see one of his stories in movie form this may thrill you.  If you are not, and are just looking for  good movie as a stand alone product this one is likely to seem plodding and conceited with a flat ending.

Okay I confess I am not much of a baker.  I bought this to use as a "fairy garden" base.  That is a base you can set a small fountain, soil, mosses etc in to make a miniature indoor garden scene.  It works really well in this capacity as it is a good depth, does not leak or rust and has a nice finish.

I got a free sample of this wallet, but I don't think that had a huge effect on my opinion.  Basically this wallet is pretty cool.  It has a matte, uncluttered metal finish.  Inside is a "fan" of plastic pockets that will hold 6 cards so they are ready to pull out at any time.  I have been using this for several weeks now and think it works well and looks pretty cool.So why did I deduct one star?  Well, who only has 6 cards these days?  Maybe it is just a limitation of the laws of physics that this is how many slots you can put in a small case.  But since when did Amazon review writers have to be rational, even when they get a free sample?  I tried to double up with two cards in each slot, but if you add more than one extra card the wallet will not latch closed.  7 turned out to be just enough for the cards I really need to carry around with me, including the all important Starbucks gift card.Maybe they could make another design that was more like a cigarette case with a clip to hold all the cards in.  They wouldn't fan out for easy access but you could get a lot more in.  I still feel very posh pulling out my metal wallet and will be using this wallet from now on.  Perhaps the bonus feature is that it is helping me de-clutter my life.  Do I really need all these loyalty cards now that they can just look it up using my phone number?  Do I need my dog's vet record cards and business cards at all times?Well, maybe the business cards.  You never know when opportunity will knock.  I will just need to have a separate case for them.  I can probably live with that.EDITED TO ADD: I have now been using this wallet for many months and I am still very happy with it.  There is no damage including to the plastic card holding device on the inside of the wallet. This is a very hardy product.

This Dove Deep Moisture Body wash has a fairly light smell, but I don't really like the scent.  It's a bit too candy-like for me.  It comes out of the bottle in a thick, creamy consistency, but it easily breaks in to chunks, and a bit always slides off my hands when I try to lather it.  The design of the bottle is also a little annoying because I can't store it upside down on the ledge of my bathtub, and it doesn't have a neck, so I can't store it upside down through the holes in my shower caddy.The moisturizing formula is nice, and my skin definitely feels softer and smoother than with my Irish Spring Body Wash.  While there isn't anything terribly wrong with this Dove Body Wash, I probably won't buy another bottle after I'm done with this one.

My girlfriend and I both like these wipes a lot.  The material is thick and each sheet is dotted with fixed scrubbing bumps.  I feel kind of guilty using these because I feel so wasteful using these, but they're great for cleaning up on-the-go.  I feel like each sheet is actually twice as big as I would need; a 40 pack with half-sized sheets would be even better.

These over-sized All Clad dish towels are great in the kitchen.  It seems like the price has gone down a bit since the product originally launched, and it's a much better value now.  They're 100% Turkish cotton (made in Turkey), which means that they're very absorbent and soft.  I'm not sure about the anti-microbial properties, especially after several washes, but these are solid dish towels.

These GreenSaver Produce Keepers are meant for people who have the regular problem of produce rotting away in their fridge.  If you're good about eating everything in your fridge before anything spoils, or if you know how to buy manageable amounts of produce, then you don't need this product.  At all.  It's meant for the less responsible of us who don't keep track of what we buy.I have the smallest size of the OXO GreenSaver Produce Keeper, and it's perfect for storing small baskets of berries.  The internal basket is suspended away from the clear plastic container so your produce doesn't get smashed and rotten at the bottom.  The carbon filter does seem to work well for keeping produce fresh, but I'm not really keen on having another filter that I have to regularly purchase.  These containers are kind of pricey to start with, and you have to replace the carbon filter every 90 days.  However, if you find yourself wasting money on rotten produce, then this might actually save you some money in the long run.

I've always been a big fan of Irish Spring bar soap, so I was actually pretty excited to try out this body wash.  It still has the same Irish Spring scent, and it comes in a pretty masculine bottle that's just black and green in color.  The plastic bottle even has a similar shape to a whiskey bottle.  I think the best part of this body wash is how thick it is.  A lot of body washes are so runny that I end up wasting some of it each time I dispense a blob and try to lather.  The Irish Spring body wash is very thick and easy to lather.  A small blob of it will go a long way.Currently, Amazon's price is pretty good for a 15oz bottle and they even offer Subscribe & Save.  If you like Irish Spring soap and want to give the body wash a try, I would definitely recommend this.

I wanted to try these out despite the questionable name, because I'm a big fan of Pocky.  The boxes are labeled as "Pocky's friend", and they definitely taste similar to Pocky, but with a different ratio of biscuit and chocolate.  Rather than a stick of the biscuit, it's a thin tube of it rolled with chocolate inside.  They're only slightly thicker than Pocky.In the end, they aren't THAT much different from Pocky, but I do kind of like that there's more biscuit flavor.  If you like Pocky, then these are definitely worth a try.

These are delicious cracker-like sticks dipped in a strawberry, candy cream.  If you like strawberry Nesquik, I think these taste kind of similar.  Each of these boxes is pretty big, and has enough to reasonably serve maybe five or six people as a quick snack.  Amazon did a pretty good job shipping these because I haven't run into a broken stick yet!

I got this mainly to be able to listen to Pandora in my car using my phone since I don't have an auxiliary jack in my stereo and it definitely does the job. It's compact enough, but feels well built. It's rubber all over so it feels like it could take a beating if you drop it. The suction cup on the back is very strong and seems like it should stay on my window, thought I haven't kept it there for too long of a time to really test it.The sound from the speaker is really good. I had a previous portable speaker and I definitely think this one has the superior sound. Particularly impressive is the bass which I tested with certain songs, and it performed wonderfully. The volume is impressive too.The Bluetooth connection is pretty straightforward; after you connect your phone once, as long as your bluetooth is on, it will automatically connect when you turn the speaker on. The up and down volume controls on the side second as next track and previous track for your currently running app, which works with Pandora (you hold the button for it to change volume). The play button can second as a call/hang up button when you get calls and can also redial. The buttons are the same black rubber as the sides, so it's hard to see your feel which button it is you're going to press, which can be problematic in the car, so I would have preferred colors and texture to indicate that better.One weird annoying thing about the speaker is that when you turn it on or off, a voice very loudly says "POWER ON" and "POWER OFF." I'm not sure how to turn that off or even just lower the volume of it... But other than that, I'm really happy with the product.Disclaimer: I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review.

I use this stuff after I wash my face, and it works great for keeping my skin from drying out and it seems to help keep my face from getting super oily too.  I just use small pump to cover most of my face so this little bottle should last me for a while too.  The only thing that I don't like is the grapefruit scent - it reminds me a lot of deodorant.

My dentist recommended that I start brushing with a Sonicare toothbrush, and she told me that any version that has the Quadpacer timer would be fine.  The Quadpacer timer is basically a feature to help you brush all four corners of your mouth consistently.  As you brush, it will notify you every 30 seconds so that you give each quadrant of your mouth the same amount of attention.  While it seems trivial, it really has helped me brush more consistently and thoroughly.This new Sonicare Gum Health model seems almost the same as my slightly older Easy Clean model, except that it offers three intensity settings.  Both models have the timer feature, and they seem to use the same brush heads and charger too.  As of March 2015, there's about a $15 premium for the newer Gum Health model, but if you do have sensitive teeth or gums, you might appreciate the power settings feature.  I haven't had any issues with my old one-setting brush, so I think most people would be fine saving their money and just getting whatever is cheapest, as long as it has the timer feature.

Dogs loved them. They disappeared in under 30 minutes. I was astonished as nylabones are generally pretty durable, but i'm guessing these are just too nummy. I didn't hear a peep out of either dog until they were completely gone.

These are great. They fold flat easily and will stay flat until you pop them out which means they take up about 1/3 of the space of other measuring cups, easily. They're sturdy and easy to clean and are dishwasher safe as best I can tell. The loop on the end to hang them up is nice. This is definitely an upgrade from normal measuring cups.I received this product for free or at a discounted rate in exchange for an open and honest review. This review represents my true and honest opinion of the product.

I was actually kind of excited to try this. I can't tell you how often I wish i had something that would hold my phone to my arm while i'm doing other things. Putting it in my pocket isn't always a great option for me so I was hoping this would solve the problem. However, there are a few issues. It's uncomfortable. It's just nylon mesh basically which doesn't feel all that great against bare skin. It does seem to hold the phone fairly securely but getting it IN the holder with only one free hand is a bit of a pain in the butt with the closure they're using. The deathstroke though is that the entire screen is obscured while the phone is in the holster. You can see the corners, but you can't interact with the phone other than with a bt headset to control tracks and volume. Overall I think the design and execution are flawed here.I was given this product for free or at a discounted rate in exchange for an honest review. This review represents my true and unbiased opinion of this product.

Admittedly, when I opened the little zipper tote these glasses came in I was a little overwhelmed. I mean they're just sunglasses right? After a few minutes of playing around with them and figuring out how to swap the lenses and reading up on what the various lenses are used for I can honestly say this is the one pair of sun glasses to rule them all.The polarized blue are my favorite for bright and sunny days. The yellow are amazing for night driving. They filter out all of the blue light which drastically reduces glare for night driving, a big thing for me because I have astigmatisms. Changing lenses takes less than 2 minutes, including cleaning them after handling. I keep the little zipper kit with the cleaning cloth and extra lenses in my dash console and just swap lenses out as needed.It's worthy of note that these are also SUPER durable. I'm VERY hard on glasses. I easily go through 10 pair a year just because of breakage, but these guys can take some abuse.I received this product for free or at a discounted rate in exchange for an honest product review. This review is my true and honest opinion.
Great gloves. Very durable. Easy to get on and off. No residue left behind and no nearing, even with some moderate work. Very happy with these.

This is truly one of those little gadgets you didn't know you needed, but you totally do. I have a clear hard protector over my tablet which lacks a kickstand option. With this little guy I can easily hold it in place at a number of angle options and use it hands free. That's especially awesome for me working in the kitchen from a recipe. I'm not constantly going back to my tablet to pick it up or get it dirty touching the screen.Incidentally. I also discovered this works VERY well as a small platform art easel. I use pre-primed compressed cardboard sheets for most of my projects that are a little larger than most tablets. This little guy holds those up just fine. so now i'm going to order another one for my painting kit. :)It's well designed and engineered. It's obvious some thought went into this....  Very happy with this little guy.I received this product for free or at a discounted rate in exchange for an honest review. This review truthfully represents my unbiased opinion of this product.

I've been taking these specific Vit D pills for well over a year now. They're excellent. No aftertaste or burps or anything weird. They're very small so easy to swallow. They're gel caps so they have a bit of a tendency to stick to each other. Just give the bottle a shake before you pop the top. At a 300 count this is nearly a year supply for one person. Recommended dosage for average weight is 5000 IU (one pill) per day, but remember D is fat soluble and has a tendency to build up in your body fat so if you're overweight you should probably be taking double dosage. Most adults, especially those in modern countries who doesn't get a lot of outside time are woefully low on Vit D and you dont get NEARLY what you think you do from Milk. You would have to drink 2-3 gallons of milk a DAY to get the same equivalent D as one pill. The fortification level in D is to keep you from going critically low... not to keep you at healthy levels. It also helps if you take these with a shot of something fatty like milk so they have something to bind to and get absorbed into your system better that way. I take mine with a protein shake mixed with soy milk in the mornings.

This is VERY much in the same vein as CAH and is tons of fun. Replayability isn't QUITE as high as CAH, but it's still pretty awesome. It's very much geared toward dirty-minded adults. If that's your bag you'll love every minute of this :)  It's important to note that this is NOT an expansion for CAH, even though the box is similar. This is a separate sand-alone game.
Excellent charger. Very well made. Love the fact that you can get 2 charging lines in instead of just one. Price is on point too. Can't go wrong with these
Great cables. been working for several months. No complaints at all. Works as intended and generally pretty well made.

I was honestly a little hesitant to try a glass screen protector, but i've used skinomi screen protectors almost exclusively for the last few years and they're all great so i figured i'd give it a shot. I was doubly skeptical when I saw how THIN the glass was, but now that i've had it on my phone for over a month i'm VERY HAPPY with it. You get the benefit of easy to clean glass that has a good touch/feel to it and an almost impossible to scratch surface without any of the tackyness or easy to scratch skin with the hard or soft plastic protectors. This is the best of both worlds. I'll never got back to a non-glass protector again.I'm a LITTLE disappointed that with the way the pre-applied adhesive works it never really fully bonds with the edges of the screen so there's a very small air gap all the way around the screen, but having actual glass totally makes up for it. You can't even see a color difference on the edges once the screen is lit up. I'm VERY happy with this screen and would highly recommend it to others.

Excellent pepper. I have a large wooden manual grinder like in the restaurants cause i'm a bit of a nerd about pepper and some spices. Fresh ground is the way to go. I've tried several different brands of whole peppercorns, but this is my favorite and SUCH a great deal on price compared to the grocery store. Literally 1/3 of the price for what you get. The flavor is not overly pungent. I would actually say it's more floral than spicey, but certainly has some spice to it. This is the only peppercorn i buy now.
Well made knives. No complaints at all. Very happy with the purchase and WAY cheaper than my local store, literally 1/2 price.

This is the greatest thing since sliced bread. It's rugged, it has a flashlight built in, it charges with sunlight and.... AND... you can use it to charge other batteries too. Soooo This is especially useful if you camp a lot. This will charge your phone and it has a sizable internal battery, but if you daisychain it to another battery so that it charges the other battery pack too in theory you could have infinite power. This is MORE than ample for keeping 1-2 smart phones charged just by itself, but if you need to keep more than that going you're golden. Really love this thing!I was provided a free sample of this product in exchange for an an honest and unbiased review. This review represents my true opinion of this product.

So the new GF is the baby wipe queen. She carries them with her everywhere and we gots no baby. However, i'm slowly becoming a believer. I've been a TP man my whole life but using wipes is like.... going my whole life without knowing the joy that is bacon and then suddenly someone shares the bacon gospel with you and you become a true believer. Baby wipes are the bacon of butt wiping. They are soft, They clean you SOOOO much better and often only with one wipe (taco tuesdays not withstanding) and they smell kinda good. Who doesn't love that? We keep a package of these in every bathroom in the house now. This is also an EXCEPTIONAL deal for high quality wipes...

This stuff does actually work pretty well. I was highly skeptical, but after testing... I can't really argue. Throw 3-5 sprays into the water before you go (assuming you're not about to explode and you can take a couple seconds to do that) and do your business as usual. This has a strong orange citrus smell that does a good job of masking "other" odors. This is especially ideal to keep in the office restroom. I'll be bringing a bottle to work soon. Someone in my office is having perpetual taco tuesdays. I will, however, mention that one of our toilets is "low flow" so the water level is very low. The spray was not nearly as effective in that toilet. For that, i'm docking a star cause lots of folks have low flow toilets these days.

I'm a bit of a coconut oil freak. Normally I buy it by the gallon, but when I got a chance to try a new brand i'd never used before I jumped on it.Don't even get me started on how good this stuff is for you. If you're not incorporating this stuff into your diet wherever you can you're just not paying attention. One of my favorite uses is for cooking/frying, especially with this stuff because the flavor is excellent. Try frying an egg in this stuff... just wonderful. It's also excellent for making popcorn on the stove. The flavor is crisp, ultra clean and unintrusive, just as it should be.Other uses for coconut oil:Replace the butter in any recipeAdd to coffee for a creamy fruity hint (my favorite)Rub into skin for excellent hydrationExcellent natural diaper creamMake super-healthy mayo (google it)massage oil or "lubrication"Season cast iron skilletsMix with equal parts aloe gel and a few drops of tea tree for great "hot spot" skin treatment for dogs.

So, yeah, i'm not saying i'm an alcoholic or anything, but I AM an avid home brewer and we go through a LOT of wine. I've been through almost every bottle opener and cork screw design on the market. My favorite is the Rabbit design. I have a $60 gift set a picked up on sale a while back that has a foil cutter and a heavy duty unit and a hard plastic case. That's been my go-to opener every night for years.Until I got this bad boy. First and foremost, lets talk about durability. There are a couple of common failure points on most cork screws, even the high end models. If they fail they usually fail where the moving part of the handle meets the body of the unit just from sheer force exerted OR they'll fail where the top of the actual cork screw meets the body of the unit. That is NOT a concern with this unit. It's made VERY well. Materials are substantial. I think this might last well into the zombie apocalypse. You'll run out of bottles to open before this thing gives up the ghost.Also, i have to say i've been a huge fan of the rabbit design for years. It's an excellent design that uses a 2nd class lever to open the cork. I really didn't think there was any way to improve on that design... but this thing does. It's basically a compact rabbit with some design tweaks that make it more compact without sacrificing ANY functionality. You'll be astonished at how easy it is to pop a cork out.The box is also beautiful, stunning in fact. This is very much a gift set.

So we have 3 adults in our house. Each of us has multiple devices that all use micro-usb chargers. I set this up on the kitchen counter and plugged in 6 micro-usb cables so we all had a readily available charging port. Previous to this we each had a single charger set up in our typical sitting area of the living room, but this was problematic because we have multiple devices. Having a power strip and multiple chargers for each of us is a bit ridiculous. This charging station solved that problem. When we walk in the door from the day we'll plug in our phones or other devices and let it sit there for an hour or two. Come back and everything's completely charged. This charges faster than my OEM charger for my Nexus. It's pretty nice. The unit itself is solid and well built. My ONLY criticism at all is this unit really probably should come with 6 small Micro USB cables included. Those are easy enough to find cheap here on amazon though. I have to say I love the fast charging port too. It really does charge pretty darn fast. This is an excellent charger. Recommended cables: Micro USB Cable, 5 Pack Ace Teah 1ft High Speed USB 2.0 A Male to Micro B Data Sync Quick Charge Premium Charger Cord for Android, Samsung, HTC, Nokia, LG, HP, Sony - Black, Blue, Green, Red, PurpleI was provided a free sample of this product in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I've reviewed a LOT of BT headsets. I own probably close to 10 pair, two of which are of a similar design as these. My pet peeves are sets that don't come with various size inserts or if it's difficult to open the door for charging. This pair has neither of those problems! Thankfully! I have no fingernails, and even I can pop the charging door off. It also comes with an assortment of various sized inserts for your ears. You're guaranteed to find a fit.Sound quality is excellent. Surprisingly excellent. Clarity is superb with good mid range and bass. Volume controls are very easy to access, though i typically control that via my phone anyway. Battery life is excellent. I have a one hour commute, which is generally when I use them. I used them 4 days in a row (8 hours) before I recharged and they weren't even dead yet so not sure what the full battery life is.I will say that there are two minor points of criticism that aren't so much flaws as much as points to keep in mind. This design uses an inside-the-ear retainer to keep the unit in place. This is comfortable, but not the most secure fit for most people. Because of that you probably wont be able to use these for working out or running without having them occasionally fall out. These are more for casual use, which is fine because they're very comfortable to wear for long periods.I let the GF give this a shot (mistake) and she decided to keep them.... I guess that says something:)I received this product for free or at a reduced cost in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. This review represents my true and unbiased opinion and experience with the product.

I've been on this brand of CoQ10 for several years now so when I got the chance to review it for vine I was happy to do so. This particular brand features a black pepper extract that dramatically increases the bioavailability dramatically. That's VERY important. You can give your body everything it needs, but if it can't absorb what you give it there's no point. Also note that this supplement is VERY synergistic with Tumeric (spice - highly anti-inflammatory and anti-tumor) as black pepper also increases the bioavailability of tumeric as well. I also recommend the herb known as Hawthorn for cardiovascular maintenance and blood pressure control as well. There are no suspect fillers in this brand and it's fat soluble so absorption is even better, especially when taken with food.

This is basically 1/2 a tent and a very clever idea IMO. Like many other reviewers have said, this is a little difficult to assemble if you're not very experienced with tents. I recommend practicing putting it up once or twice. Once you figure out what the (poor) instructions intend it makes sense and you probably wont need them again. Docking a star for that. Otherwise, this is a pretty awesome little sun shelter. Great for picnics or even fishing from the bank, track days, concerts, etc. It's not going to stand up to much in the way of wind. VERY compact (about the size of a camp chair) and decent sun protection, but I still recommend sun screen. I was surprised at the amount of room inside too.

Ok, this was a cool opportunity for me to review something I use on a regular basis. I'm a lime-aid nerd. I make it at least once a week and am a little bit of a nazi about it. I only use fresh squeezed limes. I'll share my recipe below. Needless to say, i've got 2-3 of these type of juice extractors along with a few of the standard OJ style manual reamers. This design is FAR superior to the reamers where you press down 1/2 the fruit onto a spike and twist. You get much better extraction with this design.In fact, this really is the best example of a a juice extractor i've seen. It's VERY well made (I've broken 2 other squeezers of similar design). You need to put a lot of tension on this design to get good extraction so it's hard on the metal. This design seems to be prone to breaking at the hinge, but not this baby. It's VERY well made. I have very strong hands and I can really bear down. The components don't seem to get stressed at all. That being true, the longer handles make it so that a lot of force isn't really even necessary. You dont have to be very strong to get good extraction.I was surprised at how much larger this one is compared to my others, It's easily twice the size, but that's probably one of the reasons it's so easy to use. I haven't tried it yet, but you could probably even juice small oranges. You'll be shocked at how much juice you get out of a single fruit, especially if you use my trick below. Highly recommend this particular unit. You'll never need to buy another one.Best Lime-aid Ever:For best juice extraction try microwaving the limes first. They need to be just a little warm to the touch. Don't juice cold limes. You wont get full extraction. Also, roll them on the counter firmly with the flat of your hand back and forth a few times after microwaving. Then cut in 1/2 and juice as normal. Juice 10-12 large limes into a gallon container. juice through a strainer if you're not a fan of pulp. The magic blend of sweetening for me seems to be 2 tbs of Truvia + another cup of white sugar (not bad for a gallon of juice). Using straight Truvia / Stevia isn't that great, but mixing the two is awesome. If you want something sweet, but less intense also try mixing with 2-3 cups of pineapple juice. This plays very well together if you dont want to use stevia or sugar. Serve cold over chipped ice. Also mixes very well with vodka or coconut rum.I was provided this product at a discount in exchange for my unbiased and honest review. This review represents my true opinion and experience with the product.

I have a surgical scar from a fairly deep incision. When I was in the final stages of healing the pain got to be fairly uncomfortable as the nerve endings on the skin started to heal. The pain was actually relatively intense at times, especially in the evenings after a shower when I crawled into bed. There's no way I would have been able to sleep without something to deal with the pain. I had been using "burn gels" from the first aid section of Walgreens for a while, but lidocane in those brands ranges from 0.5 to 2.5%. The 2.5% was fairly effective, but difficult to find. I would have to use multiple applications of the 0.5% to deal with the situation, and even then it wasn't long lasting.After looking at the reviews online I decided to give this stuff a try. It's been a godsend! One very small application and the pain is completely gone. Within about 15 seconds the pain is completely gone. There's no sensation at all. This stuff is awesome! Highly recommend for this kind of thing. Also great stuff if you're having tattoos done or laser hair removal since the numbing effect seems to be fairly long lasting.

This is a great tasting blend, but honestly not as potent as the True Lime I'm used to. We used this to make an orange cake this weekend, and honestly it took about 1/2 the container to achieve a similar level of intensity of flavor and even then it missed the mark on intensity. The flavor is there for sure, but not as "in yo face!" as true lime, which is what I was hoping for. Still, the flavor is excellent. The ginger is honestly pretty subtle. There's not ginger heat at all, but you can tell it's there as a supporting flavor. Overall this is great to cook with, but just not as potent as the lime variation of the same brand.

We put this mat through the paces this weekend. We did 2-3 batches of cookies and even some melted cheese chips and nothing, absolutely nothing stuck. Everything peeled off without a problem at all. I have a couple of other mats at home that I actually dont use anymore because stuff cooked on them tends to burn around the edges before the center is done, even on small cookies. I think this is because the other mats are thinner. These are nice thick mats (very well made / durable) and seem to conduct heat much more evenly. Everything was cooked evenly. Highly Recommend.Disclaimer: I received this item at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. This review represents my honest opinion.

So I have a buddy (adult) who's into flying RC planes. He's been into it for a while and owns 3-4 different models. I picked this up for him as a gift and he was blown away. Thought it was the most awesome thing he'd seen in a while. The kit is put together well and was assembled in about 20 minutes. Components are fairly well made, constructed well enough to be functional for sure. It actually does fly, which is awesome, though not very far since it's just rubber band powered. IMO this is more of a novelty and should likely be for display purposes, but it's pretty darn awesome for that. Great conversation piece.

FYI, I've actually made several batches of soap at home for regular use and have done tons of research on soap making. I was seriously looking at it as a home business option at one point so I'm very familiar with both cold and hot process soaps that use Lye in the traditional methods and the glycerin "melt and pour" soaps. This kit uses glycerin soaps which are very safe and easy to handle. There's no lye or harsh chemicals involved at all. This is the easiest method of soap making available.The book is really the crown jewel of this kit. It's very well written with simple and clear instructions that literally a child can follow. The author encourages creativity and thinking outside the box and is more interested in teaching the skill of soap making than just using the components in the kit. That's a huge bonus in my book. The kit does include everything you need to get started and make a couple of small batches. Excellent gift for creative kids into crafty stuff.
Died within a month. Wont hold a charge. Crap. Too far out to get a replacement through amazon. Get another brand.

Sooooo I pretty much ruined my last grinder. Ran a couple of ounces of resin incense I needed to turn into powder through it. Didn't think it was going to make a mess but yeah buddy did it so I went on the hunt for a replacement. Looked over some reviews and based on that and the price this looked like what I was looking for. Very happy with the fact that you can clearly see the size grind through the cup. No more guesswork. You see exactly what you're getting. Grinds quickly and fairly quietly. Also like the fact that the lid is actually a cup. Load your beans in the cup and snap it onto the grinder. When you achieve the desired grind just flip the whole thing upside down and remove the cup. No mess. Very well thought out design. Highly recommend.

I have 2 large dogs. My pit is only about 3 years old and is already showing some signs of hip problems. She's got a slight limp if she's been layign down for a while. Vet said to put them on a glucosamine supplement so did some research and these chews seem ideal. About 3 weeks on this supplement and the limp is completely gone. She seems to have full flexibility back now too as she lays out flat stretched out on the carpet like she used to all the time when she was a puppy. I was really surprised to see an impact that quickly. Both dogs also love the flavor. They think they're getting treats every night so makes giving it to them easy. The price is a little high on the bottle but there's a LOT of them. That's nearly a 4 month supply for both my dogs. Can't beat that with a stick.

Been giving this to my 2 large dogs for years now. Each dog gets one right before bed and I make them run through their gauntlet of tricks every night before they get one. They're so excited when they see the treats they start running through the treats even before i give the commands. They literally hoover the carpet looking for crumbs so they must be tasty.The price here is literally half of what they go for in the pet store.

OK, so i'm a lime freak. I LOVE me some key lime, lime-aid and I make this jello cake we call "shrek cake" around the house. I add this stuff to all of that for a super awesome extra lime kick! There's no off-taste at all. It tastes exactly like fresh lime. Not sure how they do that and dont care cause its awesome. :) For anyone interested in the cake it's easy to make. Make a standard white cake either from scratch or box. When you pull it out of the oven (still hot) perforate the top with a fork and pour an ample amount of freshly mixed liquid jello mix into the cake. The cake will suck up a suprising amount of the mix so I plan on 2 large boxes of lime jello mix for a 9x13 pan. That'll fill the cake pan to the top almost. Set the whole cake into the fridge to set for a couple hours. When it sets up mix butter cream frosting with about 2 tablespoons of true lime and mix well. Add some green food coloring too if you like, then apply icing. It's amazing! One of our house favorites! Now that I see they have true orange available now we're going to try that same application next. You can also add true lime to the jello for extra kick but keep in mind that a little goes a long way!

Got this for my daughter who wanted to be able to lock up a few things, but wanted something that looked nice too. It's actually a well made lock. It's not a masterlock or anything, but it'll keep your stuff fairly secure. Lock is well made and looks great. The key and mechanism is a standard handcuff setup so handcuff keys work too.

Super cool chain! I'm VERY happy with this chain. I've never seen anything like it, honestly. It's got some heft to it which i love. It's very well made and it's SILKY smooth. If i were to describe it to someone who's never felt it the only thing i can think of is imagine silk made out of steel. It feels and wears just like that. Clasp is heavy duty too.

I have a high end custom leather watch band from Rockstar Leatherworks. Paid like $70 for it and love the thing, but it was starting to get a little dry and cracked. Did some research and lots of folks suggested mink oil as a great way to restore the leather. One application later my band is like brand new! I'm blown away. Also put this stuff on my leather boots and it actually does work well as a water repellant. Love this stuff. Very handy to have around for leather items.

I'm not a HUGE fan of selfie sticks, but there's a time and place for everything and there are a few occasions where one of these is handy. This seems to be the cream of the crop. It's very well built and sturdy. It's easy to pair with your phone and has an integrated battery that charges via micro usb, the same as my phone so that's very convenient. Telescopes out quite a ways and the rod is very sturdy even when fully extended. The mounting bracket for your phone is universal and should work with almost any of the phones, even the larger ones like my Nexus. The retaining bracket is very strong so your device is safe. Would highly recommend this stick.Disclaimer: I was provided a free sample of this product in exchange for an unbiased and honest review.

Ok, admittedly the first time i saw this thing I was like "really? why not just use a plastic bag?" This is WAY more durable than a ziplock and is guaranteed to keep water and elements out. It's VERY well made and durable. I'm very impressed with that. It's also nice that it's set up so that you can still use your touch screen through the bag. That's pretty much essential. Sound was a little muffled so if you're going to use audio functions I recommend a bluetooth speaker or headset. Great for sports, outdoors or the beach as it seems to be completely waterproof.Disclaimer: I was provided a free sample of this product in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I've had a very similar mount in my car for a long time. The GF liked it so much I gave her this one. The mount itself is well made. It's sturdy and materials are quality. It holds very tight to the dash. No problems there. It also articulates for just about any angle so that's very helpful. It takes a little practice to be able to put your phone in with one hand, but once you get the hang of it there's no issue. Essentially put one side into the bottom of the mount first then use your thumb to hold the top half of your phone up while you use your pointer finger to stretch and snap the other arm into place around the top of the phone. Removing it is the same thing in reverse. It's actually easier to use this than my old mount that has the standard ratcheting arms. Screw that design. This is way better.Disclaimer: I was provided a free sample of this product in exchange for an honest and unbiased review

So we have 3 adults in our house. Each of us has multiple devices that all use micro-usb chargers. I set this up on the kitchen counter and plugged in 6 micro-usb cables so we all had a readily available charging port. Previous to this we each had a single charger set up in our typical sitting area of the living room, but this was problematic because we have multiple devices. Having a power strip and multiple chargers for each of us is a bit ridiculous. This charging station solved that problem. When we walk in the door from the day we'll plug in our phones or other devices and let it sit there for an hour or two. Come back and everything's completely charged. This charges faster than my OEM charger for my Nexus. It's pretty nice. The unit itself is solid and well built. It has a matt black finish so it doesn't hold fingerprints or anything like that. My ONLY criticism at all is this unit really probably should come with 6 small Micro USB cables included.I was provided a free sample of this product in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

One of my absolute favorite games. Can be incredibly scary, especially for night time missions, but that's what gets the blood pumping. Story is great. Graphics are excellent. Combat is well put together and I love the crafting system. If you're an explorer / adventure kind of gamer this is the way to go for sure! There are also tons of videos online with tips on how to find hidden or obscure items.

I used a couple cans of this to coat the chairs on our back porch. Makes a HUGE difference. Water beads up and runs off. One can easily did two chairs with a heavy coat. Well worth it. Will be looking for other applications for this as well.
ordered a 2 pack of these. One burned out within 3 days. The other is still going strong a month later. Contacted the manufacturer and they said they would send a replacement but haven't seen it yet.

solid light fixture. VERY well made and easy to install. Use it for back porch light. Can use it with or without the included glass. the wire cage is also optional and easily detaches. Very impressed with overall quality.

Got this for my mom for her birthday and had it shipped directly to her. She was extatic. It was very easy to assemble. She said it took her under 10 minutes and was very easy to do. The only extra thing she did to it was hit it with water sealant.Very happy mama. Can't beat that

This is an excellent malfunction player. Sound quality is EXCELLENT and the radio features come in handy if you get tired of your playlist. Construction quality is top notch. It's also very compact. Great design from that perspective.My ONLY complaint is that there are no dedicated volume controls so you're stuck navigating the menu to change the controls This is a design flaw IMO, but the other features make up for it.I received this item for free in exchange for an honest and impartial review. The views and opinion expressed her is my honest unbiased evaluation

Excellent quality vibe. Made very well with quality materials. Easy to replace batteries, small and discrete in it's own carry bag and has an elegant design. Controls are very easy to operate, Just hit the button and it rotates through a series of pulsing patterns. Hold the button down to toggle it on and off. Nice touch that it's water proof too. I'm surprised by the intensity of the vibration as well.Box is suitable for gifting.I received this item for free in exchange for an honest and impartial review. The views and opinion expressed her is my honest unbiased evaluation

I've owned a couple of low end food processors over the years, i think all of them were Hamilton Beach so this is sort of my first serious unit. I have to say, i'm VERY impressed. Construction is VERY good. These pieces are made to last and lock together very well. Blades are sharp and controls are pretty much brain dead easy to operate. It comes with an assortment of attachments. I haven't played with the dicing attachment yet, but the other reviewers seem to rave about it. I have used it to dispatch a great quantity of veggies for a couple of dishes and have been VERY impressed. This unit has the power to get the job done, that's for sure.The included storage container for the various attachments is very handy. I also love that the feet are actually suction cups so that it keeps the unit from walking around the counter. If i were going to have a complaint at all would be that the "adjustable thickness slicer" can't be dialed into a specific thickness from that I can see. You seem to control the thickness by how hard you push the veggies down. That leads to some variation in thickness that may not be a good thing for some applications. Overall though, this unit is the bomb. VERY happy with it.

I have been through MANY MANY pair of Ernie Ball strings and this set is no exception. they're always made right, very easy to install and last quite a while. These are the ONLY strings i ever buy anymore.

installation is fast and easy, no problems there. Once installed it looks great and functions well. However, as some of the other viewers noted there are some quality issues with a couple of the parts, namely the end caps and gaskets. These almost seem like after thoughts from the manufacturer. Not sure why the dropped the ball here, but it does impact overall quality of the product. Once you get those issues sorted out it looks great and is functional.

We are smack dab in the middle do the delightful process of potty training a toddler.  For this stage, I really prefer pull-ups with Velcro sides ( some have elastic sides that need to be ripped).  Velcro tabs make changing a  stinky pull-up many times easier, especially when the wee one wants to wriggle and squirm.  These pull-ups had Velcro tabs, don't leak during overnight, and were easy for my two year old to pull on and off. No complaints, great product.  As a bonus, these came with a stuffed Micky mouse toy.

This worked nicely as a moisturizing cream and seems to help skin clarity and appearance.  Unfortunately, it darkens on my skin and turns to a yellow shade so I can only use this product at night.  Granted, I am ghostly pale but white skin with yellow is hardly the look I am going for.  Maybe this is something with my personal skin chemistry since I have had this issue with other vitamin C-containing products. If you have had issues with other products tinting your skin yellow, you may not want to consider this product.

This toy is being used by my 2 and a half year old and he loves loves loves this.  Many things for both parents and kids to like about this toy. First, it is Chase from Paw Patrol.  Second, batteries came with this toy (it is always nice when batteries are included!) Third, it comes with lots of "missions".  My youngest is a bit young to do the missions on his own but with help from his older brother all is good.  On his own, my youngest enjoys using his imagination and pressing the badge to make Chase say various phrases (oh does he like pressing the badge!).  So far, this has kept the attention of my youngest for quite a few days.  For an older child, the multiple missions and all the features would keep a kid busy for a long time.  Great toy for toddler through 6 or 7.

I confess that I have a deep love of notebooks, especially college-ruled notebooks.  Colorful notebooks are even better.  The covers of these composition books are a flexible plastic with good binding.  These feel sturdy enough to last through a semester.  On the inner cover is a blank Monday through Sunday schedule with 8 spots per day.  On the back inner cover there are conversion charts. Each book contains 100 sheets. The paperweight feels a bit on the light side and may not be good for writing on each side if you are using a pen that bleeds through.  Overall, these are a nice set of composition notebooks.

The humidity in my basement is typically greater than 70% (levels above 60% promote the growth of mold and mildew) so a dehumidifier is a must in our basement.  to keep mold from growing, it is advised to keep humidity levels below 50%.  This unit has many of the same features as our other humidifier, a Frigidaire, but with a somewhat flimsier feel and a bucket that needs to be forcibly wrestled back into place (unlike the Frigidaire which slides easily in and out).  Both are energy star rated and have a washable filter, 2 fan speeds, an adjustable humidstat, a digital humidity readout, and an the option for continuous pump action.  The Perfect Aire has a few more options such as low temperature control and a timer function but also a higher price.The instructions on the Perfect Aire were reasonably clear (although operating a humidifier is not terrible difficult).  The unit was well packed and pretty simple to set up.  Once set up, I removed the bucket and realized that it was difficult to get back into place.  The display readout was pretty intuitive.  Its a good humidifier but not nearly as good as the Frigidaire which is currently running approximately 60 bucks cheaper.  If you need the extra options, then this is a serviceable dehumidifier it just doesn't really blow me away, especially at the current price point.

This is a cute little necklace that would make a nice gift for a young to teen age girl.  The butterfly and the chain are lightweight but very pretty.  The butterfly is about the size of a dime.  The gems are pretty, a clear light yellow color.  A nice piece.

Unlike the image in the picture, this watch is really hard to read.  The face, hands, and numbers are pretty dark and reading the face of this watch is hard.  The watch band and most of the parts are made of gun metal which is quite attractive.  The only odd part is the rubber ring that goes around the bezel, it really detracts from the otherwise attractive styling.  Setting the time and date was simple enough but the crown didn't have the smooth and tight feel of other watches I've owned.  The face is mineral which means it is susceptible to scratching (sapphire faces are extremely scratch resistant).So, metal band styling is attractive but at the price of readability.  The price is inexpensive and while styling is nice, the crown felt cheap and the face will scratch over time.  The watch is very large which is the current style but  may be too large for some tastes.  Not a terrible watch but not fantastic either.

These are soft kitchen towels that come in a combination of nice deep shades.  The towels themselves are pretty soft and work very well for drying dishes and cleaning up spills.  They seem reasonably well made and seem like they should be durable.  The colors were pretty true to what is pictured and the towel size is pretty standard.

I have two boys and there is enough noise in my life without toys that's squawk and sing.  Therefore, I love simple wooden toys and I have always enjoyed Melissa and Doug toys. Without electronic stimulation, my boys resort to actually using their imagination.  This toys is perfect.  It's well constructed and can be used for imaginative play, number recognition, or math practice.  For my youngest, this is a fun boy and a way to practice numbers.  My oldest can use this for math practice (although there is only one of each number which limits how much math you can do).  This is a nice little toy for kids between 3 and 6.

Current trends in watches favor larger, heavier styles with an industrial look.  This watch definitely fits the current fashion, this is a heavy large watch. It seems to be a pretty sturdy watch and since it has a synthetic sapphire face, should be scratch resistant. The time is easy to set and the piece fells well constructed.  A nice fashionable piece to gift or keep.

I tested the lightest shade, Opal.  My skin is very pale so I was concerned that the foundation would be too dark.  I was happy that the coverage blended well and was a very natural color (not too much peachy or pink undertones).  The foundation blended very well and provided excellent coverage.  The foundation I currently use is Urban Decay Naked shade 0.5 and I think the Vichy Opal shade may be just a bit lighter.  The Vichy is also a bit more natural than the Urban Decay (I have struggled to find a good foundation that is not too dark-this may be the one).  The coverage was excellent, I have a sun spot that I am looking to cover, this foundation minimized but did not completely cover this spot.  This also minimized but did not completely cover the dark circles under my eyes that I am prone to.I was happy to read the ingredient list.  This is one of the better sunscreen containing foundation on the market.  This contains 15.6725% titanium dioxide, a mineral sunscreen that provides both UVA and UVB protection and the concentration is high enough to be truly effective.  There were no ingredients that raised safety concerns.This is a well formulated foundation with good coverage, a natural shade, and an easy to apply texture.

This is a refreshing change, a moisturizer that doesn't promise to give me the skin of a child or to transform all wrinkles into unicorns and doves.  This promises deep moisturizing and I found that it delivers on that promise.  The moisturizer was very light and was absorbed pretty quickly without any shininess.  My skin has felt very soft and no issues with dry patches which I had been fighting.
