But I continued to apply it nightly after my shower. I'm so glad I did. Wow, is this stuff awesome! My skin is so much softer than it has ever been, yet it's not oily or greasy in any way. I've never worn much make-up, but now I get away with the lightest smattering of foundation or none at all. My skin looks more radiant/dewy and less dry, flaky, and tight.Upon some of the recommendations here, a few nights ago I applied a dab to the ends of my hair - which are slightly more damaged than the rest of my hair - and they really do appear to be much smoother now. The best part is this isn't some fancy, overly-priced beauty gunk; it's natural, soothing, and super cheap. In addition, a bottle lasts a very long time, because you need so little per application. What can I say? I'm hooked. Thanks to all the reviewers out there, without which I would have never tried this stuff.Get this. You won't be disappointed.

I'm recovering from adrenal fatigue/CFS caused by severe leaky gut and gut dysbiosis. As such, my immune system is busy nearly 24/7. I take several antioxidant supplements, including liposomal vitamin C. Previously, after researching Dr. Levy's work, I began taking large quantities of ascorbic acid powder. He claims this is useful in reducing free radicals and destruction of the mitochondria (oxidative stress). I was having results with that, but I never seemed to reach GI tolerance. So I knew I still wasn't getting enough vitamin C, despite taking the stuff all day long.I then found this company's glutathione, started taking it, and was blown away. So I ordered this too. I take 1-2 packets a day. Dr. Levy believes that the liposomal form of vitamin C is equivalent to 8-10 times the same amount of ascorbic acid powder. I like that I get so much bang for my buck and that I don't have to drink tons and tons of vitamin C powder. Also, this product passively diffuses into cell membranes and delivers the vitamin C directly into cells, where it is needed. No ATP required. What a terrific idea!I've since started making my own homemade liposomal vitamin C. It's about 70% as effective as this product, but it's much cheaper to produce. I do still keep a box around for when I need an extra boost. I squeeze the contents of the sachet into a glass of water with a sachet of Lypo SphericTM GSH and drink it that way. The taste isn't bad at all. This is really a terrific product, and the delivery system can't be beat. It's definitely aiding my recovery.

This enzyme product has it all - HCl, pepsin, ox bile, and plenty of pancreatic enzymes. I'm working on healing from leaky gut. As such, I don't produce the necessary enzymes to digest my food properly. Before taking digestive enzymes I'd get tired after eating. A few months ago I started taking Davinci Labs - All-Zyme 90 Tablets, which work really well. However, I had to take so many of them per meal that the cost was just too high. I searched for something cheaper that would work just as well, and these enzymes are it. I switched to the NOW Super Enzymes over a month ago and haven't looked back. These really do work just as well as the costlier enzymes. I take two per meal, and I no longer feel fatigued after eating. There really is a remarkable difference in energy levels. Terrific product, and I definitely would recommend.

I bought these grains for my boyfriend who needs probiotics but hates the taste of my milk kefir. These grains arrived quickly. As others have noted, the seller is thoughtful. They sent along over a sheet of information on rehydrating and culturing your water kefir. We followed the instructions to the letter, and it took about two weeks for these guys to plump back up. We had placed them in a jar with distilled water, a few drops of Liqumins ConcenTrace Trace Mineral Drops, Low Sodium, 8-Ounce Bottle, and some sugar and placed a lid loosely on the jar. Then we set the jar next to our crock-pot, because these microbes like the warmth. A few days ago, we strained the first batch of water kefir, and I'm happy to report it was a success! My fella said it tasted like apple cider. He's happy with the taste, and I'm happy he's getting the probiotics. We have started experimenting with adding various fruits to see how they alter taste, too.Terrific seller. Healthy kefir grains. You can't go wrong.

This enzyme product has it all - HCl, ox bile, and plenty of pancreatic enzymes. I'm working on healing from leaky gut. As such, I don't produce the necessary enzymes to digest my food properly. Before taking digestive enzymes I'd get tired after eating. A few months ago I started taking Davinci Labs - All-Zyme 90 Tablets, which work really well. However, I had to take so many of them per meal that the cost was just too high. I searched for something cheaper that would work just as well, and these enzymes are it. I switched to the NOW Super Enzymes over a month ago and haven't looked back. These really do work just as well as the costlier enzymes. I take two per meal plus two Enzymatic Therapy Mega-zyme, 200 Tablets (which contain only the pancreatic enzymes), and I no longer feel fatigued after eating. It really is a remarkable difference in energy levels. Terrific product, and I definitely would recommend.

Holy cow, I LOVE these shoes-that-aren't-really-shoes.A year ago, my boyfriend purchased a pair of Sanuk Men's Grifter Sidewalk Surfer Slip-On and fell in love with them. I thought they were cute and comfy too, so I'd often wear them myself. Other than that, I'd always wear the same old pair of Vans slip-ons that I've had for years. When my Vans Classic Slip-On started literally falling apart, I despaired that I'd have to finally buy a new pair of shoes. I decided I'd try a pair of Sanuks.Well, I fell in love immediately. I ordered the June Bug in gray in a size 8, my normal shoe size. They fit PERFECTLY. They were somewhat tight around the top of my foot for the first few days. Now they're broken-in and fit like a glove. It's like my feet are encased in clouds. Seriously. I'm really, really impressed with these shoes. They're cute, but even more importantly, they're the most comfortable shoes I've ever worn. And comfort is hugely important to me. I keep my old Vans around for working in the garden, but my Sanuks are now my go-to shoes for everything. I will definitely continue to buy Sanuks for a very long time.These are the next best thing to being barefoot. I now like wearing shoes a whole lot more. Thanks, Amazon, for offering these at the cheapest price I've found and for super fast shipping. :)

I've got unruly, curly hair. I've been straightening it daily or every other day for over a decade. As such, I've tried many products to protect my hair from heat damage, while getting it straight. This is, hands down, my favorite product to use. First, I spray KMS silksheen leave-in conditioner hair detangler 5.1 fl oz / 150 ml lightly to the ends of my damp hair then apply a dollop of this creme, running it through with my fingers. For my hair, this is the best combo I've found, and I've not changed it in three years (although I would love to try KMS' new 'Freeshape' line). I also shampoo and condition with the 'Flat Out' and 'Color Vitality' lines. These products dramatically reduce my blow-dry time to less than ten minutes. I'm not really into spending a lot of time primping, so I LOVE this. Also, I need only run my flat-iron over my hair once, and I'm good to go. Before using these products, there's no way one time would have cut it. And the best part? This stuff makes my hair impermeable to humidity. My hairstyle is maintained, even on rainy days. I'm sure there are other terrific brands out there, but I've tried many (both cheaper and more expensive); and this is the only brand that manages my unruly hair without ending up greasy and shellacked to my head. Definitely recommend.Oh, and did I mention they all smell terrific? I've got chemical sensitivities to cheaper supermarket brands' products and can't use them. I have no problems with KMS products.

I'm fairly miserly, meaning I don't like to spend much money on stuff when there is a cheaper alternative. However, in the case of hair conditioner, I'm willing to shell out the extra dough. I used this for two years and fell in love with it. It really does maintain my hair dye and smells wonderful.Recently, I decided I wanted to try some cheaper supermarket brands, in order to save some money. I tried 4 different brands (which I won't list here) to no avail. I have naturally curly hair that I straighten. They left my hair greasy and easily tangled, even after straightening. In addition, I was very sensitive to the chemicals in those products. Finally, I sucked it up and went back to my old standby, KMS. I used to buy it from a fancy salon, but it's MUCH cheaper on Amazon. I've used some other lines of KMS, including 'flat out' and 'curl up,' and they're all really, really great products. Really.

I had been frequenting a fairly pricey salon for the last few years, because it was the only place I'd found that would leave me feeling satisfied after each appointment. The problem? It got way too expensive, and I just couldn't continue to afford going every few months. A year ago, I stopped going and told myself I'd find a cheaper place. Well, that never happened. I don't consider myself a vain woman by any means, but I've wasted a lot of money and time over the years on botched haircuts and dye jobs. I didn't have the heart to go through that again. This resulted in my going a year - yes, an entire year - without a haircut. Although my layers were still evident, they were quite shaggy and shapeless.I discovered the Creaclip on youtube, watched a bunch of videos, and read what other people had to say. The reviews were overwhelmingly positive, so I ordered one. It arrived very quickly (today, in fact), and I immediately put it to use. I started by taking off half an inch or so. I have to say, this thing is really, really easy to use. I've never cut hair in my life, but, within a few minutes, I was creating layers all over the place! This product easily gave me results similar to those I've gotten in the pricey salons. I'm not discounting hair-dressers or their work, but I'm a very low-maintenance, do-it-yourself kind of gal, and this product is exactly what I've been looking for. Not only do I save loads of money, I also save my time. Plus, it's kind of fun to use.This product does a great job, but the material itself seems cheap. I'm not sure why these clips are priced so high. I ordered it off of the Creaclip site, which sells for a few dollars cheaper than Amazon. Still, I caught on quickly; the clips are extremely user-friendly and foolproof; and I'm very pleased with the results.

WOW. This book is outstanding. Others have reviewed the book's content, and they do it far better than I could. So, instead, I'll attest to the healing power of this diet.Over a year and a half ago, I became sick. Super sick. So sick I was unable to get out of bed. I eventually realized my adrenal glands were shot. So I quit my job and school and took time off, expecting to recuperate within a few months. Ha.I researched and researched, pouring over everything I could read online. I had a Candida infection (resulting from allopathic drugs) that never went away. I'd literally feel poisoned, especially after eating. My immune system was a mess. I had zero energy. I suffered severe chemical and mold sensitivities and began to develop hives. I started developing arthritis in my knees and fingers. Some days it was so bad it prevented me from knitting/crocheting, two of my favorite pasttimes. I experienced constant congestion and back-to-back sinus infections. My body was in terrible shape. I'm not a dramatic person by nature, but I assure you, some days I wasn't sure how much sicker one could get before the body just gave up altogether. I kept getting weaker and more exhausted by the day. For months, I didn't leave the house. For the record, I'm 32 years old. (Mind-blowing, isn't it?) After several months of research and trial and error, I discovered the adrenal issues were a symptom of a much larger problem - severe leaky gut and gut dysbiosis.If the preceding paragraph sounds like hyperbole to you, I can't say I blame you. Before my experience, I'd have been skeptical too. I had been preparing to study biochemistry in grad school. Before I became ill, I thought chronic illnesses and autoimmune diseases could merely be 'managed.' In blind faith, I had accepted what the medical establishment tells us. That was fine, until the medical establishment failed me...repeatedly. I gave up on allopathic medicine and knew it would be my responsibility to heal myself. As much as this illness has consumed me, it really was a true wake-up call. A blessing in disguise.So I researched. Boy, did I research. I took vitamin/mineral supplements. I got my detox pathways up and running again, as per Dr. Myhill's methylation protocol. I followed her advice for supporting mitochondrial health. I started eating meat. I had been a vegetarian for 16 years, but I was so sick I had no difficulty adjusting to eating meat again. In fact, I craved it. Things improved slightly, but my quality of life was still abysmal.Finally, a few months ago I happened upon some website extolling the GAPS diet. I looked into it but figured I was already eating a clean (mostly) paleo diet, so I didn't need to buy this book. I didn't think it was that different from what I was already doing. When I had to stay home on Christmas day because I felt so toxic and crummy, I decided to purchase the book.So, sure I had already eliminated processed foods and gluten. But I still ate cheese everyday. I still ate sweet potatoes and oats. I still ate a lot of fiber. This book showed me the error of my ways. These things are fine for a healthy gut. But my gut was a complete wreck and needed special help. More importantly, this book showed me what I WASN'T eating that I needed to be eating: lots of bone broth and marrow, organ meats, and lots of ferments, amongst other things.I started following the GAPS diet intro on January 1st of this year. The first two weeks were brutal. I had been toxic for so long that I was used to feeling lousy, but the die-off this diet produced was intense. In the book, she stresses the importance of managing die-off; but, because I was so toxic, there was really little I could do. The diet alone, even without the introduction of probiotics, sauerkraut, and kefir was enough to produce rapid die-off.Then early last week, it was like the fog broke. Gradually, I started having more energy. I announced to my shocked boyfriend that I wanted to go for a walk in the park like we used to do. We did. I suffered no repercussions from it, whereas before GAPS it would have taken me days to recover. I now go for a 30-45 minute walk nearly every day. I can't stress how utterly amazing this is. I prayed that GAPS would help me. It was my last resort. However, I never expected it to work this quickly. Truth be told, I'm still stunned.I'm nowhere near fully recovered. I've still got toxins circulating. I still feel die-off, but it is nowhere near what it once was. True, I take other supplements. However, since starting GAPS I have stopped taking the majority of my supplements, simply because I no longer need them. At long last, my diet is providing the nutrients my body has been needing all along for repair (particularly cholesterol and saturated fats, which are sadly demonized in our culture). I probably sound like a crazy person because I'm so, so excited about this book and this diet; but if you're sick like I was, you know all too well what it's like to live in a chronically ill body. I don't know what percentage of CFS is caused by gut dysbiosis, but I know that mine was. If yours is, this is, without a doubt, the diet to follow.Because I'm having such rapid success on the intro phase, I intend to stick with it for a few months. Some people fly through it in a matter of days before starting full GAPS. That's the nice thing about this diet; you move at your own pace and let your body be the guide.I'm also curious to see how this diet helps me with the mental health issues I've contended with since childhood (namely fits of debilitating anxiety, ocd, and depression that have become increasingly severe in the last few years). I had tried several SSRI's over the last ten years until a new doctor put me on Adderall (which is nothing more than a mixture of amphetamine salts and is very, very hard on the adrenals) after diagnosing me with ADHD. The SSRI's never worked. I'd be happy if GAPS prevents my anxiety from getting worse, but truly I'd love to see the anxiety eliminated permanently. At this point I have no expectations. After all, I've lived with the anxiety for 30 years. But if anything can help, I firmly believe it'll be this diet.This book saved me. Reading success stories of people recovering from CFS is what got me through the worst moments. I hope my story does the same, and I will update again in a few months as I progress along my GAPS journey. I wish you all the best of health.UPDATE 4/10/12: Spring has sprung here. I no longer seem to be affected by pollen, which in previous years gave me terrible allergies and sinus infections. In fact, I have not had a sinus infection in months. The arthritis symptoms are completely gone. I've lost 15 pounds and walk an hour or more just about daily in addition to my chores around the house. Also, for the last 3 months my monthly cycle has been just that (cyclical). In the 20 years I've been menstruating, I've NEVER once had a regular cycle. Now it's literally every 28-29 days. There has been no improvement on the mental stuff yet; in fact, the die-off seems to be temporarily making it much worse.UPDATE 3/1/13: I've been on GAPS for over a year now, with no deviation. No cheating whatsoever. I can honestly say I don't miss any of the "normal" food that I used to eat. This stuff is just so nutrient-dense that I don't ever think of eating anything else. And I used to literally be addicted to sugar. So, that's pretty cool. As to my progress - physically, I'm not much stronger than I was six months ago. But I'm still light-years ahead of where I was two years ago. Still taking walks, doing chores, knitting, able to function like a human being. I'm experiencing new die-off symptoms (caused by breaking up biofilm in my gut with probiotics and systemic enzymes, I believe) like visual disturbances, rosacea and other rashes, adrenaline rushes, numbness/tingling/burning in my extremities. Apparently, these things are all typical for Candida overgrowth. I'm not surprised that I haven't experienced more physical improvement. My Candida infection was/is quite severe, and I've always anticipated that it would take several years to recover. Happily, though I am able to report a significant improvement in my mental well-being. My depressive episodes started to lift just a few months into GAPS, and now they are all but gone. My favorite improvement by far, however, has been with my anxiety and panic attacks. It took about a year, but they are about 85% gone, at this point. I can't tell you how wonderful it feels to have some relief from this torment for the first time in over ten years (most of my adult life).It should be obvious, but in case it's not, this protocol is not (nor does it claim to be) a quick-fix. I've had gut dysbiosis (and many, many rounds of antibiotics) since birth. It takes a long time to undo decades' worth of damage. The diet is only the base, although Dr. Natasha says that for many GAPS folks, the diet alone is enough. In my case, after the infection is gone, I will still need to detox, fix my adrenals completely, get my metabolic hormones back in order, and perhaps chelate. I have no delusions about how long this is going to take.Thanks to all of you who have commented or contacted me over the past year; it's been wonderful swapping stories and information. I'm very grateful to you all. Here's to continued healing! :)UPDATE 11/13/13: A lot of healing occurred this year. A lot. I now walk 4-5 miles almost everyday. I am doing so much more than I have in the last few years. I am still quite toxic but can now tolerate an infrared sauna, which is great for detox, every other day. (My adrenals were too weak, and I was so toxic my body could not handle it before.) The little things that used to require so much effort are back to being a routine part of my life, i.e. doing my hair, wearing make-up, etc. I feel more like my old self than I have in a long, long time. Occasionally, I feel even better than I remembered. There are still periods every few weeks of fatigue and die-off, where my IBS symptoms act up, anxiety and brain fog skyrocket, and I feel rough. But I haven't had one panic attack! What I (and my fella) are most excited about is I actually get to celebrate the holidays this year! I missed out on them the past two years, so I'm making up for that. Lots of GAPS baking and so forth. I have read most of the other reviews here, and I am so happy about and moved by how much this diet is helping people with chronic, so-called "untreatable" conditions. My thoughts are with all of you, and I want to wish everyone happy holidays!

Ugh. I've been detoxing from Candida overgrowth for the last few months; yeah, it's not at all pretty. After a month or so of continuously feeling downright awful (this was way beyond "flu-like symptoms"), I figured I'd try this clay. I had read about using bentonite clay and psyllium husk fiber for eliminating the Herx reaction associated with Candida die-off, but never thought I needed it. Boy, was I wrong.I started making 1 "shake" a day and relatively quickly worked my way up to 3 per day, experiencing no ill effects like constipation. Provided you drink enough water, you'll have no issues with that. After a few days of taking the clay, I definitely started feeling less toxic. I've read other great reviews of the product, and I adamantly agree with them. This stuff is terrific and is really sparing me (and my liver) a lot of pain and suffering. It's my understanding that once the liver processes toxins for removal, they are sent out into the small intestine in bile. However, 95% of the bile is reabsorbed at the terminal end of the small intestine, allowing many of the toxins to also be reabsorbed. This clay binds those toxins, preventing reabsorption. So, this product is, in my opinion, an absolute must for anyone undergoing a detox program.Recently I started using Healthforce Intestinal Drawing Formula, Vegancaps, 260-Count once a day as an adjunct to the P&B shakes. In addition to bentonite clay and activated charcoal, it contains ingredients like slippery elm and marshmallow root that soothe and lubricate the digestive tract. I really like the combination, and the two products complement one another very well.I'm very happy with this brand of bentonite clay and intend to stick with it. I recommended it to my father-in-law who is concerned about heavy metal toxicity. The bottom line: this product is good stuff. I'd rate it more than 5 stars if I could.

I've been using coconut oil for a few years now and am pleased to see that its benefits are finally being touted...now that saturated fat is no longer villainified, thank goodness. Coconut oil's praises are long overdue! We used to buy more expensive coconut oil; but these are tough economic times, so we've been using cheap coconut oil. I read all the great reviews on this site and can't believe that for the cheap price, it's organic AND cold-pressed/hexane-free. We've got another brand of what I'd loosely dub coconut oil sitting in the cabinet next to this brand, and although they are similar in price, that's where the similarities end. That stuff is going in the garbage where it belongs. I could barely even taste coconut when using it. I won't go back.I eat about 3 tbsp of this stuff per day and, naturally, it's satisfying. As soon as you open the jar, you can smell the coconut. And the taste...delicious! If you're already a fan of coconut oil and are aware of its healthy properties, try this brand. You won't be sad that you did. And if you're just learning about its merits, this coconut oil is perfect to start using. If you don't like it, you haven't really lost much money. I "subscribed" to this product in order to ensure that I've always got a fresh tub on hand!

I've been using this supplement for about two weeks now, and I'm certain I'm already feeling the effects. Phosphatidylcholine is excellent for aiding bile flow and general housekeeping within the liver. As I am on a detox program for my chronic fatigue, I read a lot about this supplement and thought it was worth a shot. In Europe, PC is widely used to treat disorders and diseases of the liver. I'm really starting to veer into holistic health, trying to avoid allopathic medicine as much as possible (chronic illness really opens one's eyes!). Anything that helps the liver function better is a must-have in my therapy. PC is also used by cells in the formation of their plasma membranes, so for people with chronic illness, it really is a great supplement to have around.I'm not a big fan of soy, which is the source of this product. I'm not reacting badly to it, but I may investigate to find out if there are some other readily available sources of PC. But I gotta say, this stuff really does what I need it to do, so I've got nothing bad to say.

My interest in this product arose after researching far infrared sauna therapy for detox. I've got allergies and multiple chemical sensitivities, general malaise and severe fatigue. When my body started breaking out in hives, I knew something had to change. I had already been detoxing for some weeks, but I wasn't getting the results I wanted and was concerned about the heavy burden I was placing upon my liver and kidneys. (I've got a chronic illness and am just now realizing that by and large, many chronic illnesses can be traced to toxin overload. In my case, it's so true.) When I read all the info about how FIR sauna therapy is used to detox people somewhat efficiently and quickly, it was something I had to try. The idea of decreasing the workload of my internal organs appealed to me.I've been using this sauna daily for about a week and am already feeling results. The hives are completely gone and have not returned. I started with 15 minutes because of my health issues and have since worked up to 30 minutes at 130F. I sweat a lot. This sauna is particularly good for my health, because it gives my cardiovascular system a workout. Due to my illness, I have not been able to exercise for quite some time. So I'm really happy that my lungs and heart are still being conditioned in some manner.As many other reviewers noted, the instructions for this thing are a garbled mess. Mostly I used my common sense and a few glimpses at the illustration in the manual in order to put it together and it only took me about 10 minutes. Very easy. As per the suggestion of some others, I immediately decided to not even bother trying the chair that is included (yes, it's teeny), instead opting to use a small stool we have. The control is extremely easy to use. The inside space is pretty confined, which isn't really a problem until I get too relaxed and find myself relaxing my posture a bit; then my back invariably touches one of the heaters which instantly wakes me up!All in all, it's a great little sauna, and, for the price, I couldn't be more pleased with the results I'm feeling. Detox takes a long time, and this is an effortless way to speed up the process. I noticed after about 5 days of using it that my skin is soooo smooth and soft. It feels like I've been using a creamy moisturizer, and I haven't been using anything. My boyfriend, who is in reasonably good shape, also uses it as a preventive measure - to purge the toxins before they eventually cause illness. We call it our "spaceship." The cats also get a kick out of watching us sit in this thing; it is pretty amusing, for sure, but the benefits are anything but!

Mega-Zyme was recommended to me by someone who is familiar with treating leaky gut syndrome, which I've got extensively, as I suffered from systemic Candida for 2 years. I had never tried digestive enzymes before. I take 2 with each meal and 1 with snacks. I have noticed I have more energy after I eat now, which is great. But the main thing I'm noticing is less allergies. As my gut has been healing, I've still been dealing with food allergies cropping up. This enzyme supplement essentially helps "chop up" my food so that large particles of food are no longer passing via my gut into my bloodstream, where it causes horrible allergies.Update (9/27/11): I think this is a terrific enzyme supplement, provided you are one of the few who has sufficient levels of stomach acid (HCl). I started taking another digestive enzyme that includes HCl and ox bile and am finding that this one works better for me. But I still keep Mega-Zyme around and use it when I eat small snacks.

For the last 13 months, I've been suffering/recovering from adrenal fatigue. I've been house-bound and many days, bed-ridden. On the rare occasions where I've been able to go outside, I'd go for a brief walk, only to have to nap upon returning home. For anyone experiencing this debilitating condition, you know just how severe the fatigue is. I'm an ex-runner, so you can imagine how mind-numbing, frustrating, and downright depressing this condition has been for me.Over the course of these last 13 months, I've done little else besides research adrenal fatigue and experiment with supplements, reading both scientific journal articles as well as anecdotal evidence from others with the affliction. Adrenal fatigue differs from CFS and fibromyalgia in significant ways, but the endless fatigue is one symptom that is common amongst all three conditions. Well, I've treated the adrenals; I've treated the underlying Candida infection; I've corrected the mineral/electrolyte deficiences; I'm working on detoxing my lymph and liver. Basically, I attacked adrenal fatigue from every angle I could, yet my energy was still tanked.Once again, I came back to the internet and started reading more about CFS and fibromyalgia. Since these two conditions are at least recognized by the medical community (unlike adrenal fatigue), I thought maybe there would be more information out there, something I had overlooked. Once I happened upon Dr. Jacob Teitelbaum's website and read what he had to say about d-ribose, suddenly it all made sense. (I'm a biologist, so I've got a meager understanding of how the body works.) Immediately, I began researching "mitochondrial dysfunction" and its causes. Boy, did I fit the bill. I came back to amazon, poured over the reviews here from people with CFS or fibromyalgia, and immediately ordered this powder.I was so anxious to try it that I couldn't even wait for it to arrive. Yesterday I sent my boyfriend to the natural foods store a few blocks away, where he picked me up Now Foods Ribose 750mg, Veg-capsules Bioenergy, 120-Count. I took 6 capsules immediately (which I estimated to come out to about 5 grams or so). An hour later, I felt the effects. I'm not kidding. Trust me - if you knew adrenal fatigue, you'd know there's no way I'd be subject to placebo effect. Besides, after so many other failed treatments, I was scared to have hope and wasn't really expecting much. I took 2 more "doses" throughout the day and felt so much better than I had in months! Last night was the first night I slept a solid, uninterrupted 7 hours in a year! UNBELIEVABLE. Today I again took 5g 3x/day, as Dr. Teitelbaum recommends, and I feel improvement still. I've been able to eat less, which is a wonderful side effect; because in the last year, I've gained 35 pounds from having to eat constantly to prevent an adrenal crash. I knew that I had to be missing a key nutrient, and it seems that I've stumbled upon it.I'd give this stuff 10 stars if I could. If you're suffering from any kind of chronic illness/fatigue, please, please try this. I wonder how much suffering I could have spared myself if I had known about this months ago. In any event, I've got a looong way to go until I'm recovered, but with this, I now have hope that I will recover. I wasn't so sure before and was starting to become quite depressed. I will try to update again in a few weeks to see how well this product is still working. I also ordered Jarrow Formulas Acetyl L-Carnitine 500mg, 120 Capsules, Source Naturals Ubiquinol CoQh 100mg, 90 Softgels, and NOW Foods Nac-Acetyl Cysteine 600mg, 250 Vcaps in the hopes that these products will amplify the results of the d-ribose on my mitochondria. My d-ribose powder arrived today, so I'm eager to start using that in lieu of the capsules.Oh, it's incredible to have happy mitochondria again!UPDATE 10/19/11I'm still taking the ribose, 1/2 tsp. 2-3 times a day with meals. This product, in conjunction with detoxing, daily glutamine supplementation, probiotics and dietary changes, Lypo SphericTM GSH, and Dr. Myhill's methylation protocol, has made a tremendous difference in how I feel. Again, I've still got a long way to go until I'm completely recovered; but in the last month, I've felt a great deal of progress. I'm able to leave the house again and no longer worry about adrenal crashes. I continue to sleep more soundly at night and feel less zombie-like, in general. At long last, I'm on my way to feeling almost normal.

I should preface this review with a few things: 1) I've been suffering from systemic Candida for over 2 years. 2) I ordered this product a few months ago with a heavy dose of skepticism. When the product arrived, I started taking it per the dosage instructions listed on the bottle- 8 drops 3x/day. Well, it made me feel like crap, so I stopped taking it after just a few days. At that point, I knew I probably had toxins accumulated in my tissues/liver from the chronic infection, yet I had no idea how severe the problem really was.For the last month, I've been trying to detox and alkalinize my body. I've got the Candida under control but still feel pretty lethargic from the constant toxic burden. I started reading people's reviews of Cellfood on different websites. Also, I watched a presentation given by the president of NuScience. [He strikes me as a little shady, but the results of the studies are pretty impressive.] The anecdotal testimonies for Cellfood are overwhelmingly positive, so I decided to give it another go. The first day I used 20 drops with my dinner (yeah, I don't really "do" moderation). The next morning I woke up feeling the sickest I've ever felt in my life. (I've been drinking herbal tea and taking a greens powder everyday too.) I figure the combination of all 3 things sent my body into a detox rush that my liver just couldn't handle. I spent a miserable couple of days. Today finally I feel slighly better. I've reduced my intake of Cellfood to just 5 drops a day and intend to work my way up. I'm so impressed with this product that I'm seriously considering purchasing some of the company's other Cellfood products, despite the hefty price tag. Once I have my health back, I intend to continue using this, because I have no doubt it'll send my energy through the roof!To summarize: This stuff is intense! No joke. If you've got any chronic sort of illness/disease, tread lightly. Don't start at the recommended dosage, because it works really quickly and will make you feel terrible and put your organs under more stress. Take it slowly and let your body adjust.

I'm nowhere near menopause but use this to aid with estrogen dominance and the PMS I experience monthly. I'd be lost without this stuff. I no longer suffer the crazy mood swings, irritability, difficulty sleeping, emotional highs and lows, and all the other fun PMS-related things that I used to contend with. This stuff is fantastic. I've been using it for years and have no plans to stop. I've tried many brands of progesterone cream over the years, and this is the last one I tried. I intend to stick with this brand, because I feel it is the most effective (at least for me). This stuff is a lifesaver for anyone suffering from estrogen dominance and/or PMS.It has a really light scent to it. Other brands I've tried never smelled bad, per se, but this is the most pleasant-smelling of all the ones I've used. It's also not greasy and washes off my hands easily after application.My boyfriend loves it too, because it prevents me from turning into the lunatic that I used to become every month. :-P

This is the only sleep mask I've ever used, and I bought it because it has a lot of great reviews. The people aren't wrong. This mask is extremely comfortable and very effective at keeping out the light. The only problem I have with it is the velcro straps that adhere at the back of the head. The velcro always manages to get tangled in my hair overnight, and it's painful to yank my hair out of it. I would prefer that the mask instead had a band that would slip over the head, but that's minor. The mask really is very nice and so comfortable to use.

I've got adrenal fatigue, and, as often accompanies this condition, a severe magnesium deficiency. Magnesium is crucial for healthy adrenal function. During times of stress, either emotional or physical, the adrenal glands are called on to respond to the stressor, namely via the production of cortisol and adrenaline, among other hormones. You can imagine that if the diet is producing an inadequate supply of magnesium, one would run out fairly quickly. When these tiny glands malfunction, chronic illness can occur. This is where I'm at. I was popping magnesium citrate supplements like crazy all day long and eating foods rich in Mg, to no avail. All I wound up with was diarrhea. I wasn't obtaining results at all and continued to feel crummy.I was digging around online when I saw the term "transdermal magnesium." Intrigued, I looked into it. Then I came to amazon.com, because I feel the reviews here are authentic and I can trust what people are saying. I decided I had nothing to lose and bought some.As soon as it arrived, I wasted no time and applied it all over my body. I won't lie; this "oil" stings and/or itches, especially on a cut or wound of any kind. But it also heals the cuts very quickly. I didn't feel anything happening the first time I used it, but during the second time, all of a sudden I felt a warmth underneath my skin (presumably in my bloodstream), and I felt like someone had "plugged me in." [Note - adrenal fatigue occurs when the adrenal glands' cells are devoid of the necessary mineral reserves to sustain them, so you just sorta fizzle out. It's no fun, believe me.] My energy didn't soar through the roof or anything, but for me, I knew that I was onto something.I've been using it 2x/day for several months now, and I refuse to be without it. It goes where I go. I sleep much more soundly, whereas before I had trouble falling and staying asleep. The anxiety that I suffered for a decade is also so much better. I feel more alert and more in control of my thoughts. It's also eliminated the heart palpitations that accompany adrenal fatigue. I could not be more pleased with this product.By supplementing orally, it can take a year or even longer to replenish the cells' Mg reserves. I've read that using transdermal Mg, replenishment can occur in as little as a few months. While my case is extreme, I have no doubt that healthy folks would benefit from this too. In my opinion, we are all likely Mg deficient to some degree. For optimal health and vitality, we could all use more powerful magnesium! And, as we all know, our food quality these days is subpar and just not supplying us with everything that we need.UPDATE 2/12/12:True to what I've read, I was able to stop using this oil after only a few months. So, even in my extremely depleted (read: stressed) state, this oil was able to build my Mg reserves back up in a very short time. Now I make sure to eat a lot of bone broth, organ meats, and I juice veggies everyday. A few weeks ago, I applied some Mg oil again to ensure I still have a sufficient supply, and I didn't feel any difference. So it seems that I'm able to obtain the magnesium I need from my diet once again. I'm grateful for this transdermal oil; I believe it would have taken me much longer to build up my reserves if I had only used the oral form of supplementation.

If you have ever read a book by Trudy Stiles, you know she writes with her heart and soul.  The emotional impact of each story leaves the reader a mess, their brain is mush because of the new points of views she had introduced you to.  Nothing is cut and dry with any of Trudy’s characters or plots.  This is what I love about her and her books.  I always walk away feeling like I have grown emotionally.  Epic Sins is no different, you will find your heart racing and emotions all over the map.  I had times I wanted to cry and rock in a corner then within pages I wanted to smack some motherly common sense in Garrett and Sam.Both Garrett and Sam had a hard road because life dealt them a rough hand to deal with.  I won’t go into what they came from because this will be part of story that will capture your heart in the beginning.  Garrett went looking for that missing piece in his life and found a band of boys who wanted him to join them and make it big in music.  As time went on the fame became real but so did the nightmare of drugs, women, booze and soon fatherhood.Sam continued to feel the void in her life that her childhood created.  Becoming a nurse for babies who are in trouble was a way to fill her need to fix things, to save lives, to change events and take control, something she was never able to do as a child.  When something tragic happens she once again faces an unknown future.  With her aunt’s help she finds a place with Garrett, helping to take care of his son who needs the constant medical attention.Watching Sam come out of her shell and allow love into her life was a beautiful thing to witness.  Garrett grew up to be the man I think even shocked him all for the sake of his son and to not repeat the sins of his father in which he suffered for.  When love began to surface between the two, we think they might be ok, until the past come crashing in on them, connecting dots that no one wanted connected.  Sam’s response upset me at first, but this is where the brilliance of Trudy comes into play.  Once I stepped back and thought about it, I am not sure I wouldn’t have reacted the same way.  When wounds are not allowed to heal, loss not allowed to be grieved, how can we judge her for her reaction to the truth?I have recommended this book to many already because it is a classic example of an ugly cry read.  It will destroy your heart and then rebuild it into what could actually be a more generous and accepting one.  She brings the broken people to surface and loves them back to health, inviting the reader to not only care but grow right along with the characters.  She is a brilliant writer and for that alone you should read her series in which gave birth to Garrett, but it isn’t necessary for the Epic Fail series.

The first time I read this story I told the author this book had to be published.  Vanessa Marie took a tough topic that people tend to ignore and waved her magic talent over it to produce a story that will capture the reader’s heart and leave them thinking about what they can do to help kids in the foster care system.Her characters are rich, diverse, nothing that you would expect to not only be woven together into a plot but into a family that works.  Vanessa had my attention on the first page with Dante going to yet another foster home.  He knew not to get attached, comfortable and God forbid start feeling anything.  When the door opened he was welcomed by Violet, the spunky little red head that will steal your heart.  When Holly, the mom and my new hero came in, he knew he was entering into a circus he might not want to belong to but soon he not only found he wanted it, he was terrified he would lose it.I won’t go into how this story unfolded, but trust me there are times you will want to climb into the pages and fight the battle for Dante, and other times you will sit back and cry for the pain that unfolds.  One thing you will certainly find is laugh out loud moments, especially with the swear jar.  Vanessa Marie gives you an example of true acceptance, opening your heart to those in need of love and how the foster homes SHOULD work.She added a raw reality and emotion to her story, not sugar coating Dante’s life as he begins to share his past.  We also find that not every family is “normal” but they can still be functional, loyal and loving.  More than that, they can be accepting and forgiving, faithful and supportive.  Some of the scenes in this book had me fist pumping and messaging the author telling her she nailed it.  Other times I was shedding some tears and wanting to take those kids in myself.  One thing is for sure, I have embraced my inner Holly and enjoy allowing her to come out at the right times.  I know this story is about Dante and I adored him but Holly and Violet won my heart.After I was done reading, I did what the normal reader suffering from book hangover does; I begged, pleaded and yes demanded more books from this family.  I wasn’t ready to let go yet when I turned the final page.  This is a MUST read book.  Young adults, who are finding their way in life through the muck and evil with the support of love and adults who understand what life is all about.

I met these men Tate, Leo and Brute in the first book when Shay entered their lives.  Now we are going to read about Tate and his wife Cassie and how even perfect love might not be enough to keep them together.Tate is a man who needs to protect those he loves, it is the number one need he has and when he feels he has let someone down, the guilt leads him to decisions that he might regret.  Cassie is the love of his life; he would do anything to show her how much she is cherished and valued.  The two have expanded their worlds and sex life because she trusted him to teach her and keep her safe.The book opens with him watching as she is served divorce papers.  It is crushing his heart to even do this but watching her crumble before his eyes could be the very thing that will destroy him forever.  Cassie isn’t going to accept this; she has vowed to win her man back.  She didn’t understand his standoffish behavior the last year.  She knew what had happened, but why was he acting like this?The club Tate owns with Leo and Brute has a sex club in the basement and it could be the weapon Cassie needs to make Tate let go of the past and fall in love with her again.  No one can say she isn’t determined and cleaver.  Letting her into his private world that he had tried to protect her from wasn’t easy so when things go wrong, the results can be devastating.I enjoyed the story but have to say once he makes his confession, I was a bit deflated.  I first thought that was pretty lame, but then after I stepped back and thought about Tate, it does fit his personality.  He is the sensitive Alpha who hates failure, especially when failure involves those he loves.  You don’t have to read the first book in this series, A Shot of Sin but it is well worth the time to do so.  It will give you more appreciation for Shay who is a riot and smart butt even in this book as well.  I love her and Leo together.Now I can start counting down the time till we get Brute’s story, he is an interesting character for sure.

I have been a fan of Lynnette Bernard for a while now but Alexa’s Warrior Mate has left me speechless.  Rarely do I feel homesick after I finish a book, but this one had me feeling it during the last ten percent.  I had found a place that I wanted to call home, a group of men that I wanted to call my warriors and a sisterhood that you could only dream to be a part of.  She gives us action with the battles between the good and evil, which will take your breath away and leave you on the edge of your seat, but what won my heart was her character development with each and every role in the story.Lexi and Sebastian were the main characters in this book, but you meet Lexi’s sisters and niece along with Sebastian’s warriors. Both came from strong families with loving parents, they know what true love looks like and that is what they want more than anything, but with the roles they have inherited, no one sees them as anything other than protectors, until that moment at the lagoon where a single touch will change their worlds.With visions and prophecies that have been passed down by both families, it was fate that Sebastian and Lexi would meet and join forces to protect the people of Altavesta. They knew this was their destiny but much more is about to happen to them when it becomes clear that they are mates for life.  Lexi tried to fight this, was willing to take the pain that came from not being near him because she couldn’t see her life being shared with another soul. Sebastian had seen their future and it was joyous, with love and children, finally he would have that one person who would see past his protection and feel his soul and love, but he refused to push her into any choice that she wasn’t comfortable with. He wanted her to decide to be with him out of love, not obligation or the pain they both were feeling.This book is definitely one of the most sensual books I have ever read. Sebastian and his warriors treated Lexi and her sisters with such respect and kindness that it became like foreplay for the romance that would soon occur.  I had so many moments when I could feel my heart melt and my body heat up, when I would see these strong men who willing to fight at any moment, instantly soften to the powers of sweet little Hanna.  These men had a perfect balance when it came to flirting and talking to the sisters. It was clear they saw them as beautiful women yet they also never gave a second thought to their strength and ability to fight beside the men in battle. Lynnette did a brilliant job at describing how Lexi touched Sebastian’s soul and heart by seeing the man and his desires, while he effectively captured her love and trust by encouraging her to not change a thing about who she was.  He appreciated the training her father had given her and he admired her courage and strength, while never losing sight of the soft woman inside that needed love and protection.  There are so many elements to this book that just made me want more. I can hardly wait to see what is coming next.  I will make sure no matter what I am doing, when I get more of this story the world will have to wait as I escape back to my new piece of Heaven that awaits me on Altavesta.

I have to say this installment to the series was not what I expected. Before I go on, you must read Entice before Embrace or nothing will make sense for you regarding Laurie and her story.  Laurie is devastated with yet another man betraying her and Liam has a lot of explaining to do concerning his connection to the latest betrayal.James, her ex-husband, is determined to not let go of their marriage.  He recognizes what he had done wrong in the marriage which goes beyond the affair but what drove him to do such a devastating act.Laurie is just an emotional mess.  Her job is falling apart, the lies are becoming too much to deal with.  Her own family has been less than supportive and her heart and body wants Liam.  Seems clear cut right?  She could go with Liam, fall even deeper with his accent and sex God body and turn a blind eye to his dealings in the company but her heart is also screaming that she can’t throw away what she and James have created.I have to say when I started the book I had my choice as to who I wanted her to go with and even with the temptations that S. Layne threw at us in this book, I am still firm on my choice but I could understand what drove her to her final decision.  One thing is for sure, I would never want to be in Laurie’s shoes.Once again I was blown away with the talent of S. Layne.  She has a way with words that weaves a story which takes the reader away and into a realm that will leave them questioning what they believe and what they would do.  She makes the sinful sound pleasant and the innocent appear guilty.  I am looking forward to reading the next book which will feature Talia, Laurie’s friend.  The character development is so fabulous in this series, even the side characters were strong and interesting and going into Enflame shouldn’t be a problem at all.

I found this book very intriguing as it takes a taboo topic of affairs and gives it a realistic spin that leave you realizing no one is above doing it when the circumstances are right.Laurie loved her husband, or maybe she was comfortable and didn’t feel she needed to put forth more effort.  She had a career she loved, a beautiful home and a husband, what more could this woman want?  When she finds out her husband and best friend had been having an affair behind her back, her world comes crashing down.While out of town on business, and to get some space to put her marriage in perspective, she bumps into Liam, a man that melted Laurie’s resolve.  With the promise of one night to get her mind off her troubles at home, she accepted.  She reasoned that her marriage was over, it was ok for her to do this and it was for only one night, what could it hurt.Little did she know Liam was going to not only invade her dreams at night, her job was going to be at risk and the truth was going to come out and soon her husband would know what she did.  I am sure we all have thought there is no way we could do something like that to our spouse, but the S. Layne proved with this story that events that are beyond our control in life can change a person.  It makes their morals weak from the pain they are enduring.  It gives reason to the most unreasonable situations.  She also proved with Laurie, what happens one night doesn’t always stay in that night, the truth sneaks into our world and could destroy who we are and what we have built. Her writing style is smooth, quick to read as the story just flows off the pages and captures your attention.I look forward to the next book to see what Laurie finally decides.  She has two men who want her, a job that she is desperate to keep, how can she manage all of this and finally decide what is right for her.

I was asked by the author to give an honest review in exchange for a copy of her book.  After reading the synopsis I was interested but feared this would be a routine “housewife is bored in marriage” kind of book.  I couldn’t have been farther from the truth.  I have tried to think if I have ever come across a book with this plot idea and I came up empty.Imagine your life, taking care of the kids and husband, cleaning the home and preparing meals.  Your life consists of dress up and tea parties and a job that you love but is demanding of your energy.  Then one night and a pink dress, you go on a date with your husband and the world you knew no longer exists.  This is what happens to Mirella and Gabe.  High school sweethearts who settled very early, run into a couple at dinner who is about to expose them to a whole new world.Weston and Bridget Hanson are not only intelligent but beautiful and handsome as well.  Bridget and Gabe hit it off instantly while Mirella and Weston took a little longer to get acquainted.  After a meeting in Weston’s office Mirella finds out what Weston had in mind.  This could be a once in a life time chance for her and Gabe, but what about the ground rules they have established in their marriage.  What about their children, how will this affect them?  How will it affect Mirella and Gabe in the big picture?  Sometimes the boredom of routine and the fascination of the unknown can be a blessing or a powder keg waiting to blow.I won’t go any farther as to not risk spoiling the story but be prepared to watch a marriage go through turmoil that it may not survive.  Mirella will be making some decisions that will affect not only her family but her own life as well.I really felt comfortable with the writing style, it fit the story perfectly.  I often felt like I was sitting and talking to my best friend about what she was encountering without the glitzy flair or deadpan emotions that come in many books of this nature.  The balance was perfect for me with the lack of dramatics and the intensity being perfectly balanced.I would certainly read more from this author as she gives a unique look into topics that are usually black and white.  She has created a gray area with this book that had me thinking what I would do in Mirella’s place, what my husband would do if he were Gabe.  When a book leaves me thinking then I know I have found a winner for sure.

Have you ever wondered what the face of revenge and anger looks like?  Well wonder no more, just take a look at Keenan.  During this series he has been the one that held it together, kept focus and peace to the best of his ability but when secrets come out and he realizes the lies and betrayals have shattered his soul, he is left with one mission in life, seek payback and make it hurt.Sheldon came out of her relationship with Keenan and has started to build a new life in the years that he has been missing.  Finding who she is without the influence of Kieran and Keenan, she is totally blindsided by his return.  Now she is looking into the eyes of the man she loved, left and tried to forget.  He isn’t the man she remembered but can she ever learn to love the new man he is?  Sheldon does a lot of forced growing up in this book, some of it made me happy for her and some made me want to shake some sense into her head.  Any time Keenan is around, danger lurks in the shadows.  I found it hard to remember sometimes that this was the same man that I felt sorry for and loved in the beginning but every once in a while we would get a glimpse of him, hiding behind the armor of pain and hate.As with all of this authors books action and evil flood every page of the story, keeping the reader white knuckling through the book, so obsessed we can’t turn our heads, but fighting for our next breath at times as we keep reading.  Our highly dysfunctional family is back and once again B.B Reid wrote it in a way that we should be ashamed to love them but we aren’t.  She has a distinct way of making the monsters in her stories human, to the point I find I make excuses for their behavior.  This is what I love about B.B. Reid and her books, I am always left twisted in the mind, heart racing a sprint and begging for more glorious torture from her books.  If you are fan of this series or the dark and twisted genre, then you need to get to one clicking her books.

My review for this book won’t be typical to the ones you see listed for it on the sites.  I am not a fan of YA or Dystopia genre books but I have wanted to give one a try to see what the hype was about.  After reading the synopsis for this book, it felt like this would be a great first experience book for me and I believe I was right.I can’t go into the details of this story as it is long and complicated and I still don’t feel I am up to speed with this genre to do it justice.  What I can talk about is the talent and writing style of Logan Keys.  The first half of the book did drag a bit for me and while that is normally a curse for a reviewer, in this case it was much appreciated.  It gave me a slower chance to learn about the characters and the situation they have found themselves in.  I was also able to absorb the new information regarding zombies and the end of the world as they knew it.  I found that with the slowness and description that Logan gave us, the purpose for the kids to escape the “prison” they were in and advance to a new land, along with where they had come from and the lives they had happily lived before this devastation, was much more intense when the story picked up half way through.The writing in this book was next to flawless with the smooth reading, the suspense and mystery.  Included was an abundance of action, abuse, torture both mentally and physically and the emotional angst was off the charts.  The way the scenes were described and the detail paid to every room, battle field and event made the story come to life, which was also another benefit for me as a new reader to this genre.I was very impressed with how Logan was able to keep my attention and interest growing, even though at many points I was very lost as to what was happening, but that was due to my inexperience not the writing and I found I was emotionally distraught in the end.  The character development used established a foundation for me to connect and care about Liza, Tommy, Jeremy and a host of other characters from beginning to end.  The final page will leave you gasping with the shock that no one expected to come.  While I can’t say I am now a fan of this genre, I can say I was invested enough in the characters to want to know what happens next.

Sara Night has lost everything in life.  Her family is gone due to an accident, her dreams and goals in life are lost.  Placed in a foster home she fights for a reason to live.  Repeating her senior year again, her grades are still very low, her ambition is even lower.  She has no reason to live.  After a failed suicide attempt she finds herself being “kidnapped” by the two guys she thought was her friends.  They need her to fulfill a mission for a secret agency that is going after a drug cartel.At first Sara refuses this job, she has no idea what to do, she has never been trained to be a secret agent spy.  It wasn’t until the director explained this was her chance to leave her world behind, have a place to call home and a new family that it became a reminder that her only goal in life was to do good, help others and make up for the guilt she felt about her family.Training was intense and the mission started and from there you will have to read to feel the action and suspense, the drama and intensity of the quest.  The author had me gripping the kindle and sitting on the edge of my seat.  She developed the characters so well it was difficult to cheer on Sara in every little victory and want to rescue her before the cartel finds her.  I am not usually fan of mystery but Sara Schoen gave a heart breaking story behind the reason for Sara to take on this job.  She has me invested in this story from chapter one.  I highly recommend this book and personally will search out more work from this author.

M. Leighton presents a story that is packed with action, mystery and passion.  The prologue itself will suck the reader into the story and have them reaching for tissues and trying to find solace.  Jasper’s life is a maze into darkness from the first page and he continues to carry his secrets throughout the story.Muse is a puzzle of her own, being sent to a new town to start over because her father felt it was safer, she never really understood why her father did the things he did.  He was a military man who commanded trust and respect and when he asked something of a person they just complied without question.  She was content till she was forced to hire someone to find him.  In walks Jasper but is his agenda the same as hers?  Was he the man that she meant to hire?Their passion sparked instantly and the sex quickly began.  This is the only part of the story that caused me to lower my rating.  I felt it the story would have been easier to read and have a solid plot, if under the circumstances of why they were traveling together; the buildup had been longer and stronger.While out trying to locate the missing father, truths come out and discoveries are made, all of this became a threat to break up what they had instantly built.  Jasper is a dark soul who can’t be tied down with love or any other human.  Muse is a strong woman who loves freely and isn’t afraid to show her emotions to him.I loved the plot, and we get an idea of how the author’s mind must work. The plot was not predictable for me, I had some ideas but I was never fully on target before anything happened.  The secondary characters were intriguing and fun to get to know as well.  I can’t go more into the story as the twists, turns and surprises all need to be experienced by the reader, not spoiled by a review.I haven’t been a regular reader of this authors work but I will certainly be waiting for this next book and will go back and grab a few more of her prior reads because she held me captivated in this story.  It was gritty enough to keep me on edge and passionate enough to make me melt.  While her style seemed to hide a lot of information regarding Jasper and Muse from the reader, which at first frustrated me, I soon became a fan of this style.  It gave me the feeling of being in the story with them as we uncovered lies and danger.  I highly recommend this book and will be waiting to see what she comes up with next.

There were many things I liked about this book, a few things I loved about it and one very annoying thing that carried throughout the whole story.  I love Sara York’s writing style and how she can draw the reader into the situations at hand, leaving us feeling the emotions of the characters so much we begin craving a happy ending for them.  I loved the story of Sam and Hudson as they were refreshing and hot.  I did like the commitment and love shown between Greg, Chris and Liam and the beginning of the book was intense and had me hooked.  What drove me crazy were Liam’s weakness and his constant need for reassurance, yet he claimed he trusted Chris and Greg.From the first page you can see where Liam came from.  His parents were willing to do whatever it took to turn him from being gay and save their Christian reputation.  From Jackson Mississippi, his parents didn’t have a hard time getting the local police involved in “kidnapping” their son and sending him to a facility to fix him.  This isn’t the first time they have shown hatred for who he is and he carries the scars on his body and soul from their abuse.It is because of this kidnapping and the fact Greg and Chris refuse to just leave without him that we meet Sam, a FBI agent who will help set Liam free.  Sam also becomes part of the story when he watches the love those three men have for each other and seeks a love of his own.  Liam is forced to make a horrible choice between Chris and Greg that will lead us to more of his need for constant reassurance and coddling.  Now I know Liam is fragile, he has been through a lot but at some point I just wanted to scream and remind him he has two men who love him, leave the past behind and move forward.As you go on in the story you will see more of Sam and Hudson’s relationship develop and Liam’s parents not giving up their attempts to make Liam straight.  The suspense and emotional part of this plot was great.  Greg being the Dom in this relationship gave way to some pretty hot m/m/m scenes and the love those three had for each other was inspiring.Sara does a wonderful job at bringing those hidden taboos to light in a way that the message hits you before you even see it coming.  She shows the pain of having to keep secrets in order to save yourself from death or persecution by society.  The author also proved how far some communities has advanced in acceptance of different lifestyles while some backward communities are still stuck in the old way of thinking, that homosexuality is a disease that can be cured with violence, fear and hate.  If you are a fan of the m/m/m genre with some emotional angst that will leave you all over the place, then you will enjoy this book.

I really wanted to love this book and as I began reading the story and met Alexis and Martin, I felt for sure this was going to suck me in and leave me with a hangover.  Unfortunately, I wasn’t as invested as I had hoped to be.  I still enjoyed it a great deal though.Martin has the mission of protecting Alexis as she recovers from being abused both mentally and sexually by Elliot.  She was handed out to many men and was left a broken woman.  Martin understood how she felt since the same thing had happened to him by his parents until the police stepped in and put him in foster care.  If was during that foster care he met some great friends and landed in the Army. Now out into the civilian world, he dedicates his time helping other victims of sexual abuse recover and find a place in the world for themselves.He has a strong attraction to Alexis just as she does for him, but two things are stopping him at first from making the move.  She is broken and recovering.  This is not the time for him to make a sexual advance towards her, not until she is mentally strong enough to decide if she wants that.  Second, he doesn’t see himself as a good man.  She deserves more than what he can give her.  Alexis is a strong woman, she doesn’t see him as defective, she sees him a strong man who will protect her, care for her and will leave as soon as they catch the man leaving threatening messages.As the story progresses you will soon find out whom that man is from her past and how far he is willing to go to make her his woman but you will also watch Martin slowly learn to accept the truth about his past and his future.  It is a wonderful message of survival and forgiving yourself, but also the power of love and endurance.I think I could have loved it had there been a few changes in the writing style.  At times it felt rushed, especially the sex scenes and the consistency between Alexis being strong and logical versus emotionally crippled because of the past was not solid for me.  I also am not a fan of repetitive words or phrases used so close together.  It breaks the reading flow for me.  I did love the plot and could see some areas that could have been more intense and ways that the reader could have connected more with the characters but with all of that said, I would still recommend this book to others and I do want to go back and read books one and two because I strongly believe in the message the author is trying to project in her stories.

I absolutely love the path Elle took when writing a BDSM story.  Instead of focusing on establishing a Dom/Sub relationship and the sex, she took us behind the scenes regarding trust, love and loyalty.  Along with this she writes about when life takes a different and unexpected turn, leaving us with choices that no one would want to have to make.  Life become crazy when you agree to do a favor for someone soon becomes a life changing decision?Kit felt her life purpose was to be a sub, to serve and obey her Mistress Kayla.  Their relationship saved each other from the past they needed to escape.  Kayla had an old friend who used to provide refuge for her as a child from the fighting and dysfunction between her parents.  Stumbling upon Charles secret, Kayla started investigating BDSM and found she was meant to be a Dom.Charles has asked Kayla and Kit to help him on a project, namely his grandson.  With the plan in place, Kit is supposed to find out if Jared is not only accepting of BDSM but is he the natural born Dom as his grandfather believes he is.  After a “false start” soon Kit and Jared start to become interested in each other and the testing begins to form.I won’t go any farther with this story other than say, things aren’t always as they appear.  What could start out with your convictions firm, you can soon find yourself a toxic turmoil where choices are going to need to be made and betrayals will shatter your heart.  Friendships and love can be broken instead of strengthened and everyone has skeletons and secrets they are willing to go to extremes to protect.My heart went out to Kit numerous times as she tries to navigate her way through this maze of confusion and fear.Jared was intriguing to watch as his European ego begins to melt and he sheds his royal attitude for a more natural and accepting view of life.Charles broke my heart as we watched him finally be honest about how he has felt over the last twenty years.Kayla was devastating to watch with her pain that she has hidden because there is no real solution to her problem.People shouldn’t be changed and it is going to take a selfless person to let go or accept the reality of their situation.I am so impressed with this author’s ability to make me so focused on the dynamics of the relationship and forcing me to question what I would do if I were confronted with such a dilema.  So many times I have read BDSM books yet never have I ever considered what happened in situations like this.  There is a level of human angst and confusion that you often see in books today, but Elle did a fantastic job at keeping this story realistic from the events to the emotions surrounding the events.  I am looking forward to reading more from this author.

OH HOLY HECK!!!!!!!!!!!! Pepper Winters owns me in every way possible.  I have read dark and twisted but she has reached a level of torment that I never dreamed this series would reach.  With each book, the intensity and tension rises, leaving me exhausted, mentally warped and gloriously begging for more.At the end of the Third Debt we thought Jethro and Nila were on the cusp of freedom, but as we have learned, that is near impossible with the Hawk family.  As we enter the Fourth Debt, our innocent Nila that we have grown to love, has now turned bitter and focusing on revenge.  With the loss of the man she loves, she is determined on bringing down the family that has tormented the females in her heritage and shattered her heart.The advanced development for ALL of the characters in this story also rose to a level that I couldn’t have predicted.  We finally start seeing the true colors people and get some answers to our lingering questions that have been building.  So many times I found myself reading and internally screaming “please don’t be doing this, tell me this is a trick.” While other times I was wondering what in the world goes on inside Pepper’s mind to create such a nightmare that has become Nila’s life now.I can’t go into what happens in this book, it would be too risky but trust me, this isn’t for the faint of heart and if you have read the other books in this series, this one is even more horrific in my opinion.  I say horrific but God it is a wonderful kind of horrific.  I hated to see Nila suffer both physically and emotionally but Pepper won me over when I noticed I was holding my breath, squirming in my chair, clutching my kindle with white knuckles.  She had my world captured in this story and nothing mattered till I finished this book.What can I say about the ending other than the only saving grace for me was I know there is another book coming which gives me hope.  The last paragraph had me screaming, wanting to climb in and save Nila myself.  I am so thankful she isn’t ending the series this way; it would crush a part of my heart for the rest of my life.  This is how much I love this series and the Fourth Debt was by far the best one yet.  I absolutely live for dark and twisted so it is rather hard to shock me or make me invest myself in a book so deeply that it would haunt me forever, but this series has done it.

If you are not familiar with K.S Haigwood books, then this will be one of the most unique books you will ever read.  If you are a fan of hers, then you will not be surprised that she takes the theme of evil versus good, enemy versus enemy and brings them all together for a common good.  One difference for the fan or new reader is the addition of Anne Conley to this book.The duo wrote a novel that will draw you into the plot early and refuse to let you go.  Life will become nonexistent, chores left undone.  Children will be begging for your attention but all you will be able to do is continue to read and turn the pages as you watch Mena, Phoenix and Alex try to figure out the mess they find themselves in after one tragic night.Mena discovers her husband has cheated and she tries to leave.  When he finds her on that dark raining night, she isn’t alone, Phoenix, the alpha of the vampires is there.  Her husband has been harboring more than the secret of his affair, he is also the alpha of the wolf pack.  When Mena is changed, she becomes the new alpha but all of the information she needed wasn’t provided.  All she is sure of is she needs to figure out a way to lead this pack of wolves and combat against those that left in rebellion.With Alex being the investigator into the murder of her husband, Mena’s wolf has a strong attraction to the human Alex, while Mena has feelings for Phoenix.  K.S. and Anne created a plot that gives each character a set of pros and cons with each decision they have to make, intensifying the conflict and angst in the story.  The goal was clear; the path to reaching that goal is going to be next to impossible.  People are going to lose in this story, not many will gain but for the one who wins the prize, the risks may never outweigh the victory.Brilliance that is the first word that comes to mind when I talk about the talent of these two authors.  This book is for everyone, the lovers of vampires, wolves, shifters, love, loss and drama.  Add a few witches, humans, crime, anger and pain and you have the recipe for this emotional vortex that will take you away from reality and leave you demanding for more.

It is always a wonderful thing to see an author branch out into new areas of writing that is scary and intimidating for them.  What makes it even better is when they do an awesome job at it and provide a story that will shock the reader and leave them begging for more.  This author put her fears and insecurities on the shelf and went forward, giving us a gritty story that will shatter the weak at heart with drama, suspense and the evil deeds of others.K.A took on a tough topic in this book and added a bit of romance to the plot to remind us that love can conquer all, or can it?  Jules never grew up knowing what love or having a family felt like.  Living in foster homes, dealing with abuse, having her friendships and relationships used against her, has forced her to survive in a hotel room, working at a dead end job and avoiding the advances of sick men.It wasn’t until the Riley brothers stepped into the bar that she started to see a second chance at life begin to form. While stubbornly holding on to her independence and pride, Holden showed interest in things other than her body.  He wanted to know her heart, mind and ambitions.  He wanted to help and love her, be part of her dreams and future. Dante gave her a sense of protection, security, possibly an awkward form of friendship. While Dante wanted to find out what Jules was about, he respected the strength in her soul that has kept her alive but soon the truth about the three comes out and their worlds turn upside down.  Putting the pieces of this puzzle together was consuming, captivating and at times earth shattering.The amount of suspense and drama all begins to unfold halfway through the book and the author didn’t give you a chance to catch your breath till the last page, leaving you trying to process what you had just read with your mind swirling and heart racing.  You will find scenes that will rip your heart out and leave you emotionally raw, moments you will want to scream at K.A and ask her what she was thinking.
