Then you forgive her with the moments that have you melting because of the tender romance that brews between Holden and Jules.  The biggest promise I can give you is the unpredictability of this story.  Never let your guard down, go through the first half and learn about Jules  and understand where she came from because where she ends up will blow you away.

By far this is the best book in the series so far and that is saying a lot.  I fell in love with Pamela Sparkman’s style after I read her first book.  The way she brings the reader into the story, making us feel the emotions and live the plot was impressive to me.  We meet this crew of characters and they continue to show up in the books as the series progresses.  Skin Deep is about Hayden and Beth.Hayden has every reason to be a jerk in life but he turned his back on his childhood and family and forged ahead in life learning to love and be the kind hearted man that was his true self.  He has two girls in his life that he takes care of and loves, but Beth has captured his heart.  Unfortunately, Beth can’t give him anything in return because she is empty inside.When you read about her childhood and how she survives day to day it will break your heart.  She struggles against the vice she has depended on, her eating disorder and her longing to be normal and able to love.  Hayden can see past the walls she has built and makes it his mission to make her like him, be a friend to her and get her to love him.There are so many twists to this story, you will never be able to sit back and predict the next move.  I love how Beth isn’t a victim or someone who feels there is no hope for her future; she just needs someone to believe in her enough till she can have faith in herself.  Hayden, oh my Hayden is my favorite male character out of this series.  He is bright, funny, loving, and sexy and can sing a woman right off her feet.If you haven’t already experienced the beautiful storytelling of Pamela Sparkman you are missing out on a great treasure.  She brings her characters to life right before your eyes, allowing each of them to show their tender vulnerable souls to the reader and allowing us on their path of healing.  She gives us joy and sadness, hope and healing and humor along the way.  I know we have all heard the phrase Live Well, Love Much, Laugh Often…….that is the theme in Pamela’s books.  No matter what the situation is, no matter how great the heartache will be, nor how big the loss, she has created a group of friends and family that love, laugh and live through ups and downs in life as a team.

I have loved the Wonderland series from the beginning and I think the unique idea of different authors writing the characters story is brilliant.  It keeps the style and pattern refreshingly different and so far there hasn’t been a book that I have disliked or gives me the usual drag that often happens in a series.  But this one, Max Colton’s story, was so intense and real for me, I feel like I left part of my life in the pages with him.I am not sure how H.A. Robinson did it, but she created a bond for me with Max from the first chapter.  I have been known to become emotionally invested in a story, I have suffered my fair share of book hangovers but rarely do I feel like I have a “dog in the fight” as I did with this one.  Max became my own child or sorts, when he hurt I hurt, when he was happy my whole emotional balanced shifted.  She had me so incorporated with this story; my family noticed the emotional changes in me.  I will admit, this freaks me out that Ms. Robinson not only got in my head with Max she moved in and took over my world as well.The story starts out with Max being sent away to school.  The love of his mother was strong but in my opinion she wasn’t always worthy.  His father was a huge self-centered jerk who just thinking about him makes my blood boil.  Max had some issues with his speech and he never fought back or started a fight, yet he carried bruises and cuts from others on his face often.  Punishment at the school wasn’t detention that we have come to know, it was physical punishment and even through all of this, the light that kept him centered was going back home to be with his mom and keep enough distance from his father.I could go on for hours about this book and walk you through every day of his live as it was described but I won’t risk spoiling it for you.  Expect to see Max as he grows up to be a man, tricked by women who want to take advantage, lied to by others who have their own agenda.  He will find that his love for his mom makes him vulnerable to vultures that are preying on his gentle heart.  But there is more, you will also see his kind spirit find friendships that will nurture him into becoming a brave man who can stand up for himself.  He will find his place in life even if it is in the location he swore he would never go to, Max learns that sometimes the places labeled never become the only place to go.If this were a normal book, this is where I would say the ending leaves you in a slight cliff hanger, but this isn’t a normal book.  For me, the ending left me with the mixed emotions of being excited to see his next venture in life begin to unfold, the thrill and joy that he is about to embark on.  Then there is the other side of my heart, the more protective side that is fearful this next stage is going to shatter him and crush the fragile spirit we have seen since we met him.  Make no mistake when you open this book you are at risk of falling in love with Max, but this kind of love goes much deeper than a physical attraction.  If we could bottle this secret talent the H. A. Robinson has for making the story become part of our own soul, there wouldn’t be a single person on the planet without a book in their hands.

What an emotional second book in a series.  I could go over the facts in the book but you need to feel this story as you go.  I feel everyone should read this book in this day and age.  Of course it will upset some people because it is an f/f book and that won’t appeal to the average reader but you will be missing a great message of those beliefs that influenced us as children.Delilah is now facing the most crucial turning point in her life.  The last thing she has from her parents after their unexpected death is the guilt that they were upset with her because she admitted she was gay.  Being in a community where homosexuality was common, she struggles with coming out and questions why  straight people don’t have to “come out” about their sexual preference yet homosexuals do.  Doesn’t everyone have the same right to be happy and free without shame?When she decided to express her feelings toward Ashley she was relieved to know Ashely felt the same towards her, but  can she let go of those ties that bind her to her parents judgments and be open in public with her girlfriend?  Could what she felt was the last link to her parents really be broken if it meant saving this relationship.You will watch Delilah as she explores this new lifestyle, which I hope will be seen no differently than a young adult exploring their first real relationship no matter what sexual preference they are.  That is the message I carried from this book, every form of love, every coming of age event and every belief you grew up with, shapes a person’s future in the same way.I found this to be a powerful story of a young woman trying to find her way in life after losing her only foundation, her parents.  Striking out into the world with a shattered heart and desires that have been deemed as wrong.  Feeling love for the “wrong” person yet knowing the heart won’t let go of that feeling.  I think Delilah was a strong woman and I felt bad that a society I am part of made her struggle worse than it needed to be.

ARC provided by author in exchange for an honest review for Stephanie's Book ReportsWow, this was an intense read; I already feel a book hangover starting.  The author is going to take you on a path of twist and turns and discoveries that will rip your heart out and leave you breathless.  It starts out as an average college story, one night stands, girl meets bad boy, friends try to talk her out of going after bad boy, but shortly after the first few chapters something changes and you are thrown into the depths of the hell that Cassie and Luca have lived during the last few years.  The story goes from entertaining to meaningful right before your eyes and you are so invested by the time you realize it, there is no turning back for the reader.In one night, the loving home and charmed life that Cassie had grown up in becomes dark and destroyed.  Her world will never be the same again and the only way she knew how to deal was to deny, ignore and have sex with any man she could to feel something for a few minutes before the numbness took over again.  She is in college and living with her two best friends London and Milo.  You will love those two, Milo brings light and laughter to the story, London deserves sainthood with her patience and compassion.  London knows the secret Cassie holds, she has felt the pain of the last four years and focused her attention on keeping Cassie safe and going forward.  Cassie sees Luca at a party and decides that night should be spent having hot sex with him, but he turns her down.  He instantly sees what Cassie is hiding behind the cold exterior of her heart and he wants no part of her plan.Luca might appear to be the bad boy with a terrible reputation, but in reality he is just as torn up with events in his life as Cassie.  Maybe that is why he could identify the mask she was wearing because he had one of his own.  Or could it be he was afraid that she might become more than a one night stand? When he moves in next door to her, they begin a cat and mouse game, trying to make the other jealous enough to give in and beg for sex.  It was a safe game they thought because both were too stubborn to wave the white flag and admit defeat.  It was endearing to watch him with her and as the events continued to unfold, I found I was falling in love with his character more than I even thought was possible.There are times in this story that will have you on your knees overcome with raw emotions as Cassie faces the reality of what was left behind after that dreadful night.  Moments that will melt your heart as both Luca and Cassie take a risk at trust again and events that will make you value the love you have in your own life even more.  There are so many ups and downs with this story that will keep the reader turning pages in order to see if they will find their happy. The writing style is smooth, the action is balanced and the author truly invited the readers to care about these characters.  I would recommend this book and say I will be looking for more work from this author in the future.

Kindle Alexander has accomplished a major feat with this book.  The author took an outstanding and intriguing plot and made it blossom into an intense and emotional read that will make you stop and think about how your judgments on homosexuality and the liberty to live your life.  The message in this book that exude from every page is about acceptance, unconditional love and becoming comfortable with who you are and living the life you were given.  These messages were sent in the midst of a love story filled with patience, angst and hope that never crossed the line into ménage, cheating or betrayal.Dylan Reeves is a middle aged man who has the mind of a genius when it comes to technology.  He created a program that is sought after across the country, but his funds are too limited to expand his company any farther.  He freely admits during his college years he made some wild choices, not bad ones because those choices developed into marrying his best friend Teri and their three beautiful children.  His life was story book perfect to the world, but behind the closed doors he was living a lie.  Dylan was gay living in a straight man’s world.  His dedication to his children was so strong he was willing to live the lie till they were all off on their own in college and then he would make the difficult choices that he knew he faced.Teri Reeves was one of the most remarkable women that I have ever come across in a fictional story.  Dylan had been honest with her years ago and she dealt with his truth that had now become her story.  She committed with him to stay together for the children, but she also wanted to support him as he emerged into this new reality.  She found a man whom she carried on a relationship with for years, loved him and would go away for weekends with her lover, all with Dylan’s blessings.  She encouraged Dylan to seek his own love while they banded together as a family for their children.  She was strong, confident and a valuable support person for Dylan as he realized his day of freedom was coming sooner than he had planned.Tristian Wilder was the handsome CEO of Wilder-Nation, the company that wants to buy Dylan’s program and business.  Everyone knows Tristian is gay and a playboy but when his eyes land on Dylan for the first time he felt in his soul there was more to this man than his brilliant mind.  Tristian figures out Dylan’s secret and with small baby steps takes him on the journey of what it would be like living as a homosexual male.  I loved the balance that the author gave Tristian, as CEO and self-made millionaire, he is used to getting his way in everything, but with Dylan he had such patience and compassion, it made this story even more beautiful.Be prepared to discover emotions of your own that you might not be aware of.  I don’t know if I could be as strong and accepting as Teri.  Could I have the patience and acceptance in hiding my emotions and heart to the world because of the fear and shame carried by the one I loved if I were Tristian?  Could I break free from the moral foundation I had been brainwashed with growing up to stand up in an unaccepting society and declare my true being like Dylan is faced with? This is a powerful story and truly one of Kindle Alexander’s best books.

Once I started this series, I haven’t been able to put it down.  Lynnette Bernard continues once again to take real human issues and throw them at this group of characters who happen to also be shifters.  One thing that she does in this series that has me addicted is adding new characters with each book, giving you enough of a hint to know you will see them again soon while creating their role to the point you need to know more about their story.  We met Nikki in book one, she was Laurie’s best friend and hints were dropped that she had lived a rough life and been hurt beyond the point anyone should have expected.Now with her own book, we learn just what was behind the tears that Nikki shed, she was lonely and had been beaten down her whole life.  With a mother who continued to remind her that she meant nothing and would never amount to anything, to an ex-husband who used her for the one thing Nikki had.  Now as a nurse, she tries to hide behind the sarcasm and laughter and help everyone who is in need while hiding as she sheds the tears and longs to be held.  We saw her get hurt by Laurie’s ex-husband in book one and that places her at the ranch and in the sites of Alexander and Butler, triad partners looking for their mate.The guys are wolf shifters and in charge of protecting the pack and family.  Without having a mate to calm their inner wolf down, they were beginning to believe they might have to step away from security as they were losing their grip on the emotions that were flooding their soul.  When they met Nikki, they knew by the scent she was their mate, but convincing her was going to be a huge challenge.How do you convince a stubborn woman who is afraid to allow a man to control her that she was meant to be with them when they are so demanding and alpha in their need to protect and take care of her?  There is a lot of back and forth between these three as they demand she listen and she demands they accept her for who she is.  She wants babies so badly but fears that the lies she has been told about her ability will make it never happen.  Even with the visions they all see, she isn’t willing to risk her heart and believe in what they are telling her.  It will take a big event to prove to her that she needs to close her mouth and open her eyes to see the truth.I look forward to book 3 as we were given a peek into the story of Drew, Carter and Susannah and her story sounds intense.  As with book one, Lynnette leaves some loose ends in each book while drawing attention to the next journey the reader will embark on.  While the traditions are the same in the pack for each book, the personalities stand out and transport you into a new plot and intensity that makes you want to keep coming back for more.  Make sure you read them in order and enjoy life on the ranch.

4 stars*ARC provided in exchange for an honest review for Crystal’s Many Reviewers*I have had the honor of reading the first three books in the Den of Sin series and the number one thing I tell readers is you will find a steamy story with a real message about life, acceptance and moving forward in each book.  L. V Lewis doesn’t write this series for the erotic element alone, she write a meaningful story with an erotic twist.  The Beaudelaire Hotel is the place where broken and dishearten people go to find a second chance at love and life.In this installment you meet Karen and Paul.  They had met years ago during physical therapy and rehab.  Karen was married though and not free to explore any feelings she had for another man.  Paul was instantly attracted to her but he respected her situation in life and at the time he was trying to find his place in society now that he came back from the Marines with his leg being replaced by prosthesis.Karen was one of the most sought after fashion models in the country.  Her beauty lit up a room and men would fall on the floor in front of her to gain a single second of her attention, but she was dealt the hand of facing a double mastectomy. Her husband couldn’t handle that his wife was no longer the woman who could fill out those sexy bathing suits so their marriage ended. Giving love another try was not something Karen was willing to risk; she couldn’t even have sex without her shirt on.  After agreeing to give the weekend of fantasy a try, she is confronted with the man who fell in love with her all of those years ago.  Could she let Paul love her and give her two days of joy and passion?L.V. Lewis proves to the reader that outside beauty isn’t what feeds the soul; it is your heart and spirit that makes you beautiful.  As Paul proves to Karen she is as much of a woman now as she was in front of the camera we watch her confidence grow and admire the courage and self-acceptance Paul as over his newly formed body.  This is a story of second chances, love and acceptance that can be read very quickly due to the shorten length and writing style.  The author is a pro at reeling you in on the first page and making the next couple of hours become a fantasy come true for the reader.

ARC received from the author for an honest review for Bare Naked WordsI had not heard of this author before and was a little worried when I researched and found the term Dick Dynasty used.  The first chapter really was not what I had expected and to be honest, I was almost ready to DNF because I just wasn’t sure this was my kind of book.  I am so glad I didn’t quit though because the authors talent for suspense and making two opposites attract was well worth the read.Porter is the oldest brother to the “Dick Dynasty”.  His brothers Preston and Parker are seen as his responsibilities with his mother since their father is out of the picture and the burden becomes too much to deal with for Porter.  With all three being in the porn business, Porter sees first hand that gay porn can make more money than the average kind, he also sees the drugs that are available to them, but he isn’t willing to go that far for a buck.  When he meets Holly he realizes, he might even be willing to stop all together if he could have a future with her.Holly is a professional woman as a casting director. She deals with the dramatic and demanding people who have a list of demands that should never be expected to be met.  She has a clear picture in her head of how porn stars act, even down to release parties that she would bet money becomes an orgy.  When she meets Porter at his brother’s party, her body says YES, while her mind say NO. Good thing an accidental run in gave her the escape she needed, but Porter won’t be ignored for long.  Can he ever convince her that there is more to him that the porn?I loved the side characters in this story, to be honest; they carry the plot better than most.  Mitch and Becks gives this story a slice of humor and sarcasm that will make you fall in love with them and the boy’s mom is the queen of motherly guilt.  There is a pretty dramatic ending, some would call it a cliffhanger, but for me it was more like the prologue to what I hope is the next book.I want to make sure it is clear to those who give this book a try, the first part might offend you and make you want to quit, but the author quickly shows us what he is capable of and will provide you with steamy sex scenes, suspense that will leave your heart racing and a love story that will be remembered for a long time.  I can hardly wait to see what is coming next.

I had recently be gifted a copy of Lynnette Bernard’s Cowboy Series and fell in love with those characters and her writing style.  I made a comment that I wanted to check out her paranormal series but was concerned because I didn’t know if her style would be enough for me to really invest in a paranormal book.  She kindly offered to give me the series in exchange for an honest review.  I mean let’s be serious, if you can get a reader who doesn’t understand or like shifter stories to like your book, and then you know you must be on to something right?When I received the series I thought I would give the first book a quick glance.  I had a to do list a mile long, but I was curious about Laurie’s Loves.  Unfortunately for my to do list, nothing really got done yesterday because once I started the book I couldn’t put it down.  Even woke up at two this morning to read some more and was up again at six with kindle in my hand.  What made this addicting for me?  The human element of the story.  Even the shifters presented themselves to me as human beings with the same emotions, fears and angst that I have; therefore I could connect and identify with them on so many levels.  Now I am not a pro at the shifter genre and there were a few loose ends in this story that I still wonder about, but overall I am hooked and a proud card carrying fan of Beckett’s Wolf Pack series.Laurie is the mother of two young adult twin children that she has raised by herself from day one.  Her husband was abusive and jealous of the time the kids took away from her.  He had no love for anyone.  After saving every penny she took a vacation to the ranch where she meets Jace and Jackson, along with their whole pack.  She had been torn down by her ex so much, she didn’t see herself as anything other than old, fat and stupid, along with very ugly.  What the guys saw was their beautiful mate and they were determined to claim her as soon as possible.Jace was jaded, vowing to never find the mate that would calm his wolf and be able to contain his emotions; he fought daily to remain a fair alpha for his pack.  Jackson was the beta, second in command and he was much more laid back and easy going than Jace, but he could feel the struggle flaring inside his triad partner.  Jace and Jackson have been able to talk to each other since they were kids, not verbally but through their thoughts so when Laurie came onto the ranch they both knew she was the one they had been searching for their whole lives.  Will they be able to protect her when someone wants her dead?  Will they be able to accept that Laurie is a package deal?  Along with her love they will have to accept her friend, children and yes even the threat of her ex-husband.You will be introduced to many members of this pack family and watch as Laurie just naturally fits in with each person.  She has a unique kind of love and compassion that draws people to her but she also has enemies that want to destroy her and insecurities that will keep her paralyzed in life.  This book wasn’t just a love story; it had action and drama that will keep you turning those pages.  It is also a story of letting go of the past, releasing the fears and burning the old tapes that play on repeat in your mind, keeping you from taking risks and finding your happily ever after.  I was so engrossed by this book, I quickly started book two before I even thought about how to write this review.  This pack of humans/wolves have fascinated me, drawn me in to their world and even made me a bit jealous that it is fiction and not someplace I can go to in real life.  I look forward to reading the whole series and getting to know each of the characters better.

I say this more out of pride than for full disclosure and honesty reasons, but I was Lorenz beta reader for this series and the person who has spent the last two years regularly begging for Cyrus to have his own book.  I fell for that man in Hunted and begged, pleaded and yes even demanded that he get a book of his own.  I am so thankful Lorenz saw the brilliance in my suggestion, or demand, and gave him the fourth installment to The Gates Legacy.  Actually it had nothing to do with me begging, as the Gates Legacy unfolds, it was just common sense that this new chapter in the plot would evolve from Cyrus.I could tell you what happens in this book, well no I really can’t because so much happens in every one of her books, it would be a novel just describing it, but I do feel I can give you some insights as to what you are going to discover while you read her series.  It is strongly suggested you read these books in order, if you don’t you will risk getting lost in the plot but more than that you will never capture the true poetry in her writing.  Lorenz is one of the only authors I have come across that can write a book in such a way, you actually forget you are reading and feel more like you are living the story in a big screen production.  Her talent and way with words brings the story to life, you can smell the air in the scene, picture the little items that were not even mentioned because the book becomes a magical land you have just entered.The theme, as always if good versus evil and how far are you willing to go to achieve your goal.  In this installment she also focuses on how far you will go to make your life better.  There are some characters that we have grown to love over the past three books that are stuck in a darkness that will consume them if they don’t reach out for the light. Cyrus was dealt a terrible deal when he was transformed from human to vampire.  Now he has to decide if adjusting to his new life and making the best of it is worth the risk, especially when he is going to have to partner up with the demon himself who put him in this position.  Anger, disappointment and revenge will threaten to derail the plans and the overwhelming sense of loss could cripple some of our beloved characters.  Is this family strong enough to bring the ones on the brink back to life while carrying on the mission at hand?I have the blessing in life to call Lorenz my dear friend and with this relationship I see so much of her own personality in her books.  With Reckoning her trait to put herself aside for the greater good is the common theme that plays out across the pages.  Each member at Tack Industries will be faced with the challenge of protecting themselves and those they love or risking it all for the greater good in the vampire community.  The bond that this created family has, is fused with a moral need to do well, even in the face of the most demonic evil forces ever to be created.  Wars and battles will be fought and some are won, some are lost, but what stands firm is their resolve to do what their fallen leader had set out to do in the beginning of the series.There are not enough words that could convey my feelings about how everyone must read this series.  I was not even a vampire fan when I started working with her on Hunted.  Lorenz writes for all readers.  She doesn’t direct this series to vampire genre lovers, she writes for readers who love fantastic stories.  I found as a “vampire virgin” that I was easily enamored by these characters and plot, finding my own place among the Gates Legacy lovers, yet another one of Lorenz’s personality traits, inclusion for all people, acceptance and the ability to leave no one behind when she it typing out her magic on the computer.  Get your copies today people, you won’t be sorry.

Jake’s Angel is by far my favorite in this series, which is hard to say because I have loved each one.  Once I finished the book I took some time to think about why I loved Jake’s Angel so much.  The conclusion I came up with is because of Lynnette’s writing style.  With each book she gives you crumbs of everyone’s story along with the plot of the two main characters in each book.  The build up to why Jake was so standoffish to Claire has always intrigued me, now I know the full story and it was more intense than I had predicted.Jake’s parents died when he was younger which caused his older brother Deuce to take over as head of the household.  Jake became more withdrawn from the family and society while the other brothers grieved and moved on from their parent’s untimely death.  When you read the reason for his coldness it will break your heart and make you want to love him even more.  His nature is to dominate in the bedroom and in life.  I think he is one of the most protective brothers in the McKade clan and just what Claire needs, but his fear in hurting her keeps replaying over and over in his head.She grew up with a mother and sister who never loved her.  They mentally, verbally and physically abused her over and over because she was different.  She was an Empath, she felt the emotions both good and bad of others to the point it would overwhelm her most of the time.  When she touched Jake, she gave him the sense of peace and calm that he has been missing since his parents died.  In Jake she found safety and emotional calmness from the invading feelings.  He could shut the outside world out and give her the room to just be at peace.  Since she can read his mind, she knows what he is most afraid of and why he keeps pulling away from her.  She can also see his dreams that he gave up on long ago, her job now is to prove to him she can make those dreams come true and that he is her mate.Everything isn’t smooth for them as outside forces try to derail their path and if they make it they will have to stand strong together and trust in what the Great Spirit has put together for them.  One thing I love most about Lynnette’s books is when she introduces new characters in the book.  I always know that means there is a chance this series will go on and on as she tells the story of each one.  She writes her series in ways that each book could be a standalone, but I wouldn’t recommend it, yet each one carries not only the main couple but additions that keep the interest and intensity alive.  I have yet to read one that drags or becomes boring midway through because she engages the readers mind along with their heart.  I highly recommend the Cowboy Mates, Psychic Connections Series.  Lynnette has many other books out on the market that have more of a paranormal theme.  I am not normally a fan of such books but with her style and flair in storytelling and her ability to make me so invested in her characters I pray their story never ends, I will certainly be getting more of her work so I can dive in and enjoy her talent.

Crystal from Crystal’s Many Reviewers is a dear friend of mine and bought this book for my 12 year old daughter.  My daughter doesn’t always have the patience to sit and read a book; she must be on the go or on her computer, so I was amazed when she came out of her room the day after getting this book with her kindle in her hand.  She informed me she had already read the first story the night before and she couldn’t put the second story down.I immediately went and purchased the first book from these young authors and send it to my daughter’s kindle and she started that book the moment she was done with The Perfect Summer.  I skimmed over the book and read bits and pieces and it didn’t take long for me to realize that we have three young ladies who are going to be fantastic authors as adults if they keep this up.  They are natural born story tellers who know how to relate to teenagers through stories of morals, values and compassion.  As a mother I highly recommend these books for your young readers.Faith’s review (age 12)I loved all three stories. My favorite story was the second one, A Lesson for Summer. I think I like it morebecause I could understand the characters more. I could relate to the stories more than otherstories I have read because it was like talking to my best friend instead of grown-ups. I love how they all put their own touch it every story. Myfavorite characters are Vanessa and Teresa. They are my favorite because theyare twins that stick together in every situation. I don’t always like to read but I didn’t want to stop reading this one and already like their first book. It is nice to know that kids can be authors too.

I could not have written or asked for a better ending to this series.  The title speaks for itself, giving you the understanding of how things have work out for Ace and Max after the running, denying and anger destroyed their world.  Till now we have read how Ace runs from difficult situations.  She grew up depending on two men, her father and Max.  When death and fear took those two from her she did what came natural, she loaded her car with her belongings and headed out of the state.  With Max we came to understand him more in book two.  Being raised without his father, then reconnecting to only find out the man he really wasn’t, left Max needing Ace even more.  When she was gone he clung to the next available substitute and his life kept spiraling downward.In Finding me, it starts with Ace, now being called by her given name Harper, creating a new life for herself on the East coast.  She called in a few favors and found an assistant job in a lab and exposing her to people who pry as to why she is so closed off and away from home.  Fritz and Kitty will become vital to her discovering herself again and when she needs to go back home for her sister’s wedding, she will have to come face to face with Max again.As the story unfolds, there are a few things that the author did that gave me chills and made the story come to life for me.  In keeping with the title, Harper discovered her identity isn’t reliant on anyone but herself.  She is more than capable at being happy and we got to see that while she was on the East coast but even with happiness she wasn’t complete till she solved what she was running from.  I also loved that her father, even though he was gone, played a huge part in this book and in her recovery.  He truly showed the love of a father with the way the author wrote the story.  I loved how Max was finally able to be honest and real with Ace.  He had so many walls up regarding her because of her tendency to run but when he could finally be honest with her, you could see the confidence and courage evolve in his character.I am totally obsessed with these characters and story.  The way Mariah wrote each book was unique and insightful.  She allowed us to feel what the character was feeling and put us in each person’s point of view so we could develop our own opinions about the story.  She took some risks with this one, it isn’t the typical love story that readers have become accustom to, she added the raw elements of life, loss, anger, fear and defensiveness.  She showed we never know when a stranger will become a friend, when a first love will be the only love and how love and protectiveness can reach far beyond the grave.  I strongly suggest you read this three book series and read them in order so you can relish in the plot as I have.  This will be a story I won’t soon forget.

I am so grateful to say I was wrong to assume that this book was going to be ordinary.  She took a plot that carried interest and intrigue on its own and utilized every aspect creating a spectacular story that will remain with me for a long time.Sara Hubbard is by far the best author I have found at switching POV’s.  They transitioned so smoothly that I was able to just continue reading without having to shift mind sets to grasp each character.  Evie and Declan each had their own take on an event and different outlooks on life so to make this a smooth read using dual POV, is impressive.  She took black and white and made the perfect shade of gray with these two people.There is something about this book and her style that I can’t put my finger on, but I loved it.  It captured my attention right away, drew me into the story and allowed me to feel every scene as if I were there.  The facts became very clear as to why Evie and Declan would never make it as a couple, yet while the line was drawn, it was also blurred just enough that I never entertained a thought that they shouldn’t be together.  I guess I was Mona in real life because the Mona in the book saw what I did; they needed to make this work.Evie was the type of woman who believed you could react to others in kindness, no matter how damaged you are in real life.  Why feed the dragon you are trying to eliminate in the world.  I can’t say she really forgave and forgot, but she certainly didn’t let her past keep her down.  She grew each day and asked questions and always found the positive in people and situations.  She was nave, but not because she wasn’t street smart, it was because she refused to let the world taint her view of life.  Evie is holding a secret, like no other secret that I have seen written into a plot and that single event framed who she is today.Declan, who suffered as greatly as Evie did growing up, adopted the killed or be killed mentality.  He has sold his soul to Jimmy and will do his underground fighting and become his hitman.  He had nothing to lose and everything to gain by working for Jimmy, he also gained Mona as a mother figure and because of the pub, and he will soon have Evie.  Declan is a monster, he is an evil killer who shows no emotions, but Evie can see through that and into his heart.  She doesn’t want him to change his past; she wants him to be the man he was supposed to be and love her while allowing her to love him.I absolutely love this story and the way the author created magic while finding a common ground for the angel and the killer is brilliant. It is a raw, intense and drama packed book that brings the read front and center into the story.  Absolutely one of my favorite books so far in 2015

There are a few elements to this story that really touched my heart. The Swedish aspect since my husband is Swedish and was familiar with the traditions and foods involved and I could see a lot of him in Erick. The other element is I am a mother to a college aged young man and two teenage daughters. This topic needed to be addressed and the author did it in a very graceful and respectable way without risking the emotional impact for the reader.Without spoiling the story for you, I will point out a few things that really touched my heart in this book. Erick and Daisy was the perfect couple. New to college, love and life on their own, they were the perfect balance to each other. Preforming of the arts are center stage in their lives and one day, what should have been a normal routine, turned into a life altering day that will shatter everyone involved. My favorite line of the whole book was “He wasn’t a hero. He was in love.” And that is how this story begins, Erick and Daisy finding their love before their innocence was taken and replaced with tragedy.Friendships will be tested and futures at risk. How do you overcome that exact moment when everything went into slow motion, the noise is deafening and will be repeated in your nightmares for years to come? When the smell of blood will infuse in your senses and you will smell that for the rest of your life. Images will forever be the background in your mind and this nightmare will continue across the country and played out on the news over and over for you to remember. Crutches will be used, lives destroyed all because of one man. Erick will prove that you can come out of a traumatic event still breathing, but that doesn’t mean you survived it.The author takes us along with him as he goes through years of his life struggling to overcome the memories. I had moments of feeling like this was being extended to long, but then I realized maybe I was just wanting him to “fix this” as soon as possible because the author’s style was so intense. I was an emotional mess while watching him waste his life away.There is so much more I would love to say about this book, but you really need feel it for yourself. You will read about struggles, forgiveness, acceptance and letting go. This is a powerful story that needed to be told and I think this author was brilliant in the approach she used to tell it.

I was given an ARC by the author in exchange for an honest review.  I have been a fan of Mardi Maxwell for a while, but I always strayed away from the sci-fi genre because I couldn’t see myself enjoying it but because I have great faith and love for Mardi’s writing style I accepted the challenge and I am so thankful I did. For readers who are on the fence about sci-fi, this author gives you a complete run down in the beginning of the book regarding the terms and time frames used. You have a brief history of the situation and then as your progress into the story, you will be so captivated by the plot and characters, the fear of sci-fi rapidly disappears.Valan could be considered a real demon, but as you begin to understand you and the situation he was in, I think readers will embrace him as I did.  He lost a great deal due to a group of barbarians and he wants revenge.  When he learns that the only way he will be able to stay alive is to mate with a woman from that group, he was willing to die instead.  His father still remained determined to live after the heartbreak and pave the way for his son to mate and live as well.  If Valan refuses, he will not only die, he will lose his warrior status.  As demanded he and his other members invaded this enemy territory and kidnapped the women who were destined to be the new mates for the Zarronians.  His mate was a beautiful young woman named Lia.Being woken up in the middle of the night and realizing she have been ripped from her home and taken to the enemy camp should have terrified her, but instead Valan saved her life.  As Lia’s tribe’s tradition was, the sire can have as many women as he cares to have and the females are not treated with respect.  Lia’s sire had sold her to the worst man in the community, one who enjoys punishing his girls in public and not caring if they die or not.  Lia was going to be Gorm’s as soon as the cycle permitted so when she found herself mated to Valan, she was given a new chance at life.  Unfortunately Valan wasn’t very nice in the beginning, he saw her as a part of the reason he lost everything.The best part of the story is when Lia tells Valan about her life before he took her and shows us how Valan’s heart begins to struggle between need to protect her and the urge to get his revenge. There are some steamy scenes that will have you grabbing some ice water and fanning yourself off.  Along with that, we see Lia as she accepts her new life and role as his mate.  The question is, will Valan finally release his need for revenge and allow his life to become full of happiness and love before Lia’s past life will come back and take her back to what she was desperate to escape.  I really enjoyed this book and can hardly wait to read book 2.  I am so thankful I took a chance at sci-fi because Mardi Maxwell could make me a fan with stories like this one.

I received a copy of this book to review for Stephanie's Book Reports.You will find an intense introduction to this series in a matter of sixty some pages.  It took me no time at all to absorb this piece of the story and when I was done I desired to know more about what was going on with this man.Thane has created his own religion, a set of beliefs that leads him to save women and find the one that the Gods has approved of to give him a son.  He really believes that everything he does is for her sake, her benefit and will greatly improve her life and he ask the readers to believe in him and his methods.Already in his compound he has a few women who live to serve him and a young man called simply Boy. When he spots Betty, a prostitute who was running from her own family issues, he takes her as his special one and calls her Freya.Book one, as I said, goes very quickly and basically gives you an idea of the compound, his plans and her initiation into the new group she will be forced to call family.  I have a feeling this is going to be a very dark and twisted series and I am not even able to predict where the author is going with this one.  What I can predict is I am going to be sitting on pins and needles till I get the next one.The ONLY reason I gave this a 4 star rating is because of the length and the fact I feel we only got a chapter of the story.  Because of this, I read scenes that felt rushed and information that I would have loved to of had missing because of how fast this book unfolded. This would have been a perfect first book in a series had she given us more as an introduction and expanded more of the scenes to this plot.

I have yet to open a book by T.K. Leigh and not feel like I just gave her my heart and soul to do as she pleases.  This author can bring a reader to tears and tug at the heart strings more than any other author I have read.  Chasing the Dragon is no different.Mackenzie, also known as Serafina Galloway, will steal your emotions as you read how she had to leave everything at a young age and go into hiding.  As she reemerged back into society things became complicated and dangerous.  She built those walls in order to protect herself when events left her totally alone in life.  Now with the chance to make her dreams come true, Tyler Burnham will walk into her world and rip things apart.Tyler has his own agenda and loving Mackenzie isn’t on the list.  He needs information that only she can give him, or at least that is what he believes.  Someone is after her to gain information as well, but if they succeed first, it could be deadly.  The plan?  Go in and get to her before the other enemy does. Make her trust him and possibly steal her heart but that won’t be easy because Mackenzie tailors her life by a calendar.  Every minute of her day is scheduled and spending time with a man or falling in love is NOT on that calendar.Of course love has a way of wiping out schedules and breaking down walls.  It also has a way of changing the agenda and forcing a person to make a choice between love and job.  This isn’t your typical romance story though.  The author will leave you breathless with suspense and danger.  The lies will be flowing between the pages forcing you to sort it out and come to your own conclusions as to why she had to leave her home as a child and who can she trust now.  At one point I couldn’t  figure out who I trusted anymore and that broke my heart because I had grown to love Tyler and Mackenzie along with some of the side characters, I didn’t want anyone to be an evil person.  You see the book ends leaving  you feeling as empty and broken as the characters and wanting to beg the author for more immediately.There is not a single book that this author has written that I wouldn’t highly recommend, but this one has a new intensity to it that I am in love with.  She can make you feel just as strongly as the characters do.  Her scene development is so strong, at times you feel you can reach out and touch Mackenzie and Tyler.  She doesn’t just entertain you; she takes you on an epic journey that will leave you wanting more.

I was intrigued by this psychological thriller and can hardly wait to see what is coming next for Greg Dorn.  I think part of my attraction to this story was I can relate to the location that this story takes place.  Parsons Kansas, the small town feel gave what happen to him when he was a teenager more impact as I could feel his loss.  With the town circling him and his father during this loss, it was a natural prediction he would want to give something back to them.Greg’s mother and sister were killed in an accident when a mental patient stole a car and slammed into them.  The devastation and pain were overwhelming for him and he lost his way in life for a while.  It was one day when he saw an officer stop a car for violation he found his passion.  He wanted to be a cop.  He wanted to prevent another teenager from experiencing the same loss that crushed his world.Moving up the ranks, he found he wanted to take his wife and daughter to a bigger city so he could do more to bring order to the streets.  Moving to Denver was going to be a transition on its own, but to see the road rage and aggressive driving was more of a shock.  Slowly his perception began to change, he wasn’t sure what this voice was that continued to tell him how to handle situation.The author leaves us wondering if we are witnessing anger taking a personality of its own in this plot, because Greg has a lot to be angry about as more loss and dealing with people’s rage at cops happens in his life and career, or are we seeing depression come to life?  Could this be a different psychological issue being born right before our eyes?  Slowly he loses himself, what his goals were and dreams.  His wife decides that this isn’t the life she signed up for with him and his world starts crumbling beneath him.  Could he be the cause of what he was trying to prevent in the final pages of the book.The ending isn’t flashing red lights and warnings leaving you hanging on the edge of your seat but it should leave you wanting a lot more regarding what is going on with him.  I really loved this story, the unknown, the questions and watching the path of this man go from happy to torn apart was done with such subtle detail it was impossible for me to identify when he took the next step into insanity.  I did have one problem with the writing style, I felt like repeat phrases, words and meanings were happening to close together and too often but that didn’t take away from the plot that I was following.  It is a quick read that will absorb your attention.  I look forward to see what is coming next in this series.

Well Ms. Blalock has made a believer out of me with her talent to take thereader on an epic emotional rollercoaster.  No matter how many times I wasbegging to “make the insanity stop”, no one could have pried my kindle outof my hands.  Once I started book two with that dream of all dreams,reality had no chance at interfering with this book.So much happens in My Demons and it makes writing this review verydifficult.  As a reader I want to just tell you all to pull up a chair andlet’s have a multiple hour talk about what Abby and Evan go through, but asa reviewer I am bound by my rule of not giving spoilers.  Oh the strugglesan awesome book brings.Abby and Evan were left in book one with her memory of him erased.  Shecould “feel” her emotions for him but every step he made in getting her tolove him over the last year was gone.  Trusting that her heart would leadAbby back to him, Evan goes on a mission of keeping her safe from thedangerous characters that mean to cause her harm.  He also has to find away to protect her from the demons of his own past that still lurk in thenight.You are going to see just how deranged his father Thomas is, herex-boyfriend Marco is a huge jerk. He had to have put on a great act forAbby to fall for him because he is seriously unlovable, but you willfinally learn more about him and Evan’s ex will put a dramatic spin on thisstory.  Through all of that Evan still works at regaining Abby’s love andtrust, helping her find new heights not only life but in the bedroom.  Wefinally get to see moments of pure happiness for Abby.  She will alwaysmiss her sister but her relationship with her parents is getting better,she is finding love and throughout all of the ups and downs, she is seeingEvan for who he really is.You were sighing and sinking into the lake of romance weren’t you?  Wellwake up and put the seat belts on because the ending of this book will haveyou screaming, crying and reaching for tissues and vodka.  OMG how could anauthor do this to her readers?  If I wasn’t invested in Evan and Abbybefore I sure am now.  Kimberly how could you do this to us?  You hadbetter be hitting publish on book three SOON. Get your copies of thistrilogy people, I have a good feeling that we will be seeing Ms. Blalock’sname on the best sellers lists very soon with this kind of talent.

Secrets, love, suspense, heart break and much more is waiting for youbetween the pages of His Angel.  The author will take you on a ride thatwill leave your head spinning by the end of the book.  It is a cliffhangerand WOW what a cliffhanger it is.I found the first half to be a bit slow with getting Abby and Evantogether, but by midway through the book, the slow pace had been forgottenbecause once the author flipped the switch, the action began and thesecrets started to spill.Abby had a twin sister who died when they were in a car accident duringtheir teen years.  Abby has tried to move on in life. She went to collegeto fulfill her sister’s dream of medicine but her heart was really injournalism.  She met a man, had a two year relationship with him and thenhe suddenly disappeared from her life.  Protecting her heart and strugglingto find a reason to look forward to the next day, she agreed to go out withher best friend who just returned from college.  This is where she willmeet the sex God named Evan.Now I can’t go into much detail because I won’t spoil this book for you,but Evan has known Abby for a long time and he has wanted to be her mansince he saw her.  The secrets you will learn, are what kept him from her,but now the road is clear and he can move in to not only love her butprotect her from the danger she will soon face.The ending of the book was unpredictable for me.  After all Abby hasstrived for in the last year, the love she was beginning to find with Evan,it is all wiped out in a few minutes.  We see the angel Abby become more intouch with the demon that has begun to grow in her fueled by the truth shejust learned, revenge, anger and years of pain due to the loss of hersister.Grab your copy now and buckle up for the second book My Demons.

The truth is about to surface for Frankie. When we last left them, Frankie had seen Hayden leave Derek’s home and she instantly jumped to the conclusion that Hayden had found her way in bed with yet another man Frankie was involved with.After going MIA for a while Derek finally found Frankie and was able to learn the truth. With his sexy ways it didn’t take long for him to correct this misunderstanding and leave Frankie very satisfied. While she can’t seem to get rid of Reed, at least now Derek knows more about what happened between them and isn’t too thrilled to know his sister was involved.Marni gave us plenty of steamy passion in this episode and Derek was allowed to go where no other man has gone on Frankie, but this part of the story was pretty much more focused on sex and Frankie figuring out how she felt about the change of plans. Could they really have a relationship along with a business contract?By the end of the book things were getting good. Derek and Hayden might just have what they need to take Randy down, which Derek wants even more now after a visit that caused him more angst than he needed. Hayden confides to Derek about what really happen that night Frankie’s world fell apart and strange text messages alarm Derek enough it might force him to do the unthinkable.This is a very quick read due to the writing style being so smooth and the interest the author creates for the reader. If you haven’t already started this series jump on board now. I think episode four will blow us away with the intensity that has started to build in book 3.

I have been waiting for this book since the second I finished Fear Me.  I am all about dark and twisted stories but when an author can add the element of dysfunction in her characters to the point I love them even though I want to hate them, this just makes my experience with the series even better.  I was so emotional after reading Fear You, I had to take a couple of days to gather my thoughts and figure out what I could say about this book that would carry my true feelings.There is no way I can give you a synopsis like review for this book, it would risk spoiling the story for you.  Fear You did pick right up from the end of book one, so make sure you read them in order.  Lake has finally found her courage after being bullied and intimidated for so many years.  Full of questions as to what Keiran has really done and being pushed one final time, she did what she felt was right at the time.  Unfortunately for her, her actions didn’t send him away, it made him more determined to take her over body and soul.  No matter how much she thought she knew him, she was in for a shock as to who this man really is.We found out a lot about Kieran’s past, who he really is behind the mask of evil he wears.  It broke my heart and made loving him much easier for me.  The secrets behind his family members and the reason he can kill so easily was very difficult for me to read.  With each layer that she peeled back, I felt my own emotions become rawer.  I went from not wanting to like him to wanting to save him from the past that tormented him in his sleep and drove him while he was awake.  We also got to see how he really felt about Lake as he was crushing her spirit.This was an intense series to read.  The author reached in and tore my heart out, angered me to the point I wanted to scream and then put me in a situation that I couldn’t talk myself out of caring for these two people.  The secondary characters played just as big of a part in the story as the main ones did.  The balance of events and the style of writing were so smooth and perfect; once you start this series it is difficult to put it down even for a minute.One thing I loved most about this story is that we watched Lake in her transformation and we weren’t even aware that what was happening to her was in a way what had happen to Keiran.  The evil deeds of others, the horrible agendas that were placed on these two created the monster Keiran acted like and the ballsy woman Lake turned into.  The only difference that kept her from going as far into the dark as he did was she had known love in her life.  She had a family structure at one time and an aunt who loved her and nurtured her dreams.  Lake always had hope, Keiran never experienced hope till he met Lake.I am not sure there are strong enough words to express how much I recommend this series to any reader who loves the dark side of life.  I don’t think there is a single emotion B.B. Reid left untouched by the time I turned the final page.

Oh those McKade brothers are at it again and I really love it.  Claiming Lainey is one of my favorites in this series because it touches on the realistic concerns of a ménage relationship and how love can overcome fear.  The author starts the book with Spence, Lainey and Tim being teenagers and we see how Tim’s father was so abusive to Tim.  Lainey and Spence come and save him and it was then that Tim became a McKade by love, not blood or legally.After almost twenty years of being best friends the guys decide it is time to let Lainey know they want her as their mate, but she is terrified this will mean she will have to pick one of them and hurt the other, which she refuses to do.  We watch Lainey as she goes through the process of accepting that she can have it all with both men and with each step of acceptance the author brings another reality to light.Will Spence be fine if she is with Tim alone, will Tim accept if she compliments Spence and not him?  What if they have children, will the man who isn’t the father feel left out.  This wasn’t as easy as the men presented to her, sure they had two years to figure this out and be prepared for society to bash them, but she has had only a few hours.  There is also a new surprise about the signs the Great Spirit leaves mates which warmed my heart and made this story even more precious.In every book of this series the author brings powerful messages of broken people finding the love that has been in front of them since childhood and providing a level of suspense and love that makes the book impossible to put down.  Once again she has a high level of passion this this book that will leave you sitting in front of the fan as our beautiful threesome try to figure out how this will work for all of them.We also get to see more of Rafe and Becca and their struggle with the distance between them and Jake and Claire will have a part of the story.  The Great Spirit knows who should be mates, but the humans are being a bit stubborn and making this more difficult than it needs to be.I have said it before and I will keep repeating it, I love those McKade brothers and the whole family.  Lynnette really proves that family isn’t always created by blood and law, this family is made up with love and loyalty.  Grab this series and fall in love with this family just as I have.

The concept of this plot was intense and the author sure knows how to display dysfunction at its best.  The author took a woman who was abused and battered as a child and grew into an educated counselor/lawyer who still found herself in abusive relationships. From her current relationship with Liam, which led her to Ronan and a host of other men who had no problem using her, she found some connection with Ronan that she couldn’t turn her back on.  He reminded her of a disturbing story from her past, a person she couldn’t save.Ronan knew from the first few minutes after she entered prison to talk to him as his lawyer, that he could manipulate her and use her for his own agenda. She was hiding secrets from him and that wasn’t good.  Once he realized he could get her to open up to him, she because the perfect tool in his agenda.  He didn’t believe the world “no” was even found in her vocabulary since he knew Liam and the kind of man he was.As the story goes you will encounter crooked law enforcement and city officials, drug deals and runs that will lead to suspense and drama, abuse, betrayal within the group and something that might be considered as a very dysfunctional sort of love.  There are some pretty great criminal scenes here that had me glued to the pages and mystery that left me trying to predict the ending.The author did a great job at displaying one of the most maladjusted relationships that I have read.  So many times I wanted to smack Brooke upside the head and beg her to wake up and get away from these evil men, but she wasn’t going to break her loyalty that I felt was more out of guilt than a moral issue.It is very difficult to give you more than what the synopsis offers because the whole story is full of action packed drama and sex.  It is hard to write a review on White Rabbit without giving spoilers away.  I will say that there are a few issues that I struggled with, such as important events being talked about yet we never had the full story as to what happened.  I also found some consistency issues as things jumped around with no clear path as to the journey of this story or whose POV we were reading.  I am not a huge fan of the Daddy talk, such as she liked being Daddy’s little girl with Ronan but that is my opinion and doesn’t reflect in my rating of the book.I do believe the book could use some work as far as making it read smoother and filling in the gaps, but I based my review on the plot and talent of the author to take crazy and make it into a work of art.  If you love dark, then you will want to give this one a try.  Just be prepared as rape, talk of incest and brutal treatment of people are clearly in this book and since she is a pro in making the words scream to your soul, it does get rather intense while reading.

I finished Without Mercy and honestly, I had to sit for a while to sort out the many emotions that this story brought me.  Words literally have escaped me when I think about how to write this review.  I find it astonishing that this was coauthored because I could never, in a million years, be able to pinpoint who wrote what scene or chapter.  Victoria L. James and L.J. Stock have such similar writing styles yet they each bring something that could only be described as magical to this story.Not only is the writing style impressive, they have a talent of drawing out a huge range of emotions from their readers.  I rarely am brought to tears while reading, it happens but not very often.  In Without Mercy, the authors had me falling apart for different reasons on three occasions.  I was so wrecked during those times I had to put the kindle down and walk away so I could gather myself.  I won’t say what those scenes were, or give any hint as to what occurred because you must experience this book on your own but I found I had gained some valuable lessons from Drew, Ayda and yes even Tate’s journey.Ayda was still adjusting to her new life at the hut with the MC gang.  They had accepted her into the fold, well the whores who were hanging around didn’t like her but the men respected her not only as Drew’s woman but as Ayda herself.  Kenny had taken Tate under his wing and the feeling of being an inexperienced single mom to her younger brother was less of a burden than it had been before.  With not having to worry about paying the bills and keep a roof over their heads, she was now free to keep the hut going, laundry clean and food in the men’s belly’s while she found new ways to try and draw Drew out of his shell.  With all of that going the number one thing she had left to figure out was, is living her dream with Drew really fair to Tate?  Her younger brother was getting sucked farther and farther into the MC mentality and forgetting his dreams of college and high school football.  She had sacrificed so much of her life after her parents died to provide and raise Tate, she isn’t sure if she can sacrifice Drew and the gang in order to keep Tate on the right path.Drew was still leading the charge for revenge of those who were responsible for Pete’s death.  He knew he had done things that would make a normal person sick and haunted with nightmares forever, but to him this was life, his life.  With new threats emerging in town, a dysfunctional relationship with the head of police that could prohibit him from protecting what needs to be protected, he is also faced with the balance of how much does he let Ayda in on club business.  If he isn’t careful he is going to wake up alone one morning and realize his need to protect her is actually what pushed her out the door.It was a stunning turn of events that made all of the pieces fall in place for Drew and Ayda, leading them to find that lost link that had been there all the time, yet hidden due to their own stubbornness. I won’t give any hints, but trust me when I say, those few chapters left me in excruciating heartbreak as I watched them and had no clue how this would end.  You read romance books and they use the word love, but these two authors showed you what love is all about.  That realistic kind of love that comes from so deep in your heart you don’t even recognize yourself any more.  They also showed us about trust and the fine balance that it takes to maintain it.  Acceptance was another message that I gained from this book.  Love and loss is a promise in life, acceptance of that is something you must work to obtain.  They both had to have their own form of acceptance to the new world they have created and how they acquired that was beyond anything I could have imagined.  In conclusion, I think the most heartbreaking part for me was the last page, as their story had come to an end in this chapter of life.  Knowing they will move on and we possibly won’t be there to watch, yes this is a pathetic plea to the authors to not bring this series to an end, was like saying goodbye to a loved one and knowing you might not see them again.  I not only fell in love with Drew and Ayda and the rest of the gang, they became part of my heart that I will carry for a very long time.

If Unworthy Heart is any indication to what we can expect in The Donnellys Series, then we should be in for a lot of enjoyment.  Ryan and Maiya would never be two people anyone would expect to hook up because of the major differences.  With her red hair, tattoos and hang ups from her childhood, there would be no way she would be a good fit for the sexy, clean cut,professional business man Ryan who is a single parent .  But Maiya is a pure example of a phoenix rising from the ashes and making something out of her life.Coming from a childhood full of absent parents, an event that filled her heart with so much guilt that it almost disabled her from moving on.  She was told for many years that she was unworthy of anything good, especially love.  Even with all the odds, she made her way through college and landed a great job in the business world.  She has her own car, apartment and clothing.  The life her mother provided for her when she was a child had no place in the world she created for herself.Ryan was dealing with his brothers and trying to raise his child as he worked with Maiya at the office.  Past relationships have left him broken and let down, but he isn’t willing to give up on love yet.  Something about Maiya intrigued him, made his body ache for her and confused his mind.  How could he introduce this tattooed beauty to his son and family, but how could he resist his heart yearning for her either.  They came together with humorous banter; quick comebacks and sex scenes that will make you blush.  Still even with all the confidence and love Ryan gives her, Maiya can’t believe he would want to stay with her long time, invite her to be the mother to his little one.  Soon this is going to end and she is going to have to brace herself for that moment. It always ends when the guy gets what he wants from her.I read Dorothy’s first book and fell in love with her style and flair that is in every book so far.  She doesn’t embellish her plots to make them sell, she uses the raw, gritty and dark reality of what really happens in life and makes her readers believe in miracles and love once again.  I adore Ryan, his patience for Maiya and constant acceptance and reassurance that he offered her were wonderful, yet he was still human with the quick triggers and pet peeves that would drive him crazy.  Maiya while confident in her job was so insecure in that private world she hides behind her walls.  The moment she let Ryan in and exposes the cause of her guilt was done with such taste and grace from the author it made me feel I was sitting along with them as they talked.  Grab your copy of Unworthy Heart now and be ready to see what happens to the next Donnelly in book two.  You won’t want to miss out on this remarkable family.

I remember when the author asked me what I thought of this new idea she had.  What would I do if I had been bullied and humiliated in school, to the point I didn’t even want to go on.  If my home life wasn’t what you would call normal and I lived with the depression of loss at home, would I tell the bullies in hopes they would back off?  The biggest question, what if I met one of my bullies after I had become an adult and had a great career…….would I tell them what I thought, would I run away, would I be mature and explain the pain they caused me…….would I fall in love?That is what Sadie is going to have to decide when the years of losing weight, changing her appearance and working her butt off to succeed in her career all comes to a halting stop the moment Matt walks into the conference room for a meeting.  He thinks he recognizes her even after she denies it is her. She tries to convince herself she is nothing like that little girl either on the inside or out, but that little girl constantly reminds her that some things don’t change.Matt was involved in the bullying,  he wasn’t the leader of the abusez, but he knew how it was hurting Sadie.  Now he wants a chance to make it up to her.  Maybe he can help her heal the old hurts, but as he listens to her he realizes she has never had a boyfriend, been kiss, held hands.  All of the things a beautiful woman should have experienced by her age, she hadn’t, all because of the bullying and feelings that she can’t recover from.Will she let Matt be her first in all areas and will he end up saying to be her forever?  I love the message in this story of recovery and forgiveness.  As we know in life you can forgive a person but rebuilding trust is something that rarely happens.  Get your copy now and watch Sadie as she makes the difficult choices regarding self-image, confidence and where Matt will fit in her life.

I was honored to be able to beta read this book.  I had fallen in love with Nikki Grooms first two books and her style of writing but she has really grown into an even more brilliant author with the unique story of Finn and Megan.This story isn’t rushed, yet it flows consistently and packed with action and events that will keep you invested and turning those pages.  Megan and Finn both are coming from heart break and disaster, so when they  see each other across a crowded club they know that there is something there, love, passion, hope or escape, it didn’t matter it was better than what they had.  Of course hope doesn’t instantly surface, it is just that, a hope, maybe a dream of escape, either way, they find themselves in an alley giving into a few moments of lust that will open up a ton of wounds that will need to heal.Finn will face a level of loss that could crumble him, if not for the need to care for his mother who is dying, I am not sure Finn would have found a reason to go on.  He had some good friends who cared and helped him but how his sister died will never release his soul from the guilt and pain he feels. Someone is to blame and his anger needs to be released but Megan might not be able to handle his rage.Megan is trying to get away from a drug dealing abusive boyfriend.  She just wants to be free of his behavior and business but she has nowhere to go.  She left her family for him years back and now she isn’t so sure they will take her back. Sure she sees something in Finn that keeps drawing her to him but when he lashes out she is firm that this won’t be accepted in her life again.  How many chances can she take in life before it just becomes to difficult to stand back up?On the occasions Finn and Megan give into the lust and attractions, new bonds are created between them yet neither know if being together is even possible.  One gives the other a chance to love and in their lives, the other is terrified of life and losing another person.  Revenge fuels their soul.  It will take something big or an event to bond them together.  I am not giving hints; you will have to read to find out.I loved how the author wrote this.  It truly came across to the reader as two lost hearts, roaming the streets, passing each other once in a while…….trying to find their meaning in life.  It takes not a chance encounter but a huge shove from fate to make them finally stop and talk.  Watching the characters, slowly emerge from their sheltered cocoon to bloom into mature adults who take risks for love, was a beautiful journey that the author took us on.  Suspense, crime, loss and pain all surrounded by fate, love and value of the human spirit is what you will be exposed to in this beautiful book.  Grab yours now.

I am not a big fan of paranormal or shifter stories but this author asked me to beta read for her and I agreed.  I know how hard she worked on this book to make it unique; she didn’t want to put out a run of the mill story about shifters that is predictable. She wanted a new element to such stories, she wanted to expose the element of empathy and the power it has to build and destroy a person.  Since I was not a huge fan of the genre she challenged herself to write and rewrite this story till I was able to say, I am hooked, give me more.Acer Randall let his family in order to find a way to deal with the “curse” that was handed down through the generations of his family.  He has empathy to the point it cripples him at time, carrying the heavy loads of others emotions as his own has forced him to put the walls up and go forth in the job of enforcer against the powerful warlocks.  He is a fierce defender, one that most are afraid of but he had to keep a constant control of his anger and conduct himself in the role he was assigned.His heart has signaled that Haven is the woman to fulfill his desires but she isn’t as on board with his plan.  While beautiful she is also in a position in life that mixing with Acer could prove disastrous. She does rescue him from a dangerous situation but that was with the promise she would put him to death by her own hands………the question is when the time comes is she able to keep that promise.Make sure you grab your copy of this book now and be prepared for the next installment of Haven and Acer.  I would really recommend this series to others like myself that are just not sure if shifter books are something they could enjoy.  I know the author put a lot of effort into giving those of us a chance to find a shifter that is unique, investing and would give us exposure to a genre that is difficult to write and often ignored.

I fell in love with the McKade family in book one.  There we met all of the brothers and discovered that Deuce McKade was the oldest brother, intent on fathering all of his brothers and taking care of those who couldn’t protect themselves.  This was the situation with 8 year old Grace; she was trying to take care of her little sister Melanie while her abusive parents did their own thing.  Grace fell in love with Deuce way back then and was happy to just be a friend of his in adulthood.  It helped that her little sister married Luke McKade, Deuce’s brother.Now Melanie is about to deliver her second child and knows that there will be issues with the birth.  The girls have a special gift, Melanie can see into the future and Grace has the power to calm children and animals.  Grace’s gift comes with a curse though, most humans that she touches not only causes her pain but she also sends pain to those who she is not meant to touch.
