As Deuce and Grace get his ranch house set up for Robby, their nephew and the new baby so Melanie and Luke can focus on her recovery, Deuce decides this is the time to prove to Grace that she is his mate.The McKade family history includes the Great Spirit placing a symbol on the back of the necks for the two who were supposed to be mated.  Deuce knows once he has proven to Grace they were meant to be the symbol will appear and they can focus on having babies and creating a family.  Grace wants Deuce, her doubts about a family comes from the pain she experienced with her gift.  Will she give birth to children who will be isolated and tormented like she was?  She can see her nephew has her sister’s gift, it has to be the same for her, that gift/curse will be passed on to her children.I love how the author has created this family for us to fall in love with.  In this book we get to experience some of the background stories about the other brothers as well.  It wasn’t enough to let us know the whole story but it sure increased my interest in getting on with the rest of this series.  The ladies in their life are not only friends but they fit with the McKade brothers like a glove to a hand.Grab your copy of Touching Deuce and watch this love story unfold into a magical relationship.  With her lust for him that is covered in fear and his alpha protectiveness that sometimes overpowers his love, this is a beautiful story to jump into.

I wasn’t aware that this was part of a series called Independence Fall when I signed up to review this book.  Wild With You can clearly be read as a standalone, but since I fell in love with the characters and the fact that I love series that are set up such as this, where each character has their own book, I will be looking for the rest of this series soon.Brody could easily be the man of my dreams.  He is sexy, handsome and protective.  He has taken on the role of being caregiver for his siblings but his dedication to others goes much farther.  He is also part of a search and rescue team that saves people who have gotten lost or hurt in the wilderness.  With his brother Josh who is suffering from a brain injury and has lost his short term memory, Brody searches for treatment options that will help Josh regain a normal way to function.  Brody will be picking up the doctor who has accepted Josh as a patient for a trial therapy, little did Brody know this was going to be one pick up he would never forget.Dr. Kat Arnold had been raised in Independence Fall as a foster child.  She was ignored as if she had a disease, her possessions would fit in a bag and wasn’t worth the price of a fast food meal and she was lonely.  Her one bright spot of the day was seeing Brody.  He always showed her kindness and compassion, even when it came to fixing her “lucky” pair of shoes with glue.  Coming back to her past wasn’t something she had planned, but here she is with a handbag that cost more than her could have even dreamed existed as a child.  She is replacing the doctor that was supposed come as a favor and the first person she sees once she arrives is Brody, the longtime crush that made everything better. The author created some very hot and steamy scenes that will leave you panting and begging for more, but she also shows you what love really looks like.  Brody is going to have to make a choice of his brother’s future or his heart’s desire for Kat.  Having the woman you love treat your brother’s brain injury as his doctor could get messy.  Kat will be faced with the realization of all the confidence she has gained from her PhD and career as a doctor may not survive going back home to the people who felt you were nothing your whole life. The insecurities that stayed with her through childhood will make a raging comeback if she isn’t careful.  She will also be torn between her oath as a doctor and her passion for Brody.This was a very well written book that read smoothly and quickly.  I found when I had finished the time had just slipped away because I was so drawn into the story.  I will certainly be getting the rest of this series and putting Sara Jane Stone on my list of authors to watch for.

I was reminded once again to never judge a book by the cover alone with this book.  As you see the cover is beautiful, gives the impression of a love story that will sweep you off your feet, but that really isn’t my style. I need angst, drama, really issues that will leave me on the edge of my seat.  What the cover is hiding is one of the most realistic stories that takes you from your comfy chair and places you in a southern town where Southern justice and evil thinking runs the town Monday throughSaturday and they all come together under one church roof on Sunday to worship the Baptist way.  Heads are turned, giggles are heard, sins are abundant and survival of this small town will be the hardest thing you have ever done in your life.No this isn’t a religious book, this is a story of two people who followed the traditions, suffered the blows life had dealt them and found a way to make it through the country muck.  Drew Dunne had a football career lined up when he entered college.  He had suffered loss, heartache and lived with guilt that nearly suffocated him.  Results of bad choices were going to haunt him for years to come, then that one injury, the injury that every athlete prays will never happen, occurs and Drew loses the last piece of sanity he had in life.  Now married to a woman who hates him, blames him for her unhappiness and a father in law that dictates what is going to happen in his baby girl’s life, Drew wonders if ending it all wouldn’t be a better solution than trying to survive it.Allison Bennett found herself married to an evil man who treated her horribly.  When she hears they are moving back to a small Georgia town, she loses everything, even down to the furniture and items that belonged to her Grandmother and family.  Dealing with daily put downs, physical abuse and the demands from her husband, she sees that she needs to be silent because her husband is the new star for the football team in town.  She learned quickly, no one listens to anything negative about the jocks in small town USA.When Drew and Allison see each other in church, they look past the sexy exterior and see the pain and emptiness in each other’s eyes.  With the town against them, spouses who would rather kill them than set them free, their hearts still beat for each other.  This story will take you on a twisted road as we watch them to see if they ever find their freedom and love.  The suspense was intense but what grabbed me more was the realistic dramatic feel to this journey.  I was all over the map with feelings.  I was angry at the injustice that was approved of and supported.  The self-righteous attitude from the town “Christians” was revolting and the lies and secrets that were defended made me want to throw my kindle across the room. Then you had the innocent moments that Drew and Allison could steal with a glass of lemonade, working at a church function or sitting in a pew for Sunday service.  They could communicate without words with only the gentle smile or touch while be scrutinized by everyone around. I haven’t cheered on two people in a book as hard as I did Drew and Allison.  I wanted their happily ever after more than they did at times, but they never gave up even when life was balancing on the edge and we were left wondering if finally evil had won.  I highly recommend this book and will certainly seek more from this author.  Grab your class of sweet tea, put your feet up and be prepared to “Bless your heart” a few times because you will be transported to the country roads and justice of small town Georgia.

I have sensitive, dry skin and in my opinion rough hangs. I love discovering new, effective hand creams that will make my hands soft. As a result, I did not hesitate to try Ahava’s Dead Sea Essentials Witch Hazel hand cream. And I’m glad I did. This hand cream is wonderful. I love it as much as I do the Ahava’s Tea Tree Oil foot cream. It’s affordable (around $11), which is comparable to other hand creams I have purchased (L’occitane, Eucerin or Neutrogena) and Ahava is a brand that I have grown to trust. It is a pleasant scented creamy blend of ingredients that include witch hazel, which soothes and heals dry skin. The cream is not too thick and doesn’t feel greasy (although initially you may think so, it dries to be almost sightless). Even after washing my hands, they still felt moist. The scent is pleasant and doesn’t linger. And finally for those who are sensitive to parabens or phthalates, this hand cream doesn’t contain any. I give this hand cream, 5 stars. I will definitely buy this product in the future.

I usually spend Sunday night giving myself a mani/pedi. It is rare that I go to a nail salon. Instead I purchased an Amope Pedi Perfect Electronic Pedicure Foot File, some files and clippers, and a dozen or so fingernail polishes. I usually use (old school) Vaseline to moisturize my heels and feet but am constantly looking for a good foot cream that will leave my feet feeling soft and smooth. So when Vine offered Ahava’s Dead Sea Essential Foot Cream, I jumped all over it. I wasn’t disappointed. DSE foot cream is non-greasy, contains tea tree oil and has a pleasant scent. The cream itself is not too thick, and goes on easily. I have found that it is most effective when your feet are damp. I apply my foot cream immediately following a foot soak or shower/bath. After using this product daily, for over a week, following my shower, I do see visible improvement on my heels. They do not seem to be as dry and are definitely softer. I would definitely recommend it. 5 stars

IZZE, Organic Sparkling Water is not what I expected. I knew that it was carbonated water, but I was expecting something sweet like the old Clearly Canadians, especially since the ingredients lists sugar cane. But when they say it is a “hint” of sugar cane, they mean it literally. This water is not sweet, but offers a hint of flavor. I will be honest, this sparkling water reminds me of a more expensive La Croix. I absolutely love the packaging. It is attractive and bold. But the product itself is just ok. If you are a sparkling water person, you will probably love it. I personally preferred the Raspberry Watermelon combination over the others and it must be really cold. This assorted box of 12oz bottles comes in three different flavors: Raspberry Watermelon; Blackberry Pear and Mandarin Lime. Each bottle has 10 calories; 2 carbs, 10mg sodium and 2 grams sugar. The reason for the decrease in stars (i.e., rating) is the price. At twelve bottles for $24, it ends up costing about $2 each. This is expensive if you compare it to other brands on the market. For example, you can get 12, 12 oz cans of La Croix for $12 and not have the sugar, sodium, calories or carbs, for less than you are paying for the 12 bottles of IZZE. Don’t get me wrong, the IZZE bottle is cuter and may make more of a statement…it screams “I just spent some serious money on this water”…but in terms of taste and cost, it isn’t worth it to me. Don’t get me wrong, if I have a nice BBQ and have folks over, I probably would serve these because they are so attractive, but on a regular basis, probably not. 3 stars

How would I describe this bar?Well, I should begin this review by saying that I am not a huge fan of bars. I know, I know….bars are popular and all the craze. Some people absolutely live by them. And as a result, the market is flooded with bars. There are protein bars, energy bars, fruit bars, granola bars….bars used for meal replacements, healthy bars and even those that curb your appetite. So while not a fan, I decided to try the “Brookside Dark Chocolate Fruit and Nutty Bar” with Blueberry Acai flavor. This product is a chewy bar that has dark chocolate, nuts and fruit. If you traditionally like that combination, you will enjoy it. If you don’t well, you won’t.  Each bar is approximately 180 calories; 9g of fat; 0% cholesterol; 22g Carbs; 55mg Sodium; 4g Protein; 13g Sugar and reasonable amounts of Vitamins, Calcium and Iron. It is gluten free, has fiber, antioxidants and vitamins A, C & E.There are two things that I am not sure about: 1. The taste and 2. The cost.In terms of taste, either you are going to like it or you aren’t. If you love the taste of dark chocolate coupled with a strong blueberry/acai flavor, you will gobble it up. But to me it is a bit overwhelming and lingered on my tongue. The consistency was good. Not too chewy, but not too soft, just right. It isn’t anything that I would just grab with enthusiasm, but it could again be the flavor combination. Now, the cost. There are twelve bars in the box which are going to cost you about $26 (via Amazon), which means that each bar costs over $2. That is kind of expensive, unless you are one of those who are willing to pay top dollar for a fruit bar. But for those of us who are cost conscious, who have large families or simply have teens that snack a lot, this would be a pretty steep investment since you can get a giant box of chewy granola bars (40 +) from your local warehouse for under $12.  So with those two things in mind, I will give these 3 to 3.5 stars.

This review is based on feedback from my teenage son. The first thing that I noticed when we opened the Amazon box was how thick these pants were. I knew that they were going to be lined with flannel, but I still didn’t have a concept of just how much. These carpenter pants are attractive (khaki) but definitely made for cool/cold weather. I would even go so far as to say if you are a hunter, camper or participate in a lot of winter sports or activities, these would be perfect. Although we live in Atlanta, and traditionally have mild winters, I am sure that these will be an option once the weather cools off. In terms of style, these pants are a very rugged looking pair of pants and look nice with a number of shirt colors…..either plaid or solid. The material is comfortable and wears well. My son suggests that you wear them with boots or a high-top shoe because of the width of the legs. In his opinion they would not look good with tennis shoes. He also likes that you can wear them with the cuff or without, it is up to you. These pants wash well and if they wrinkle (they are 100% cotton), you can just iron them. Overall, these pants are a steal for under $30. And if you enjoy outside or cold water activities, they are a must have. For price and functionality, 5 stars.

This review is based on feedback from my teenage son. Simply stated, he loves them. He said that the Wrangler stretch pant is not only attractive, but comfortable. Made from a light weight material (cotton and spandex blend), these pants allow you to move freely. He said that they aren’t too tight or restrictive. He is able to sit behind his desk at school, or run around the school easily. These pants are styled like jeans but can be used as slacks, especially for those events that you want to look dressed up, but not look overly dressed. Meaning they can be casual or dressy, so you have an option. He also likes the fact that these pants fit just right in the crotch…not too long or short. He complains that some of the newer styled jeans either fit like hip huggers or hang low in the crotch. These pants wash well. He didn’t notice any shrinkage or tightness after they were washed. I simply threw them in the washer on the normal cycle and dried them as usual. So there aren’t any special care instructions. And if you take them out of the dryer immediately, they aren’t wrinkled and rarely has he had to iron them. And finally, these pants are not expensive. For under $30, you get a pretty decent pair of versatile pants. He gives them 5 stars.

For around $14, you get two fantastic mitts (which amounts to about $7 per mitt). They are attractive nautical blue and black. The fingers and thumb of the mitts are covered in a silicone/neoprene material, while the portion from the wrist up is covered with a thick blue quilted material. They appear to be durable and well made. (Of course I will update this review if something changes). They are unisex, so anyone can use them. However, I believe they fit better on a person with smaller to medium hands. My husband could put them on, but said they could be could be bigger. They are machine washable. And in terms of drying, you can simply throw them in the dryer on a light setting (so it won’t get misshapen) or air dry them. When I use these mitts to remove things from the oven, I am not able to feel the heat. My hands feel protected, which is the whole point. Finally, these mitts would definitely be a welcomed addition to most kitchens. You can even give them (with a gift card) as a bridal shower gift or as a stocking stuffer. I would definitely recommend them.

Thrive is a brand/company that cares about the health of your skin and so much more. This company is environmentally and socially conscious. They are dedicated to restoring the land and giving back to the community by supporting local farmers and workers. Thrive is natural, hypo-allergenic and cruelty free. For those consumers who have sensitive skin, this is a product that I think you should try. I have not noticed any irritation, dryness or blemishs while using it. This face wash is free of everything….free of paraben, formaldehyde, ammonium, and PABA (para-aminobenzoc acid). The two ingredients that form the basis of the scent and yield the restorative properties of Thrive are Fierrilo and Juanilama. Both can be found in Costa Rica. Fierrillo is a vine that has anti-inflammatory properties and Juanilama (in the mint family) is a potent antioxidant with healing/restorative properties. The scent is pleasant enough and would remind you of cloves (i.e., those black things that my grandmother use to put in the Christmas ham). This may be a slightly confusing description, of the scent, but I think it is accurate. Note, while it may seem a little overwhelming/loud at first, it dies down once you rinse and the scent doesn’t linger. In terms of the container, this 3.38 ounce container…is attractive (I really like the logo, a bold red feather) and fits anywhere…on the counter or in the shower.  The translucent gel is easy to use/manage….you simply squeeze a little more than a pea size amount, add water and lather. I use my fingers versus a cloth and simply rub the mixture on your face. It goes on smoothly, doesn’t leave the skin feeling oily and leaves no residue.  And if you would like to exfoliate, you may want to use a face brush or a washcloth by rubbing it in a circular motion before rinsing well.  I would definitely purchase other products on this line, and am considering purchasing the beard oil for my husband. With that being said, I would definitely recommend this product. Overall, I give it 5 stars

Musician Julia Ansdell stumbles across a beautiful piece of handwritten sheet music while traveling in Rome. On the spot, she decides that she must own the captivating music, seeing it as a challenge to master its complicated rhythm. However, once she returns to America, she realizes that the notes that haunt her compel her young daughter to act bizarrely, even violently. Julia’s only hope is to determine the origin of the music and hence the culmination of the rest of the story.Tess Gerritsen, the writer of the Rizzoli & Isles series, offers something a little different in this haunting tale. “Playing with Fire” flips back and forth between present day (Julia) and the past (to a talented musician named Lorenzo). Departing from her normal style, Gerritsen allows the reader to see the events leading to WWII, and the atrocities against the Jews through the eyes of Lorenzo.While haunting, this story moved a little slow to me. After the powerful …or intriguing might be a better word, beginning, I found myself struggling to get through it and I am not sure why. So while the story was interesting and had tons of potential, it wasn’t my favorite.

I have used Goody powder for years. I personally tend to buy the flavored ones because they do not leave the bitter flavor that the non-flavored ones do. In the past, I have tried the cool orange flavor, but after trying these, they are a definite “go to” if the orange ones aren’t available. One packet with a coke knocks any pain out.Taste/Flavor. The taste isn’t bad. The fruit flavor does cover some of the bitter taste that can accompany powdered acetaminophen.Convenience. There are 24 individual packets that are extremely convenient. They slip in your pocket, wallet, bag or purse. There are no large pills or pill bottles.  You could leave some at work in your desk, and strategically place them around the home.Effectiveness. To me, these powders work faster than pills. I have found that the powder formula hits the system faster, especially if you compound it by drinking a soda that has caffeine in it too (i.e., Coke or Pepsi).  I also think that it is the combination of caffeine, aspirin and acetaminophen that form this product that make it effective.Price. Amazon offers these powders at the same price as most drug stores (under $7).I know what you are wondering, since it seems that I like this product, why didn’t I give it 5 stars? Well, I took off half a star for two reasons: 1: Just like the other Goody’s, these packets can be difficult to open. Perhaps they are trying to prevent kids from getting into them, but for us “adults” who have a headache, attempting to rip these open quickly is not always easy. 2. There is still a slight “bite” or bitter after-taste once you take it, which is probably why I don’t take them with water. It isn’t horrible, but I think the orange flavored ones cover the taste more.

Shelby is still reeling from her husband Richard’s sudden death when she finds out that he wasn’t what she believed him to be. Not only did he have secrets, but he was he a liar, a swindler, and left her in crippling debt.  Faced with no real options and a young child (Callie) to raise, she decides to return hometown, to her roots in the mountains of Tennessee. Determined to stand on her own two feet, Shelby returns to small town living and faces those from her past.  Griff is a local contractor who recently moved to Rendezvous Ridge. The minute he sees “the sad eyed” Shelby, and her beguiling red-headed daughter (Callie), he falls in love. While Griff likes projects, he knows that any pressure he gives will make Shelby run, so his plan is to be patient and wait for her to catch up. Meanwhile, while Shelby is learning to trust again and rebuild her life, Richard’s past seems to have followed her to Rendezvous Ridge. There have been a string of break-ins, thefts and a few deaths. While the two find love, they must also solve the mystery of who and what Richard was.I enjoyed “The Liar”, and while some may say that there is nothing new or original about this story, I would suggest that there was that familiar and pleasant a NR formula that holds true. Guess what “The Liar” had it. You had romance, some mystery and a pretty satisfying conclusion. Overall, I would give this story 4 stars and recommend it to Roberts’ fans.

The benefits of purchasing the Mead Five Star 2015-2016 (August to July) planner are:1. The size is perfect. It fits well in a large purse or backpack.2. The thick plastic cover is attractive and seems to be durable.3. This is the perfect tool for a student (or non-student) to get organized.4. It covers a school year….August 2015 thru July 2016. It is divided by the month, which is on two facing pages. Following each month is a daily option with bullets for you to write events or tasks.5. Scattered throughout the planner are other items that are beneficial for students: proofreading symbols; conversions; the states and their capitals; spelling tips; maps; dates to remember and holidays.The cons of purchasing this planner:1. It is kind of expensive ($18) for what you get.  I think someone in the market for a planner can find one that has more features (i.e., times, scratch paper, etc.) or that is just as good, if not better for less.2. This planner would have been superior if there had been times that corresponded with the daily section. That is a feature that I normally look for in a planner, and is a feature that I think would appeal to some consumers…although you can write in the times of the events by the bullets.In conclusion, while this planner is aesthetically pleasing to the eye, it is nothing special and in my humble opinion does not warrant the $18 asking price. Therefore, I can only give it 3 to 3.5 stars.

I really like this laptop. It is versatile and has tons of features that make this a great purchase.1. It has a large easy to read screen (about 17”). Wonderful for watching movies or surfing.2. It has the regular features of a laptop but the added feature of being touch sensitive. Therefore, you can navigate between screens and tasks by using your fingers.3. The keyboard is located in the center of the laptop but is surrounded by a rubbery filling casing that allows the palms of your hand to comfortably rest while typing.4. You can use either the mouse or the touch feature.5. This computer has several USB ports, an Ethernet, hdmi, SD card, and DVD/CD drive.6. A nice long cord for charging.7. This laptop is large enough for a dorm room or home office.8. It has a built in camera.9. The keyboard lights up when you are typing which helps if you are working in dim light. (Ok, now I am telling my age.)10. It comes preloaded with Windows 8.1 and a free upgrade to Windows 10 when it is available.11. The battery life is decent.12. You can decide how you’d like to sign-in on the laptop, either a password or face recognition.13. This laptop is comparably priced to others on the market and has the touch screen feature.The only warning that I will give anyone considering purchasing this laptop is the size. It is large (which is great to use at home or in a dorm room), but a little too large and heavy (5 to 7 lbs) to be portable or carry around…..unless you have great arm strength or a large backpack.Overall, this product warrants 5 stars and I would recommend it to anyone in the market for a great laptop.

For under $50, a groom could purchase this portable iHome speaker for his groomsmen. Of course there are other occasions that you could purchase this item, but that is what came to mind when I first saw the masculine design. It's cute and the sound quality isn't bad. There are some other benefits to buying this item. This speaker is portable, about the size of an actual flask. It fits in my hand easily. It is Bluetooth enabled or you can attach a cord and play your music. I was able to connect both my phone (android) and ipod easily. It comes with both USB and aux cords that fit along with the speaker in a small leather like pouch that you can attach to anything. The controls are on the top of the speaker and easy to access. Overall, I think this is a great novelty item that would make a great gift. 3 to 3.5 stars

The 5 Star 5 Subject Mead Spiral Notebook is perfect for those anal retentive people who thrive on organization. You have a quality product by a trusted brand. The notebook is durable and attractive.Description of the product: a traditional 5 subject spiral notebook with a few exceptions. (1) The cover is colorful and made of a durable plastic (versus the traditional paper), which means you can wipe it off and hopefully it will last longer than its paper counterpart. The notebooks come in an array of colors, which should suit most. And I would even say that if you wanted to, you could decorate the cover making it uniquely yours.  (2) The subjects are divided into 5 sections by colorful tab pocket folders, that are…..expandable and moveable. You can use a sharpie or other marker to label the tabs. (3) The paper is quality and college ruled paper, which I prefer because I think it forces me to write concisely and neatly. (4) There is a pen holder on the front of the outside of the notebook and a small fabric cover over the spirals.I could only find one potential issue with purchasing this product. This Advance Mead Product costs a little under $20, which is expensive for a school supply for the average consumer. However, I think this might be worth it if you have a special project for school (i.e., preparing for graduation for high school or college, preparation for the SAT, the ACT, the LSAT, MCAT, writing a thesis, project, etc.) or if you are a really dedicated student. I can also see a person in the working world using this as a tool to stay organized. Overall, I can already see the benefits of owning at least one of these notebooks. I plan to organize my son’s senior year in it….it will include, everything from upcoming dates and deadlines, as well as lists of things to do, party planning, entertainment, trips and menus, etc. I think it will be invaluable.

Chelsea Cain is a talented writer. Her writing style is effortless and captivating. She has the ability to pull you into a world that is both disturbing and tantalizing. I for one really enjoyed the nuances of the Archie/Gretchen chronicles….the story of a serial killer and her hunter. That series invoked so many different emotions that I found myself conflicted, upset and yet spellbound. In my opinion, an author who can bring out so many emotions in the reader, has to be talented. So when “One Kick” was released, I didn’t hesitate to download it to my kindle. I knew that reading another Cain novel would mean exploring the mind of the disturbed and a world filled with violence and depravity. I wasn’t wrong. First, I will explain why I found this story to be more disturbing than other Cain novels. In my mind, there is a clear difference between adult victims and children. Yes, I know it is a fine line, but in the Archie/Gretchen chronicles, you understand that at the heart of it they were consenting adults. One was supposedly in a position of power and the other was beautiful but pure evil. You knew that they made the choices that they made willingly. BUT that is where “One Kick” differs. In this story, Cain gives us a glimpse into the mind of child abductors, their victims and those that hunt those that prey. This time the story revolved around the helpless….kids versus adults. Kids who clearly did not have a voice in what happened to them, or who didn’t have the ability to make certain decisions.Kick Lannigan is a survivor. Having been abducted as a child, forced into child pornography and “accidentally rescued”, she is determined not to be victimized again. Kick had been abducted while looking for her puppy, and was being held by Mel and his consenting wife. Five years after the abduction, she was discovered by accident during a collateral investigation spearheaded by a dedicated FBI Agent, Frank. The FBI didn’t even know “little” Kick was there until they saw her and destroying evidence of a pretty horrific crime. Discovering her changed a lot of things for all parties involved. Mel was jailed and his wife committed suicide. Eventually testifying against her capture, she is responsible for imprisoning a man who was part of a larger child pornography ring. Fast forward several years and we see the survivor Kick, who has become obsessed with self-defense and rescuing/locating missing kids. She is now a weapons expert, proficient in hand-to-hand combat, and emancipated from her mother (who was willing to cash in on her new found celebrity) and living a very life solitary life with the exception of her “play” brother (James, a fellow abductee) and her sweet old dog, Monster. So when she is approached by a mysterious man (Bishop) and asked to help in a child abduction case, she believes that she can make a difference and finds herself on the trail of a child abductor, possibly one who was involved in her own abduction. All she needs to do is contact her jailed abductor (Mel) and ask for help to find children that are missing. He could hold the key to their survival. Faced with bombs, dead children, and a mysterious foe, the Bishop and Kick work together to locate those that deserve to be saved and bring down an evil network.What I found to be the most compelling was Cain’s voice as the survivor “Kick”. While she may vacillate between being a survivor and a warrior, I had to remember underneath it all, Kick is a victim, and her response to certain things made sense. (SPOILER) I could understand why Kick hid scrabble tiles in her hiding spots and I could also see why she ran to destroy evidence after being prompted by Mel, I could even understand how a young child, who on some level realizes that she is being abused, could form some kind of bond with her capture, but I struggled with her decision to save his life. On the other hand, I did understand Bishop’s mysterious actions and reactions. However, in the end, it was the subject matter that I found to be so disturbing and found myself struggling just to get through the story. It was not necessarily what I read, but the sheer ramifications of what it all meant. In my mind, Kick while partially healed would always be flawed and broken. No matter what she does or who she tries to save, there would always be a certain sadness, a vulnerability, a loss of innocence that she will always have. But she is the perfect protagonist in that every day that she works to be normal, is a testament to her triumph over evil. As the two explore the dynamics of their relationship (both working and personal), they fight to locate those believed lost and abused. So in the end, we have a truth revealed, a dead bad guy, hurt good guys and injured “not too sure which side they are on” guys and a somewhat uplifting story. But we also have a lot of questions about Bishop (although he gave us a little glimpse into his past) and who he works for. Why do they (Trident) have an interest in keeping Mel alive or Kick involved? Overall, I would give “One Kick” 3.5 to 4 stars. Although disturbing, I thought it was a thought provoking read.  And I probably would read the upcoming sequel, if for no other reason than to discover the truth behind Bishop.

In true James Patterson & Michael  Ledwidge fashion “Burn” is unrealistic but extremely entertaining. Lovers of the Michael Bennett series will appreciate this installation in the series. It’s the usual: various crimes that seem unrelated, a sprinkling of personal issues for Bennett, an introduction of new characters and new investigations, and some pretty gruesome deaths. While this isn’t the most realistic story, or the most accurate …in terms of police protocol or investigative practices…it was fast paced and entertaining.As far as the main storyline, here it is in a nutshell. On the personal front, Bennett is still juggling a ton of kids, especially after his beloved nanny (Mary Catherine) has to return home to care for her ill mother. His can’t really find time for a love life since it always seems to be affected by either his job or some personal crisis. He’s worried about his feisty grandfather who suddenly becomes ill, and the return of the biological father of one of his adopted kids (Chrissy) who has suddenly decided that he wants to be a father. On the professional front: Bennett is being punished (by a rival) and tasked with supervising a rag-tag group of misfit cops (The Outreach Squad in Harlem), each of who has their own set of issues, and failure to do so could mean the end of his career.  To complicate matters, he receives information about a disturbing crime (a possible cannibal club in the NY area), which sadly leads to the death of one of his detectives. And finally, in order to return to Major Crimes, he must arrest some pretty savvy jewel thieves who have been hitting the diamond district.Overall, I give this story a 2.5. I have the usual complaints (that I have about the Patterson collaborations), but again I decided to read this one (like the others) because it offers a few hours of escape. The normal Patterson formula is ever present…..you know those short, easy to digest chapters….each ending with a small cliffhanger or a pregnant pause. But for me, there were too many dangling storylines at the end. Ok, I can live with the eventual (all be it forced) connection between the jewel thieves and the cannibals, but what about the other stuff? There was some attempt to really develop some strong characters (in the Outreach Team), but then nothing. It is kind of hard to explain, but you wonder why after molding this team, making these friendships, and really making a difference (which his character always strives to do), would he just return to Major Crimes? It seems like this would be his opportunity to really make a difference and develop these officers into great detectives….hence destroying his arch nemesis, Starkie. In terms of plot, once the connection was made between the jewel thieves and the cannibals, I groaned because it seemed a little forced. And then the conclusion or should I say cliffhanger (one of the cannibals escapes in an SUV with several bodyguards), I found myself puzzled.  And instead of something to wrap it all up, which again is a Patterson/Ledwidge tradition, we see Bennett finally visiting Mary Catherine. The Bennett I know would have never rested until he identified his man and brought him to justice. I mean I’m all about a little romance, but can we stay focused on finding the escaped bad guy? Of course, maybe the next story will fill in the blanks, but I would have liked a little more closure. Regardless, if you want a mindless read…this is perfect. But don’t be disappointed by the lack of depth in the plot or in the characters.

Ginger Dysart is suffering from a broken heart. Over the last year, her marriage to a wanna-be rock star failed and her infant son died from SIDS. Looking for a fresh start and wanting to heal, Ginger moves to Thunder Point and starts working in a flower shop. Matt Lacoumette, a part-time professor/farmer, has turned to the bottle, still reeling from a stunning betrayal from someone who’d sworn to love him. When the two meet at a wedding, fate pushes them together and they soon find themselves falling in love. However, Ginger is reluctant to continue a relationship with someone so filled with hurt and rage. Instead she wants Matt to forgive the person that has wronged him, learn to trust again, as not to bring those feelings into a new relationship, which would kill their budding future.Overall, this was an easy to read novel. However, I was at a disadvantage because I hadn’t read any other novels in the Thunder Point series. I am sure that Robyn Carr intended this to be a stand along novel, but clearly there were storylines developed in previous books. As a result, some of the intuitive things about the story confused me, which made some of the storylines seem forced or underdeveloped. There were also times that some of the characters seemed overwhelming, irritating or over the top. For example, there were times that Matt seemed too broodish, too stubborn, even though I agree he had been wronged but still …pull… it…together. Meanwhile, Ginger seemed a little too forgiving….I mean forgive, but don’t forget…in other words, why bend to meet with an ex-husband who clearly didn’t give a darn about you or his deceased son, only to say that you were the better person? And then there were certain other characters whose storylines, I am assuming, were explained in previous novels or will be explained in future ones. These just seemed to be thrown in there. Perhaps if I was familiar with this series, I would have really enjoyed this story a lot more than I did. Regardless, I would give this book a 2.5 to 3 stars.
10:43 Mins I ordered this product, my son reviewed, and loved it!

What better than to enjoy the floral scent of Pre de Provence Shea Enriched Soap (Rose de Mai) while lathering in the shower. This soap lathers well and exfoliates the skin, leaving your body feeling fresh and clean. The bar is attractive. It is a pink/ lavender rectangular bar of soap with what appears to be small crushed pressed flowers. While some may find the scent to be (initially) overwhelming, once rinsed and dried, the smell dies down and leaves a pleasant aroma. It doesn’t dry the skin, or leave your body feeling greasy or irritated (which is important since most of my family has sensitive skin). The size is convenient, especially for those who like to travel. It is versatile. You can use it in the bathroom or the kitchen, although the bathroom was my preference. And finally, the bar, while some would consider a luxury, is not over-priced or overly expensive (under $7), especially if you compare it with soaps that you can buy in other specialty stores like Victoria Secret, Body Store or L’Occitane. So for the cost, for the benefits, you get a pretty decent bar of soap. 5 stars

Whenever I think of anything "Celtic", especially when it comes to jewelry...I think of intricate weavings that are inspired by romance (preferably a Highlander), symbolize strength and are reminiscent of either Ireland or Scotland. These earrings are no exception.  Simply wearing these earrings will make you feel romantic and whimsical.There are several reasons to purchase the "Sterling Silver Celtic Tree of Life Round Dangle Earrings": (1) The size and weight. These earrings are about the size of a penny and extremely light. They don't pull on your ears or stretch the holes. (2) They are aesthetically pleasing to the eye. Simply put, they look great, even better in person than the picture. They don't look cheap and the average person would think that you paid more than you did. While the stone is very small (which I think is best so that it doesn't take away from them), they are the perfect size and don't overwhelm the design. (3) The cost. For under $20, you will get a pretty decent pair of earrings (I have sensitive skin and it has not irritated my ears or my neck where it might touch), and for under $20 you can get the matching pendant [thru Amazon].Why then (if these earrings are so great), do I only give them a 4.5 out of 5 stars. Well, the posts/hooks are a little large. While they allow the earrings to dangle, they sit far away from the head. [The end of the hook may touch your neck slightly. You might have to bend them in a little.] I personally would not have designed them to be as wide. But overall, I think these are a great bargain, look great and would be a nice addition to your own jewelry collection or to give as a gift.

Lieutenant Eve Dallas has an admirer, or shall we say a devoted friend who is willing to do whatever it takes to get her attention. For starters, they are willing do those things that Eve isn’t allowed to legally do, like kill those who have escaped or perverted justice.  And all Eve needs to do in return is acknowledge the killer. So the first killed is Eve’s nemesis, a  savvy defense attorney who Eve has faced in court and the next is a junkie that Eve once tangled with. Unfortunately, this is just the beginning of a crime spree.  As the killer changes focus and targets those people that Eve loves, she becomes more determined than ever to unmask the killer before the ball drops (New Year’s Eve is fast approaching).  From the cryptic messages left at the crime scenes to close encounters with a killer, Eve must follow the clues to a startling conclusion…the killer is closer than they even realize.I love the “In Death” series and this was no exception. After over 40 books and or short stories, we have seen the evolution of Eve Dallas from the loner/career driven Homicide Lieutenant to a softer/kinder/gentler Homicide Lieutenant. While Eve is still not “overly lovey dovey”, seeing those times that her shell cracks (with Bella and Peabody), makes you smile. Not to mention her relationship with Roarke is better than ever, and her relationship with her friends and co-workers is constantly evolving. JD Robb (AKA Nora Roberts) doesn’t ever disappoint. And I for one, as a devoted fan, can’t wait to read the next one!

Personally, I have always loved the look of Zoysia. My aunt who lived in Florida swears by it.  There is nothing like a lush yard of green grass.Traditionally Zoysia is plush, yet it is a tough, durable grass that requires very little maintenance. I live in Georgia and have a rather large yard, almost an acre. I thought that the perfect solution for some of the bald/bare spots in my yard would be to try Scotts Turf Builder Zoysia Grass Seed & Mulch. I scratched the bare ground lightly with a rake, and spread liberally with a spreader and by hand (depending on the size of the area). I also placed this mixture in small planter cups in the hope of growing plugs. Even with tons of rain (for some reason Georgia is experiencing a large number of April showers), I have yet to see a sprout (in either the trays or on the ground). I even took into account that I have two dogs that may be trampling the tender new growth, but still nothing. It has been approximately 3 weeks since I planted the seeds and still nothing.The pros:1. The price offered thru Amazon ($32) is cheaper than some places that I have seen it. I have seen it in stores for over $45.2. It spreads well.The cons:1. I have yet to see a sprout either in the trays or on the ground.In conclusion, I think if I could get it to grow, I would love it. But that is also the reason that this product only gets 1 star. As a consumer, it would be disappointing to invest in a product and not get any results. **I plan to reapply this product over the next few weeks, and will revisit this review if necessary.

This box holds 96 teenie, green dog bones shaped like small toothbrushes. About the size of your pinkie, they are the perfect size treat for my aging Pomeranian. This treat freshens the breath; cleans the teeth; helps with plaque buildup and doesn't irritate the bowels. While these are recommended for dogs between 5 and 10lbs, my Australian Cattle dog has nabbed a few. While we mere mortals may not find these ....shall we say tasty, the doggies love them. In conclusion, even though these greenies are a bit pricey ($35 dollars + shipping if you don't have Prime), they are well worth it. And if you compare these (via Amazon), to those sold in your local pet store (Petsmart or Petco) or retail store (Target or Walmart), they are comparable.

I am sure that I am not the only parent who has found themselves stressing out about college entrance exams (i.e., SAT or ACT). I have paid for classes and purchased a ton of books to help my son prepare. The "SAT Premier 2015-1016" prep book is the perfect tool. It includes several tests; a CD with proven strategies to score higher;  test taking strategies; and offers online (and mobile) training tools and aids. There are hundreds of practice questions in every subject ......math, critical reading, and even writing examples for the essay portion of the exam. So for a small investment, you have a decent prep tool. However, like other tools granted most students, they are only as good as a motivated student. Only time will tell if his score improves (he is scheduled to take the test before summer), but if his score does not improve it won't be because he wasn't provided an additional tool to prepare.

A brand you can trust.Easy to use....just measure product using the lid.  Smells great. Clothes smell fresh and clean. Attractive container and packaging. Comparably priced to other scent boosters. Gentle enough to use on infants clothes, but ok to use on adult ones. Great for sensitive skin.Definitely would recommend to others.

I know very little about Nick Cannon. There are three exceptions... I know that he was married to the pop star, Mariah Carey; was a host of a TV talent show (America's Got Talent); and is an entertainer. What I didn't know was that he was a decent writer/poet. Overall, I definitely think that Cannon's book "Neon Aliens Ate My Homework" will appeal to some teens. Those who look to pop culture to express themselves, or really appreciate urban culture will gobble this short book up. There are tons of musings on subjects that every young person can relate to. Over 137 pages, Cannon covers everything from bullying to a young boy's desire to fill his father's shoes. They speak of loving yourself, to knowing your self worth and being kind to others. There are sentimental poems (Remembering Shel & Daddy's Shoes); humorous poems (Funky Feet, Halitosis or Farts & Burps); and ironic ones (Pink Lunch Lady & Haters). They are introspective  and engaging. Accompanying each poem are black and white illustrations. Some are extremely detailed and others whimsical. Yes, Cannon does illustrate a few himself and they remind me of Mindcraft....but the others are talented street artists, from different backgrounds, who express themselves through art.While not always rhyming, there is something almost musical about Cannon's poems. I definitely can see the hip-hop influence, and honestly believe that a few will touch certain reader's hearts and souls.

There is something amiss in the town of Stratus...supernatural occurrences are abound. The dark Prince is determined to get two of its residents, Brielle and her boyfriend, Jake, at any cost. He is even willing to restore the sight of a fallen angel, Damien, to get them. You see, Brielle, not only wears a halo around her wrist, but she can see through the celestial veil, which is an invaluable gift to have. And Jake, well he can heal people with his bare hands. Controlling their powers would be a game changer (literally change the tide of the war between good and evil), so he is pulling out all the stops. And to complicate matters, Brielle is having nightmares, worried about her father (who appears to be drinking again and dating a woman who literally makes her stomach crawl), still struggling with her mother's death, and she's worried about Jake because he appears to be keeping a secret. She simply needs to have faith and believe in something and someone bigger than herself.This was my first Shannon Dittemore novel and I enjoyed it. I am intrigued enough to get the first and next books in the series. This story had everything that you need to have an entertaining read. The story definitely has some religious overtones (sometimes it was heavier than others), but there are epic battles between good and evil, and some teenage angst thrown in for good measure. I enjoyed it and give it 4 stars.

Personally, I like the Head & Shoulders, Instant Relief Scalp Soother for the following reasons:1. Head & Shoulders is a shampoo that my family uses for dry scalp or following wrestling meets as a cleanser, so this is a product that I trust and use.2. The gel is perfect for instant relief of itching and dry scalp.3. The gel is clear and non-greasy. While the packaging says that it was non-greasy, I thought that even using small amounts over time would leave my hair looking greasy or heavy, which would in turn mean that I had to wash it more often. It didn't, and I was pleasantly surprised.4. It doesn't smell bad or loud. There is a vague scent, of tea tree or mint. Once placed on the affected area, the smell doesn't didn't last. I could not smell the product hours later or once it dried, so you don't have to worry about people inquiring about it.5. I like the pump bottle. It allows you to either squirt the gel onto your finger or directly onto the scalp. This also allows you to control the amount of the product you use.6. It did help with flaking on the scalp, leaving the area looking clean.7. And finally, price wise it isn't bad. If you have a problem with dry, itchy scalp, a product for under $7 that offers some relief might just be a product that you wouldn't mind investing in.

It's been three years since mixed martial artist fighter, Cannon "The Saint" Colter, has seen Yvette Sweeny. While he fought hard to resist her in the past (because of her age), now that they have been thrown together (to settle her grandfather's estate), he doesn't see the need to fight the attraction now. She's all grown up. The only problem, she is still traumatized from an incident that happened years prior, one that Cannon had to rescue her from. And it is understandable, who wouldn't be traumatized after being doused in gasoline and forced to watch a woman be assaulted by a group of bad guys. With that in mind, he is willing to be patient, and seduce her slowly. If anything, his training has taught him patience, and anything worth having is worth fighting for. As the relationship develops between the two, they find themselves in one dangerous situation after another and soon we come to realize that there are forces trying to tear them apart.  Will their love conquer all? Will Yvette find her happy ever after with the sexy fighter Cannon?There were several things that I liked about the story. (1) It was familiar. I have read the story that included the tragic events involving Yvette and Cannon, and I was glad to know the outcome of their story. (2) I enjoyed the other characters in the story and look forward to seeing how they evolve in the series. I definitely can't wait to read Merissa (Rissy, Cannon's sister) and Armie (Cannon's best friend) story because they are destined to be a great couple. And (3) the story is easy to follow. Foster has a formula for her novels that is sure to please most romance/mystery fans. There is a decent story + romance or a forbidden relationship + intrigue and danger and wonderful characters, all of which results in a pretty decent story, which are ideal to read while on short vacations or trips.Now the things that I wasn't wild about but willing to struggle thru in order to see the outcome. (1) Cannon was a little corny. While he was dashing and considerate most of the time, there was some dialogue that was super dumb. I can't put my finger on it, but there were some statements that just didn't ring true. (2) There were some things about Yvette, that didn't ring true as well. Again I couldn't put my finger on it, but some of their discussion or her reactions seemed a little off. Regardless, in the end I was somewhat satisfied but thought that these concerns warranted a star deduction.Therefore overall, while a little predictable in parts, "No Limits" was an entertaining read. You have romance, danger and excitement. 4 stars.

Michael Connelly is a very talented writer. He has two series that I am familiar with......Harry Bosch and Mickey Haller (the Lincoln Lawyer). You can always count on two things with a Connelly story: (1) a nicely developed mystery and (2) a decent backstory for some engaging characters. So, when I saw that Bosch was going to be an Amazon series, I was thrilled. At the very least, I knew that it would provide a few hours of entertainment. Guess what, I wasn't disappointed. While you may find that episode 1 moves a little slowly, there is a gradual building of tension and suspense that will compel you to watch the entire series in one sitting. This weekend I was able to binge watched all 10 episodes, and while not as raw/gritty as True Detective (which I loved), and not as edgy as Banshee (which I love), it still ranks pretty high in my mind as great television.Titus Welliver is perfect as Harry Bosch.  He embodies the essence of the no-non-sense homicide detective who has a keen eye to detail (doesn't accept the quick and easy), is deeply flawed, but clearly dedicated to the truth and justice. The opening episode finds him not exactly following police procedure and chasing (without calling for backup) a murder suspect. Soon we find him fighting for his career as he is being sued civilly (the department has cleared him) for using deadly force against a suspect. While awaiting the verdict, he responds to the scene of some skeletal remains that were discovered by a dog. Needing something to take his mind off of his troubles, he tasks himself with discovering who is responsible for the death of a young child killed several years prior (cold case). Meanwhile, a serial killer has been arrested, and seems to have become fixated on Bosch, and inserts himself into the bones investigation.As Bosch awaits his fate, the investigations come together in only a way that Connelly can orchestrate. And to complicate matters, Bosch's personal and professional lives are clashing. So while trying to solve a very old case (that involves incest, jealousy and abuse); stay one step ahead of a serial killer; try to reconnect with his teenage daughter; have a personal relationship with a fellow cop; deal with unscrupulous co-workers; he must also learn to navigate departmental politics while maintaining his integrity and adhering to his strong sense of justice.  As the credits of Episode 10 roll, I prepare myself for another season. Hopefully it's a hit, will be renewed, and I will be able to binge watch Season 2. I give it 4.5 to 5 stars.

As a true Nora Roberts fan, I can say while not totally original and slightly anticlimactic the final book in the Cousin O'Dwyer trilogy was enjoyable. There was nothing really new and original, but there is always something about finishing a Roberts book that is satisfying to the soul. There are a few things that you know from the onset...... Nora Roberts is going to follow her tried and true formula that always works well for her supernatural or paranormal stories....i.e., good will always overcome evil or the light will overcome the dark. Of course there will be some romance and loving among the characters. Usually pairings, by three (in her trilogies), with a little angst thrown in for good measure. Dark Magick is no different. I won't really rehash the storyline, as a ton of others already have, but I will brush over what my thoughts are. Branna and Fin were destined to be together. We saw it coming from book #1. Branna refuses to allow Fin (her true soul mate) into her heart because he bears a symbol of evil and her most trusted enemy, Cabhan. Cabhan is an evil sorcerer who has been trying to take "the three's" (Iona, Branna and Connor) magic in the hope of becoming all powerful. Typical bad guy musings. And don't get me wrong, I understand she has vowed to destroy Cabhan (along with her brother and cousin) to right a wrong from long ago, but I wanted to scream, "give Fin a break, quit punishing him for something that he had no control over". He was cursed by your ancestors for goodness sake.  But instead, Branna brudes and cooks elaborate meals while getting punchy with everyone. And she constantly denies her feelings for Fin while he secretly searches for answers and travels the globe for ways to remove the evil symbol and possible curse, so that they can be together. So for two books now, we have seen them dance around each other, snip at each other, and fall deeper in love. And you know what is coming, and have to sit back and enjoy the ride. Why then the 4 stars and not 5? Well, Cabhan was a little lackluster in this installment....never really doing anything truly evil (ok, he did hurt a puppy that Fin had grown to love), but with that exception, he was around, but not really around. And then they threw in some demon stuff but it wasn't really that well developed, so hence the reduction. So when the plot twists were revealed.....among them Fin's role in the upcoming showdown.....and Branna finally got herself together, you were a little underwhelmed. With all that being said, I did enjoy the vivid imagery (Ireland)...and I like anything to do with witches, sorcerers and demons.....basically magic, so I enjoy it.

I usually don't do much with my brows with the exception of brushing them lightly to tame them. On occasion I will clean them up with a nice snip here or there, but every day I just brush them in place. This product however is a nice trade off. It doesn't take a lot to do, simply brush along your natural brow line, and you are as good as new. The small brush that it comes with is easy to handle. So you don't put a ton on. It doesn't appear to stain, smear or clump. It also didn't make my brows look hard or stiff. The end result is a more polished and put together you. And while this particular color (transparent) may not be the perfect for everyone (because the gel is clear but I do think it comes in other colors, like brown or black), it is perfect for me because my brows are dark. It merely enhanced what I already have. Over all, it's a small investment for a nice little tool that makes any makeup bag complete. 4.5 stars

In theory this should have been a wonderful product. It's aesthetically attractive and would be a wonderful tool in the kitchen (on the sink), if it worked. Everything you need in one dispenser. Well, it doesn't. Work that is. It's cute and that's about it. It leaks!Buyer beware: first, you should know, and just in case you don't, it doesn't come with the scrubber or brush that you see in the photo. And even that would be fine, it the thing did not leak. While pleasing to the eye, it is just not practical because the soap seeps into the other compartment which defeats the purpose. I tried to even use a thicker liquid soap hoping that would help (which is dumb I know...but I was keeping hope alive), but it didn't matter. I think even lotion would eventually leak into the other compartment. With all that being said, $15 is a little high for something that looks good but doesn't work. The average consumer would NOT be able to justify the purchase.With all things considered....the looks, the functionality and the price, I can honestly give this product 1 star. HOWEVER, I did like what one reviewer suggested, making it a desk caddy. I think I will try that.

When I ordered these, they were to be a spare pair to ones that I ordered from the optometrist. And knowing that Foster Grant has been around forever and is a reputable company, I didn’t see what it would hurt. You know what? I haven’t been disappointed. While these are slightly more than a dime store pair (these are about $39), they are better made. They are attractive and smart looking (tortoise colored), with a traditional shape. I only have one small concern, and hesitate to give these glasses 5 stars….and it is the multi-focus component. Which yeah, I know is the main feature…But, this multi-focus technology definitely takes some getting use to, but it could be based on the individual. For me, a recipient of lasik several years ago it was hard getting use to. As I have aged, I have noticed that I need a little reader to sharpen things up a bit. So in theory, a pair of glasses that contain multi-purpose lenses…ones that I can use when reading, using the computer and interacting (tv)…..would be wonderful. What takes some time getting use is the shifting between purposes….or tasks that you do. Over time I am sure that my eyes would adjust a little quicker, but initially, when my eyes move from the reader portion (which is the bottom) to the computer or tv, my vision would become slightly blurred. While with my normal rimless readers, I can look up and down at my book….merely moving my eyes up and down, with no side effects (if that makes sense). Otherwise, these are perfect as backups and I give them 4 stars.

It’s almost Christmas and Lt. Eve Dallas has to not only shop for Christmas gifts (something she hates…she loves her family and friends, she just can’t stand shopping) but solve the brutal murder of a personal trainer (Trey Ziegler). While no loss to the world (Ziegler had a lucrative side business that dealt with sex and blackmail), she is determined to bring his killer to justice (hopefully before the New Year), even if she doesn’t like him. So in typical Eve Dallas fashion, she unmasks a killer even while planning a holiday party and loving her incredible husband, Roarke. “Festive in Death” is a definite must read for those who love the series. I give it 4.5 stars.

Benzac Skin Balancing Foam Cleanser is gentle (even for my sensitive skin), lite (doesn't feel heavy on the skin) and super easy to use. I have what the dermatologist described as "adult acne", go figure......I grew up, had two kids and now suffer with the occasional breakout (certain times of the month on the chin and cheek). Anyway, I like the fact that this cleanser is in a pump bottle, although I always feel cheated with pump bottles because it doesn't seem to be a lot of product in the container. Regardless, I like that you can control the amount of product that you use...meaning one pump is more than enough. The main ingredient is salicylic acid which is gentle. After using this product my face isn't red, irritated or peeling.  I have even added a little "Purpose Cleansing Soap" to the foam to make it creamier. And it smells good (sandalwood), not like the traditional acne medicine (which smells like a medicine). And finally..... the price. As a kit (all 3 steps), $34 seems reasonable especially when you compare it to other products on the market. Overall, I liked this product. Of course, only time will tell (long term use) how this product really works. For slight to moderate acne, or the occasional breakout, it seems to work, but I am not sure if it will work for someone who has severe acne. My 16-year-old son suffers from (moderate) acne as well and I am going to let him try this product, as well as purchase the last two steps of this kit (spot treatment & blemish clearing hydrator) so that he can experience the full treatment. If it works for him, and continues to work for me, I will update. Otherwise, I give this product 4.5 stars in terms of results, convenience, and price.
Just enough of a challenge for those times that you are stuck in candy crush. Great fun.
Just what I needed another sweet addiction.

I own an Oreck XL Tall vacuum and have found that ordering my replacement bags on Amazon is less expensive than purchasing them in the store (I save a few dollars especially when I use Prime). In the past, I have paid about $18 for 16 bags (by B&M Housewares), which....depending on how often you use your cleaner can last awhile.  And while these are not the Oreck brand of vacuum cleaner bags, they work fine. The only difference that I noticed between these and others that I have purchased is the material that the bags are made of...the Oreck brand is more of a fabric while this is more of a paper-like material. Of course like other bags, these by Ultrafresh claim to do what other brands on the market claim (i.e., microfiltration and odor prevention). So that is not the deciding factor for me and instead I ask myself "why purchase this brand of bags over others"? Well in a nutshell, these work just as good as the others and are cheaper.

Recently I have been really pleased by manufacturers pumping out great products, which looks and feels premium, but also performs very well at an affordable price and this item is exactly that. From being completely built with a metal body to having a great mic, I am astonished as to how affordable this product is. It comes packaged very nicely in a small box highlighting the company and inside it provides additional earbuds in order for you to find the perfect fit for comfort. Just as you can expect, these sound great. From solid bass to great mids, it performed like a champ. However the highs on this headphone is on the poor side since at louder volumes the sound tends to distort. However for the price, this product is an absolute champ and I wouldn't think twice about recommending this to another individual.Disclaimer - I was given this product by the manufacturer in order to provide an honest review.

It is really hard to find a pair of solid sport headphones. Most sport headphones tend to be uncomfortable and lack the sound quality, however this is one of those rare occasion where both needs are met. Depending on your requirement, the headphones can be adjusted to get the best and most comfortable grip. The wire is very sturdy and the overall look seems very sporty, especially in the transparent blue. It comes packaged very nicely in a white box which has a very premium look to it, which is out of the norm for it's price range. The sound quality is very solid with good bass, balanced mids, but suffers on the highs a little bit, since the sound tends to get distorted. If you are in the market for an affordable pair of headphones which provide solid grip and great sound, these are a solid choice which I wouldn't think twice about recommending to another individual.Disclaimer - I was given this product by the manufacturer in exchange for an honest review.

Once in a while you come across an item which turns out to be far better than what you had initially anticipated. This item definitely fits the bill. When I was reached out by Sentey to test their product in exchange for an honest review, I had my doubts mainly because of two key reasons. One, it was a company as to which I have never heard of, and two package that is being offered seems too good to be true for it's price point. Well, let's just say I feel idiotic for bashing something before even giving it a chance.From the very beginning this item screams premium. The headphones come packaged in a very nice box along with great art, providing all the details and highlighting the design. The headphones come packaged inside the box within a large protective shell case which has a very nice matte appearance, and seems very sturdy. It is a case I'd definitely trust to protect my headphones if I were to drop them from a high altitude. Now I am going to be listing the Pros and Cons and elaborate, this way it will be easier for you to decide whether or not these are for you.ProsA) Design - The aesthetics of this product is very surprising for it's price range. Majority of the headphones are crafted from steel with  brushed finishing, giving it a very premium feel and image. The headband feels very sturdy and a easy to size for the perfect fit. The ear cups are a mixture of hardened plastic and steel, but looks great. The ear cups also has very soft large foams which cover your entire ears, blocking outside noise sources and providing comfort for long hours.B) Sound - The sound quality on these headphones are really good. While it does lack a little bass compared to it's competitors, this product is no slouch compared to the price point you are grabbing it. Due to my limited resources, I was only able to compare these to my V Moda M100 ($300) and my Audio Technicas ATH-M50 ($130) and I must say they are pretty close in terms of sound quality for general listening. If you are a fan of bass, they won't do much for you as per say a pair of V-Moda headphones would, which in my opinion provides the best bass under $500. Also these won't provide as solid of an overall balanced sound such as the ATH-M50s would, however they fare very well and I was quiet surprised. Overall, solid sound at the price range.C) Comfort - The headband is very easy to adjust and provides a lot of room to fickle around, enabling you to achieve the perfect fit. Also the ear cups are very soft, providing a comfortable grip for longer listening periods.CONSA) Size - While it isn't an issue for me, these headphones do run rather large and can be a little intimidating for some.Overall this product is a hidden gem. While Sentey might not be a very popular brand, I assure you that these are a great buy for the price you are attaining them for. If you are in the market for an affordable over the ear headphone, look no further because not only do these sound good, but the overall experience is very premium.Once again, Disclaimer. I was provided these headphones by the manufacturer in exchange for an honest review.

I am a person who does not prefer cases on phones and prefer to use them naked. As gorgeous as the Galaxy Note 5 is, it does tend to be a little slippery due to the dual glass body build. So I decided to opt for a full body screen protector in order to protect it from scratches and to get a better grip on the phone. I've never had prior experiences with Skinomi but I did use another manufacturer who produces screen protectors very similar and they were pretty solid. Since it is very affordable, I decided to give Skinomi a shot.When I received the package, it came packaged very nicely. The instructions were clear, the products were all placed separately and everything seemed awesome. So far so good right? Well, it went downhill from there. I've installed numerous screen protectors using the solutions before from a different manufacturer and never had an issue. However, these weren't the same. I cleaned my device thoroughly and washed my hands prior to starting, in order to prevent fingerprints while installing the screen protector. As usual, I installed the screen protector and wipe out the excess solution under the protector. What I find odd is that they do not provide a rubber to push out the water, which is easier to use but rather they provide a microfiber cloth which is a terrible idea because rubbing the cloth hard only causes it to deteriorate and the little pieces of cloth starts to go all over. I left my device untouched for a few hours and once I came back I started to notice streaks under the screen protector and they did not disappear by the end of the day. What I also noticed is that the back of the phone which has curved edges, the screen protectors were slowly peeling off at the edges and this was under 24 hours. Maybe I received a defective product but I couldn't recommend this product to another consumer.

Great fresh design, comfortable, easy to store, affordable, and decent sound quality.......a great buy right? Well, not really. When I first received this product I was really ecstatic. Unlike other Bluetooth headphones, this product has a great new fresh design which I think other companies should start adapting to. It has a magnetic clip which opens and shuts, so you put them on as if you were putting on a chain. The most important aspect is as to how lightweight they are. Once you put them on, it is very easy to forget that you even have headphones on, so for exercising sessions these are perfect. Battery life is about average; listening in about low to mid range volume, you will receive close to 4 hours of battery life from a full charge. So far so good right? Well this is where it went downhill for me. The sound quality is average, something I won't be harsh towards due to the price range. It performs very well and has a somewhat balanced sound which is a little bit dominated from overpowering bass, however the sound output of this product is absolutely horrendous. When I first connected the headphones via Bluetooth to my cellular device, I could barely hear anything. I cranked up the volume all the way up on the phone and it still seemed very low, so I resorted to increase the volume on the headphones also. Within a few clicks I reached max level and they were still very low. With outside interference you wouldn't be able to hear anything since they really do not provide any sort of noise cancellation.I love the design, I love the lightweight and compact size, and I absolutely adore how comfortable they are BUT a headphone is only as good as they sound and these definitely under performs due to terrible sound output. For full disclosure, I was given this product by the manufacturer in exchange for an honest review. Would I recommend these? Not really. There are some better alternatives within this price range of which I have had the pleasure of testing. However that being said, I think Syllable has something great in their hands here. With some improvements and adjusted made, I think the future iterations of this product can be great!

In every category there are companies that are considered to be hidden gems due to their high quality products being offered at an affordable price. I believe Brainwavz is a company which applies to the prior statement. I've had the pleasure of trying a few of their products prior to this one so I already had high expectations when I was offered the opportunity to review this product. As usual, the packaging is outstanding. The product comes packaged within a box, inside a protective carrying case which can be used everyday if you are the type of person who tends to lose their headphones. One thing I truly appreciate that Brainwavz does as a company for all their products is that they provide numerous sets of earbuds, this allows the listener to try on different types of earbuds to find the perfect sound they sought after.The design of the headphones are really well done. The components are housed within a metal casing with a mixture of polished and brushed finishing, creating a sleek look within different lighting. They are a mixture of various shades of grey and light maroon, which is the usual Brainwavz signature color, and I must say not only does it look great but it sets you apart from the rest of the crowd which tends to use popular solid colors. While the headphones are built with metal casing, they aren't heavy at all and actually very comfortable, even for longer periods of usage. The wire consists of a little remote which allows you to control the volume, play/pause and switch songs with double click. However, as stated on the box, the controls seems to not work for Android but rather iOS devices only but the play/pause works for both platforms.Now to the main aspect of a pair of headphones, the sound quality. I say this about every Brainwavz headphones and once again it is present within this product, and that is how good they are at balancing the sounds. Usual headphones these days tend to have overpowering bass which creates muddy noises that cancel out the mids and even highs sometimes. I am a person who loves genres of music that are very instrumentally driven such as Rock/Metal/Classical etc. These headphones are superb when it comes to balancing the sound of various instruments. Everything seems to be on level and nothing overpowers one another. If you are more into bass heavy genres such as electronic music or hip/hop, don't worry these does the job as well. The bass is very tight and drops sounds incredible. If I had to complain about one thing, it would be that the sound output could be a little bit better. While they do get loud enough and block out any outside interruptions, their max volume isn't that impressive. However it varies from device to device, on computer they can get pretty loud but while I tested between two phones (Galaxy Note 5, iPhone 6S plus), they were a little bit on the lower side but performed better on the Note 5, but the difference is very minimal.Overall, these are incredible headphones which should cost much more but hey, as a consumer that's something we should never complain about! Once again I was provided these headphones in exchange for an honest review and I couldn't be more honest when I say these are incredible and a steal at this price range.

I am a no case guy, I refuse to use cases on my phones. Since Samsung knocked it out of the park this year with their flagship designs and performance, I had to pick up the note 5. However I haven't fallen in love with a phone this much in a long time, so I decided to opt for a case in order to protect the phone. The case itself is very sleek. The case consists of a TPU plastic which hugs your phone and provides a solid protection, and it is rounded with an aluminum bumper. Usually aluminum bumpers degrade your reception but not once have I experienced that issue with this case.
