The packaging of the product is very appealing. It is an all white small box with the product display picture on top, very simple but stylish. Once you open the package, you see the product right away, packaged very carefully. The design of this product is what made me fall in love. It has a very appealing look and very easy to store away since the size is so compact. The length of this product Is only about 4 inches long and has a grip on top to keep the phone being charged to stay in place and stay secure. I have tested this product using my Nexus 5 and it stood in place securely even when I bumped the phone lightly to see if it moved or fell off. Keep in mind the Nexus 5 is much larger than the charger and a little push or nudge will cause it to move and fall off due to it being unbalanced but I have not experienced that while using this product, the grip is very secure.Now the most important part, performance. I have always preferred the classical way of plugging in the charger and leaving my phone to get charged over a few hours. When I first received this wireless charger, I had to adapt to a new way of charging. I decided to take it to work and leave it on my desk, just because it looks so stylish. Every morning my phone would barely have any battery left at around 2% and I would just place it on the charger, which would start to charge the phone instantly. Within about 1 hour and 15 minutes, my phone would be fully charged. The Nexus 5 has a battery of 2300Mah, and I find it very impressive that the charger was able to charge my phone fully within such a small time period considering it is wireless.A wireless charger is not only a "cool" concept but also a very useful accessory. Why is that? Well it is a charging base that you can just place your phone on and it will start charging right away, without requiring you to keep finding a wire to connect to your phone every time you are willing to charge. Another huge advantage is that it gives you the ability to be portable. Whenever I am at work and I receive a call, I can just pick up my phone from the charger and talk without having to worry about unplugging anything. When I'm done talking, I can just place my phone back on the charger and it will start charging again instantly. Overall it is a wonderful product and I highly recommend it to anyone who are willing to get into the world of wireless charging without breaking the bank.

Recently I have had a urge to wear clothes that are fashionable, but much different than the norm we see in the states. I decided to browse around Amazon for some interesting designs and discovered this brand H2H. I've noticed that this is a Korean company and sizing is usually smaller than what we are used to in the US, so I decided to go one size higher than my usual. I normally wear Medium, but decided to go Large in US size.Once I received the cardigan I was very impressed with the overall quality and feel of the product. It is thick and soft, very comfortable to wear. At first you might be think the material might not be heavy enough for the winter time, however it keeps you very warm, I adore it. This cardigan does have only 1 button that holds the two sides together, right in the middle.Now I do have one issue with one color. I can't speak for the most of the colors but when I purchased the Red cardigan, I expected it to be like the picture. However when I received the product, it was a very and I mean very light shade of red, almost close to pink. It is a very feminine color and many people thought I was wearing a women's cardigan. I do like the look but I ended up giving it to my mom who loved the cardigan and I decided to grab a black one, which looks much better in my opinion.Overall it is a beautiful product that I couldn't recommend enough. It is light, warm, fashionable, extremely comfortable, and everything a good cardigan should be.

My schedule is hectic. Almost every day I attend college from 8AM to 3:30PM, and right after I work from 4PM to 12PM. Both school and work involves me using my phone. Whether it's contacting clients or researching information for classroom discussions, let's just say my Galaxy S4 is always under heavy usage. Even though the S4 has a much improved battery life than the previous models, it is still no where near perfect to run an entire day on one charge. I was lucky enough to be contacted by RAVPower to try this product. When I realized this product would enable me to charge my device and a spare batery, I was very excited because this would solve my battery issues for long days. Due to my previous positive experiences with their products, I decided to try this one out without any hesitation.Within two days the product was at my doorstep. The charging dock came packaged very nicely in a box. Once I took the product out of the box, I was very impressed by the overall build and quality. For the price point, the design and attention to detail really caught my attention. The front part of the docking system has a beautiful glossy finish to match your S4's body, whereas the sides of the product has a matte finish, complementing the S4's brushed steel look. The back of the charging system has a little insert to charge a spare battery. Now, it has a little LED light to show if the battery is charging. When the LED light is glowing red, it indicates that the battery is charging. Once the charging is complete, the LED light switches from RED to GREEN. The charging time for the docking system is extremely fast, within about an hour I can charge my phone completely. The charging time for the spare battery isn't as fast, it takes about 1 hour and 40ish minutes to charge the battery completely, which isn't bad at all.For the price point, RAVpower is enabling customers of Amazon to get a gorgeous charging dock for a very low price. The quality and performance of the product does not make sense for the price point. If you are someone such as me with a busy schedule or if you are just someone who likes to put their phone under heavy usage, this is a great product for you because it will always enable you to have a spare fully charged battery, no matter where you are.RAVPower has an amazing customer service team. I've never had any problems with their products but they have always taken their time to respond to any questions I have ever had in order to make sure that I was fully content. I highly recommend this product, not only for it's performance and quality but also for the company that is behind it!

I love watches, they are a passion of mine. Once in a while I decide to change up the look of my watches by changing up straps to create new looks to keep them interesting. Recently I purchased a watch that had a poor quality bracelet and I decided instead of buying a new bracelet, I would replace it with a good quality leather band. Now, after browsing through amazon for a few hours, I came across this pair and I really fell in love with the light tan color displayed on the picture. However, I realized that the watch band was from the manufacturer DeBeer. Recently I bought a bracelet from the same company, and it was a very negative experience. Why? Well because the picture used to display the product was complete opposite. The description provided by the company was completely wrong and the quality was way below average (feel free to go to my profile and read that review). Me being a nice person, I decided to give them another try by ordering this product because frankly, everyone makes mistakes once in a while and I honestly thought this would be a good purchase.So after waiting anxiously, my package arrived after four days and I was very excited. As soon as I opened the package and took out the product, Once again I was hit by dissapointment and frustration. Once again they have provided me a product that looked nothing like the picture and the padding was completely different. The color of the band is much darker than the display picture. It is a very feminine orange, sort of a creamy color that is very shiny due to the oil tan finish. However to write a proper review, I decided to inspect the product up close in order to provide an accurate statement of the quality. Well, lets just say I wasn't surprised and I should've expected it. Similar to my previous experience of another product from this company, this strap was also of very poor quality. The bands were very stiff and felt very hard. I can't think how these straps would be comfortable. Just a horrible experience.At the end of the day I am done with this manufacturer. Not only are they overpriced for their poor products, but they also provide inaccurate information and misleading pictures in order to trick consumers into purchasing their products. I understand the price isn't high compared to other brands, however within this price range there are various other companies such as Hadley Roma that provide much higher quality. Also another factor to keep in mind, DeBeer does not pay you for return shipping, even though they provide misleading and inaccurate information. So buyer beware. If you decided to order, keep in mind you will be out five bucks if you decide to return the product.

I am one of the very few people who actually prefer slip on shoes sneakers. I came on amazon to browse for a slip on sneaker that was all black because it is a very versatile color that looks good with anything you decide to wear for the day. After searching for a while I came across these shoes by puma. From the pictures, it looked very nice so I thought to myself why not try it? Considering Puma is a very reputable brand, I ordered without hesitation.Now when I received the package, and took out the shoes, they looked very stylish. However, looks aren't everything and some aspects of the shoes threw me off right away. First of all the shoes are very light in weight, and feels very flimsy. The entire shoe is made of synthetic leather. There isn't any sole in the middle of the shoes that cause them to bend, which can cause injuries to your foot if you live a very active lifestyle. The grip on the sole is also not very good, it can cause you to slip on wet or slippery floors. My job requires me to constantly move around and I have came across many times where I almost slipped. These shoes also run a little small when it comes to sizing. My shoe size is 11 but I usually wear 11.5 for a little breathing room but at 11.5 size, these shoes were a perfect fit on me. So order half a size larger than your normal size for a comfortable fit.These sneakers are very stylish like I've mentioned before. When you wear them, it feels as if the sneaker is a glove for your feet, giving it a very slim and sleek look. However the fit also becomes another con. I have very slim feet and even for me, the fit of the shoe is way too tight and does cause a tight grip around my ankle, causing pain and discomfort. If you however walk around for a while, the grip tend to loosen up a bit and it becomes quiet comfortable but if you stay idle or sit down, the grip tightens up again causing pain and discomfort.At the end of the day if you have slim feet and looking for a sleek sneaker that will look good with skinny jeans or summer wear, then these are great for you. However if you are looking for a comfortable pair of slip on sneakers or do not have slim feet,  avoid this one because you will be highly disappointed.

I am not really a huge fan of leather straps. I usually prefer the looks of bracelets much more. However as a watch enthusiast, I like to change up the look of my watches once in a while to keep things interesting. A good quality leather strap can cost a lot, sometimes over $100. I wasn't looking to spend that much, so I decided to browse amazon to see some selections and what were my options for an affordable pair. Now this was during summer time and I hate when sweat builds up and cause the leather bands to release a horrible smell. After doing some research I came across many who recommended water resistant leather bands which does not absorb sweat and does not cause horrible odors. Of course I did not believe it at first, but considering Hadley Roma is a reputable brand and the price was so low, I decided to purchase this item.My first impression was a very positive one. The leather straps came packaged very well in a clear plastic box, exposing the item. Once I opened up the package and took out the straps, right away I realized the quality was very good. The stitching is done very well and the straps actually taper down from 24MM to 22MM creating a sleek look, that does not create an overpowering presence that takes away from the watch. At first the straps are sort of stiff and will need breaking down for it to be comfortable. After a few days, the straps broke in and became very comfortable to wear. During the summer I wore this strap for long periods of time and not once did it absorb a lot of sweat and cause any sort of odor, so the water resistance coating is very well stitched and done.Overall for the price, I truly believe this product is an absolute steal and if you are in the market for a good pair of leather straps that does not cause odor and also comfortable to wear, consider this one. I highly recommend it!

In a world where technology is advancing every day, we are always introduced with new products. When I first heard of wireless chargers I was astonished by the idea. I kept thinking to myself how is that even possible. Right away I knew it was something that had my interest and I was convinced that I had going to get one. However, wireless chargers tend to be very expensive and sadly I could not afford it. Then came this product from RAVpower. Now at this price you have to be a little skeptical, it's natural to question great deals and sadly I felt the same way. RAVPower decided to reach out to me and offer me a discounted deal to try this product, and that gave me assurance because I respect a company that goes out of its way to back it's products to customers.Within two days the product showed up at my door and I was very excited. My first impression was very positive. The product came packaged beautifully and very securely. When I opened up the packaging and took the wireless charger out, I was thoroughly impressed by the quality and modern look of the product, It is very appealing in person. Now the set up is probably the easiet thing in the world, you do not even need the instruction guide that is provided. All you need to do to get started is to lay down the charging pad, and connect the adapter to the wall. In order to charge your phone, just lay it down on the pad, give it a few seconds, and watch the phone start charging. Now keep in mind not all phones are capable of wireless charging, even very new models such as the Samsung Galaxy S4. Since I am a S4 user, I had to purchase an off market Qi Receiver, which is a very thin pad that you attach on top of your battery on the inside of your phone. They are generally very very cheap and can be bought from amazon. Once the Qi receiver is installed, you are good to go!I have tested this product extensively, putting it under a lot of stress and heavy use this past week. I've charged back to back phones for seven days straight and it is performing flawlessly. Keep in mind since it is wireless charging, your phone will not charge from it as fast as a regular charger. However, the downtime isn't that big off a difference where it is a deal breaker. A traditional charger takes about two hours to charge my S4 completely whereas, the wireless charging takes about three hours. At the end of the day it is a very hassle free way of charging and a very cool concept. Not only is the price one of the best in the market, if not the best for a reliable, durable and beautiful wireless charging pad, but the RAVPower team also provides amazing customer service. For me even if a company has good products and great deals, I will still avoid them if they have mediocre to poor customer service. I've never had any problem with RAVPower products over the past year since I've started using them, however the few times I did reach out to their customer service team with questions, the head product manager took time and took care of me to make sure I was completely satisfied. If you have any worries, put them aside and purchase this product. This is a great company that not only provides amazing deals, but also makes sure that their customer is happy.

As a watch enthusiast, I am always looking for ways to change up the looks of my watches to keep things interesting and the best way to do that is to change straps/bracelets. I have never really liked NATO straps before but for some reason I just decided to come on Amazon and browse through the selection. To be specific, I was looking for an Orange/Black combination and this was the one that was the most appealing to me. Since NATO straps are cheap, I decided to order this one just to try it out. Thanks to Amazon Prime, I received the package the very next day and put it on my watch right away. At first I thought my watch looked a bit funny because I was not used to NATO straps, however I fell in love right away after putting it on.The quality of this NATO is superb. The stitching's are done very precisely and the bracelet is very thin. The three buckles are highly polished and they are of very good quality. The strap was very easy to install and on the wrist it is very comfortable, for the summer days it is perfect. The strap is quiet long and I am sure it will fit anyone's wrist up to 8 1/2 inches. Overall for the money, it is a very good investment and if you are on the edge of purchasing this product, trust me buy it. I am very happy with this product and it has helped me become fond of NATO straps.

Recently the bracelet for my Hamilton Jazzmaster Cushion broke and I decided that instead of switching to a pair of  leather straps I already owned, I was going to replace the bracelet. So I came on Amazon to see what kind of bracelets were being offered in the 24MM measurement and after browsing around for a while, I came to the conclusion that this product was the most appealing and best fit for my watch. Without hesitation, I ordered and waited patiently. The first thing that bothered me was that the company never provided a tracking number and it had me a little worried, but the item did arrive after 3 days. When I received the package I was very excited because the field of horology and collecting watches are a passion of mine, and changing bracelets/straps is a huge but very exciting part of the hobby. I opened the package right away to find the small packaging that included the bracelet. The bracelet was being displayed beautifully on the package but there was a red flag right away. The bracelet was missing the top links on both sides, which means that if you were to put the bracelet on the watch, it would have 2 little holes and expose the spring bars, creating a horrendous look. Another thing that really upset me was that the description provided by the company and listed on Amazon was completely wrong. The description on Amazon states that the outer links are polished and the inside links are done with a brushed finish (Just like the display picture) but the actual bracelet is exactly the opposite, which is the inside links are highly polished and the outer links are done with a brushed finish. The display pictures for the listing is completely wrong and needs to be updated along with the description listed.Even though the bracelet was missing the top two links and the description was completely wrong, I decided to take it out of the package to see if the quality was good in order to provide an accurate review. As soon as I took the bracelet out of the package to inspect it's quality, you guessed it, another huge red flag. First of all, the finishing looks very cheap and I've never seen a bracelet pick up so much fingerprint/dirt so quickly. Second thing, the bracelet was very light and feels very flimsy. Just by holding it, I can tell the links are hollow and would break very easily if they were to be exposed to any kind of harsh stress/contact. To give you an idea, you can expect a bracelet of this caliber from a very cheap watch and that is very disappointing.It's understandable if you get one or two things wrong, but to advertise with pictures and descriptions for a product that is exactly the opposite, it kind of makes me feel like I have been scammed. Not only was I fooled, but the quality of the bracelet is very poor. I know of a few small manufacturers who create bracelets of very good quality, superior quality compared to this product, but charge way less. Not only did I waste time waiting for this product to arrive, I ended up being highly disappointed. I ended up returning this item and it is ironic that the company did not cover the return shipping charges, even though it was a mistake on their part. If you are in the market for a 24MM bracelet, I highly advise you skip this product.

Like many of you out there, when I am taking a shower, I tend to become a genius. I've come across many ideas for work, writing music, and even sometimes for projects involving school. Usually when I do think of such wonderful ideas, I try to keep repeating them in my head so I can remember them once I get out of the shower, but sadly I fail most of the time. Thanks to my wonderful girlfriend, she has purchased this product for me since I always complain to her about how I come up with such great ideas, but always tend to forget them. Well not anymore! This product is absolutely brilliant. It is very compact, easy to install, and not to mention very easy to write on while the water is running. However nothing is perfect. The impermeable cover on the sheets tend to fall off when exposed to moisture for a long time, about a week or so. If you are someone who do not plan on using these regularly, you will need to rip out the front sheet every few weeks because as I have mentioned before because due to the exposure to moisture, the impermeable cover on the sheets will come off, making them non-waterproof. Also a quick suggestion, after your shower is over, I recommend that you give it a bit of time for the sheet to dry up a little because it makes the sheets easier to rip off. If you aren't a regular user, you can also place this product outside of the shower, so they do not get too much water contact. It will make the sheets last much longer. Hopefully I was helpful! If you are someone like me who comes up with great ideas while in the shower, this is a must have for you! A great little invention, I ma a huge fan!

5:03 MinsAs a young watch enthusiast, I do not feel comfortable financially investing in the higher tier watches, however I am slowly building my watch collection by attaining some affordable luxury watches which are true Swiss Made and from a reputable company with a rich history. Now if you do not know of the brand Hamilton, it was originally an American brand but however they are now owned by the Swatch group which is a Swiss watch group that consists of legendary brands such as Longines and Omega. Within the watch community or to watch enthusiasts, Hamilton is a very reputable company and held dear by a lot. Knowing that, I decided to purchase my first Hamilton, however I did not know at the time which model to choose. After browsing through the catalog, I decided my first Hamilton would be something from the Jazzmaster series, and if you are not familiar with the Jazzmaster series, it is basically Hamilton bringing a lot of retro designs back and adding a little modern edge to it to make it very fashionable and appealing to today's world. While browsing through the catalog, I came across this design and it caught my attention right away because of the case shape, which is what the watch is named after, the cushion. Now living in a modern society, you will rarely see in your life someone wearing a cushion shaped watch, and just because of that reason alone, I purchased this watch, for its uniqueness. Of course, there is a lot more to the watch for the price being higher than your average watch, and I will clarify as to why. I will be setting my review up within three categories so you can focus on the aspect that is the most important to you before investing on this watch.Body/Dial - the body is the most important aspect of this watch as we know from the name. It is a very unique shape that will definitely stand out from the crowd and will definitely get you attention. The beautiful cushion shape body has two finishing. The bezel and sides are done with a high polished finish, however the lugs are done with a brushed finish. Hamilton is by one of the superior companies compared to most of the industry when it comes to constructing a case, and they are very well known for it. Once you take the watch out of the box you will find no imperfections, all of the brushed finish is done with every stroke perfectly aligned and the polished finish just looks as if the metal is melting and merging naturally with other parts of the watch. The dial of the watch is absolutely breathtaking which is protected by a beautiful sapphire crystal with an anti-reflective coating on the inside of the crystal. While keeping it simple and retro, Hamilton modernized the watch by adding a smaller sunray dial in the middle while leaving the outer portion matte black.  Most companies or designers would not be able to execute these two entire different looks together, however Hamilton did an outstanding job. The hour markers and the hands are all silver with a very thin layer of luminous material that glow vividly in the dark, but only for a short moment with a full charge. Since it is a dress watch, the lack of lume is quiet understandable. The date is presented in the inner sun ray dial by the 3 o clock position. The back of the case has an exhibition case back, which means the the case back has a mineral crystal exposing the movement of the watch, letting you see the watch in action.The measurements of the bodyCase Diameter - 43MM but wears quiet larger, close to 45MM due to it being a cushion case.Case Thickness - About 12MMLug Width - 24MMMovement - The stock movement for this watch is the legendary ETA 2824-2. Now if you are not a watch enthusiast, you might be wondering to yourself, what the heck is that? Well for the people who are not very knowledgeable about movements, the ETA 2824 is considered to be a high grade automatic movement produced by ETA which is a manufacturer based in Switzerland. ETA is also part of the swatch watch group and known to be the largest Swiss movement manufacturer in the world. The ETA 2824 is a high caliber movement that is used by many companies that are producing high end Swiss watches, some coming in around $2,000 to $4,000. So what is so special about this movement? Well first of all an automatic movement requires no battery and it is purely mechanical that consists of hundred of micro components which are put together by bare hands, they are considered to be a pure work of art by many, that is why the cost of automatics are so high. The ETA 2824 consists of 25 jewels to add beauty to the movement but mainly to add more accuracy. Lower end automatic movements vibrate at about 21,600VPH whereas, the ETA 2824 performs at 28,800VPH. Now why is vibration so important? Well the higher the VPH of a movement, the more accurate it will be, not to mention the second hand will also be much more fluid and create a wonderful smooth sweeping motion across the dial. Over a week of having this watch, it is running about +10 seconds fast, which is remarkable for an automatic movement. The power reserve of this movement is about 42 hours fully winded, what that means is that if you keep the watch outside of a winder or do not wear it, the watch will have enough power to run for about 2 days. Keep in mind that the ETA 2824 has 3 variations that it comes in. First variation is the standard, which ETA supplies to most companies outside to the Swatch group that keeps time within 30 seconds per day and then there is the elaborated version, which is an improved version to keep more accurate time, within 7 seconds per day. Then there is the highest grade which is COSC certified, keeping time within 4 seconds a day. This watch comes stocked with a standard ETA 2824-2 but it can be regulated to be much more accurate.Bracelet - The bracelet of the watch is absolutely stunning visually, however in terms of quality, it was the one problem I had with the entire watch. Before my complains on the bscelet, lets focus on the positive aspects. Even though the bracelet is on the thicker side at 24MM, the bracelet actually plays very well on the wrist because of its slim feature. The outer links of the bracelet are highly polished and the inside links have a beautiful brushed finish. Both finishes are done flawlessly and looks absolutely stunning on the wrist, a real wow factor. Hamilton is very generous when it comes to the bracelet size. Unsized, the bracelet will easilt fit a wrist up to 8 1/2 inches. The weight is very light of the bracelet and that is where my only complain comes in. Hamilton is known to make decent bracelets but could do better for a brand that is considered to be luxurious by many. Instead of using screwed pins, the links are held together using friction pins, which are not as durable and known to break in the long run. Even though the bracelet isn't of the highest quality, the light weight actually balances the watch very well on your wrist and it is very comfortable overall. Since this watch comes in different variations with a leather strap, I am sure you can order the leather straps directly from Hamilton if you end up not liking the bracelet. However, I would always buy the bracelet variation over the leather strap variation just because lesther straps are much affordable to acquire compared to a good bracelet.At the end of the day this is a wonderful watch from a very prestigious brand with a very rich history. Hamilton is recognized around the world by many. For the price, you are not only getting the name and prestige, but also you are getting a legendary movement paired with a beautifully crafted time piece that is very unique and bound to turn heads while worn in public. In this price range, I cannot think of a better watch and I truly believe this is a true bang for the buck, a steal almost. Keep in mind from an authorized dealer, you will be paying the full retail price of $875, however thanks to amazon you are getting access to the most reputable online grey dealers who can offer you a much better price. After reading everything if you are still on the fence on whether to purchase this watch or not, trust me, go for it.Hopefully my review helped! If you have any question, comment or concer, always feel free to reach out to me because I am always up for a chat!

In a society where mobile technology dominates, we are all accustomed to balance our life around our cell phones. From being a student to a person being involved in a professional career, we all need to use our mobile devices on a regular basis for various tasks. Sadly, nothing is perfect and as we all know from personal experience, battery power on mobile devices are very poor. However, there is always solutions to a problem, and this product happens to be a great one. For those who do not have much knowledge on what is a power bank, well it is a small device that has the capacity to store electricity, which enables you to charge your mobile devices anywhere on the go. It is such an important device because it gives you a peace of mind and now you will never have to worry about losing your phone's battery life while in the middle of an important task.Now before I wrote this review, I decided to put this device under very rough usage over a span of 3 weeks in order to test it's durability and performance. I wanted to make sure if you ended up purchasing this product, that you would get a solid Power Bank that would serve it's purpose over a long period of time. Before I get into the specifications, I would like to take a moment and talk about the construction and build of the product. First of all, the product comes packaged very well in a small white box. As soon as you pick up the box, you can feel the weight of the product, and yes it is a bit on the heavy side but it is to be expected since is a high capacity power bank. Once you open the box, you see the item placed by itself and the presentation is quiet nice and simple actually. The product itself is very well built with a thick plastic body and it is a great fit in the hand due to it's compact size. Even though at first it is only a piece of plastic box in your hand, you can actually pull out 3 different types of connectors from the sides which are used for different devices. The main connector is the 30 Pin connector made for apple products, but that is to be expected since this product was made mainly for Apple products. However, the other two connectors are for devices that require an USB plug-in or a micro-USB connector for devices such as the Samsung Galaxy Series or many different digital cameras. The coolest aspect of this gadget is that it has 5 mini bright LED lights that show's the capacity left. Each light represents 20%.Now on to the performance, as I have stated before, I put this device under very rough usage over a span of 3 weeks. To clarify, I have charged this to it's full capacity and drained it's entire capacity every single day. Since I do not own an iPhone, I let my girlfriend test the product for me under my conditions for a span of a week and a half. According to her observation, the device charged her iPhone completely from 0% about 3 times in one full charge. For each full charge for her phone, it took the device about 1 1/2 hours or 90 mins. Considering that she was on the go, it is a really quick charge while leaving the device connected to the phone in your bag. You are also able to use your phone while the device is charging it.Of course I wanted to do another week and a half of testing on my own to make sure her observations and the device was going to provide similar results for me. Since I do not have an iPhone, I decided to test the battery on two separate devices that I own, and they are the Samsung Galaxy S4 and the iPad 3. First of all, unlike the iPhone 4 my girlfriend used for testing, The galaxy S4's battery has about 33% more capacity, coming in at 2600maAh. So for the product to be successful, I expected the device to charge my phone completely about 2 times per full charge. I am glad to say after testing the product constantly for another week and a half, the device was able to charge my phone completely 2 times from a full charge every day and it took roughly two hours to charge my phone completely. So after 3 weeks of brutal testing, I decided to test it's ability to charge the iPad 3. From one full charge, it was able to charge my iPad 3 from 0 to 70% within three hours.It is ironic how I came across this product before but ignored it because it is manufactured by a company I have never heard of, however after trying this product I must say this is an absolute steal for the price and performance. Over the last couple of months RAVPower has really impressed me with their amazing customer service and their solid built products. This device was given to me as a sample to provide an honest review and I must say, I am quiet impressed. If you are in the market for a high capacity power bank for your mobile devices, don't even bother looking at the much more expensive power banks, purchase this one. I have tested it under rough circumstances and it withheld and did it's job, just a wonderful product!

I am the type of person that never carries around money but always my card. Ever since I have been introduced to wallet cases, it has been a huge bonus for me. Instead of carrying a wallet in one pocket and a phone on the other, now I can save much more space by having a case that acts as both. I am going to be setting up this review in different categories in order to give you a better idea of what you can expect.Body - The stitchings are done very well and the materials are of good quality. The outer portion of the case is stitched with Polyurethane leather, which gives you a solid feel, but also makes it very versatile because it is much more durable than normal leather and tear and wear won't cheapen the overall look like pure leather would. The inside of the case is padded to gives your phone extra protection just in case an accident were to happen. Inside of the cover there are 3 Slots for cards or money, whichever you prefer to store. The case stays close with a magnetic flap that closes on its own to keep the case shut, which is a big plus. Most flip covers does not have this magnetic flap mechanism and tends to move around enabling dirt and small particles to enter, which can end up scratching the screen of your phone. However, this case stays shut very well and provides great protection. The best aspect of this case that is not listed is that this phone is actually a Smart Cover. Just because it does not have the S Window, it is hard to notice that it does function as a Smart Cover. Now if you are not sure what a Smart Cover is, it is basically a cover that puts your phone on stand by when you close the case, putting it to standby mode enabling you to save battery. Great case!PROS- Smart Cover.- Built and stitched very well.- Padded to provide extra protection.- Auto closing magnetic flap, keeps the case closed.- Stores 3 Cards or money in the slots.Cons- Adds a bit if thickness, but not close to being a deal breaker.Overall this is a wonderful case that has features most expensive flip wallet cases do not. It is an absolute steal at this price and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a case similar to this one!If you have any questions or concerns, I highly urge you to contact me. I am always up for a chat!

I am somewhat of an unordinary child. Growing up, I always used to read about watches and movements from magazines around the house. About a while back, I picked up an issue of watch time and absolutely fell in love. They covered many watches in the affordable range and also gave me us an inside look at the very prestigious brands that I could never afford, but it was nice to get a glimpse of the work of arts. It was very well balanced, many articles for every collector. However, recently the issues have shifted towards the luxury brands and completely ditched the affordable watches. Watch time shifted from being a balanced magazine to a much more high end watch magazine for the rich. It is still a fun magazine to pick up and read about various aspects of the watch industry, however if you are someone like me who cannot afford the big names just yet and appreciate collecting and reading upon affordable watches, then you will be disappointed with Watch Time.It is still a fun read at the end of the day. If you are someone such as me who loves reading on horology  and gaining new knowledge, then you will still appreciate watch time. If you are someone who prefers variety, and an inside look at the more affordable watches, then you are better off not subscribing.

In our current generation, almost everyone has a smart phone. Smart phones have become an essential part of our lives and they are under constant usage for everyday tasks. It's amazing to think such a small device can perform at such a high level and be able to support so many aspects of our lives. Now, every thing has a power source, and sadly smart phones still lack a very good battery life. However thankfully, there are a few alternatives to tackle this issue. Some prefer to carry around a power bank, which can be used to charge your phone anywhere and some prefer to carry around an extra fully charged battery, which is what I prefer.This High capacity Li-ion battery is from the manufacturer RavPower. Now prior to this item, I've had no experience with this company, so I did not know what to expect. Considering the price range for this 2800mAh battery, I honestly did not have high hopes. Once I received the item in the mail, I opened it up right away and was quiet surprised at the packaging, it as very well done. I decided to take out the stock battery that came with my Samsung Galaxy S4, and popped in the new battery by RavPower. The battery already came halfway charged, however I was astonished as to how fast the battery charged to it's full capacity.  Usually it takes me about 30-40 minutes to charge my S4's stock battery from half to full capacity, whereas this battery only took somewhere between 20-25 minutes, that's quiet an improvement. Another reason to consider this battery is, the stock battery is 2600mAh, whereas this battery comes at 2800mAh. Without the technical terms, what it really mean is that you will get a little bit more battery life out of this product.I was given this product as a sample to test after I came to an agreement with RavPower's product manager that I would provide an honest review of my experience, even if it were to be a negative one. After speaking to the product manager, I can assure you that this company has a great staff standing behind their products and provides great customer service. I mention that because this product comes with a no question asked 30 days money back guarantee and a year long warranty to replace the product free of charge if it were to break down. Many companies state such claims but fails to provide them, however that will not be the case with RavPower. After testing this product out, I recommend it to you with confidence and I am sure you will enjoy it as much as I did. If you have any questions or concern, please feel free to contact me. I am always up for a chat!

I just bought this machine for a friend for an early Christmas present. We bought from JoAnn's because it gives a free lesson plus she can take it in for repairs or any kind of question she has. I have the 7258 which is the same machine but did not come with nice extras like the extension table and walking foot like this one does. I sat with my friend while the salesperson went over all of the features plus she showed her how to use all of the feet that came with it. The 2 best features are the auto tension and needle up or down. (so important if you are turning square corners). I highly recommend this machine. I buy a lot from Amazon and they have the best return policy, bar none, but my friend needed extra instructions because she is new to sewing.

The forward to this book is promising. It states that this book consists of two lectures given by the illustrious Italian political philosopher Giorgio Agamben at a seminar at Stanford University concerning civil war on October 2001. The subtitle for this book is “Civil War as a Political Paradigm,” promised to be an illuminating read of Agamben presenting his theory of civil war following the cataclysmic changes wrought by 9/11.This is not what the book is about, sort of. The book consists of two lectures alright, but one lecture describes civil war in ancient Greece and the other is (sort of) about civil war according to Thomas Hobbes.The first lecture concerns civil war in ancient Greece. Essentially civil war was considering to be an inter-family dispute and struggle, not surprising considering the close-net nature of society in Greece at that time. Fairly straightforward.The second lecture concerns civil war according to the political philosophy of Hobbes. While the subject of civil war is mentioned, of course, but the main focus of Agamben is on other matters. But that’s okay. Agamben’s discussion of those other matters is probably more interesting.I would say the main focus of the second lecture is the decipherment of the famous engraving of the first edition of the Leviathan which graces many, if not most, modern editions of the work.  This engraving is packed symbols containing esoteric meaning which can be understood only with reference to Hobbes’ philosophy, and, according to Agamben, made according to his express instructions.As I indicated, this is the most interesting part of the book. Political philosophers such as Carl Schmitt have expounded on the meaning of the symbolisms in the frontpiece of the Leviathan. Agamben even talks about why Hobbes’ work was even so named. The Leviathan, after all, is the Biblical anti-Christ and arch-demon. Was this Hobbes’ opinion about the rough and tumble nature of everyday politics? Agamben does not provide any answers but plenty to think about.When Agamben returns to the subject of civil war, the purported topic of this book, it can be understood only with reference to the general philosophy of Hobbes. Here, Agamben might lose the general reader or those not intimately familiar with Hobbes’ political philosophy. I have more than a passing knowledge of Hobbes but I had to stop reading this book to consult Wikipedia and re-familiarize myself with Hobbes’ philosophy. Be that as it may, broadly considered, civil war for Hobbes was considered a struggle between the population in a state of nature (called the “multitude”) and the population who have conceded power to the sovereign (“People”).As with the other matters, Agamben does provide any answers and this is not a definitive book about the nature of civil war. It does provide plenty of food for thought and is a good start for those interested in political philosophy. Therefore, highly recommended.

Everyone is familiar with the triple-LP, double-CD, Live Europe 72 from the Grateful Dead.  The songs selected for this collection represented a mere fraction from their 1972 European Tour. The tour covered twenty venues. Rhino Records released the complete recordings from this tour, in seventy-three CDs, in 2011, in a limited edition  suitcase, and later as an ordinary box set. These collections instantly became a collector’s items, and if one is lucky enough to find one online, the collector’s suitcase edition alone will run almost one thousand dollars. Rhino released individual concerts on CD, but even these are becoming difficult to find. Finally, these concerts are now available for download.This “concert” represents a change of pace. After beginning the first leg of the Continental portion of their European Tour, the band appeared on German television. The occasion was an appearance at the Beat Club, in Bremen, Germany. The telecast last a little in excess of one hour, and it featured many of the songs they would perform, had performed, in other concerts in their European tour, but in abbreviated form. Without the luxury of playing a stadium or an audience for upwards of three hours and more, the band largely performed tight, economical versions of those same songs, without the occasional jamming or improvisations. What improves were executed were understated and pointed.There were some bumps along the road, however. The band experienced a false start with Playin in the Band where there erupted a shrill burst of feedback emitting from one of the speakers. Then, later, with Truckin there was another false start. Sensing that something wasn’t right, and also that they were on television, JC deftly plays the chords of a melody from William Tell before stopping the song. Oh, the virtues of live television! The band soldiered on with Truckin, however, leading the way to a twenty-minute rendition of The Other One. What kind of a Grateful Dead concert would it be without an extended jam of Dark Star, The Other One, or both?The jam ends abruptly on the tape and does not reflect any banter between the band and whatever audience happened to be there. No doubt there were some songs not recorded for posterity. The band had played Loser and Black Throated Wind during the soundcheck. These songs are not on this CD. What is, however, on the CD is a good capsulated version of the band during this tour.Before purchasing other concerts from this tour, newcomers purchase or download this CD to get a good flavor of what is to come.

Most are familiar with the story of Grace Kelly, the American Academy Award winning actress who married the Prince of Monaco. If the newspaper accounts at the time are to be believed, they lived happily ever after, a story-book ending for the fairy-princess.According to Grace of Monaco, all was not well in story-book land.In was 1961 and there was plenty of drama and palace intrigue behind the glitter and glitz of royal life.Grace Kelly, conflicted and dissatisfied with royal life, wanted to return making pictures, at least to star in Marnie, a role Alfred Hitchcock offered to her. Grace believed Ranier did not appreciate her.  This may have been true. Ranier was preoccupied with his neighbor, France. France was fighting a war in Algeria and pressured Monaco, a small dot of a principality on the Mediterranean, to impose an income tax on its subjects and forward the revenues to France.  Or else. Or else France would invade, take over Monaco and depose Prince Ranier. If this  weren’t enough, it was discovered that the sister of Prince Ranier was betraying him by being a spy for France.A quote allegedly from Grace Kelly herself at the beginning of the movie summed it up: The story of the fairy tale princess is itself a fairy tale.The main performances are strong in this picture. Tim Roth plays Prince Ranier, regal, of course, but with a hair-trigger temper. In one scene a French diplomat was slurring Grace Kelly and Roth/Ranier cracked him across the face. Nicole Kidman plays Grace Kelly, who plays the role with appropriate ...  um,  ... grace.Some of the supporting characters are throw-aways. Frank Langella, who is ordinarily a fine actor, has a weak role in this movie, and yes, I’m afraid to say that Derek Jacobi’s role was wasted. But the performances and events they describe are enough to bear repeated viewing.

Everyone is familiar with the triple-LP, double-CD, Live Europe 72 from the Grateful Dead.  The songs selected for this collection represented a mere fraction from their 1972 European Tour. The tour covered twenty venues.Rhino Records released the complete recordings from this tour, in seventy-three CDs, in 2011, in a limited edition  suitcase, and later as an ordinary box set. These collections instantly became a collector’s items, and if one is lucky enough to find one online, the collector’s suitcase edition alone will run almost one thousand dollars. Rhino released individual concerts on CD, but even these are becoming difficult to find. Finally, these concerts are now available for download.The previous occasion the band played this venue was a bit rocky, with the band apparently perplexed at a lackadaisical audience. Perhaps to liven the set the band played a tune infrequently included in concerts, let alone used as an opening number, Cold Rain and Snow. This first number was typical of their first step. Lively, upbeat performances without drama. Their first set closed with Black-Throated Wind” to a more enthusiastic applause.The second set began with Casey Jones. In the same way, the band’s rendition of tunes such as Sugaree and Playin in the Band were performed with verve. A novelty in this second set was that the band buried a song they usually reserve for an encore number, One More Saturday Night. The band was apparently more at ease this time around in Tivoli, and it showed in the audience’s response. After they played El Paso in this second set, the audience gave the band an especially long and appreciative applause.In general, these and the other songs in this concert were done more or less in a straightforward manner, with no great guitar flourishes or melodious cascades up and down the bass fret. The band could be forgiven for this straight up performance, considering their previous concert at Aarhus University saw them play with single-unit abandon.Weir wearily said the band was going to “take a short break” at the end of their second set. When they returned to their third set, they employed an incredible intro before getting into their Dark Star medley. It started with JC’s guitar dueting with the piano keyboards, Lesh’s bass entering soon thereafter. Weir and Kreutzman on the drums contribute subtle, understated flourishes here and there, and for the next half hour the four instruments communicate with each other, one playing off the other. Really, it is one of the best Dark Stars in this tour. After traveling the reaches of outer space, the band returned back to earth with peppy Sugar Magnolia. The band segues into an improvised bit of jamming called Caution (Do Not Stop on the Tracks). Things must have been going well with the crowd, because they ended with Johnny B. Good, the only time they played this song in the tour.All in all, it was a good concert and I wish I could have been there.Next stop is Germany for a change of pace.

With the appearance of the Islamic State (or ISIS, ISIL, IS, ISI, or Deash)  —  this is how they want to be known and this is how the author refers to them  —  there have been a plethora of books on the subject. These books cover the political spectrum, and they vary greatly in informational value.This is the best book on the Islamist State for one reason: It strives to be, and largely succeeds in being, one of the most objective accounts of this group.The Islamic State is a digital caliphate. What sets them apart from other terrorist groups is their technological know-how. They skillfully navigate the back channels of the dark internet to recruit soldiers, obtain financing, move money, conduct cyber-intelligence, or hack internet or bank accounts. Without the internet, Atwan tells us, the Islamic State could not exist.This book introduces us to the shadowy world of international terrorism and crime and is more powerful than any book of fiction. The IS has media savvy and an incredible technological knowledge of the internet. They know how to propagate their views to produce the greatest effect to the largest number of people. The immolation of the Jordanian airpilot was a good example. The brutality of the airman’s death shocked both the Western and Islamic world and was their way of saying using shock and awe methods that they are in the Middle East to stay.While the subtitle indicates that they are the digital caliphate, a good part of the book, perhaps one third, concerns the origins of the Islamic State. Russian President Vladimir Putin has stated that the United States is responsible for creating the IS when it completely destabilized Iraq following its invasion. According to Atwan this is only partially correct. Other factors such as the civil war in Syria and internal strive within Muslim jihadists contributed to the birth of IS.The main promoter of the Islamic State, the author tells us, is our most intimate, stable, ally in the Middle East, Saudi Arabia, who consistently and regularly funnels millions of dollars, not only to the IS, but to other terrorist groups.This book contains real information. The Islamic State has displayed a savagery, ferocity, and brutality that has shocked both the West and the Middle East. But the Islamic State is not just an ad-hoc bunch of unruly thugs. For all intents and purposes, the Islamic State is a de facto nation state. The territory under IS control covers the area greater than that of Great Britain and over 9 million people. It issues its own currency; it revived the monetary unit of the Mediaeval Caliphate, the golden dinar. It issues passports; requires vehicles within its territory to display Islamic State license plates; has its own flag, and coat of arms. Islamic State soldiers even have their own salute; ironically, it is the same salute Sasha Baron Cohen’s character used in The Dictator  —  the right index finger pointing upwards. The IS areas have a working postal system and a functional governmental and judicial system.It has a treasury with millions and millions of dollars. Widespread news accounts indicated that when IS besieged Mosul, the Iraqi national troops fled and left an enormous cache of cash, one-half billion — that’s a “b” — dollars, and military equipment. Atwan relates that this year the IS published its first annual budget: $2 billion.Areas under IS control have a functional governmental It is particularly ironic that in an area of incredible internal instability, law and order reign — if not under the constant threat and implementation of Sharia law — in areas controlled by the Islamic State. IS has taken control of oil fields and sell the oil on the open market, collecting the revenues from the confiscated fields.This book is helpful even for news junkies such as this reviewer, to explain the dire situation in the Middle East and clarify the sometimes confusing inter-connections between the terrorist groups.

Everyone is familiar with the triple-LP, double-CD, Live Europe 72 from the Grateful Dead.  The songs selected for this collection represented a mere fraction from their 1972 European Tour. The tour covered twenty venues.Rhino Records released the complete recordings from this tour, in seventy-three CDs, in 2011, in a limited edition  suitcase, and later as an ordinary box set. These collections instantly became a collector’s items, and if one is lucky enough to find one online, the collector’s suitcase edition alone will run almost one thousand dollars. Rhino released individual concerts on CD, but even these are becoming difficult to find. Finally, these concerts are now available for download.The band began this concert following playing in another venue before an appreciative but ultimately indecisive audience in  Tivoli Hall three days earlier. Playing there must surely had been a frustrating experience, because while the band played as expertly as always, it seems they did not know where they stood with the audience, given its response to the music. Here, they knew they were plying in front of a student crowd — a university student crowd no less — so the band undoubtedly felt more secure and within their element. Knowing the audience would be more responsive, the band played accordingly.In general the numbers featured in this concert were played with a greater degree of musicality. That is to say, the arraignments were more complex, played with their usual sense of abandon, but with obvious great care in how they played.If JC’s guitar dominated the previous concert, here Phil Lesh’s bass lines dominate. This concert is a fine example of Lesh using his bass in providing the bottom while at the same time using it as an improvisational instrument in its own right. This concert is a fine of example of his musical skills. The keyboard lines from Pig Pen are also prominent. While in the previous concert JC’s guitar was piercing and searing, here it is muted and proceeds in the background with a warm fuzzy phatt tone, making ample use of the wah-wah peddle. All told, this concert produced an enjoyable version of their playing where all elements in the band are in balance and no one instrument dominates.Playing in the Band opens with a unique, extended intro and proceeds with complex, intricate solos, guitar and keyboard taking turns doing their own improvisations, a mini medley as it were.The band gets into their improvisational jamming soon thereafter. The third number undertaken was a twenty-minute jam of Good Lovin’.This concert displayed one of the finest closing numbers of the tour. Following Truckin’ the band falls into a spacey, twelve-minute improvisational jam, entitled simply, “Jam.” After a short interlude rendition of  The Other One, the band switched to a standard uptempo version of Me and My Uncle, returned to The Other One, then moved to Not Fade Away, changing to an impassioned version of Goin Down the Road Feelin Bad, and returned once more to Not Fade Away. Fifty five minutes of sheer joy, tampered by deft, flawless performances. The audience went wild.There was no encore apparently. Weir simply said in closing, “See ya,” and left, even though the audience clearly wanted more. There was good reason for their abrupt closing. On the next day, the 17th, the band was scheduled to play in their previous Denmark venue, Tivoli Hall.

Everyone is familiar with the triple-LP, double-CD, Live Europe 72 from the Grateful Dead.  The songs selected for this collection represented a mere fraction from their 1972 European Tour. The tour covered twenty venues.Rhino Records released the complete recordings from this tour, in seventy-three CDs, in 2011, in a limited edition  suitcase, and later as an ordinary box set. These collections instantly became a collector’s items, and if one is lucky enough to find one online, the collector’s suitcase edition alone will run almost one thousand dollars. Rhino released individual concerts on CD, but even these are becoming difficult to find. Finally, these concerts are now available for download.This concert follows the band’s three dates in England, two at the Wembley Empire Pool and one at the City Hall in Newcastle. Newcastle is in the extreme northern border of England, almost at the Scottish border. Given air travel in 1972, it was certainly a long trip to Denmark. I don’t think the band was prepared for what was in store for them in this next venue.Their opening number, Bertha, was lively and uptempo. The band played peppy and uptempo throughout. The band, however, appeared to be befuddled by the response from the audience. We do not know exactly how the audience reacted with only an audio recording existing: The audience clearly enjoyed the music as their whistles and voices of approval can be heard on the recording, but early in the concert Weir asked the audience, “How many [in the audience] can understand what we are saying?” looks at the response from the audience and then dismissively states, “Not very many.” Finally he says, “You [the audience] can do anything you want, sit, whatever,” before getting back to the music. My guess is that the audience was simply sitting in their seats and not dancing around as is the wont of the typical GD audience.Perhaps due to their perceived language barrier, the band performed generally straight renditions of the repertoire, carefully singing the words.  Short of a tell-all autobiography we will perhaps never know the dynamics of this concert.Then, perhaps to shake the perceived passivity of the audience, the band launches into an incredible one-hour set consisting of Dark Star, followed by Sugar Magnolia, then with two different parts of Good Lovin sandwiching a rendition of Caution. The audience gave their polite yet fervent applause.After Ramblin Rose, the band offered another mini medley consisting of Going Down the Road and Feelin Bad, with improvisations of Not Fade Away on either side.The band closed with a closing number which will be used for most venues of this tour — One More Saturday Night.So while the concert perhaps got off to a rocky start, but both the band and the audience appeared satisfied with the gig. In two days the band will play another spot in Denmark, Aarhus University.

This year the Magna Carta will be 800 years old. To celebrate this event, David Carpenter has presented what will surely become the definitive edition.For anyone reading the document without its historical context, the MC is a puzzling, mysterious document. Yet, there is no other more important single document in Anglo-American jurisprudence. For example, without the language in the document, the Fifth, Fourteenth or Fifteenth Amendments to the Constitution, arguably the most important in American law, would never have had been devised. Carpenter brings new life to the Magna Carta, giving the general reader the understanding of why the Charter was written and explaining the historical context within which it was written for the modern reader.This book has enough academic content to satisfy scholars, but also written to attract the widest possible readership with a popular, extensive history of the life and times of the king which created the need to have a “Great Charter,” King John I.The beginning book contains a short description of the available manuscripts of the Magna Carta. This may be of interest mainly for academics. Thereafter Carpenter presents a translation of the Magna Carta, with the original Latin on the opposite page.What follows is the real innovation of this edition. Carpenter gives a detailed historical account of King John and the events which lead to the signing of the Magna Carta, events which occurred both in and outside England, and the application of the historical background to the signing of the Charter. This account is rendered in a lively, non-academic voice. The historical material is written with constant reference to the Magna Charta and serves as a detailed commentary of the contents.Carpenter brings the life the life and times of King John, who surely was an errasable personality. If not for him — and mismanagement of the Kingdom  — future generations would have never the Magna Charta.

Anyone who has followed this film on the internet or who reads some of the other reviews in this website will know this movie has generated a lot of buzz. This is not the usual movie hype which follows a popular film. It is that rare film -- and there truly are not a lot of these films -- in which the audience projects its own opinions, beliefs and positions onto the film, so much so that the film becomes a reflection of its audience.  So when the audience comments on the film, it says more about the person making the comment than the film.On one end of the spectrum, you have the comments from the Left. Sonali Kohatker calling the main character a "Psychopath." Bill Maher saying that the film should have been called, "Psychopath Patriot." Seth Rogen will compare it to the Nazi sniper on "Inglorious Basterds." The Guardian saying that the movie was about a "hate-filled killer." ...  And, of course the infamous comment from Michael Moore saying the protagonist was a coward.Jane Fonda, once the leftist pin-up girl, said the movie showed the problems veterans have in adjusting to civilian life, much like the protagonist in "Coming Home."The Huffington Post on the one hand says the movie "sanitizes" a "bone-headed war" and is "dangerous propaganda," and on the other hand comments that the movie exposes still unresolved issues about the Iraq War.On the Right end of the spectrum there are comments from Vice-President Biden who "teared up" at the ending. Sara Palin called all who panned the film "pansies."  CNN called the movie a "pro-military masterpiece."Fox News answers the movie's critics in saying the film is much more nuanced in displaying the horrors of war and more effectively than most movies in showing how combat will affect humans with all of their faults and frailties.Real American snipers also say that the movie sanitizes the war, but for a different reason. The real war was actually much more horrible. Clint Eastwood, the director, calls Amercan Sniper an "anti-war film."All of these comments apply to "American Sniper", and at the same time none of them do. This is not a simple war movie; it is a movie about one person's personal mission to fight in the Iraq War. It works on different levels. The scenes about actual engagement with the population in Iraq and the combat scenes are intense, nearly unbearable. This intensity is increased because the engagement and combat is viewed through the eyes of the protagonist. The focus is always on Chris Kyle, who fights for patriotic reasons, but at the same time is incredibly conflicted about his mission. This is not remote-control killing through drone warfare. He always sees the face -- or at least the figure -- of his victim, so his mental anguish is palpable. His visceral conflict accounts for the strong comments from both sides of the political spectrum.This movie does what every great movie should do: touch a nerve and spark comment. This movie will change your viewpoints and after seeing the film you will not be the same person. It will affect your outlook on war and peace. You will leave the theater and wonder at how superficial is the everyday life so much of us lead.This movie is Eastwood's masterpiece.

Let it Be is a difficult film to watch. The Beatles were once on top of the world. Young, cocky, truly appearing to be enjoying their success, by 1969, they were mentally and spiritually burned out.John was nursing a serious heroin habit. He only found satisfaction in the drug and in his new-found love interest, Yoko Ono. He seemed uninterested in making music, and as you watch him in this picture, when he is lucid, he is secretly waiting for the right moment to break away from the group.George was disgruntled. Frustrated at not being allowed to display his talents in the group, he was harboring deep resentments at the main songwriters, Lennon and McCartney, for holding him back. That sullen look you see in George's face is genuine. The "highlight" of the film is the argument he had with Paul. The result of that argument was George leaving the group for a few days until the other band members begged him to return. By the time the film was being made George had a cache of songs, and as you watch this film, he was secretly thinking what he can do with these songs. Of course, these songs became his three-LP album, All Things Must Pass, which was released after the Beatles broke up.Ringo is just Ringo, but he also left the band for a few days during the filming of this movie. The  distant look in his face is his attempt to distance himself from all the drama in the group.And then we have Paul. He is the only member of the band happy to be a Beatle. In this film he is constantly trying to lift the spirits of his band mates, mostly without success. On the surface, he appears to be a total control freak. This might very well be the case. But the spirits of the other members were so down, it is difficult to tell what were the real dynamics.The Grey Eminence, the Darth Vader of the group was Yoko Ono. She was not liked by most Beatle fans and despised by the other band members. This reviewer's memory when seeing this film for the first time in the theater was that someone emitted an audible hiss when the camera first panned on her face.For the longest time this movie was not available on DVD. For good reason. The four people we see on the screen are not the happy-go-lucky youths running down a street, chased by fans, nor the young lads peddling their bikes on a Carribean island. It is a depressing film, a documentary about the break-up of a band.See it for the Rooftop Concert. All the in-fighting, grumbling, and drama were forgotten, and for one brief moment it must have felt like old times. And so it will for you, watching the Beatles perform for the last time. Perhaps they were so happy because they knew, secretly, it would be their last concert, and they wanted the last one to be a good one, and create the magic they were known for, in a concert they will and should be remembered.

This is the Road movie to end all Road movies. There are two main characters: Bruno, a movie projector repairman who lives in his van and whose job requires him to travel all over Germany repairing movie projectors in small-town theaters, and Robert, who is depressed, estranged from his father, his marriage on the rocks, and whose life is a mess. The two meet when Robert, depressed, makes a half-hearted effort to kill himself, drives his car in a river.The movie is set in the rural villages of Germany of the 1970s, in what surely must now be as long-gone as the areas around Route 66 in the United States. The dialogue is minimal, the scenes of the German villages are lovingly depicted, and camera pans of rural Germany are long and expansive. Wenders was making a statement in this movie. This movie is about self-discovery, both for the characters involved as well as the German countryside Wenders must have known and knew was vanishing.For years, this early masterpiece was not available in DVD. The only copies which could be had were cumbersome two-pack VHS tapes. This DVD is remastered and the black and white cinematography has a crisp, sharp picture, unlike the graininess of the original. In many ways, the murkiness of the original print was a perfect match for the existential struggles experienced by main characters though the picture.While this is a Road movie, it has none of the destructiveness, self and otherwise, of Easy Rider, a movie which heavily influenced Wenders. Every character, major and minor, live in a quiet desperation and Bruno and Robert, while traveling throughout the country, attempt to resolve their anxiety and inner demons as best they can. While there is no final resolution from the film, any conclusion that may be drawn can be obtained from the original title of this movie, Im Lauf in Zeit, meaning, "in the course of time."The ONLY drawback is that this movie is available only in a PAL format, and will not play in DVD players formatted for the United States and Canada markets. This movie is a good excuse to find a serviceable region-free player and savor this marvelous film.

In addition to being an eminent philosopher, Slavoj Zizek is also a well-known Marxist theoretician and cultural commentator. Thus, a book about the crisis in global capitalism from a Marxist perspective, from a legitimate Marxist philosopher no less, raises the expectation of new insights into the crisis from a noted social philosopher. Sadly, this is not the case.Nowadays, writings on the crisis in capitalism are nothing new. This book is unique in that this is the most direct statement from Slavoj ZIzek on capitalism.The "Paradise" is the promise Fukuyama outlined of the End of History following the downfall of the Soviet Union, discredited by the turn of historical events at the hands of the Neocons for whom the doctrine was addressed. The "Trouble" refers to a movie by Ernst Lubitsch.On the contrary, the "trouble" is the manner in which ZIzek is presents his thesis. In his own inimitable style, Slavoj Zizek examines the present state of global capitalism. Based on lectures given in South Korea, Zizek discusses the crisis in capitalism in medical and faux medical terms of diagnosis, cardiognsis,  prognosis and epignosis. The diagnosis, the present state, cardiognosis (his term), and prognosis, "what is to be done." He also offers his epignosis, a term borrowed from theology, what the new capitalism looks like.Zizek says that the cure of the crisis in capitalism comes not from capitalism but from communism. A daring hypothesis but one never fully or systematically discussed in the book. He is very vague on this cure. As in previous endeavors, Zizek frequently diverts into cultural observations and such musings are distracting. And so in Trouble in Paradise he makes frequent social and cultural commentary between discussing the crisis in global capitalism. These cultural diversions actually supplement, rather than detract, from the point Zizek is attempting to make.His analysis of the crisis in capitalism, however, is unremarkable and unfocused. The "analyses" are scattered, unstructured musings of the current state of global capitalism, for example: * People do not revolt when things get "very bad," but when their expectations are not met.  This rule was involved in the revolts in the Arab world in 2011 and has potentially serious consequences for China in the future. * The best method to diagnose and cure the defects in the Capitalistic system is found in Communism. * The neoliberal Capitalist system is a victim of its ideological mother, Ann Rand, the author of Atlas Shrugged, and the unbridled greed which fed on the system like a cancer. This is pure Marxian ideology. * The best illustration of the class struggle is in the current fight for a free internet. Presumably Zizek means the struggle for net neutrality but does not expand on this statement. * The defining characteristic of the present crisis in global capitalism is that the concept of unemployment has changed. In the classical model, unemployment was a discrete pool for the source of labor. Now, as a result of the 2008 meltdown, unemployment now includes a segment of the population which have been "written out of history."  This phenomenon is what the news media refers to, when the quarterly unemployment figures are released, to those who have given up finding work.Zizek offers gems of insight, but to  get there you have to sift through a lot of rubble.Trouble in Paradise is thus a mixed bag. I will employ a bit of cultural commentary Zizek likes to use so much: When the Beatles were world superstars, they stopped in Los Angeles after their concert there to see their idol, Elvis Presley. The arraignments were made and they would indeed see Elvis. The problem was this was circa 1965, Elvis' career was in a slump, and when they actually met him, he was detached, unresponsive, and frankly not all that interested in seeing them. The Beatles got lost trying to find Elvis' residence in LA, and continually asked themselves, "Where's Elvis?" After they actually saw him, they left, disappointed, and in leaving asked themselves, "Where's Elvis?"While he occasionally makes a brilliant observation here and there, on the whole Trouble in Paradise could have been much better."Where's Zizek?"

There are many accounts about the Paris Commune. Many are written clouded by a particular political viewpoint. Some accounts are written about specific stages of the insurrection, either about the causes of the insurrection, the insurrection itself, or the aftermath or the long-term consequences of the uprising.This book is unique in providing a practically hour-by-hour, day-by-day, blow-by-blow account. Merriman provides  a broad, balanced, beginning-to-end, account of the Commune, its causes, the aftermath and, yes, the bloody massacre of the insurgents.Yes, the amount of detail is sometimes dizzying, but Merriman offers many little-known details: * The Commune, for instance, was allowed to flourish in part because the Central government, while initially deployed security forces to quell the insurrection, then strategically withdrew the military support which allowed the spirit of rebellion to mushroom. * Once the Commune commenced, it easily obtained financing for its day to day affairs from French banking institutions, including the Rothschilds. * The Communards were not a bunch of wide-eyed radicals, although there were such elements in the ranks, but very much a bourgeois rebellion mainly consisting of tradespersons and professionals. * There was a great deal of dissension and lack of organization within the  Communards. Its ad hoc organization worked against them in the end. Central government troops were able to breach the barricades blocking Parisian streets because those barricades were completely unmanned. * While the ferocity of the Central government's response is well-known, Merriman meticulously describes the ruthless extent to which the Commune was shockingly put down. The Central government, for example, engaged in indiscriminate bombing of entire neighborhoods in Paris with little regard as to whether the inhabitants supported the Commune or not. The government soldiers shot first, asked questions later. The author estimates that upwards to 100,000 individuals lost their lives as a result of government retaliation. * There was a surreal character to the entire affair.
